description:
It was my husband's birthday, so we spent in San Francisco.  We decided to come here around 3:00pm for their Happy Hour that I'd heard so much about. Um, yeah. It was a Saturday. Duh. We decided to stay anyway, since the restaurant wasn't busy. We got a table with a gorgeous view! The view is priceless, I will give you that.  Our server let us take our time, as we each had a glass of wine and some sour dough bread.
At 4:00pm we decided to order dinner. I got the seared scallops and my husband got the Hawaiian Opah, cooked in banana leaves. We started out, splitting a salad with blue cheese crumbles and candied walnuts.
The salad was plenty for two, simple and good.
My scallops were seared to perfection. The Opah wasn't quite as spectacular as when we were in Hawaiian-- but we assumed it was frozen and not fresh...obviously.
Our server brought us a complimentary dessert with a candle-- nice touch.
I think we sat here for close to two hours. Total bill, with tip was about $160.00.  We expected that, given this is San Francisco. We had such a relaxing and romantic time, loved the view, the wine, the food...that we felt this was worth it.
We come to SFO every few years. I'd come back, for sure.  Like I said, the view is breathtaking. Simply beautiful!
author: Debby F.

description:
Splendid experience last night.
I made a reservation through Opentable. The restaurant called me to make sure my reservation time and number of people on the day of. I arrived 10 minutes earlier than the reservation time, but they were able to seat us. As requested, they placed us near the window. 
Food was pricey, but on a special occasion, it was okay. One thing they can improve is bringing out the food quicker. The waitress came with new utensils, but it took 10-15 minutes for our main dish to come out. The gap between our appetizer and the main dish was very long as well. 
However, the food was great. I ordered chicken and it was moist. The sauce was not over powering the chicken or the potatoes. My boyfriend ordered scallops and they were pretty good. It's a little disappointing for someone who eats a lot. The birthday girl ordered steak. The cut was pretty big and the meat was cooked medium rare (just how she asked for). The birthday boy ordered a seafood plate with mussels, crab, squid, and lobster. That plate was big and the sauce went well with the bread.
At the end, the waitress came with two muffins with ice cream on top for the birthday people. I was very pleased with the service! Not to mention, they handed us menus that said "happy birthday" on the top! 
I would come back here for special occasions, or for a date. We did dress up for this occasion, but I did see people who wore casual. There were kids and couples. I would say this is a good place to go for tourist. After eating here, you can enjoy Ghirardelli Square or during the day, you can walk towards Fisherman Wharf!
author: Kiyomi K.

description:
I see that their customer service team takes this issue pretty seriously...

I'm sad to see that this restaurant relies upon its location and the fact that it is a well known chain, and has forgotten what it means to provide good food and service.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Went here today to have dinner. 

Environment: nice ambiance, quiet with a great view.  Modern flair for the interior design with more classic seating. Bar is on the top level with open seating. 

Staff: Excellent! Super friendly. I walked in, by accident on the wrong level and the bartender quickly greeted me with a warm welcome and told me I could sit anywhere and asked if I wanted anything. I said thank you and I'm good. I quickly walked down the steps and went to the restaurant. The hostess asked if I had reservations and I said no. They told me it was not an issue and quickly sat me at a table with a GREAT View! My waitress was very personable and knowledgeable.

Food: Alright. I wish I could say I would want  to eat dinner here again(I'd come back for maybe dessert or a drink - definitely for the start and environment). The drink was pretty good. They managed to take the pine taste out of the gin drink?! Haha, I didn't know what I was going to get, but it was good. The sourdough was pretty epic! The dinner though, it was mediocre. I managed to crouch down on a bone in my fish. :( and the sauce was super buttery tasting. The fish also didn't have any salt or   Seasoning. 

Dinner was $44 dollars. $26 fish, $13 was the drink and there was a surcharge which I wasn't sure what that was. Once again I would go back, dessert or maybe an appetizer... I just am not sure that dinner was worth the price. I would recommend this for a nice romantic or quiet night out!
author: Melissa P.

description: Wonderful service. UNBEATABLE VIEW. Great food. Comfortable, warm, yet upscale ambience with a wide selection of wines and cocktails. It's the perfect place to host an event too or a really special occasion with a loved one
author: Elizabeth G.

description: Just perfect. This restaurant was awesome. I couldn't believe how good the halibut was. Very polite and waiters always checking up on us. This is a romantic hide a way spot. Thank you for your service.
author: Craig L.

description: The view is gorgeous! The clam chowder was not anywhere near the best I have had. The service was decent. The scallops were OK. My friends got the shrimp linguine and loved it! My favorite part was probably the bread-and-butter! But over all, I would return to this restaurant just maybe try something else on the menu.
author: JEN M.

description:
Yay:
1) view of the bay
2) lobster and dungeness crab dip

Nay:
1) Benjamin, waiter who appeared to be bored
2) Sylvia, hostess who was not helpful at all and seemed as if we inconvenienced her
3) pieces of bread (for the lobster and dungeness crab dip) were rock hard
4) dungeness crab cake was dry
5) Kuleto's mint julep (my photos of it speak for itself)

Our party decided that we will order entrees after the appetizers. But because of the already bad start, we ended up cutting it short at this establishment.
author: Bo A.

description:
So, a few things...

As soon as I entered the restaurant, the waitress looked at my friend and I as if we didn't belong there. Rude.

She was also our server and proceeded to talk to us and answer our questions very sarcastically. Rude.

The food was alright but to be honest, I had the shrimp linguini and all I can say is it tastes better at Olive Garden for half the price it costed here.

It was not very flavorful, but it did look very pretty!

My boyfriend had the filet mignon and he liked it, so he said (because I treated him for his birthday) but I was not convinced but I'll leave two stars on his behalf anyway.

Essentially, you're just paying for the view and the decor. Don't get me wrong, it was a very beautiful five star sight and a very beautiful restaurant... but at the end of the day, you may as well save your coin and go to Olive Garden where the food is better and the employees won't judge you!

I hardly write negative reviews because I feel it's very unnecessary, but if I'm going to be paying around $100 for a meal, I'd like the meal to be well worth it and I only left disappointed.
author: Natalie A.

description:
Hostess Palo claimed he called me about my reservation ahead of time. I showed him no calls received. Never the less he was an amazing hostess with leadership qualities.  Brenda was excellent and should be an acting manager and here's why. 

Make a long story short. 

McCormick is one of my favorite restaurants. I last had dinner at the McCormick in Kansas City, Mo, on Aug 10. 2018. WASHINGTON STATE daily for 6 weeks while in training. All Excellent service for a party of 13.  I bring friends to have dinner, celebrate birthday's, I mean I love this place.

Today, I was treating my cousin for lunch. Over the last 10 years I've never received bad customer service. 

Here's my concern about this location. 
Title: Simply a bad day for the business

At this location Management is the problem. The waitress was sarcastic, rude, and unprofessional.

We suggested a different waitress and to speak with a manager. The manager assured us the next waitress would not be afraid. 

Meaning the first waitress was afraid. Unsure, of what she was afraid off. I will admit we both have presence. But, we were in a really good mood.y cousin was excited about setting in the front row of the restaurant with such an amazing view. 

One hour later, no food. When asked about the meal. We were told the stuffed salmon I ordered was over cooked and they will have to remake it. 

My cousin asked about her pasta. The waitress said the food is sitting under the warmer. My cousin requested her food to be recooked. 

More to follow

One hour and six minutes later food arrives. No flavor. I asked for to go box after one bite. Instead of sending the food back.

Business was empty unacceptable!

We were accommodated with dessert!

End result, the manager admitted they dropped the ball.

Will I ever return to the San Francisco location. Never ever again.
author: Ethel D.

description:
An amazing evening out! From the host to the server to dessert, McCormick & Kuleto's delivered. We were seated by the window with a stunning panoramic view of the Bay. I was mesmerized!

The food was delicious. For starters, we shared the Dungeness Crab cake with fire roasted corn salsa, Meyer lemon butter - very light and flavorful. For the main course (we sampled each other's plates), I had the  crab & shrimp stuffed Salmon, arugula, sun-dried tomatoes, brie cheese, mashed potatoes, and vegetables. Mr. E had the sesame crusted Ahi tuna, wasabi mashed potatoes, baby bok choy, Mongolian black pepper sauce (not pictured) - a new culinary adventure for him that he did enjoy, but probably won't try again. We relied on our server, Jose, for our dinner wine - kudos to him! He suggested a delightful Napa Valley Chardonnay that paired very well with our meal.

For dessert, Mr. E ordered the seasonal cheesecake - which was strawberry creme angalaise. It was beautifully presented - and just downright perfect to the taste and texture. So as not to disturb the euphoria still resonating in my taste buds, I had the light and delicate seasonal sorbet - raspberry flavor. It was a winning finish!

Overall, a memorable experience, punctuated by the window seating, and the spectacular sunset scenes over the water as we dined. Many thanks to Jose and the crew!
author: Bridget E.

description:
Visited on Thurs, Jul 27 @ 7:30pm for our anniversary dinner

We ordered...
Apps: Dungeness Crab Cake, New England Clam Chowder, Dungeness Crab Cocktail (more crab than we expected to have in the cocktail)
Main course: M&K's Signature Cioppino (with a suggestion of added linguine), Alaskan King Crab Legs
Dessert: Warm Flourless Chocolate Cake
Drinks: Mezcal Mule (if you're going for a cocktail and like mules, we definitely recommend this one!), Blueberry Squeeze
...and spent: ~$180 between 2 people...(we're big eaters XP)

Service: Waiter was attentive and we were never short on water
Vibe: A nice ambience with moody lighting; not super busy when we went, probably because it was a weekday
Good for: Romantic dinners, celebrations, splurging
Overall verdict: Not high on our list for coming back just because the food didn't impress us enough for the price we paid, but not too disappointing either. Our favorite of our orders was the crab - specifically, the crab cakes and crab cocktail.
author: Diana C.

description: We tried a few restaurants and found that McCormick was one of the best .Food cooked perfectly our waiter Thomas was prompt with service I highly recommend this restaurant
author: Douglas L.

description:
Gorgeous view during sunset and delicious food. We ordered steak and salmon and it was great. The only thing they lack is a delicious sweet red wine! That's my "thing" whenever I have steak and seafood lol. 

Also, their service was decent considering how busy they were. They didn't give us bread and we didn't even know they offered it until we saw all the other tables eating it and then we asked. You shouldn't have to ask for that! Oh, and you need to make reservations as they're often booked and busy.
author: Daisy T.

description:
Bopping around San Francisco for the day, we needed lunch while checking out Ghiradelli Square.  Weighing all the options, we went with McCormick & Kuleto's and am sooo glad we did!

Holiday shopping and sightseeing is SO grueling so it was a relief to be seated at a table with a beautiful view of the bay. ;-)  Our server, James, suggested some cocktails and took very good care of us.  My manly lavendar mojito was the perfect blend and refreshing. 

Food was outstanding from the chowder in a sourdough bread bowl to the heirloom tomato salad to our entrees.  I had the steak frites, subbing out the fries for the garlic mashies.  Since the medium rare hanger steak was topped with an herb butter, it blended into the potatoes well and made them decadently delicious!

All in all, one of the best places to eat in that area and you can't beat the views (see my pics).  Go get yourself some massive chocolate and ice cream desserts next door at Ghiradelli to complete your pre-food coma experience!
author: Doug K.

description:
SCREW YOU GUYS!!!!

I understand that this is a "fine" dining establishment but we are unfamiliar with the area and my toddler was in desperate need of the bathroom or he was going to wet his pants. 
After getting terrible directions to the "public" restroom from another shop (we were told go to the left... that's a great help), we weren't able to locate it and McCormick & Kuleto's was our only hope. 
I asked someone in the restaurant if my son could please use the restroom, they said "Sure" (probably seeing that a toddler was in need). Just before we reached the bathroom door, the front desk lady followed and asked us "Where do you think you're going?"
I told her that my son really needs the restroom and she said "Nope! Come with me." (I though she was going to take us to a closer bathroom...)
 
Instead, she led us out the door and told us to go to the brewery.

Look, I get that you all want to maintain a certain illusion of "sophistication", but at what cost?

We weren't asking for free food... My child just needed the bathroom!!!!

How dare you guys try to represent San Francisco when you find it more important to let a toddler wet his pants and ruin his San Francisco afternoon rather than let him use your restroom for 1 minute!

You are offensive!
author: D Moz K.

description: Delicious seafood and great views of SF Bay. The gnocchi with pesto is a great side dish too! Our server Rachel was so outgoing and funny!
author: Melissa R.

description:
Restaurant is beautiful... nice location. We decided to sit at the bar for dinner to avoid the wait. Had a nice cocktail before dinner. We had to wave  a busser down to get some bread and butter. I ordered the mahi mahi with a baked potato... no baked potatoes at a steakhouse... what?! My friends bf ordered the ribeye medium rare.... it was cooked medium well. He didn't want to complain so he ate it. 
My friend advised the server that it was my birthday.... they don't even offer a free dessert for someone's bday?!? Manager take note: A small gesture like that makes a big difference considering we spent over $200 there.
author: Patricia K.

description: This is a great place to eat with a beautiful view of the Bay. The restaurant has its tables on tiered levels so there are many tables with a view.  We had lunch on a Saturday and were seated immediately at a table by the window. The food is fresh and high quality.  They bring you complimentary sourdough bread and butter. The fries are fresh and have skin on them. Our server was very attentive. The dining room is quiet.
author: Sherry W.

description:
Came for lunch on a Tuesday. Despite the 3 star orange rating. 
Staff was very attentive except w any special requests!  
I was willing to drop a $100 in lunch. But their response to my special requests hampered my experience 
Crab claws were fine , potatoes and Corn very mediocre 
View fabulous.  Ambience fabulous 
I ordered  $44 crab legs , $16. Glass of wine 
They couldn't sell me a second half glass. 
Hey are corporate- and there's are no deviations 
Shame on you Corporate!  That you don't empower your people to make good Decisions for good paying customers 
My bill was $84 before tip for lunch just me
That's fine but I leave disturbed 
And I'm leaving you the sw one half of the second glass of wine you could t figure out how to sell me!
author: Trina H.

description:
Wanted to write something nice about this place when I walked in, but here's my advise to all who visit, count your returned  change when you pay in cash or check the invoice card/thing for conveniently tucked in large Bill's behind the leather seal....oops(not the restaurant owner ships fault probably but I smell foul play by the operations staff). Coincidentally happened to a few other people while we was there.
I would avoid using credit cards here.
author: Tushar S.

description:
Restaurants that are this fancy and cost this much shouldn't make you shrug your shoulders and go 'meh, ok but nothing great'. Unfortunately, that's what McCormick & Kuletos did when our party of 6 had lunch there. When you think about it, that shouldn't have been the case:
- Location is fantastic, and they seated us by the windows so we had maximum view of the bay. Interior was also nice and they used the space well (i.e., while there were many tables, you didn't feel like you were squished in with other diners).
- Service was good: quick and prompt, friendly without being intrusive, good suggestions.

So everything was set up for a fantastic meal... except the food fell way short of the expectations. We had:
- Lobster and dungeness crab dip: This appetizer was my favourite. Strong flavours (i.e., not watered down at all which sometimes happens with appetizers), good for table sharing.
- Pan seared scallops: Ok-to-good dish. Scallops were well done (which can be tricky), and the corn and bacon bits complimented them well. That said, it was a bit too salty for my tastes.
- Crab and shrimp stuffed salmon: Huge disappointment. I couldn't taste the crab or the shrimp at all, and the overriding salmon taste was bland (and not in a taste-the-freshness-of-the-salmon type way)
- Dungeness crab and shrimp roll: Another huge disappointment. The crab tasted like one of those filler/fake ones, and I couldn't taste the shrimp at all. The bread was also a bit tough to chew. The side fries were pretty good though.

For a seafood place, there were a lot of misses on the seafood dishes. So despite the awesome view and great service, McCormick & Kuletos definitely left us wanting for a lot more.
author: David Y.

description: Maria made me give this place 5 stars just for the view alone. No doubt, this place has amazing views from many of the tables.  My bride and I were in SF and looking for a place with a view. I have eaten here a few times in the past and remembered the great view. About the food? I had the salmon stuffed with crab meat. Oh yeah. If you like salmon and you like crab meat, you have a winner!  Oh the view. Looks out over the Bay with Alcatraz reminding you to stay on the strait and narrow. Be good.
author: Garrett Y.

description: We are big McCormick and Schmick's fans. We decided to come to this location. First off, beautiful view! Come when the sun is setting. Also, awesome atmosphere. We unfortunately, didn't have he best waiter. He was absent minded and made a few mistakes. He add up for it by giving us free desserts. The food was all awesome. I suggest the clam chowder for an appetizer and any of the fish or steak entrees.
author: Betsy M.

description:
This review is exclusively for the bar happy hour. I'm compelled to write it because I am a local and most locals think of McCormick's as a restaurant for tourists, primarily due to its location. I thought that myself until I researched their happy hour and I have become a regular. Of course, the view alone can brighten any day, but the happy hour is legit; one of the best in the city due to the QUALITY of the offerings. Extensive drink and food selection compared to most, and both are excellent! The garlic Parmesan fries are a must! My friend had a full size burger with fries (I don't eat meat) but the tuna roll is a good compromise for a little protein.

The service is great and Don, the bartender is a friendly guy

My only reservation in reviewing this happy hour is that I don't want it to become too popular!!! I don't want to give up my seat!!
author: Sheila K.

description:
I've been here a couple times over the years. There is no denying they have a great space with a fantastic view so when we had a special occasion and were in the mood for seafood, decided this was our spot. 

I made the reservation yesterday morning for last night (or maybe it was the night before... that's the wine talking). In any event, i indicated it was a special occasion - my husbands 65th birthday and noted that I wanted to pre-order dessert so they could present with a candle. 

On arriving at the restaurant, we were seated at a fantastic table so that the three of us could all enjoy the view - it was a beautiful evening so we very much appreciated that! They had printed menus with a special message - my husbands name and Happy 65th Birthday - a little corny indeed but it was a nice touch. We started with the crab and lobster dip - OMG, it was delicious - decadent and fattening and so necessary. I had the caesar (good but maybe a bit bland) and the ahi tuna, very good, large portion. My daughter had the stuffed salmon which she inhaled. She also had a Lavendar mojito which was quite tasty! The birthday boy opted for cucumber and heirloom tomato salad and grilled swordfish. His meal was also very good. We then shared the pre-ordered dessert - blueberry crumble - very good! I wasn't blown away (though the dip was pretty out of this world) but it was a very solid meal. I'll be enjoying leftovers tonight. I know the reviews are somewhat mixed but we had a very good meal. Not that often that we go someplace like this but if I were in the area I certainly wouldn't hesitate to visit again.
author: Karen O.

description: Good food, great view, weak service, our waiter looked mad and acted accordingly. Many times I stated it was my wife's birthday and he served us like he didn't care. I'm a big tipper I believe in compensation for good service but not here and not my waiter, they didn't even sing her happy birthday or anything of that nature, we were just another order on his table, our waiter served other tables that arrived 20-30 minutes after us first. Maybe our waiter profiled is as broke or something but he's the ones that missed out on a great tip opportunity Will not return. I have been to Ruth cris and epic steaks they have better service same tasting food if not way better.
author: Most W.

description:
Review for 3/25/18
Bay Area!!
This is the second trip to Cali that we've taken recently where we've spent the last day in San Francisco by the bay. Last time we had amazing Italian food close to Chinatown. This time we ventured to the other side of the city to Ghiradelli Square for lunch with great view. Our Aunt stumbled into this restaurant during a work conference and loved it so she was excited to take us. McCormick's in SF has a fantastic view of the bay. They strategically staged all of their tables in tiers so every table can enjoy the view no matter where you sit. 
Good tips:
-They have a good brunch menu for a cheaper price
- If you like Bloody Mary's they have an awesome menu
- The wine menu is extensive
I ordered the Black Angus Ribeye Steak with seasonal veggies and my lady had the seared scallops topped with a mixture of corn and bacon. The steak was cooked perfectly and it was seasoned well. My girlfriend liked the scallops but thought the dish was too salty. The kiddo had pancakes and our Aunt had the grilled Mahi Mahi. Our Uncle settled for breakfast as well with an omelet. All of the food was great. The wine list is extensive so I went with a glass of sauvignon following the Aunt's great taste in wine. The whole experience was great having wine with lunch and enjoying the view of the bay on a sunny day. Our server was polite but was absent a little more than we'd like. Especially paying the prices we did, it was a little disappointing to have empty water glasses. We had to search around for her, but it was a fairly busy time so I like to give servers the benefit of the doubt.
author: Tasha L.

description: Love this place the view is amazing. The food was great and the service was just wonderful. I picked the place to host my cousin's  birthday. She loved it! They even print out Happy Birthday with her name on the menu. So felt so special she took the menu back to Minnesota with her and laminated. ;)
author: Michele T.

description:
We had a 50th bday dinner here with about 60 guests in their private dining room. The service was spectacular as everyone was able to grab drinks for about an hours at a private bar before being seated for the meal.

The three course menu offered a large selection of items and the seafood-centric main course I had was very tasty.

Overall, our entire party really enjoyed the event and they even allowed us to stay in the room a little past the reservation end time which was greatly appreciated. Definitely not a bad spot to consider if you're willing to break the bank a little for a special event.
author: Ryan R.

description: I've been here a few times while visiting San Francisco and a couple of times with family/friends after moving to the Bay Area. The food has always been very tasty and the view is wonderful (obviously), but the service isn't consistent. The first visits were fine, no problem - then after that, horrible service. Then the most recent time it was great (I only chose to go because it was a birthday dinner). If they work on customer service, I'd be glad to give them 5 stars.
author: Trina N.

description: This place has an amazing view which is a big reason to go here. They have a lot of seafood options on the menu. The portions were small. The ahi poke (served with taro chips) and the cup of clam chowder were both good. My family enjoyed the fish as well as the Crab Louise salad.  The service was slow and the waiter hardly checked on us. We continually had to find him or ask a different waiter (who was not ours) for help. It was pretty cold in the restaurant which was a little uncomfortable. The view was worth it but the service could have been better.
author: Christine A.

description:
This review is based on Christmas Day.

Made reservations for 4:45 and showed up on time and was immediately greeted and seated.   They had a vast selection of dinner items.  We selected the prime rib and a bottle of wine.
Food  was great and service was spot on.
One thing we knew they were going to be busy but did a fantastic job.  Great job and the view was fantastic.
author: Tony A.

description: We had fresh halibut with veggies and potatoes. Service was excellent! Beautiful view of the bay and Alcatraz!!! My friend had raviolis that were good but I recommend getting fresh local fish first! Best view in a restaurant is here!!!!!
author: Terrie S.

description:
STAY AWAY 

We decided to go to this restaurant because of the views.  We decided to have drinks at the bar before dinner we were met by a RUDE bartender who obviously doesn't enjoy his job and seemed annoyed waiting while we decided on a drink.

Dinner & the service was below average for the price you pay, what I found interesting was the 6% surcharge on every bill which the restaurant claims is to "off-set" the cost of doing business in San Francisco.  

Wait so I pay 6% more so you can serve me !!!!!!!  So this restaurant charges a 6% surcharge to serve me !!!!!!!!

Then you pay the state 10 % sales tax and tip the rude staff 20% on restaurant enforced surcharges 

By the way the waiters already earn $15.00 per hour so that might explain why they are rude seem annoyed and don't care about the level of service.

It's a shame because the view is beautiful the staff is horrendous and rude and the restaurant feels it's ok to had their own 6% taxes to your bill
author: The B T.

description:
Beautiful ambience and location by the seaside. 
We were a family of 5 and we all did seafood. Everyone enjoyed their meals. 
I had the blackened Atlantic salmon which came with boiled vegetables, mashed potato and cream butter sauce. 

Old school butterscotch pudding for dessert was a really good way to wrap up our dinner.
author: Lawrence A.

description:
View is great, seating is comfortable and well placed. 

Service was all over the place, right drink, wrong drink, are you ready to order, repeatedly and too frequently...more to the point,

the "jumbo" shrimp cocktail was not "jumbo" in my book, a "shrimp cocktail" admittedly it was...it just wasn't "jumbo" by my experience with that label at other restaurants, and didn't deserve the pricing.

the steak and frites... "medium rare", but the meat was so tough I could hardly cut it, I gave up, and the portion anyway was small, not that I was able to eat what I was served. fries were ok, nothing special.

Was never asked, how was everything...

For the steep cost, notwithstanding the great view and comfy seats, unlikely I'll return due to the food...

PS There was a patio area just outside the restaurant, which I assume belongs to McCormick's.  There were wood tables there that apparently had been stained or varnished, the stain/varnish had not dried, was wet and sticky to the touch, and there were no signs warning of that...
author: Steve M.

description:
Two of us arrived at 7:15, were sat immediately, at a requested table, enjoyed the gorgeous sunset  and enjoyed a glass of Pinot LaCrema...
Our waitress was "Larissa" she was very nice and helpful...upper level seats the very best in the restaurant...scallops were excellent big and four of them perfectly cooked, stuffed salmon was extremely good...we'll definitely go back...thanks
author: Judy K.

description: Service was not great food served cold on several plates. Just kind of like it didn't really matter you are paying for the view.
author: Bob A.

description:
McCormick & Kuleto's sells very tasty food at a high but not completely unreasonable price. The view was spectacular. My family and I went after seeing the Blue Angels for Fleet Week and although we did not have a reservation they were able to seat us.

It's fairly pricey, but that is expected from about every McCormick restaurant. But similarly the food was wonderful, I had the 7 oz. filet mignon rare with a side of garlic mashed potatoes. My family had the seared ahi tuna meal and the grilled scallops, both of which they said were very good. (It is possible all the walking from Fleet Week exaggerated the taste of the food.) My parents also enjoyed a sparking wine sampler with I believe it was La Marca Proseco, Gloria Ferrer, and Mumm (Brut?). Nothing particularly spectacular, but they had a fun time trying the different wines. As did many others, it appeared to be a popular order; that and the Kendall Jackson. 

It is worth noting that this place has a 6% additional fee to help them compete in San Fransisco. Which seems ridiculous to me, there were plenty of people and the bill was quite expensive. But keep that in mind if you plan on going here.
author: Katrina U.

description: Everything hear was delicious!! I asked in my reservations to have a spot overlooking the water and they did accommodate me! The food was amazing and our waitress was extremely friendly! Having dinner at this restaurant was one of the better moments of the trip.
author: Suzy A.

description: Ok.  I recently did a 3 month stint in San Fran. I read the reviews for this steakhouse.  I can tell you the view from this place into the harbor is absolutely amazing. The seafood platter we got was awesome. My only complaint was "in my opinion" was overpriced for what you got. Especially Being so close to the source. I'm from New Orleans and if you have been you know what I'm saying.  You should expect abundant good seafood.....Nonetheless we enjoyed the atmosphere and the views.
author: D C.

description:
Located in the middle of a tourist area, this steak & seafood restaurant has a bougie decor and upscale atmosphere. However, the location lures casuals like myself. Where I sat, had a nice view of Alcatraz over the tall railing...

Service: You're given a look of hesitation for dressing casually into this place that appears to be fancy. Our servers (not sure if we were supposed to have multiple) couldn't remember our 2 item order but polite yet inattentive. Other servers didn't know where to bring dishes. Food also took 35minutes to come out...

Food: Mediocre and sorry for its price. I'm very glad I did not go all out on this place.
1) the BOWL of clam chowder was the best of the 2 things I had. It didn't taste too creamy, and you can actually taste the clam umami. The serving, however, was a coffee mug worth of chowder... I can't imagine how small the cup size is...
2) the filet mignon: do not let the appearance fool you. It was a huge disappointment, but it had visually impressive sears. The order was for a $37 medium-rare filet mignon (additional charge for mashed potatoes... Seriously? I skipped 'cause I didn't have a huge appetite). What I got was was a well-done/medium-well palm size piece of meat with burnt squash and two pieces of tomatoes... The meat was not savoury, tasted like it dried out and got soaked in butter to gain the moisture back, and contained next to no presence of pink meat. The pile of squash and 2 tomatoes... I won't bother.

Overall, they tried. It's not the worst place, but it is not worth what you pay. I advise adapting to the tourist theme, make sure the servers don't seem lost, and improve the pricing for food quality/proportion: 1) Get someone who can cook meat properly, 2) Choose better veggies/fruits that people like to add colour to the steak (majority dislike squash..), 3) A bowl instead of a cup-size bowl.
author: Albert T.

description: It was ok. I was looking to splurge somewhere with a view is what brought me here. I had the dry rub Black Angus Rib Eye. The steak was tender, but not really much on seasoning or flavor. Paid extra for the potatoes, which nothing special. My girlfriend had the Crab stuffed Salmon. That was delicious full of flavor. The Host staff was great with seating and personality. Our waitress took long. Which the view was great, but when paying for parking, over 2 hours. Parking in SF not cheap. The Host said he hooked us up with a 2 hour validation ticket, but only took off 1 at the machine. So overall I gave it the 3 for the Salmon, hostess, and the view.
author: Anthony M.

description:
Yes, I feel super comfortable giving this place 3 stars. We have been here a few times for family dinners and tonight we went after seeing the Blue Angels fly for Fleet Week.

Pros: 
They are on Opentable -- you can walk there from Marina Green, Ghiradelli Square is much more hip that it used to be and the restaurant has gorgeous views of the Bay, and the food is good.

Cons:
A bit pricey, especially for the not superb service, our wait was a bit long at the table before anyone came over to start our service.

In the end, the food was good -- we were seated in a nice corner so our son could walk around a bit and our waiter (even though he was a bit slow) ended up being the best.
author: Kate F.

description: We had a lovely dinner at McCormick & Kuleto's!  The views are fabulous, and the service is great.  I especially like the crab cakes.  You should definitely come here for dinner.  You'll love it!
author: Paula M.

description: Great experience, fabulous view of Alcatraz from our table, we went with some visitors from the U.K , they really loved it. I ordered the Snapper (blackened), it was perfect followed by The Banana Toffee Pie which was delicious. The service was impeccable
author: christine w.

description: Ate here this early evening. The service was terrible. The waiter seemed like he didn't want to be at work. Never checked on us... the bill was $160 for terrible service.  He forgot our wine.  Slow to bring the side dishes. The restaurant was not crowded.  We were very disappointed in the experience.
author: Michelle G.

description: The food was subpar and the service didn't fare any better. We travel allot and the San Diego location never disappoints and this location just came up short. The ambiance is great but that's about it.
author: Julio E.

description:
To me, 3 of 5 stars is a solid D. That's not good, and it's not A-OK. It's below average.

Once upon a time, there was a restaurant in San Francisco called Kuleto's. As I recall, there were two locations (although there may have been more). One was on Powell Street near O'Farrell. The other (this one) was/is in Ghirardelli Square. Apparently, the one on Powell has closed its doors, and so this restaurant with the spectacular views of the bay and a remarkably wonderful floor plan is what's left.

This used to be a shockingly good restaurant, despite its location in a tourist containment area. It always had fresh fish and seafood of other kinds, and it consistently had a wide variety of fresh oysters available. It was not inexpensive but not exorbitant. The bread was fantastic (just as it should be so close to Boudin and the Wharf).

It has become a below average restaurant. Indeed it is now exactly what one might have expected it to always have been: a restaurant in a touristy location with a fabulous view and disappointing food and adequate service.

Everything about the dining is forgettable. The upside is that this means things aren't horrible...horrible is memorable. This is not horrible. It's merely adequate. The bread isn't what it used to be, the seafood seems Costco-level, and the other food items are neither bad nor good. The property clearly has the feel of being part of a much larger family of brands, and it is.

If you have tame expectations, this restaurant will not disappoint you. And the view remains tremendous. Certainly a good place for cocktails. Tighten your belt and head elsewhere, or sit down and enjoy this Marie Callender's-by-the-Sea. 

You'll remember nothing but the view. And that ain't half bad.
author: Joe A.

description:
As you can tell I don't give out 5s easily, even though in this example, this is where I met my wife randomly at the bar. I would not think that to be normal as the bar is usually couples, some tourists, just trying to get some clam chowder (which is solid in a bread bowl) and a drink. The fish dishes (like halibut) are always good and have not had a "frozen experience" even though it looks like some people have. 

We do go to remind ourselves of when we met, but have not had a bad experience. Have had a bad cocktail now and then, but when that's over a period of years it's not a negative.
author: David A.

description:
Views are 5 Star Amazing.  The service was really good (5pm seating on a Saturday) and the quality of the food was great.
A standout portion of the meal was desert. The Bag of Chocolate is a share desert and a great way to end the meal. There is a $25 corking fee if you bring your own wine (a bit pricy) for a corking fee.
Overall great night and meal.
author: Douglas F.

description: They brought me the wrong order twice.  The first time they gave me an appetizer... the second time it was cooked incorrectly.  My mothers food was cold.  The waitress never checked on us.  The waitress said I pointed at the wrong item on the menu and tried to blame me for it.  Zero apology for the cold food. They took forever to get us the check... We just left the calculated cost in cash on the table.  The manager never came to our table.  The free bread was burned.  Zero discount, zero apology, zero accepting responsibility.  I guess the customer is always wrong here
author: Kristen B.

description:
This is a fancy family restaurant set in a beautiful location. I always have a good time and feel that the culturally mandatory 20% tip has been earned, but certain elements of the service and food quality do skew lower than expected on a scale from Cheesecake Factory to Michelin. It's important to keep your expectations in check.

My dad loves the Cioppino and gets it every time. We usually have several people ordering it, getting excited for the hot fish stew, waiting with bibs.

I tried the Opah once but found it too sweet. I then spent 30 minutes googling photos of the fish and felt so sorry for the large, clumsy animal with stupid-looking eyes that I couldn't finish my tropical-inspired dish.

Be mindful when ordering substitutions, switching tables, dropping cutlery or customizing too much. It appears that every table (comprised of either a family celebrating a special event, tourists, or couples untouched by more trendy food crazes) puts a lot of pressure on the serving staff.
author: Anastasia D.

description: I had enjoyed the atmosphere the last time I came here with my co-workers after an event for work, so when I received an Evite for a co-worker's birthday I knew it was going to be a great time. The Warriors Championship game was going on and it was packed! My drinks were on-point but my burger was given to me medium rare TWICE after I requested it to be well done. On top of that it was a kids burger *insert eye blinks* Like what kid eats a medium rare burger? Anywho, my drinks were good and the service was awesome even under the pressure of so many patrons. The view is nice, the establishment is beautiful inside and the happy hour is affordable.
author: Itika D.

description: So we made our rsvp with open table and requested a nice view only to find out that not only did we not get a view but the table was not even ready at the time of arrival.  We had to wait about 15 mins before we were seated and they had rushed a table that we had to cramp nine of us to fit.  But the night ended nice as Jessica was an amazing server and the food was top notch.  Can't go wrong with the grilled fish and appetizer dishes.  We wanted the porterhouse steak but they ran out yesterday which was a bummer.
author: Shelton F.

description: Work trip - Beautiful dinner at McCormick & Kuleto's with great service from Tom. Even found an amazing bottle of wine that I was familiar with, but have never tried, Goldeneye Pinot Noir. So good!!
author: Joe M.

description:
The view never gets old, day or night, and it's San Francisco!  Growing up in SF, I tend to stay away from Fisherman's Wharf aka tourist trap.  There are a few iconic places I reminisce about, and I don't come here on special occasions.  Those are the worst times to dine at such establishments.  

I spontaneously make reservations for Sunday nights or weeknights, when no big conventions are in town or peak tourist season.  Get the clam chowder, can't go wrong.  I love the PEI mussels, delicious!  More bread please LOL =)  

The prawns linguine is another amazing dish, and the kids' menu is not too shabby.  Hubby enjoyed his stuffed salmon with a side order of garlic mashed potatoes, gave me all his veggies though.  Desserts and after dinner drinks are a must!

Extensive wine list and cocktails, awesome Happy Hour M-F, and corkage is $25 per bottle.  

'Til we meet again ~ cheers!!!
author: Christine R.

description: Left a place at the wharf to come eat here. Was told that I can't get a table for 1, "because we have a large private party taking up dining room space." Didnt offer a bar seat or anything. Im kinda confused because they have a huge banquet room. Asked the guy if they are reservations only or what, he told me as he was multitasking and barely looking at me that they stopped talking walk-ins for the night although a party of four had just gotten seated as I walked in. No idea. Seemed to me they didn't want to serve 1 person.
author: Emily M.

description: We came here to celebrate a couple of family birthdays. Delicious food (crab cakes, steak, fish and chips, creme brûlée for desert) everything was tasty! Attentive server as well. The view is fabulous. I would come back again for a meal or even just for cocktails as the bar has the same view!
author: Kim D.

description: Chef Romero is the best!!! Highly recommend the lobster bisque--it's the best in town. Also the stuffed salmon is the dish I had in my wedding day and it melts in your mouth. Enjoy!
author: Camy T.

description: Have been to this restaurant before, and really liked it. I realize that we did go on Thanksgiving but that is no excuse to serve old, pithy crab. I was so disappointed as I only order crab when I come to San Francisco. We are from Los Angeles and come here to visit our son who lives here. With all the wonderful restaurants in San Francisco, we will probably check out another one next time we come up.
author: Melissa A.

description: OK, So parking fee through the roof and the fact that they don't valet or validate is kinda not too cool guys! But, that being said... What an amazing Brunch :) Food was awesome, service was awesome and as so many others have said, the view. Crazy beautiful. Great way to spend a weekend morning with friends or someone special.
author: Walter F.

description:
I am a fan of this place. So much to like: 

-The view here is immaculate. 

-The food is high-quality, with free range chicken and plenty of locally sourced options. The seafood is (obviously) as fresh as can be.

-The menu is very allergy-friendly and the staff/kitchen do a great job of accommodating special requests. 

Of course, there are also a few things to not like: The menu is very expensive. The location is obviously very touristy. 

But when we dined here, the good FAR outweighed the bad. And the food was outstanding - expensive and traditional - yet very high-quality and served in very healthy portions. I'll take that any day over fancy restaurant with a really adventurous menu yet microscopic portions. 

All in all, McCormick's is a solid dinner option with a view that's hard to beat. Would absolutely come again.
author: Brian S.

description:
Ridiculously over-rated. We came to San Fran for Christmas and decided to have a fancy Christmas Eve dinner. We left disappointed and ready to leave San Fran. 
The bread was served cold because that's how it's served. Service was nice though. 

Not worth it.
author: BKat A.

description:
Dinned here for New Year's eve for the 1st time.  Knocking a star because we called in before to confirm everything and ask a few questions.  We ask about cork fee and while the young lady was very helpful with everything she gave us the wrong information about the cork fee.  So we arrived and got seated right away.  The restaurant is beautiful and was festive for holidays.  The meal we had was sea bass and lamb.  My BF was happy with his lamb but I have to honest and i'm a sea bass lover and I have had better.  The salad was great and so was the desert upside down apple pie.  Or server wasn't that friendly or inviting but maybe he is just a serious server.  
After dinner we had a chat with the manager about the false information about cork fee he was understanding.
author: Tina D.

description: The wild mushroom ravioli was amazing! They were nice enough for us to wait at the bar while a table opens up at the restaurant.
author: Lena H.

description:
We live in san francisco. First time to try food here. We were exciting because we try in boston before. It was delicious and service was wonderful. But since we sat by window side.  Server name's "YAMIL" treat us so bad. I told him we need more times but he stood next to our table, crossed his arms and stare at us. 
Food came fast. We ordered PEI streamed black mussels that smell so bad. Until we finished ,we told him how to split as 3 ways but he doesnt understand. We dont like how server YAMIL treat us and the way he talked with us. Also he looked at us as insulted us. And my friend tipped him 18% by cash but he gave it to my friend back and told her "Its not enough, just keep it, its ok". 

** Manager or Owner should know how YAMIL did with us and I wish you should train him more and more before he's on floor. He's such a bad server ever. **
author: Sasiprapa P.

description: For its price, the food here is pretty good. The sautéed scallops are huge and were delicious! The dish was about $32 if I remember correct. My girlfriend got the shrimp scampi pasta, in which the shrimps were also huge, definitely worth the price in my opinion. Don't go here if you don't want to spend money lol
author: Phi V.

description:
Came for a drink and a little snack after walking around Ghirardelli Square. It was honestly the only place that didn't have a line. Inside was very fancy, I have been to the one at Beverly Hills before. However, this one has an amazing view. 

We sat at the bar and ordered gin and tonics and some sweet potato fries. The drinks were made well and the sweet potato fries were very good. They were crispy and some fresh herbs with them. The sauce was a yummy aioli sauce. I highly recommend here for a nice romantic date!
author: Natalie L.

description:
This place was actually recommended by our Lyft driver when we were in the search for the best clam chowder in town. He did tell us that it is a very fancy looking place but the food is not expensive, plus itd be happy hour by the time we arrive. 
When we arrived it was very slow, probably no more than 3 parties in the restaurant. We came at the start of Happy Hour and sat at the corner of the bar/lounge area. It was me, my baby in the stroller and my younger sister and her boyfriend. We're part of the younger crowd and stood out like a sore thumb and unfortunately our server made us feel that way too. 
We ordered two clam chowder bowls and three burgers that were on the Happy Hour menu. I ordered a spicy vodka with watermelon, cucumber and mint with waters and a soda. 
As we sat there, more people started to come in since Happy Hour was starting up.
The food was REALLY good. Our Lyft driver did not disappoint and I was very happy with the chowder and the burgers. Burgers came out juicy, even when I ordered them well done
But the service was mediocre. I just felt judged the whole time. He made us feel like we didn't belong there and he definitely was not in a good mood to serve us. Don't get me wrong, he did his job- took our order and brought our food, but the service we got compared to the other parties was not consistent. You can just tell when someone is treating you differently and unfortunately thats EXACTLY how we felt. 
Another waiter came to check on us towards the end of our meal, he picked up plates, conversed with us, stated he wanted to get things out of the way and clean up a little bit so we felt more comfortable. I really appreciated that.
If we ever come back up to the Bay Area, we probably will come back for the quality of the food but I hope we get a different server next time!
author: Jhuanna M.

description: What can I say. This place was so bad. First the waiter named Marvin dropped all the juice from an empty plate on our friends clothes didn't really even apologize. We never got any bread or were asked if we wanted dessert or coffee . We had come with friends from all over the world and it was so embarrassing how they saw this in our country. The manager Came over but was so rude and acted like we were putting him out. He said he would comp our appetizers but when we got the bill, he never did. We left and did not fight it because we wanted to get the heck outta that dive. Do not go here. You will be treated like crap. Also make sure Marvin the idiot does not serve you.
author: Alice S.

description: Great food, good service. We went here for a civil service wedding dinner and it turned out really great. Staff even personalized our menu.
author: Robert T.

description: Fantastic place in the heart and hub of downtown SF Bay.  We came on a Wednesday  evening for a Birthday  celebrations with friends.  Service is excellent.  We have our menus customized for our Birthday.  Superb food . Ordered Beef Medallions, Atlantic Salmon stuffed with Dungenness crabs.  &  Sturgeon Maitre D'Butter.  And the view.... will come back for sure.
author: Dalima L.

description:
I live and work in SF and avoid the area around Fisherman's Wharf, and all the accompanying mediocre yet over-priced restaurants, like the plague... That said, I had to kill some time in the area today so decided to take in the view at lunch. Sat in the bar, and on the Friday of Fleet week, the first day of the air show, in a restaurant with sweeping views of the sky had ONE (one!!) guy working the entire bar area. He had to make all drinks for the entire restaurant, but also deliver menus to everyone in the bar, take their order, give them their bill, take their payments, etc. It was ridiculous. He was literally running and couldn't keep up. I was in no hurry, but watched multiple people get frustrated and leave.

And, not surprisingly, my meal was mediocre and over-priced.

BTW, in a really crappy move... I was not provided an itemized bill--just the credit card form to sign. This means I couldn't check the accuracy of prices, but even worse, means people are tipping on tax + all the various SF fees, like healthcare, that get added to the bill in restaurants. Not cool.
author: Lyn R.

description: My wife and I recently ate lunch here, and had a wonderful experience.  The view of the bay is awesome!  Our server was very friendly any the service was very good.  I had their signature crab salad with salmon and bacon, and my wife had a hamburger, both of which were very good.  We look forward to going back.
author: Rob R.

description: Arrived to the restaurant and was seated right away with a view out towards the water at a booth.  The waiter came and introduced himself and took our drink orders and also our food and he brought my brother a appetizer that he ordered and then our meals came and my brother's food was incorrect and the waiter apologizing about his order and only had to wait s few minutes and his order came and everything was very good.  The food was the way we ordered and I would recommend this place to eat.
author: Roxanne S.

description: This place was OK..the Decore was nice..the view is really nice, however,the service was OK and my friend kept getting dirty utensils and a broken glass that was served to her. when I got my food it was cold too.. but we were there for a birthday and they put happy birthday on the menu which is a nice gesture. For the amount we paid I expected better.. to be honest but it was OK and the people I was with made the experience better
author: Coco V.

description: This review would have been 5 stars if it wasn't for the waiter.  Food tasted amazing but our waiter (Thomas) made us feel unwelcomed there. He was rude, short with us and ignored us multiple times. It took almost 10 minutes from the time we sat down before he even introduced himself to us. Looking at the other reviews on here, either they had him or this seems to be how the restaurant is training their staff.
author: Holland G.

description:
We loved our visit to M&K! 
The views cannot be beat. Try to sit near a window, you'll have the best views. 

Our food was delicious. A bit on the pricey side (but hey, it's steak and seafood, whaddya expect?), but worth every penny. Our server was a bit blah, which is the reason for 4/5 instead of 5/5. Tried to make conversation and crack jokes, but he seemed more interested in just getting orders in quickly. Even told him this place was highly recommended by our tour guide, but he kind of just stared at me. Twas a bit strange.

However, I noticed multiple managers on the floor aiding the servers in filling up drinks and clearing off tables. That is much admired - coming from someone who works in the restaurant industry, that kind of stuff tells a lot. 

TIP: MAKE A RESERVATION ONLINE. Seriously, it's so easy. We were seated promptly (actually, 15 mins early!).
author: Renn J.

description: If you're looking for a variety of foods, cocktails, a water view, comfy seats, and a quieter scene--go here! The view while sipping on their version of a Moscow Mule was outstanding!! Don't bother with dessert since Ghirardelli is right there.
author: Christine M.

description:
This restaurant did not meet my expectations.  There were several issues with my Saturday evening experience:
(1) Cocktails in the bar were ordered, but when we received them (15min) they were the wrong drinks - it took 20min to correct to the right drink and we received a bit of an attitude from the bar staff.
(2) We were seated at our table in the back area of the restaurant, adjacent to two very loud parties.  Despite our request, the service staff did not ask the other guests to 'take it down a notch'.
(3) The food was not really that great.  I had the Ahi Tuna dish - and it was o.k. My 'house salad' was mixed greens, Gorgonzola and walnuts - very underwhelming. 
(4) We asked to speak with the manager 'Steve' as we wrapped up our meal.  Steve was defensive, even mildly argumentative, when we shared our complaints.  He offered no condolences or reprieve. 

Overall, I would not recommend this establishment to others and I will not be returning.
author: Serena S.

description:
I was quite surprised to see that the reviews were not a lot higher. 

We made reservations here a month earlier.  When we arrived, we asked for a nice view of the San Francisco Bay.  We were given a table separate from the group with an awesome view.  Although, I noticed that almost all of the tables had great views!

The restaurant is beautiful and the servers were polite, friendly, and professional.

I ordered the Alaskan King Crab Claws and Exotic Mushroom Saute.  My wife ordered the Jumbo Shrimp Scampi Pasta.  We also ordered the Crab & Lobster Dip appetizer.  

The appetizer was amazing!  A huge portion that could easily satisfy 4 people.  It was cheesy and chalk full of crab and lobster.

The crab claws were delicious!  The were all cut which made enjoying them quite easy.  My wife loved the scampi pasta which was full of shrimp and had a fantastic light and creamy sauce,  Both of these portions were also quite large.

We decided to throw caution to the wind and order desert even though we were already full.  We ordered a cinnamon blueberry cake dish.  (I don't recall the name.)  The cake portion was light and sweet.  It was cooked over an amazing blueberry compote.  Once again, it was a large portion that easily feeds two.

It is a little pricey, but I would recommend this place to everyone.  We won't hesitate to come back!
author: Jim C.

description:
Best Happy Hour at Fisherman's Wharf.  Food is amazing, the very is even better.

They have a new happy hour menu, starting today! 

Incredible!

You've got to try it.
author: Nan M.

description: Two years running, this has been a great experience for Mother's Day brunch. The price is great for the quality, it's pretty easy to get a reservation even with a large group, and everything was delicious. I'm kind of obsessing over the buttermilk biscuits I had during the brunch. My only complaint is that I can't just walk in and get one anytime!
author: Jasmin P.

description:
My server was Steven, his service was AMAZING! 

Seafood platter for 41 didn't really have that "sea / salty" flavor. It was more like freshwater taste...very dull. Fish and chips platter was decent. Fish were too oily...and there was no salt on the fries --- basic. 

Great place. Great view. Great service. Food needs a little bit of work. And again, I thank Steven. Such an amazing server.
author: Eleni T.

description: We're visiting from Los Angeles and it happens to be fleet week. We wanted to sit by the window and watch the show with a cocktail. We come in and tried to get a table and the hostess Sylvia was more than rude and unaccommodating. She asked if we had reservations and we said unfortunately no and was just a walk in. There were a few tables open in sight. And she just said "no we only take reservations" and walked out. So my friends and I just looked at each other and walked out. I got on my phone and checked on how to make reservations and there were plenty of time available but I asked my friends if they still wanna support this establishment after such a rude treatment by this SYLVIA. They said yes lol, so I made a reservations and went back in. And we smiled and said hi we now have a reservations can we have a table now? And she said "I don't like you" and I said I'm supporting this business how can you not like customers but she just grabbed the menus and pointed us to our table. Our server Benjamin was accommodating and apologetic when we told him about the incident. Then we got our cocktails, one of the glasses were chipped so he was trying to replace it with another one and per our server the bartender decided the right thing to do was dump my martini into a wine glass. Also my friends mint julep we're just crumpled mint and ice and a very weak cocktail. It was very disappointing to say the least. The location was perfect, we enjoyed the rest of the jet shows, our food wasn't the best at the price point, unfortunately the service is not  the highlight of this restaurant.
author: jo c.

description: Pricey but good! I can't give this place 5 stars because of the price of the food. Hands down the best crab cakes I have ever had and the Beef Medallions were cooked to perfection and greens were cooked so tastefully! Calamari could have used some peppers to make them stand out. Service was great and very professional. If you are looking for a great view of Alcatraz and the Wharf while dining on some SFO classics, look no further!
author: Abel G.

description: Food poisoning  Save yourself and do not go!!!!! They were rude about it and gave NO REFUND for POISONING me!!! In many reviews others have gotten sick from here as well !
author: Angela A.

description:
View - great 
First visit - wonderful
Dec 15, 2017 - my birthday - absolutely terrible 
I am so disappointed because for my birthday I had reservations for dinner. My husband and I were so excited because we were staying in the city and had picked McCormick & Kuleto's for dinner. We walked in and were a few minutes late. Other people were waiting as well. The host nodded and I stood there for a few minutes at the host stand. He then looked up and said stand over there. I went closer to the door and after 16 minutes to leave. Never had I been so ignored by a restaurant professional. I know the restaurant was busy it was Friday night and the holiday time but...I hope the restaurant management reads this and that I get a response. I am a hospitality professional and my training and actually my upbringing would never allow me to be so dismissive of people. Maybe they don't need the business but I will never recommend your restaurant. Sorry because I had a great lunch there a few years ago with a super attentive server.
author: Ann P.

description: Came here for lunch with my family and will definitely be returning. The food was delicious, the service was great and the view by the window was phenomenal. I would definitely recommend this restaurant for anyone who would like to go to a nice/elegant restaurant.
author: Alicia M.

description:
We are huge fans of our local McCormick and Schmick's so it was hard to pass up McCormick and Kuleto's while we were in Ghirardelli Square. It was a rainy day so there weren't many people out and about which meant no wait and the best seats in the house while we dined. We had unobstructed ocean/ Alcatraz views.

We were starving having just come from the Walt Disney Family Museum. I got the shrimp and crab roll and my husband got the salmon club. We devoured the food and are extremely disappointed they don't have these at the San Jose location. The roll I got was huge and stuffed to the brim with crab and shrimp. My husband's sandwich looked so good; the salmon was cooked perfectly. I also had the Italian job cocktail which was nice and bubbly and my husband had a beer. 

It was such a nice, relaxing lunch. We really felt removed from the tourists and could recharge to head back out to whatever awaited us at Fisherman's Wharf which is just a few steps away. I would come back here no question!
author: Christine S.

description: Omgsh... for a trendy upscale place the service was lousy. The bartender was tightly wound. No one asked us how our meal was and we can hear the bartender taking his frustration on the waiters and by the way no one offered us bread! I will never come here again. Horrible horrible service!
author: Audrey L.

description: Food, service at atmosphere were all amazing. Our server, Illiana, was amazing. She suggested the perfect meals, drinks and dessert. Loved it!!!
author: David J.

description:
Please take your money somewhere else. This establishment is probably the worst place I've ever had dinner. The service was so poor from the very start. If the host tries to sit you next to the waiter post please do yourself a favor and move! There are so many things this restaurant needs to change to optimize their service and value. 

Put a screen or divider around the waiter post. It will keep that area discreet and free from butt to back touching. The booth seats below the stadium seating needs an opaque divider. As we sat eating you could see peoples feet and crotches. This was not appealing since the lady and man above were getting waaaaay to close for comfort. Secondly it kicks dirt, dust, and other fragments on to the lower tables. This is not good!!!

The food is the reason I gave another star. Aside from the potatoes being cold everything was delicious. My mahi mahi was so perfect! The plantains and pineapple chutney were a great blend of flavors. The sole was great and not over breaded. Speaking of bread the sourdough bread was disgusting and hard. 

I love McCormick's but this place has a lot to deal with. The standards here are very low in service.
author: Charlie L.

description: Beautiful view anywhere inside the restaurant great ambience and great food
author: MG B.

description: Stumbled across this beautiful restaurant in Ghirardelli Square in SF. Best view, clean, modern, comfortable place. It was literally like 3 minutes until their Happy Hour started, and even though we felt underdressed, we went in and sat at the bar. Sam, a bartender, made us feel welcomed and important. He made us two fabulous drinks, a Lemon Drop and Strawberry Haze. The freshest "drink" I've ever had. Stayed for a bite and more drinks, and enjoyed chatting with Sam and the servers. Watched Sam working professionally behind the bar to make ever drink the finest. I was truly impressed. The view of the water from this place was phenomenal and would recommend it to everyone. On a side note, I read this location was originally scouted by George Lucas for a Star Wars themed place, but didn't work out.
author: Carolyn R.

description: It's a little pricey from what I'm used to but that's what you pay for when it comes to the delicious food and service and also the view of the city. I definitely enjoyed this place. I recommend it for date night and to go for Ghirardelli ice cream right after. :-)
author: Robyn M.

description: We tried it despite the low 3 star review. Maybe I was too harsh with 2 stars but it was pretty bad. No one approached us for 10 min after seating even though it was very slow and many servers were just standing around doing nothing. Food was actually good. Though portions were very small. Mash potatoes were cold. Only 1 butter for 4 patrons for bread. No one has checked on us since getting served. I had to ask for my potatoes to be warmed. And extra butter. 10 min has passed. Beautiful view. Beautiful restaurant. So much potential!!!!! Please work on your service so you don't fold. So many empty seats here. When everywhere else we went for dinner to was packed.  No apologies from staff. Kinda cocky imo.
author: Guy H.

description: We had a great meal! Steak and shrimp scampi were delicious! View and service were wonderful!!
author: Alyssa C.

description:
The view at this location is breathtaking! It seemed like the whole restaurant is facing the windows which gives you a wide view of the bay, making it beautiful to look at while enjoying your meal. 

Otherwise, the food here is decent. I may think the food is overpriced for the taste and for the quantity you receive. 

We came when they had the Valentine's menu and ordered the appetizer: fried calamari, shrimp, and mussel ($16), main entree: king crab & steak ($63), and salmon and crab ($39). Overall, the salmon was decent, nothing too special. The king crab was pretty salty, but the steak was good. For the price, I expected more value and taste. I also wished they had more bread options rather than just sourdough. 

Adding to our experience was a little frustrating as our waiter seemed to always forget to bring what we requested, this happened several times. Our waiter seemed disinterested and distracted at times too. For a fine dining experience and at the price we paid for, I expected better service on a special day.

Otherwise, come for the view, don't expect much from the food. You can get validation parking for 2 hours by parking in the Ghirardelli parking lot right next to the restaurant.
author: Hong L.

description: This was the worst experience ever!  There were 16 of us for a dear friends birthday. We all placed our order, and then then the horror began.  The waitress kept coming back to our table to tell us that they ran out of that dish.  This happened (4) times.  Then when we received our food it was cold!  The is not an exaggeration by any means.  The manager came over and blamed this on the chef for not ordering correctly.  So why was the food cold?  Terrible food, and would not recommend this place to anyone!
author: Suzanne G.

description: My family was visiting from out of town and I took them here for their last evening. The view was absolutely stunning and the food was delicious. No complaints and clean plates all around...shrimp scampi, seared scallops, roasted chicken, blackened snapper. All delicious and well prepared. The gruyere truffle mac and cheese was incredible. I shared a side with my cousin on a whim and was blown away. Not too heavy handed with the truffles. Must try! We also enjoyed a variety of the hand crafted cocktails. The restaurant was not terribly crowded on a Wednesday evening. I'll be back!
author: R A.

description:
Nice spacious restaurant with a sweeping view of the bay, overlooking Sausalito.  We first attended a private party in a large room on the lower level before migrated to the main floor for dinner, which has three sublevels so most seats have a great view over the pier.

The service was good, and food order was accurate.  The food tastes great - we had king crab legs, Halibut, and the best yet was the chocolate mouse cake with hazelnut.  I wish the restaurant has blenders to make mixed drinks.  I settled for a chocolate martin.  I was first told they could not make it.  Then the waiter came back with one, which did not taste right, the chocolate was a bit muddy, not smooth.  

The place was full, so a bit noisy.  I would still go back though
author: Stella S.

description: Our cousins made reservations for our Anniversary so we could have the gorgeous view and dinner.  When we arrived, we were completely ignored for about 10 minutes before the host finally came over ( there were approx 20 other guests in the restaurant-- not busy at all) we were seated and given menus and then after 25 minutes with no water, no bread, no contact with any server, my cousin got up and found the manager. He stated that someone would be right over.  When the server arrived at our table she apologized and said she didn't know she was supposed to serve us because they had sent some servers home. (So clearly they weren't busy) We ordered and when the food came our cousin had ordered  cioppino -- they brought it out with no tools to crack the shellfish we had to ask for them. It was incredibly salty!! They bright no bread to the table until we asked for it then the busboy brought it and flung the butter onto the table. There was a part of my mahi mahi that was under cooked. Then to top it off, at the end of the meal I discovered a metal pelligrino cap in the bottom of the water glass that I had been drinking out of! My cousin called the server over and told her to show her manager and he never came to our table! He told her to comp 1 of our appetizers!!! On a bill that was over $200!!! As my cousin spoke to him about the terrible experience the managers only comment was "well I comp-ed an appetizer." No apologies, no concerns when my cousin told him he knew the owner and would be contacting him.  DO NOT EAT HERE!!!!  Over priced, terrible non existent service.  The best thing about this restaurant is the view. Not even that is good enough for how we were treated -- 1 star. And 2 thumbs way down
author: JulieAnn H.

description: Loved, loved our dinner here, in spite of the ill behaved, noisy children at the table next to us. Maybe we should've been seated elsewhere. There were plenty of tables.  The service, however, was excellent-very professional, quick, and friendly. The sole was light, slightly crisp and DELICIOUS!  A nice size portion and I ate every bite!  Will definitely return as we visit Ghirardelli Square frequently.
author: Linda V.

description: Bartender: biggest douchebag on earth. Didn't get his name but he had tattoos on his right arm (only bartender there). Asked him if it'd be possible to change tv to giants game and totally ignored us. Didn't even bother to look up and ask if any of the customers at the bar needed anything. To his credit, he looks like he hates his job so perhaps the shi*tty attitude is understandable. Bartender, go find a better job if you're this miserable.
author: A G.

description: Amazing steaks and fantastic appetizers. The view of the bay is perfect at sunset. Great area in Ghirardelli Square as well.
author: Ken O.

description: Possibly the best view of any restaurant in the area, especially when the sun is going down. Great customer service and food. A great place for a romantic date or for group.
author: Nancy K.

description: Delicious food with great views of Ghirardelli Square! We tried their Parmesan Crusted Petrale Sole which was perfectly cooked and full of flavour, the wild mushroom & ricotta ravioli (the only vegetarian dish on the lunch menu!) which was super delicious and Grilled Chipotle Chicken Sandwich which was ordinary. The kids had fish and chips and Mac and cheese - they loved their Mac and Cheese. The fish became very chewy after few mins! The portions here are of decent size. This place is special good for families with children. The kids menu is perfect and kids get a small activity sheet with crayons to keep them busy.
author: Shobha S.

description: Came here for my grandmother's 80th birthday. Such a beautiful restaurant, the views of the bay are breathtaking. The food is awesome, beautifully plated and delicious. Definitely recommend coming here for special events, or for a night out in the city.
author: Nicole S.

description: Just Spend $115.00 for happy hour and the food was cold and slow service. Won't recommend it.
author: Mustapha M.

description: Had a booking at 7:15pm at this place and arrived 10 minutes early. Waited a long time for someone to bother greeting us, the was directed to check in with the hosts who again took their time before bothering to acknowledge us. Tables were available but they made us wait 15 minutes before bringing us to our table. It was a Saturday night so perhaps they were busy but didn't get the impression they welcomed their guests. I'm pregnant so asked the server to see if the kitchen could go easy on the wine in my sauce but she was dismissive and said the alcohol cooks off completely. Alcohol cooking off completely is a myth and I could feel a buzz after eating my pasta so now feel very guilty for ordering this dish. Food is decent and view appears to be great (was there at night so couldn't see much). Parking validation made parking cost very reasonable. Just wish service was better.
author: Alice S.

description: Wonderful location and view. Special trip to celebrate my dtr's high school grad, and I reserved a table in advance, noting her graduation. We were given a great table, a note on our menus saying "congratulations!". Very special. Excellent salmon and sole.
author: Anne H.

description:
If you're eating here, you probably have been sightseeing all day and just want to eat already. It's location right by the water is prime - it looked like the only place to eat at Ghirardelli square, and you just want to sit down somewhere. 

The views were 5 stars. The food was 3 stars. This is not a destination for the food. It is entirely a place to eat for a nice view and great location. I would say you could get similar quality food, with an obviously less fancy atmosphere, by just grabbing some food at the stalls at Fishermans Wharf. If we hadn't spent all day sightseeing with a baby and stroller in tow - that's exactly what we would have done.
author: Christina R.

description: food is great but me and my wife had to wait for our food for 2 hours because they ran out of jumbo shrimp and forgot to tell us.
author: Sammy S.

description: This place hands down has one of the best views of the San Francisco Bay. I wish I had taken a picture because it it's truly breathtaking. I came here for drinks twice and really enjoyed my time. They have an excellent happy hour menu with great deals on drinks and appetizers. Their regular bar menu also has good options, including a sparkling wine flight (how exciting!) and delicious cocktails. I highly recommend the Summer Spice, which is the perfect combination of spicy and sweet. We also tried their baked brie off the bar menu, which was a hit. If I'm back in Ghiradelli square, I will definitely stop by McCormick and Kuleto's!
author: Sungeeta A.

description:
Not a good experience and I would recommend avoiding. 

I booked this venue for an important client dinner with European customers and it was an absolute shambles. I am still reeling from how poorly everything went - as a former waitress, I cannot reconcile myself to how poorly everything was handled. It wasn't just one thing, it was a series of ridiculous and entirely avoidable situations.

Because the restaurant won't seat you at your reservation time unless all party members have arrived, I waited at the bar, where I was joined by my party. Our bartender was very good and for 4 drinks (1 cocktail and 3 glasses of wine), our bar tab was $58.00. That went quick!

We then went to our table. We waited 25 minutes to be approached by our waiter; I ordered a bottle of the same wine from him. He returned in good time and poured it round so now we were ready to order. I ordered the Hawaiian Opah fish dish, which I had never had before but was excited to try. Two of my guests ordered the cioppino (a San Francisco seafood stew) and the remaining 2 ordered scallops, and 2 of us ordered small salads as starters.
