The waiter returned within a few minutes to explain that the kitchen was out of the Hawaiian Opah and asked me to choose a new dish. I saw at the top of the menu that they had a "simply grilled" section, so i told him I wanted the Ahi Tuna, simply grilled. He pointed to the Ahi dish on the menu and asked, "This one?" I explained no, I didn't want that dish because the tuna here is sesame crusted and I don't want bok choy. Instead, I just want the fish itself simply grilled. He said it would be no problem and left - although I was confused why he didn't ask if I wanted any other items on the plate with the fish, I assumed the kitchen would accompany it with some vegetables.

The beginning salads were delivered and I had ordered the "Heirloom Tomato and Cucumber" version. The dish was 98% cucumber in a parsley dill sauce (quite good) with only 2 slices of tomato. I would have assumed a 50/50 combo here, or at least 40/60 as they were showcasing the heirloom tomatoes. It was a bit disappointing because of the missing tomatoes.

When our entrees were delivered, only 3 dishes came out first: 2 cioppinos and one scallop. After a few minutes, my dish was delivered to me, except it was seafood stuffed salmon. Due to a bivalve allergy, I cannot risk eating something which may have clams, scallops, oysters or mussels, so it wasn't even an option for me to accept this dish. I explained I didn't order salmon, and the table runner asked what I had ordered. I said that I requested the Ahi Tuna simply grilled. He immediately went back to the kitchen. 

I was left to wonder, "Where is my other diner's scallops dish?" But it didn't come! 

15 minutes later, the table runner comes back with the missing scallops (thank God) and a new dish for me. You guessed it: it was the Ahi Tuna sesame crusted with bok choy dish - the specific one I said I did not want. 

By this point, my client who ordered the scallops had already finished her meal, and the two cioppino diners were about halfway through. I was also highly embarrassed by this point. The table runner insisted he would get me whatever I wanted, but as my clients were nearly finished and I had no confidence it would be satisfactory again, I declined. 

During the remaining 35 minutes of our meal, our waiter never returned to our table. This was an opportunity to explain what had happened, apologise, and maybe even try to upsell us on a 2nd bottle of wine. At the very least, he could've bussed the table. 

I excused myself to the ladies' room where I then experience "the final straw." Out of 5 ladies' stalls, one of them had toilet roll. The others had stacks of paper towels in each one, as desperate women were using this item instead of loo roll. There were also paper towels scattered all over the floor.

I went back to our table, where the waiter finally came to bus the dirty dishes. I asked to see the manager, who said that he understood there was a kitchen order mixup with my dish. I explained to him in great detail all of the above. 

He explained that Mark was "one of his better servers" and he was very sorry this had happened. He also said he had no female hostesses on staff, and these ladies are the ones who normally check the women's toilets throughout the night. He admitted he should've sent a dishwasher in periodically to see how the room looked. 

He expressed confusion as to why the 2nd scallop dish was so delayed in being delivered, apologised, and said he would take this dish off the menu. I explained patiently that it wasn't just the server's fault; there were clearly numerous problems going on in this restaurant. He asked what more he could do to satisfy me and so I suggested he also take the single bottle of wine off the check.
author: Christie F.

description: Fantastic service,  they managed to seat us near a window without a reservation.   Ambience and  food were both top notch.  Really appreciate them saving the day and getting us a seat quick.
author: Juan C.

description: Crap service. Crap food. You do not get what you pay for at all here. Service was terrible. Slow. I'd rather eat Taco Bell. Oh and not to mention over 40 mins into our wait they decided to tell us they were out of rib eye so we had to put a different order in and wait some more. That's not acceptable. For such a beautiful view they should probably get their shit together. And the steak and fritters is crap. Don't order it. $115 buck down the drain. Take your money somewhere else.
author: Reese B.

description: We've been here numerous time with good meals and service. Last night was a major disappointment. Arrived at 7:45 for 8:15 reservations. Place was not too busy. Went to the bar, sat at a high top and waited-10 minutes for a useless waitress. She didn't know what bourbon or tequila they had, suggested we go to the bar to look ourselves. We did and ordered. 15 minutes later, no drinks and we were led to our table. Another 10 minutes passed and no drinks or waitstaff approached us. Finally flagged down a manager who asked "what do you want?" I said bread, water, and a waitstaff. Waitress finally arrived, took our order and left. 20 minutes later we get bread and water, then dinner, and our initial order of drinks arrived. Scallops were ok, chowder was good as were the salads, salmon was tasteless. Asparagus we ordered never arrived. Waitress never returned except to give us the check. Again, not a busy night but the service was unacceptable and the food was fair.
author: Penny H.

description:
FOOD POISONING. DO NOT EAT HERE. 

I vacationed to San Francisco with three of my friends in February. It was our last night in town, and we had to be up early Monday (President's Day) to drive back home to Los Angeles for work on the following Tuesday. 

We decided that our last meal would be at McCormick and Kuletos, a restaurant recommended highly by one of the three friends I went with. Two of my friends got separate meals -- I believe on was shrimp scampi and the other was the linguini. 

But me and one other friend got the San Francisco Cioppino. 

Around 2 AM, I was woken up by a gurgling in my stomach and had to rush to the bathroom to vomit. My other friend, the one who also got the Cioppino came into the bathroom and started to vomit as well. For the rest of the night until early morning, we could do nothing but vomit. I attempted to sip water, but could not keep anything down. The minute I started to drink, I would vomit. 

Because we HAD to be back for work, we piled in the car with thick trash bags and proceeded to make the long drive home. I vomited whenever I attempted to hold down liquid, and quickly began to dry heave. We were about 3 hours out when I began to vomit bile. Now, that's a really bad sign. Because the next thing after bile is blood. I began to feel light headed as well, as if I were going to pass out. And my whole body was shaking. 

The nearest place was a hospital. They immediately got me in and gave me two IV bags of water and told me that it was good I stopped by and that i likely would have passed out had I attempted to continue the drive. They gave me some anti-nausea medicine and advised me to slowly start to drink liquids while on the anti-nausea medication. We drove the rest of the way home after that, and I had to spend the next two days home from work as I continued to slowly recover due to health complications from the food poisoning. 

We informed McCormick and Kuletos of what happened, and they were very insensitive, didn't apologize, and were only concerned with asserting that we were 'fine now' so everything should be OK. We requested a refund of the meal and that they should assist with my medical bills. 

This became a two month process of attempting to get in contact with them over and over. They were always very slow to respond. Finally, this past week, I received a notice in the mail that they will not honor my claim and that they deny all accountability related to our food poisoning. They did not even refund the meal. What was supposed to be a nice $30 meal to cap a great vacation has become a very expensive hospital bill that I will be paying off over the course of the next year. 

Their food poisoning ruined the entire ending of the vacation for all four of us. 

They do not care about their customers or their experience. 

DO NOT EAT HERE.
author: Ethan L.

description: Great fresh fish. Unique recipes. Fabulous view ! Great service - waiter very attentive.
author: Sally P.

description:
Update--.  Manager emailed to smooth over but she never followed through with promised phone contact.    
**********************

TOURIST TRAP- Burn and Churn service and food.   LOCALS should avoid.     

My Wife and I had lunch here in June.  It was a spur of the moment thing and nothing special.   I had a crab melt (waiter was able to get cook to accommodate) and my Wife had a scallop plate, that went back twice-   Grit in scallops, cooked to death the second plate.  

We thought we'd try again (hey---it used to be good like 15 years ago....) so..... We made reservations for 7 people for 530pm on 23DEC17.   We received a confirmation call three hours prior.   We told them we would be on time.

We arrived on time.  Hostess said they were short handed and seating would be delayed.   We asked for a table near the bar, as the lobby was packed and we were tired of getting bumped by passer bys.  We were told we could go to the bar, but no tables could be attended.  

I reminded the MGR when he came up that we had a reservation for our 30th wedding  Anniversary.   We were in suits and ladies in gowns and heels, as we had attended the afternoon Nutcracker Show.   We were not walk in tourists looking for a last minute table.

We  were seated at a nice corner, window table.   The menus were customized wishing us a Happy 30th Anniversary. We ordered drinks and appetizers after a more than lengthy wait.  Our server was a nice lady, but slow.  

We had dinner show up before salads, and were asked if we still wanted them.  We elected to pass, citing we'd prefer to have had t hem prior, and we did request a second round of drinks. (never came, never billed)

My Wife ordered a scallop and shrimp medley, and was satisfied, but did say it was not hot.   My Brother had medallions, his Wife a chicken plate and my Daughter a ravioli.     I had ordered a Filet mid-rare, and it was near raw.  Blood dark red and cold in and out.  

I requested it be replaced.      20 minutes later, it arrived.  Same piece brought out (end cut of the tenderloin, flat and triangular, the piece is usually butterflied and sold as medallions, not served as a filet..... just saying....) missing the end I had cut into.   I cut it directly in half.  Still cold, still blood rare.   The manager (assumed he was) had brought it. I called him back over to show him.  He graciously offered to "replace with anything on the menu". 

I declined.   The whole party had finished their meals 10 minutes prior to the "re-fire" showing up.    Secondly, if a steak house cannot cook a simple filet to medium rare, what possesses them to think they can do anything right? 

He brought a bottle of Scharffenberger sparkling wine from Mendecino ($13 at Safeway, but nice touch) to apologize.    He sent out a round of deserts on him.   

In all fairness, I just wanted a steak for dinner at a professed steak house.      I had iced tea and water, and a piece of shortbread from a desert.   My Wife and I are LDS and don't drink, and I'm gluten intolerant.   Desert was a no go. 

Disappointed.    Will not return.    no third chances given here.

Stay away---- this place churns vacationing diners.....
author: Bill F.

description: Ordered a garlic grilled salmon. They served the smoked salmon which I do not like. Told me I had been given  the garlic grilled salmon. Really?  The smoke was so obvious. Don't appreciate trying to pass off a wrong order for what I ordered.
author: Nancy E.

description: We came here for the view, but was pleasantly surprised by their selection of wine and those raviolis! Luscious!
author: Patricia R.

description: Just visiting here for business, we had a business dinner in the dolphin room and it was spectacular. The views are amazing! It's located right off the water,  you can see Alcatraz and the other neighboring cities. The food was delicious and the service was very good. We all had a great time!
author: Cassidyand Michael R.

description:
I am a real fan of the food and ambiance that McCormick & Kuleto's Seafood & Steaks provides for tourists and locals alike. I once had the opportunity to come for an event and eat in their Captain's Room. With their nicely prepared food and stunning view of the bay from the restaurant's huge bay windows, I knew I had to return one day! Luckily I finally got the chance to try out a few dishes and all I can say is I can't wait to come back for more and try out their Happy Hour.

Friends and I came on a gloomy Sunday afternoon after having a fun old time at the nearby Ghirardelli Chocolate Festival. And after that event concluded late Sunday afternoon, we were still experiencing our sugar high and needed to get some food in our system. It also helped that at the fest McCormick & Kuleto's provided the best treat of all the vendors, a chocolate ganache tart, plus they gave away coupons for a dessert worth ten dollars, so we were sold. Fortunately for us, McCormick & Kuleto's wasn't packed on this day and even allowed us to get a reservation (and therefore points via OpenTable!). Our wait for a table was a mere five minutes and the staff was nice to place the three of us at a beautiful table in the center of their dining room overlooking Aquatic Park and San Francisco Bay.

We knew weren't super hungry and although we were bummed that McCormick & Kuleto's don't have a Happy Hour on weekends as well, we decided since we were so close to Fisherman's Wharf, we all wanted clam chowder. The best and most affordable option was to get one New England Clam Chowder sourdough bowl to share and since they were not as hungry have another of our diners get the chowder in a regular bowl and eat that with the complimentary bread they serve. At $13.50 and $8 respectively, both prices were actually quite worth it. The clam chowder tasted warm and flavorful filled with a decent amount of clams versus potatoes and the best part was the warm soup melted the sides of the sourdough bread bowl really nicely so when you scraped the sides there was an equal bread to soup ratio on your spoon. For our second dish, we chose from the appetizer menu, the Steamed P.E.I. Black Mussels topped with Fennel, Linguica Sausage and most importantly Jalapeno Cilantro Butter. It was that butter sauce which was rich and creamy and totally made the dish one of my favorite mussel dishes of all time and it was perfectly paired with the complimentary bread. The linguica sausage tasted more like traditional Chinese lap cheong sausage, but I give them credit for having the dish filled with plenty of mussels, as there was not a single empty shell in the entire dish.

Despite only having two dishes we were stuffed as there was plenty of food on both plates. We still had our dessert coupon to use and after perusing the menu, we were all chocolated out so we went with the Upside Down Candied Walnut Apple Pie which was baked twice with a Candied Walnut Crust with warm caramel sauce and served with Double Rainbow vanilla bean ice cream. It tasted like an apple crostini meets and upside down cake, warm and fluffy and paired perfectly when served with the huge scoop of ice cream. It was the perfect way to end the evening with a warm meal. The good news continued because my friend was able to use her Landry's points thanks to McCormick, which is affiliated with the nationwide McCormick & Schmick's franchise but named after their local restaurateur-owner Paul Kuleto, also being apart of that group's rewards program so our bill was very very affordable. Everything was perfect, from our food to the service provided by our server Shakela, who treated us like friends, made this late afternoon meal one to remember. I just reminded me that franchises that exist in tourist meccas like Ghirardelli Square can be a great place for locals to enjoy a nice meal as well!
author: Jason F.

description:
I really liked it here; from their enormous windows out to the beautiful scenery, to the accommodating waiters and waitresses, this is a perfect spot for a first impressions date or just an outing with the girls for lunch.

I used to live by a McCormick & Schmick's restaurant but was not truly pleased by the food, but here at McCormick & Kuleto's it's a whole other realm.  It's not as packed during the day which is good because you get to enjoy your meal without feeling rushed to eat fast.

THE STAFF -

Our waitress was very accommodating when it came to our needs, and even asked if we had any allergies that would need to be addressed (you don't get that too often).  I never felt rushed to eat fast even If I was just looking out the window.  She really treated us like she loved working there.

THE FOOD -

Like all my seafood affairs, I like to start off with Fried Calamari, and if they have any - some fresh oysters!  The Calamari was sub par but their Oysters were amazing! I was astonished by the freshness of their Oysters, as if they were caught that morning.  

My date ordered their Jumbo Shrimp Scampi pasta which had the cutest mouth watering shrimps topped on which I got to taste a little bit of *winks.

I ordered Fish and Chips only because I haven't had it in such a long time -  I could probably eat this for lunch any given day, the way It was cooked was beautiful.  As I cut through the fish, I can descry the heat glistening off onto my fork, absolutely beautiful!

I would definitely come here again, It was a joy!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Fried Calamari (large $13.50)

12 oysters $33.99

Fish and Chips $18.99

Jumbo Shrimp Scampi pasta $26.99
author: Marina S.

description:
The restaurant was crowded when we arrived. The person at the reception who appeared to be the manager was very condescending telling us multiple times that we'd get paged when the table was ready and that we should go to the lounge area which was no less crowded witout any table or bar seats left. 

We waited for over 20 minutes and didn't receive any page. We had a full view of the reception area from where we were standing and we could see people who came after us with later reservation time were getting seated. 

When we went back to the reception to check, our name was gone from the system. No apologies from the people at the reception area and the manager(?) who was passing by didn't even bother to stop by or understand what was going on. No explanation whatsoever given.

We did get seated eventually and the server was great even though the overall service was very slow. I had brought out of town guests to this place a few times because of the location and the food - serving some sf classic seafood fare. But I will never come back here again.
author: Dyne L.

description: If you are a vegetarian, DON'T COME HERE. Would be a struggle finding anything reasonable to eat here then. They have a great view of the Bay and all that, pretty high end place in general. But only if you love Sea food.
author: Ram S.

description: Mediocre food, over-priced, nothing too memorable here except the view is phenomenal.
author: Paige R.

description:
My family and I dined here last night for my mom's birthday/Mother's Day. She wanted steak and lobster and this is the better option I could find within a short time frame. We got a decent table on the second tier facing the water. Once our food came around though it had gotten really dark to see our food. So, about the food: I ordered the mushroom and cheese ravioli in tomato basil cream sauce, my mom ordered a large crab plate, my younger siblings just ordered off the kid's menu, and I honestly did not see what the rest of the adults ate. I asked for lobster bisque as a starter for my mom and I to share, because one, a bisque always sounds tasty, and I saw it mentioned in many reviews. The waitress brought it out with 4 spoons but no other small bowls. I do not mind eating from the same bowl as my mom but others wanted to try as well, and I was not about to have them dipping their spoons in over and over. The waitress looked at me a little funny when I asked, but that's okay. I found the taste to be amazing, but to my surprise my mom quickly stopped eating. "I can taste too much butter", she said. She also thought maybe too much heavy cream. I had a few more spoonfuls before deciding she was probably right. My mom's crab with mashed potatoes (they don't have baked potatoes) came out and she was ecstatic. My circular ravioli, covered in the cream sauce, looked okay as well. I never have been and never will be into sauces being slathered sll over my meals. But I gave it a shot. All I could really taste was the semi-firm eggplant in the pasta. The sauce, much like the bisque, was so heavy in cream. I looked at the plate and remembered it was $21. I was not hungry enough nor interested enough in the plate to justify that. I sent it back and asked for a simple side of mac n' cheese, which was made with gruyere and truffle oil, supposedly. I liked it better and couldn't even finish half the bowl. I was much happier with my $8 pasta. 

The food was good and the service was professional. She wasn't a spunky waitress by any means but she was helpful. She also made sure to bring out a little dessert for my mom's birthday. Overall, I did like the food, and there is a small chance I'd come back to try the Dungeness crab cake. Just keep in mind that this food is VERY heavy. I took a walk with my sisters afterward.
author: Delana T.

description: First of all this restaurant is so beautiful and immaculate. Second the view is so awesome, the best view of the bay...third, the food is delicous but there is still improvement with their variety of choice. All in all so far this is the best seafood restaurant that we ate in a long time in sf...
author: Armand A.

description:
FANTASTIC happy hour! In a city as expensive as SF, finding a quality meal that won't take up all your funds is difficult, and I got a top-notch burger, a basket of fresh Boudin's sourdough, and a big glass of Anchor Steam for under $12. Amazing. 

I can see the service being slower when it's busy, but if you go and get a burger it's definitely worth the wait! The view was amazing, the staff friendly, and I couldn't have asked for a better end to my SF visit.

Thank you!
author: Jaime B.

description: Only thing good about this place is the view. Typical tourist trap restaurant located right in Ghiradelli Square. Our waiter spilled a drink all over my husband's pants and phone and they did nothing to apologize for this. We also secretly ordered a cake to surprise our friend for her birthday, and the same waiter spoiled the surprise. Food was mediocre and way over priced.
author: Christina C.

description: I can only tell you what I know and only on this day.  I dropped by with my wife after a day@ the Fillmore Jazz Festival. We had an order of a dozen oysters and a bowl of clam chowder--with a glass of white wine and a stout of course.  It was off the hook.  The Bay views were tremendous!  A very romantic and relaxing place to dine or just have a drink.  Please check this place out.  Very top notch, my friends!
author: Abel H.

description: The crab cake was great! The fetuccini I got was a little too salty. The view is amazing. This place makes for a great date night spot because of the view but the food is just decent. The service is great.
author: Kavya T.

description:
Made it in for dinner today, food was decent but the service was extremely slow. I asked for a window seat but didn't get one, fine but I'm stuck in the second row where your waiters are too busy to pay any attention to. My friend had to go and flag you down to get a check. 

I wanted to share a few dishes with my friend so I asked to split it so we can share. They said they could not do it, mine you we are ordering more then 1 dish per person. They said they would bring plates to share but never did.

We also ordered the spinach but it never came. More I think about it the more upset I am getting. This is unacceptable. Very careless.
author: Tiff W.

description: I don't think I've ever left a negative review and I honestly barely use yelp but I needed to say something. The hostess was rude, talked on the phone for ten minutes, and completely ignored us even though we told her we have reservations. We stood there and waited with no explanation and she pretended to be REALLY busy even though the restaurant had maybe 5 people in it. We finally got seated way after we should have been, and then it took the waiter FOREVER to take our drink orders. Once she brought them out, 2 of them were wrong. It took another ten minutes to take our order and now I'm sitting here for an hour and 15 minutes and still no food..... this is taking so long..... and this restaurant is not packed. I'm so confused. Our waiter is being nice about it but everyone and everything is SO SLOW.
author: Jackie P.

description: We had happy hour here. We really loved the oysters and the salmon poke. My husband had a Manhattan, which he really liked.
author: Lauren H.

description:
You go here for the pleasant and admirable ocean view while having good food to go with it!

The scene was very enjoyable and they take big party reservations.

Do order up their raw oysters, fried calamari, rich escargot and creamy lobster bisque as starters!

I liked their Cioppino and Linguini with clams as entrees!  Two of my favorite picks.  

The fish and chips were a pass for me.  Their steak was decent, but it was missing some sort of potato or carbs on the side with it.  They only gave veggies with it.  Their scallops were not seared well enough to crisp perfection that I prefer.  Skip.

Staffing was good.  The food came out in a timely manner. 

A recommended place for the bay view with good meals!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Spacious Seating Great for Family and Kids, friendly staff, big plates, cocktail drinks were a bit diluted. 

Nice atmosphere for a touristy place.
author: tommy c.

description: This restaurant has a great location in Ghirardelli Square and an amazing view of the bay. I had dinner here with a group of friends and the overall experience was pretty decent. It has the standard fancy sit-down restaurant setup. Nice interiors, large wine menu, and somewhat pricy food. I ordered the Raspberry Affair from their cocktail menu. It wasn't as good as it sounded - a bit too thick for my liking. If I ever go again, I will probably try out the Blueberry Squeeze. For the main dish I had Shrimp Scampi. To be honest I wasn't super impressed with it. Neither the shrimp nor the sauce stood out to me :/ It was okay pasta, but not something I would go back for. The desserts were great. We had a couple orders of Crème brûlée, ice cream sundae, cheesecake, port wines, etc. They were all amazing, though I don't know if dessert alone is gonna be a good enough reason for me to go back :P The wait staffs were very attentive, but it did take a long time for drinks/food to come out after ordering.
author: Angel C.

description: We've been here numerous time with good meals and service. Last night was a major disappointment. Arrived at 7:45 for 8:15 reservations. Place was not too busy. Went to the bar, sat at a high top and waited-10 minutes for a useless waitress. She didn't know what bourbon or tequila they had, suggested we go to the bar to look ourselves. We did and ordered. 15 minutes later, no drinks and we were led to our table. Another 10 minutes passed and no drinks or waitstaff approached us. Finally flagged down a manager who asked "what do you want?" I said bread, water, and a waitstaff. Waitress finally arrived, took our order and left. 20 minutes later we get bread and water, then dinner, and our initial order of drinks arrived. Scallops were ok, chowder was good as were the salads, salmon was tasteless. Asparagus we ordered never arrived. Waitress never returned except to give us the check. Again, not a busy night but the service was unacceptable and the food was fair.
author: Ed F.

description: This is mine and my husband's go-to for special occasions and when our families come to visit. The dining room itself is spacious and beautiful and the views of the Bay are incomparable. If they know ahead of time that it's a birthday or anniversary, they will personalize the menu for you. It's a really sweet touch that goes a long way! Will always be loyal to them!
author: Emily B.

description: I am really surprised that this restaurant doesn't have stronger reviews. The lunch I had was excellent - Dungeness Crab Cocktail and then the Petrale Sole. Be sure to ask for the bread - it is excellent Sourdough! The menu items are varied and makes one challenged in deciding what to have! One very nice extra is the incredible view of San Francisco Bay - I'd come here for the view no matter the quality of the food!
author: Lindy H.

description: Stopped by here during Fleet Week for my wife's birthday dinner.  The staff were very accommodating and seated us quickly.  Great view, waiter was very knowledgeable and food was fantastic!  Highly recommend!
author: David J.

description: Decent food. Service very slow. Took forever to get our drinks. Ended up turning away wine when it arrived after already finished main course. Won't return.
author: April W.

description:
Beautiful scenery, entrees pricey enough to pay a week's worth of gas and the Ghiradelli Square- what more can I ask for?

McCormik's is right in the heart of Ghiradelli Square. It's a place to take your date out for enjoying the romantic scenery across from the bay. It's a place to feel like a high roller with some wine in a wine glass. It's also a place to feel like a fancy diner for about 60-90 minutes then cry at the dinner bill for even eating like the Queen of England, but hey... It was all worth it in the end.

My mother, sister, and I stumbled upon this restaurant to fill our empty stomachs. From the time we entered to dine-in to the time we left, we embraced the elegance of the restaurant. 

Our course started off with beverages and a plate of bread with butter. Although the bread was too chewy to handle, it was enough to keep me sane throughout the next dish. Next came out the soup. While my mother and sister ate the clam chowder, I enjoyed slurping my chicken and rice soup. The chicken and rice soup was flavorful and not too salty nor bland. I love the balanced ratio between chicken, rice and vegetables. On the other hand, I sampled a little bit of the clam chowder and it was rich and creamy with a distinct garlic aftertaste. Afterwards we got our main dish! My mom had the Mahi-Mahi, my sister had eggplant ravioli, and I had the clam linguini. All dishes were equally good as I took a sample out of my mom's and sister's plate, but my pasta was the hi light of my afternoon. I love how the dish was represented and the noodles were cooked. The white wine the chef used for the pasta plus the pepper crumbs neutralized the clams making it taste savory with a slight spicy kick. Although, I didn't add any Parmesan cheese,  I think the dish would be better without it unless you like some part of your pasta super cheesy... Nevertheless, we left full and happy!

Overall, this is a pretty cool place, but I have to take away one star for the high roller prices and the waiter for getting a little too friendly with my sister, myself, and my mom. He was charismatic but his flirt game was no Bueno.
author: Aubrey D.

description: This spot is unfortunately overrated and overpriced. It is a faux high end restaurant. The service was below par and the food was upsettingly extremely bland and lifeless. We arrived over an hour before our reservation time and waited in hopes of having a view of the pier only to be stuffed in a small corner booth. We ordered the salmon and a steak well done (don't judge) and both came out medium rare. Not worth a visit at all.
author: Ashley S.

description: We bought out the whole restaurant for an event that was flawless. Couldn't recommend more. Thanks, Susan and staff!
author: Noelle F.

description: Great location.  Good service.  That's it though.  Food was very average.  We sent a $37 ribeye back for being too tough though the second one was a better cut and tender.  The mashed potatoes look and tasted like they were from a box.  Fish and chips not great and the beef medallion was ok but the sauce was bland and the large pile of spinach was tasteless and stringy with stems. For the price nothing special. Very noisy and cramped sitting.  We were sitted at booth that was way too small for four adults. The noise level was high.  We won't return for dinner.
author: Mary H.

description: Good steak, horrible and super slow service. Lobster was beyond salty, I would have told our server except he was nowhere to be seen. I would have told the manager but he was arguing with another table. So disappointed, the restaurant is nice but not worth the trouble.
author: Arianna J.

description:
We walked in, the host ignored us while we waited, and then proceeded to help another group that came in after us. When we told him we were there first, he said he's helping the that group
First, ignored us, and continued to help them. If this is the introduction to the restaurant, I'd hate to see the rest of how they deal with customer service. We walked out.
author: Brizzi B.

description: This is one of the best meals I've ever had. We split the lobster crab dip, I had the crab legs but instead of the potatoes I opted for a side of their gruyere mac n cheese, just wow. I looooved the upside down apple pie. Incredible service. Will be back!!!
author: Kelsey J.

description:
This restaurant seems to have mixed reviews, but we decided to try it anyways and give it a shot. Sat and had a drink at the bar while we waited for our table to be ready (we were early for our reservation.) No one came to tell us when our table was ready (even though they said they would), we had to go ask.

We were sat right in front of the huge Windows, which was nice. It was relatively busy, but it was a Saturday night so that's to be expected. Drinks came quickly which was nice. We ordered appetisers (soup and salad). Sourdough bread was brought out quickly after our order and soup and salad came out reasonably. They were both tasty.

Our main courses took quite a while to me. Luckily I still like my husband enough to talk to him and make the time pass. When they did come, we were actually really happy with them. Husband's filet mignon was cooked perfectly and really flavourful, which was nice because most places overcook steaks. My seared ahi was also really nice when paired with all the sides, but on its own was a bit bland. We both finished our meals, so we were too full for dessert.

Overall, good meal, good service. Things could be better, especially for the price, but I wasn't disappointed. The only thing that was upsetting really was the bathrooms were a mess. Trash overflowing and toilet paper all over the floor. Nobody had obviously checked on them for a long time.
author: Sarah K.

description:
I am very sad to write this review because going in I thought it would be another 5 star experience confirming the expectations I had of a restaurant/group of this reputation and caliber.  Honestly, they could have easily done WAY better and earned the full 5 stars.

Unfortunately not.

Pros:
1. There were 2 of us and we were sightseeing around the square, and too lazy to go elsewhere for dinner after a tiring day, so around 5:30pm on Friday evening, we decided to check if M&K had reservations for later in the evening. I walked in and spoke to the hostess, who was very sweet and engaging, and she immediately hooked us up for a Bay view table for 6pm.
2. When we returned at 6pm, we were immediately seated in the front, on the balcony level.  While I preferred being right by the window, those tables were clearly being saved for larger groups, and the booth we had was central and not shabby at all.  Turned out later that we actually realized we had a better view since we were higher up and looking over the others by the window than past them.
3. The Crab & Shrimp Stuffed Salmon - more on this below.

Cons:
1. Our Waiter.  He was awful.  Nothing at all what I had expected.  I went to wash my hands and left the kiddo, who happens to be an adult, alone at the table. She was ignored the entire time I was gone. When I returned, no one showed up for about 10 minutes even though the restaurant was still not busy. Once our waiter did show, and realized we only wanted to drink waters with our meals, he became aloof and non-existent. He brought our waters and bread and took our orders all at once, barely replied to my question of what he recommended, and then vanished until we had to flag him down for the check.  My daughter, who always sees the best in people and never points out bad service, pointed his behavior out...so I knew it was bad.  We both noticed all the other waitstaff engaged with their customers, read off specials, answered questions, came by to ask if everything was OK and refilled glasses, etc.  Not the same for us.  Someone else brought our food to our table when it was ready (which took nearly 45 minutes after ordering, but we were enjoying the view and bread/butter, so not a problem). We finished our meals and sat with dirty plates in front of us for almost 20 minutes before I saw him and waved him over. When he finally brought the check, he literally dropped it on our table in a pass by on his way to another table. No stopping. No thank you. WOW!  I don't know what to say.  This is not at all what I expected here.  He didn't seem new at his job and surely was trained better.  I was in a good mood and wouldn't let him bring me down so I still tipped him in full and assumed he was having a bad day.  To his benefit, he did wave at us we were walking out the door.
2. Anchor Steam Fish & Chips.  I don't even want to think about these ever again but I will for the sake of this review.

Food:
1. Appetizer - 6 raw oysters ($17) - nothing special - they were gritty and needed a proper cleaning before being served. I have tasted better in Japan but they were OK, once you got past the grit, and came with the traditional cocktail and horseradish sauces and lemon (no Tabasco). 
2. The Crab & Shrimp Stuffed Salmon ($35) - Oh. My. God. I could eat this for days.  I wanted to lick the plate clean.  I didn't want this to end. I didn't want to share. The salmon was cooked to perfection and sat in a decadent, yet delicate, cream sauce. The stuffing was delicious and the sides of red peppers and green beans and mashed potatoes were yummy. I did end up sharing half with the kiddo because...
3. Anchor Steam Fish & Chips ($25) - her order, since she had been craving fish and chips, SUCKED.  It smelled bad, a very fishy odor and definitely not fresh and the fish had a peculiar flavor.  I tried two bites and regretted it since it ruined the beautiful mouth memories I had from my own salmon. The fish was greasy and tasted heavy with oil, even though it was lightly battered. The fries were soggy. The side of coleslaw cut thru the grease a bit but not much. I felt bad for her since she tried my food and wished she had ordered the same. As a good mom, I gave her half my food and we left most of the fried platter alone.
IMHO, fancy-shmancy restaurants do NOT know how to cook fried fast food type dishes at all and should not even try. Long John Silver would be a yummy and welcomed 10/10 compared to what M&K served as a fried fish and chip platter, which gets a -3/10.  Shame its even on the menu.
4. We skipped dessert since we were ready to get out of there by the time he came by with the check.
author: Nunya B.

description: I'm writing this as my first ever review on yelp after years of using it because this place deserves it. I came her for my girlfriends birthday and made a reservation ahead of time. They went out of their way to give us a fantastic table with an incredible view, a menu that said happy birthday to my girlfriend, and an incredible complimentary dessert that topped off the night. We were so impressed not only with how kind everyone was but also with how fantastic the food was. She got scallops and I got the stuffed salmon. Both to die for. Thank you for the incredible night and one to remember.
author: Tyler B.

description: Clam chowder was great everything we ate was good. Pinot Grigio was also excellent. Good service. View of harbor was great
author: Jerry O.

description:
Ill start with the only negative: our server was as knowledgable as you would expect in a restaurant of this caliber. Wine and food recommendations were a bit off. 

Now on to the positives. The food was exceptional. The crab and mango tower was just over the top. Very tasty and the ingredients complimented each other very well. I got the pacific snapper and my wife had the beef bordelaise. We ended up splitting both because neither of us could decide which we liked better. The beef was so tender and the fish was done perfectly. Very flaky and popped with taste. The sauces for both (bordelaise for the beef and ginger soy for the fish) were done so well they didn't overpower at all. 

The view is amazing as well. It overlooks San Francisco Bay and when it is lit up at night, you get an amazing experience. This place was really amazing and I can't say enough!
author: John S.

description: WARNING!!!!! Just got food poisoning from the Oysters here and have been throwing up constantly! DO NOT ORDER!!!!!!!!!!! Ridiculous to get food poisoning from such an expensive place!
author: Angela R.

description: Delicious cioppino and seafood Newburgh. Great service from our server Cloe..awesome views..this is a very nice spot to celebrate a special occasion...dined here for my husband's birthday
author: Rodney I.

description: We have had events here before and had good experience with food and service. Last night we had a party of 8 and service was 2 out of 10. Mostly the service issues were attitudinal . She challenged some of the issues that developed during our dinner. I will not be choosing M&K in the future for group events.
author: Peter E.

description: Wow. Incredible views. Classy restaurant. Good service. Food was great. Scallops and the stuffed Salmon. Both were recommended by Natalia. She was excellent. Salad was simple and quite tasty. Highly recommend v
author: Jeff F.

description: Severs were nice and restaurant manager was pleasant & professional. View is great! Food is metiocre at best.
author: Cindy B.

description: We should have looked at the other reviews, the restaurant has definitely declined since being acquired by the Landrys restaurant group. It's now a tourist trap for a good view with poor service and small portioned average overpriced food. On our visit it was 15 minutes after seating before someone came to our table. After ordering drinks and appetizers the appetizers oddly came much before the drinks. Our soups came without spoons. Our table looked right into the kitchen as they never shut its doors.  They were out of 25% of the entrees. The restrooms were disgusting with tp overflowing. When we expressed our discomfort to the manager, Douglas, he was arrogant and condescending without even apologizing. Not exactly the service you'd expect after spending $100+ per person.  His behavior really upset my parents, who are 70 and wanted a nice memory with their grandkids. We definitely won't be back or to any other Landry's managed restaurant as his behavior is unexcusable.
author: Greg B.

description: Loved every bit of our experience! The food, service and view were all top notch! We went for seafood so we were thrilled with the selection. BUT If you were going for the steak it didn't look like a large selection, just your basics. I can't wait to return and enjoy dinner next time!
author: Sarah H.

description: We had a wonderful time at this restaurant this weekend. We had reserved via open table and were seated a few minutes after our reservation time. View was just great and we got a table right next to the windows. Great view of Alcataraj and parts of the bay. We ordered the Pacific snapper which was delicious and the Ahi tuna - well made (rare) with some bok choy. Most of all the lady who took care of our table (Jessica) was well aware of our dietary restrictions and made sure she communicated that to the chef and guided us through the menu. All in all a great experience. Will definitely return!
author: Hasnain K.

description:
We made reservations for 730 on a Tuesday evening. Even with it being a Tuesday, I was surprised to see that the restaurant was completely full. 

I was recovering from an intense stomach bug and didn't have much of an appetite. My hubby and I split the ribeye and a side order of garlic mashed potatoes. The steak was perfectly split and came with a generous helping of vegetables. My in-laws split a ribeye as well and a bleu cheese wedge side salad. 

The steak was cooked perfectly and I enjoyed the garlic mashed potatoes. However, because I was still recovering from the stomach flu and did not have much of an appetite, our waiter came over to make sure everything was ok. When I explained that I didn't have an appetite he offered to bring me some ginger ale. Such a sweet gesture.

After our meal, or waiter noticed (even when the rest of us didn't) that my father-in-law had quite a bit of gristle on his steak. He spoke with the manager and brought two complimentary desserts to us. My hubby and I munched on the chocolate bag. It was a dark chocolate shell filled with white chocolate mousse and fresh fruit. 

As we were leaving I asked our waiter if I could get a ginger ale to-go. He said he was so sorry but that the restaurant did not have to-go drinks. However, he ran next door to the diner and brought me back a ginger ale to-go.

Everything about this dinner was perfect. The view of the bay was breathtaking-- especially at night. Service was on par and the food was amazing. I would come back anytime.
author: Rachel R.

description:
The Good: awesome view and great food

The Bad (really bad): Our server, Brendan, was absolutely awful. Seemed like he got just about everything wrong and items delivered late! I asked to speak to server's superior and out cane the supervisor who was useless. Then a manager came out who tried to fix my tab (oh, because I was over charged as well) and he still got the tab wrong. I finally asked for a to go box, that I had been waiting for for 20 minutes already, and for the corrected check. Manager said it was so I confronted him. He then threatened to call security on me. I walked to the front and finally spoke to the true manager that was finally able to redress the entire situation (still the tab was wrong, however, but I accepted it since I was fed up and was finally able to leave. 

Advice: if you feel your server is not going to be attentive, ask for another one. As for me, I will NOT be dining there again. Too many other nice(r) places to go in the city and that are nearby (ie, Scoma's, The Buena Vista).
author: Martin A.

description:
Enjoying happy hour amongst the tourist crush of the Wharf.
Amazing scenery and great service from our new bartender John.
Great deals for food on the 3-6 Happy hour
author: John R.

description:
Great view as you sit comfortably and see Alcatraz. Man I wish this place was still a working prison as there are a number of folks I would send here. But operating this place cost too much, so other venues are now possible for such vacations ;). 

Oh yeah,this eating place. Like any other in Frisco you have to hike up stairs or a hill, so be ready. She had the pasta with clams and I had the linguine with shrimp. Nothing special, but nice as most of the other places around are burger and pizza joints. We also had the calamari for an appetizer and it was not served very attractively nor was there the spicy red cocktail sauce or what not . I wanted to come here as 20 years ago I came here with my folks, so it was kind of nostalgia Jr dejavu kne would say. 

Tip and all about $81 buckaroos , which ain't cheap,but in this city everything is super expensive.
author: Daniel C.

description: Food was excellent but service was WAY OFF. Soup delivered without a spoon. Charged for wrong drink. Appetizer showed up at dessert. Refill on soda took forever.
author: Nancy T.

description:
If it wasn't for the drinks, the decent finger food (and by that, I really mean just the fried chicken wings) the atmosphere, and the fact that they're located in Ghirardelli Square and can boast great views of the Bay, this place would not deserve a star from me. 

I came here for a private event held by my former place of employment, and from such a nice place, I was expecting great food. They had a buffet system going for us, with the main courses being clam seafood pasta, and beef. Every clam shell that was in the platter either had no clam meat or very negligible morsels, and the overall dish was ridiculously oily. The beef tasted quite rubbery, but at least it was digestible. What really disgusted me was the rock hard bread (you could literally throw it at a window and it will break), and the stale, unimpressive dessert assortment presented after the main course (the only winner in the dessert assortment is the fresh strawberries...at least, I hope it was fresh). 

Well, at least the drinks were potent enough to make me temporarily forget the travesty that was the food. With the excessive amounts of decent and nice-looking restaurants to choose from in this city, you're better off trying your luck elsewhere.
author: Viet N.

description:
I'm typically a fan of this chain's location.  However, i was pretty disappointed when we had dinner there last night, New Year's Eve.  A limited menu was offered which is probably the reason for their shortcomings.

Service was excellent.  Sherricka was very attentive and friendly, a bit on the quiet/shy side.  She was very knowledgeable regarding the description of the food being served, beers on tap, etc.

The appetizers (lobster arancini, fritto misto, and crab/mango/avocado tower) were delicious, accordingly to the the rest of the family.

However, the restaurant fell short on the entree portion.  Most of the offerings on the limited menu are not typically serviced.  We ordered the filet au poivre, prime rib, duck breast, Chilean sea bass, and stuffed salmon.  The 1st 4 don't appear to be normally served and were all disappointing.  The filet did not have enough of the peppercorn sauce.  The prime rib was mostly fat and lacked flavor.  The duck breast was flavorless and the root vegetables were too "earthy" for the meat.  I had asked Sherricka about the duck and she took a slight pause before saying it was good.  I should have picked up on that "tell" to realize she really had no idea how the duck breast tasted.  If you really don't know, say you don't know!  The sea bass was good, but not as good as Yard House's offering.  My FIL seemed to enjoy the stuffed salmon, which is on the normal menu.  

Desserts were somewhat missing as well.  The bread pudding was saved by the white chocolate sauce drizzle.  The double chocolate mousse's white layer had a funny aftertaste to it.
author: Gene D.

description:
All I could say as we walked in was WOW! The view is absolutely breath taking and the entire restaurant was just beautiful and extremely elegant. The all glass walls over look the San Francisco Bay with views of the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz, just beautiful. Our waiter was very attentive, wine was on point but the food....TO DIE FOR! The clam chowder, delicious not to mention the calamari was definitely the best I have ever had! I had the sirloin steak with garlic mashed potatoes and sauted vegetables. I don't think I ever had a meal this delicious. I was one happy girl. :)
I HIGHLY recommend this place if you wanna make your girl feel extra special. :)
author: Marisa J.

description:
Service sucks, waited 35 min for the waiter to come by and ask us what we would like to drink. In there for about two hours. An hour and thirty minutes total just waiting for the server to come around between visits. The kicker is that there was no one there on a Thursday night at 5pm with plenty of staff working. Honestly BJ's has better food and cheaper. Food is way over priced for the quality. I would recommend Hairs Steak House over this place on Van ness.  I will give them credit for the view, it's nice. Never again, it's a typical tourist trap, that's what it felt like. We were treated as out of towners. Well we are locals and gonna tell everyone one go somewhere else.

You may have took my money, but I gave you my yelp review.
author: Ant T.

description:
Located at the north end of Ghirardelli Square. The moment you walk into this restaurant you know you are in a fine dinning establishment. The huge windows over looking the water gives you amazing views no matter what time you decide to eat. I can't understand why anyone would give this restaurant a 3 or less star rating. I've read some of the reviews about slow service. They must have never ate in a fine dinning establishment, this is not fast food. Do not rush this experience. 

To start I had the lobster bisque soup. It came well presented and tasted Devine. The flavour of Maine lobster was evident. I was surprised by the pieces of lobster in the soup. I have not had a bisque soup that was not completely liquid. 

My main was the 6oz filet accompanied by a vegetable medley. I also ordered the Yukon gold mash potatoes. I felt that the peppers in the vegetable medley were over cooked but the broccoli was cooked perfectly. The steak came with remanence of butter on top. In my opinion this is cheating a bit but it tasted great none the less. I ordered the steak medium rare and it came as a true medium rare. If you are not used to true medium rare I would suggest ordering your steak medium.  The mash potatoes were smooth and delicious. 

As far as I could tell there was no dress code which brought down the feeling of fine dining a bit. Although I felt the bill was a bit high I would recommend anyone travelling to San Fransisco to give this place a try. The views alone is worth the price.
author: Cameron P.

description: From beginning to end, this restaurant exceeded my expectations.  The friendliest staff service begins from the moment you make a reservation.   Our waitress Natalia was a sweetheart and so genuine in all she said and did.  Every course got better and better.  As a picky eater I asked to change 1 ingredient from original menu selection.  They not only honored it, but made it even better with a surprise favorite ingredient!  The flavors in each dish made us want more.  Did I mention the views???? This was a perfect romantic birthday dinner.  I can't wait to return.  Loved it.
author: MA K.

description: Happy hour menu has changed! They've added fried calamari and @$6.00 who could complain and it was delicious! $1.00 oysters on Wed. only! Cheese Burgers is still good but it seems like the beef patty got smaller. This is my favorite restaurant for happy hour. The service is exceptional tonight, Thank you all for a great evening!!!
author: Amy H.

description: Terrible customer service from "Josh" who seemed to be the seating manager. Flew in from San Diego to SF for dinner at this restaurant and disappointed/embarrassed all the way. When we arrived we politely asked for a table by the window. There was only one available but the person who sat us would find out if available. We were given a booth and Josh came over and told us "no it wasn't available". We said that's fine and continued looking at the menu. Not a big deal. A few minutes later a server came to us and told us "the table is now available you can move". So we did. Before we knew it we had Josh stomping down the restaurant and told us "I'm sorry guys I told you before this table is not available." I explained to him I had been just told by the server it was fine to move and his reply was "I am pretty sure she didn't tell you that and those weren't her words." At that point I didn't know if I should just get up, thank him, and walk out the door? Or ask him if he was calling me a liar? Long story short I kept my cool and ONCE AGAIN MOVED. People around us just looked at us. Pretty disappointing birthday celebration. Avoid this place. Terrible customer service.
author: Luis Enrique R.

description: Very poor service. Waited over 15 minutes to have someone come over to get our drink order in the bar with only about 4 other groups. Asked for a regular menu and waited over ten minutes for it. Been to other locations and usually the service is exceptional. The service here was lousy and pure laziness. No really seemed to care about the service at all. A bit disappointed but the food was still good.
author: Prit G.

description: Great view of San Francisco Bay! Good food - frito misto, lobster bisque, seared tuna. Service was a little slow when it came to getting the check, but it had been good up until that point.
author: Lisa B.

description: I took 16 of my family there just over a month ago. The service was excellent and the food incredible!
author: Parker E.

description:
whadda great place!!  once again it was valentine's weekend and i'm again back at M&K with my GF and wine comp friends....we had reservations and had a short wait...they set us up at a bay facing window with just the most wonderful view of the bay ever!!  our waiter, rachel was attentive, informative and energetic, which is hard to do on a saturday nite...after starting a few doors away w an irish coffee from the buena vista, i started w a glass of central coast pinot noir from five rivers?....well, it didn't smell/taste/look like a pinot, so i asked for the sonoma coast pinot which was lovely and quite a proper pinot...am i a frickin snob?? kinda...but if i order a pinot, it really should taste like a pinot!! rachel took care of it.....

several friends had the beef shortrib...which they said was wonderful...as a side, we had some brussell sprouts that were roasted and tasted sooo good!!  their mashed potatoes were great too....my GF had duck which was tender, moist and had sooo much flavor....oh yeah we shared a simple salad first....was pretty good....she also had a lovely sonoma county sauv blanc, can't remember from where....was clean, light citrus, and delightful finish....i had the cioppino which was awesome!!  a wonderful melange of seafood, scallops, calamari, clams, mussels, shrimp, whitefish in a savory sauce that i dipped my sf sourdough in and ate...mmmmmm....the food paired soooo well with my sonoma coast pinot....ach du liebe!! das ist gut.....

ok, so you know i don't rate many places five stars but i guess i'm gonna step out on this place cuz as a package deal, ambiance, location, food, beverages, service and style...it really does merit 5 stars!!  for valentine's dinner...for my sweetheart, with friends....soooo worth it !!
author: Doug U.

description:
I still think McCormick & Kuleto is for locals and tourists alike. A beautiful setting, especially on a clear day. Delicious food and attentive service from the staff. Second meal in a month, still no room for dessert. Shucks! Need to plan my menu choices better, next time. 

Treat yourself!
author: Debbie T.

description: The worst restaurant I have been to in many years. Never has staff in a "high end" restaurant been so arrogant, rude and non-attentive.  After waiting for 25 minutes at our table with not a single staff member so much as acknowledging our presence, we left.  The ambience was stale and was uninviting.  We would have had a better experience at Denny's.
author: Paul D.

description: Well I can't comment on the food, because I wasn't able to be seated. I was told it would be a 45 minute wait, so they took my phone number and said they would send me a message when a table opened up. Ok, so I wander around the square and never got a text. I ended up at another restaurant and got in right away. As of this review, still no text! Guess everyone has been dining for the last two hours. :P
author: Kristen S.

description: The restaurant may be okay the rest of the year, but for Thanksgiving it is pathetic.  The turkey appeared to be sliced deli-style sandwich material.  The service was terrible; we saw our waitress when she took our order and then again when she gave us our check.  View?   We were seated in a dungeon area so dark I had to use my cellphone flashlight to read the menu.  Worst Thanksgiving meal I have ever had.  Probably my mistake thinking that no restaurant could screw up a turkey dinner; they better stick to seafood. Oh!  The two bites of cranberry sauce were good.
author: Chet F.

description:
DO NOT EAT HERE. SEVERE FOOD POISONING.

My friends and I ate here on a trip to San Francisco and wanted to have a nice seafood dinner. Eating here was a massive mistake. My friend and I ordered the same thing and later that night, around the exact same time both got severe food poisoning. My boyfriend tried some of my food and wound up with food poisoning the following day. It is the only place we ate at on our trip that explains which ones of us got food poisoning and when.

My friend had to be hospitalized due to the food poisoning and I had to see a doctor two days later in order to slow it down. We both missed several days of work.

This was two months ago and the restaurant sent us on a wild goose chase in order to be compensated. And now, finally, they are refusing to pay my friends hospital bill or accept any responsibility. This restaurant is disgusting and if you value your health we don't recommend eating here. All of use severely regret it.
author: Rhianna O.

description:
Terrible service, terrible steak, and charged a
7.5% surcharge to our bill for a health fee!
author: Tawnya B.

description:
This place is a total tourist trap. I mean that's fine, it's there. Nice view.

I went with one other person (out of town we that forced us). We both got one item. Super simple. I asked for mine with no cheese and extra avocado on the side please.

They brought the first one with cheese and avocado inside. I really couldn't do the cheese so I returned it after waiting 10 minutes before they came back to my table.

The next one the brought had no cheese, but the avocado on the inside. I mean it's really not a difficult order for a restaurant of this "caliber" to get right. What else am I paying for? The quality of the food is nothing to admire. I didn't even bother to do anything about it. I ate the warm avocado.

Would never go again.

The woman wasn't even nice.
author: Ninja R.

description:
Birthday Dinner for my brother here. Thank you for welcoming our family on the menu!! Such a cool and personal idea, I've seen this at some restaurants and I think it's a great idea. We had a party of 7, we sat at the window. I've eaten here many times but I wanted my brother to see the view!! Just lovely!
The service was great and the food delicious 
Thank you again for making this night special.
author: Cecilia D.

description:
First walking in, this restaurant has a very interesting and fun theme and layout! It is located right by the water across the plaza from Ghirardelli's Original Ice Cream Square (I think this partly fosters the restaurant's business also)! The interior has stairways and railings that make you feel like you are dining in the interior of a ship or on the docks of the ship, which is really cool! 

Overall, the quality of the seafood here is VERY good. However, everything comes in super small quantities and it is really expensive! 

Fried Calamari ($13): cooked in garlic oil and sprinkled with berries on top! Very interesting mix and it was pretty good. the calamari pieces were very small however :( it is also served with this creamy light green sauce that was very interesting and unique to dip the calamari in

Lobster Bisque ($16): very creamy and very rich in flavor! Few huge chunks of lobster meat in it and drizzled with some kind of green pesto sauce that is mixed in. super good and super creamy! 

Halibut ($33): cooked with a lemon butter sauce. all seafood entrees come with some sort of vegetables that are cooked and complimented in with the fish to make the dish very colorful. 

Pan Sear Dry Packed Scallops ($32): with sauteed greens and butternut squash. the scallops were HUGE!!! served on top of this green sauce with olive oil that makes it yummy to dip in. It was really good and definately one of my favorite entrees here! Very well seasoned and tender and moist and yummy and delicious!

Exotic Mushroom Sautee ($8): Nothing special. just like regular sauteed mushrooms! Wouldn't order this again :O

The service was horrible however!!! Very horrible. The host and the hostess were rude and didn't even bother to make eye contact when speaking to us. Our waitors never really tended to us and even the manager at the restaurant seemed to just be fooling around or chit chatting with the fellow waitors and busboys! While we were eating in the restaurant, there would be many tables waiting to be served. However, there will always be at least a group of 3-5+ waitors, manager, or busboys just lingering by a walkway or a stairway chit chatting and talking amongst themselves. The fact that the manager is also included in this made me realize that the management of this restaurant is very oblivious to customer service. 

Pros:
-super delicious and creamy lobster bisque soup
-very good and big scallops

Cons:
-very poor and rude and inattentive service from host, hostess, and waitors
-expensive
-very small quantities

Honestly, I would not come back here. This is more of a tourist attraction if anything because of the location next to the pier and the huge attraction from Ghirardelli's Square that pulls customers to here for dinner too!
author: Cuc N.

description: My family went there on Sunday night at 8:30 pm before Presidents weekend and they were out of all popular fish like salmon and halibut. Noticed a large group of people arriving for a private event. Have to wonder about it!
author: Anita V.

description:
Boy oh boy have I ever been this angry at a restaurant.

It was late afternoon on Monday when we came in. We intended to come for happy hour but I made reservations on Open Table anyways because I wasn't sure how busy the restaurant would be on a long weekend. We waited 5 minutes for someone to come at the front desk. I told them we have a reservation, and the host asked if we are here for happy hour or early dinner. We said happy hour. He goes on to say "all right then I will cancel your reservation, just go up to the bar area and find a table". 

The cancellation of Open Table reservation, I understand. The tone of his voice? So offsetting. 

When we got to the bar area on the second floor, we saw that it was practically empty, so we asked if we could sit at a dining table right by the bar. The server we asked said "usually you're not allowed but we'll make an exception".

We sit down, we waited. Every time the bar waitress walked by, we asked for some menus. She kept saying "I'll be right with you", but we saw her take an order from a table that arrived later than us, and getting refills for other customers. 15 minutes (I kid you not) went by, no water, no menus. Just sass and disregard handed to us on a silver platter. We got up and headed for the exit, and even then no one asked us if something was wrong.

Needless to say I will never set foot in this restaurant again, or any McCormicks for that matter.
author: Ivy W.

description: Not impressed for the price. I ordera glass of wine and he brought my daughter a glass of water like she requested. One would think to bring water automatically to everyone at the table but that didn't happen. Mashed potatoes were good, calamari was average, beef medallions - very average.
author: Jodi B.

description: Unfortunately, we did not have the best dining experience. Staff were pleasant enough - it was the menu options that was the problem. The only fish dinner available on a Tuesday evening was fish and chips. I've had better from Red Robin and at least there you get bottomless fries. My husband order the 8 oz filet mignon and it was ok. It was not a memorably dish either. I don't have a dull or bland palate so believe me when I say the view was amazing but dinner was not.
author: Michelle J.

description: We dined at an off- peak hour (6pm) and it worked out great. No trouble getting a window view table.  The service and food were both excellent, with a few caveats:  this is basicly a touristy type restaurant that happens to have good food. It is a large facility and gets very busy so I'd recommend going early.  We had petrale sole, and pacific snapper.  both perfectly grilled.  The veggies and sides were great.  Really liked the sweet potato fries.  Only thing negative: they bring out the food when it's ready so the mains came right after the appetizers.  We would have preferred to have time between the courses.
author: S M.

description:
Love this place for Happy Hour the best, great views!!!

Unfortunately we had dinner here our second time not so good- eeek!
Had the "Surf n Turf"; steak was Yummy, but the Lobster tasted like a farmed Lobster Tail eww. Not even like a Maine Lobster Tail either! More like a Lobster from a Red Lobster chain restaurant YUKKK and @ "$53" O-M-G a rip off, I'm local and Not A Tourists...plus the side was Boring; red peppers & onions sauteed cheapskates, REALLY(?) like from a Philly steak sandwich Ha Ha! Come on...where's the Mashed and grilled Asparagus...LOL???
author: Ron M.

description:
One of the best restaurants we ate at during our trip.  We decided to eat in the bar (a little less formal).  It was happy hour and the menu options happy hour were surprising affordable and delicious.  Their regular dining area is elegant and the menu is definitely $$$, however the happy hour menu is $ that's why I gave the restaurant a $$ rating.  There are options for those looking for a wonderful place to eat on a tighter budget.
It faces the harbor and the view is excellent.  It is in Ghirardelli Square which was also a favorite of our visit.
author: Sandra W.

description: GO ELSEWHERE! What a disappointment. Years ago Kuleto's was reliable for fresh, well-prepared seafood and excellent service. Not anymore. We decided this more, uh, traditional spot was a good venue for my out of state in-law's 56th wedding anniversary. We requested a view table both on the online reservation and in a day-of phone call to the restaurant, during which I was assured they had notes to provide a special table for our anniversary celebration. When we arrived, there was no table ready for our party of seven, so the very rude host told staff to set one up--immediately adjacent to the door--the busiest, coldest part of the restaurant with a view of the CVS pharmacy across the street. They argued with me when I told them that was unacceptable for a party of our size for this very special occasion of which they had been notified well in advance. Once we were finally seated at a decent table, our extremely friendly waiter went on to demonstrate an utter lack of knowledge of just about everything on the menu. I want to be clear that his demonstrated ignorance of the food he was serving is a reflection not so much on him as it is on the restaurant and its management for their clear lack of even a rudimentary staff training program. As an example, my mother in law asked him what rockfish was. His reply, I kid you not, "I have absolutely no idea what rockfish is ma'am, I hate seafood". I'm sorry, but when I'm at a $30+ per entree seafood restaurant in San Francisco--on Fisherman's Wharf FFS--I expect the restaurant to ensure staff can thoroughly answer my questions about menu items and, preferably, that they do not gleefully express their hatred of seafood. Moving on, no one had told our poor, untrained waiter that we were there for an anniversary celebration. Upon hearing the reason for our gathering he valiantly tried to make up for his ignorance by bringing out a complimentary desert--one tiny serving only, not even one each for bride and groom--of some sort of chocolate cake plus ice cream plus walnuts, for a group that had clearly advised waiter and kitchen that we had a few nut allergies at the table. After my mother in law doled out benadryl to her husband and my daughter, who both had taken bites before spitting it out when they hit nuts, we decided to cut our losses and wrap it up without an official desert order (did I mention the food was nasty, the tastiest part of the meal was the sourdough?) Unfortunately, our Kuleto's experience didn't end there, well at least not mine. I was the only one at our table who had the mussels, something I used to order weekly at the restaurant's bar with a glass of chardonnay 25 years ago following my friday shift at an art gallery down the street. I was also the only one in our party that spent the hours of midnight to 6:AM after our unfortunate dinner vomiting my guts out. The entire evening was an absolute embarrassment to this native San Franciscan. As much as I love and participate in the modern foodie scene in our fair city, I do make a point of supporting legacy businesses as much as possible. Chains don't typically fall into that category, but with the view and my historical good experiences, I thought McCormick and Kuleto's would be a good choice for my elderly in-laws anniversary. It was the worse possible choice. There are a zillion better places to spend your food dollars in San Francisco, stay away. I still feel robbed. And nauseous.
author: Roxie B.

description: Food was good and the service was pretty slow. Our waiter was very nice but was given way too many tables to wait on (not his fault). They ran out of bread and had no kids cups....BUT the view was worth every penny! It truly is an amazing dining experience. Great kids meal options as well and very casual.
author: Kendra C.

description:
If I could give this zero stars I would have. Stopped in today to relax our feet and grab a drink at the bar tables. It took over 5 minutes for someone to greet us. We ordered drinks: a beer, two Pinot Grigios, and an espresso martini. It took over 10 minutes to get our drinks. As the server brought the drinks over, he spilled the espresso martini all over my father's lap. He apologized immediately and ran to get the manager. We waited another 10 minutes and still NO manager. Not only do they NOT care about the well being of their customers, our bill was not even adjusted at all. My father looks like he wet himself and the blatant disregard for the situation is appalling. I have been a server and bartender for many years and I am utterly disgusted by the way this restaurant handled the situation. Do not waste your time on this crap establishment.
*Update- the manager finally came out after almost 35 minutes with a horrendous attitude toward both my parents. He was extremely dismissive and rude. The bill was adjusted only after we told him we will be calling the corporate office and putting in a formal complaint. His name is Doug and he refused to give us his business card.
author: Melissa J.

description:
My boyfriend and I have been here twice now. The first time was last year and we enjoyed the view and atmosphere. So this year for Valentine's we thought to come back. Although the entire dining experience was fine and my dishes were excellent, my boyfriend came home immediately with FOOD POISONING! We don't live far away, so less than hour of leaving the place and settling in at home, he was in the bathroom and having cramps, later the chills.
He had the oysters for appetizer and Hawaiian Ahi Tuna for entree. Both dishes are raw and we've had them both before at our last visit. This time however was not the same. I had tried only one oyster and one piece of tune but he finished the rest of the shells and half the serving of fish. Im not sure which it was that got him sick but i threw out the left over tuna in case. Yes, I understand that it is the customer's risk to eat raw foods but when a restaurant claims to be a seafood restaurant with local sources, you expect a slight chance of it actually happening.
So please be very cautious that just because the restaurant is "fancy" and get "fresh" fish, you are still very susceptible to illness. Im so disappointed about their claim for fine quality seafood and paid $200 for my boyfriend to spend our Valentine's weekend in pain. Never returning to this or any other establishments within this chain.
author: Susan A.

description:
Got invited to a wedding rehearsal dinner last Thursday, we were guided into the back private room upon arrival, the restaurant had a number of tables already. Place smells great. The private room had wonderful settings, beautiful weather and viewing of the sunset. Servers were attentive and the bartenders were top notched. 

Servers brought around crab cakes, tuna tartare and deviled eggs to start off, my gfs and I grabbed two of everything =) Dinner was GREAT, served buffet style: every piece of the skirt steak was cooked to a perfect, medium rare. The salmon was super tasty/flaky and on top of a yummy creamy spinach sauce. The brocolini(ummm umm good), sides included salad with cranberries/almonds, tasty potatoes and quinoa salad. Everything was really good!!! The tiramisu on the display table looked superb. 

Pleasantly surprised by the whole experience!! 4.5 stars ****.*
author: Vee V.

description: The last time I came here was years ago with coworkers and it wasn't so busy on a weekday. I don't remember if the food was good or not, maybe it was just ok since it wasn't memorable enough either way. Last weekend we went Pokemon hunting with our friends near fishermen's wharf and decided to pop in b/c we were just so hungry. It was around 5pm on a Saturday, not too crowded yet. We got a table pretty quickly and we were seated at a large table facing the huge window with a view of the piers and Alcatraz. The view is unbeatable. The service was impeccable. The food just so-so. My mojito was way too sour - too much lime juice I think, and only a single twig of mint leaf. I like my mojito filled with semi crushed mint leaves so it's refreshing. Anyways, I ordered the lobster bisque soup which was good but a bit salty. My son's spaghetti was also salty, though portion is huge for a kids meal. Hubby's seafood something ravioli looked delicious, but salty as well. Plus it didn't taste like freshly made. Anyways, overall quality is ok, just didn't wow me or anything. I think this is a good place to sit and enjoy the view, but don't count on it for quality dinning.
author: Lily C.

description: This is the second year in a row that we've met as a large family group at McCormick and Kuleto's before Christmas. Our reservation was for a Sunday at 4:30 for 17 people and we can't say enough good things about the staff, the food and the amazing view! Everyone was so accommodating, especially since we had three children under the age of 3 years.
