All of our dinners were excellent, and yes, they were expensive, but we were prepared for San  Francisco prices and set aside this night for a special dinner with family. We'll be back next year!
author: Susan R.

description:
One star is so harsh and I hate to do it. The food was actually deserving of a 4. Loved my pasta and crab cake.  However the service was BEYOND bad. Sat in the bar prior to being sitted. Never was asked if we'd like a drink. Okay. Interesting. 

Get to the table. Beautiful nice view. Still waited forever for cocktails. Finally received. Yea!!!

Ordered dinner. 

One of the four of us had to wait a bit for his to show up, what to do - eat while ours was hot or start without him. He insisted we start without him. Sweet. 

However since we didn't have silverwear we couldn't anyhow. 

Water never refilled. Had to ask twice. 

I could go on. But you get the idea. Just horrible service. What a shame.
author: Samantha Y.

description: We were blessed not only to be seated close to the big window with the amazing bay view and on the top of that we warched the Blue Angels performance. Our server Mrs Londan was simply perfect. We order lobster bisque that only Mc Cormick knows how to prepare.
author: Cristina C.

description: Paola, our waiter, is as good as you are going to get.  Meticulous, knowledgeable, friendly, helpful and if he didn't know, he went immediately and found out.  Tremendous view of the Bay from almost any table.  Super food, excellent selection and great dessert.  Highlight of our dinning in San Francisco for a week.
author: Jay B.

description: The salmon was overcooked, and the chocolate cake was too rich, but the view more than made up for it. Nice staff too. The location is right in Ghirardelli Square, overlooking the Bay and Alcatraz.
author: Marc B.

description:
Meeting friends for cocktails here.  The views were spectacular.  The drinks were crisp and a good variety.  We were there during happy hour.  The slight issue was with service.   I know the waitress had a job to do but she seemed more interested in getting the utensils ready then checking in us.  The bar area was not that busy.

But the food was decent despite the service.
author: David Y.

description: Went here today for the first time. It was for a Mother's Day brunch. The best I've ever had. Mimosas were great, awesome selection of food ranging from eggs, omelettes, salmon, roast, oysters, shrimp, crepes...everything. The view of the ocean was amazing. Staff was very attentive and awesome. Couldn't have asked for a better experience. The price was pretty high but you get what you pay for!
author: Shamekka M.

description: Really affordable HH menu! My friend and I tried their burger and fries, the salmon poke, and garlic fries. The burger was HUGE, super meaty, juicy, and with the fries was only $5.50.
author: Linz C.

description: Ambience was nice and waitress was also very nice. My husband ordered their cioppino and loved it. I ordered their duck and was totally disappointed. First of all it was served raw and secondly it didn't even taste like duck. So needless to say I was not a happy camper.
author: S T.

description: Great place to have a drink at sunset. We had yummy cocktails and the champagne flight. Patrick, our bartender was a total professional, very responsive, friendly, and informative about the drinks we chose. Would recommend for a pre-dinner drink. The diners seemed to be greatly enjoying themselves too.
author: Dana A.

description:
I have been here before for just dessert and the chocolate bag dessert is to die for!! 

Last night I went with two girlfriends for dinner and drinks. We sat in the bar and the bartender was very attentive and courteous. We got a round of some delicious raspberry martini that I would totally get again. We shared the baked Brie app which was sadly pretty small for the price, but delicious nonetheless. I ordered the chicken as my entree which came with potatoes au gratin and some kind of incredible peachy sauce. It also came with a little salad with capers and mushrooms but I avoided that due to personal taste. I will dream of this chicken it was so good. And even eating the leftovers today it's still delightful. Great ambiance in the bar and dining room and very nice staff.
author: Morgan P.

description:
This is about the bar area.  I love the food at McCormick's but since I work about a block from there, I frequent the bar more than the restaurant area.  First of all, they have a killer happy hour, cheeseburgers, chicken wings, raw oysters, and fabulous cocktails.  My favorite is the Cucumber Mint Martini, so good!
The wait staff is great, Samer, Israel, Don, and Patrick, Sara, Raquel, everyone!  The bartenders and waiters always remember exactly how you I like my libation, really nice.  Even though it's happy hour prices, they go the extra mile to keep you happy.
author: Patricia A.

description: I'm going to keep it simple the service was horrible, the drinks were weak and the filet mignon was  flavorless and dry definitely not worth the price.
author: Reyna A.

description: Used to be frequent diner at this location but this place has gone down hill recently. Ordered Lobster Thermidor and food came out cold. This is a $44 dish at least serve it warm!!
author: Jake Z.

description: Views, Company, Food, Wine, & Service - all components of a great meal.   Overall dinner was fun.  There are awesome views of the Bay and Alcatraz.  Ciopinno was excellent, rich and full of seafood (just not Dungeness crab - it only came with one claw : |  The shrimp scampi was pretty good too.
author: Patricia N.

description: Great view of the bay, well appointed, very good service. My old fashioned was made well, but not the best I've had. I enjoyed my pancetta wrapped scallops. However my wife's filet was overcooked, twice. She ordered medium rare, and it was medium well the first time. They remade it and it was medium. She was hungry enough she just ate it. She said it was flavorful but honestly for that kind of money I expect the steak cooked right the first time and it damn well better be right the second time. Not acceptable to spend this kind of money on dinner and not have the steak cooked correctly.
author: Adam M.

description:
We have been here twice on two different trips and both times have been fantastic. The food is excellent as well as the service. The atmosphere is wonderful too. We love the fact we are not rushed through our meal like most restaurants do. You are allowed to enjoy the food and the company at your table at your own pace.
We look forward to our trips to San Francisco mostly because we know we will get to come here for dinner.
author: Shawna D.

description: A quick visit to a local favorite for seafood and appetizers. Their food, drinks and service were impeccable. We tried 5 different items: poke, sushi, cheeseburger, fish tacos and chicken satay. Sushi was fresh and the poke was excellent quality. A perfect stop to celebrate a wonderful birthday with our "adopted" daughter: Meg!! A special thanks to our waitress Iliana  for her exceptional service and surprise dessert for Meg. A perfect way to end a perfect day.
author: john j.

description:
Worst service I've ever had. If they are going to charge crazy-high prices, the service should at least be adequate. 

This is the first place I've ever not left a tip.
author: Taylor O.

description:
Such mixed feelings about this place. 

We came in around 12:30pm in a weekday for lunch, and were greeted warmly and promptly by the hostess. The place was not filled to capacity -- several empty tables, and no one else was waiting. It took about 5 minutes to get the table ready for us before we were seated. Not a problem. 

After a few minutes, we were greeted by our server who took our drink order. She was very nice, but it started to go downhill from there. 

The service was really S. L. O. W. Basically, while the kids got their food fairly quickly (20 minutes?) we got our food at about 1:40pm. The cheeseburger was very good, but my husband was not impressed with the cioppino. We were done eating by 2pm. Not checked on until we were almost done eating. And after that, didn't get our check until past 2:30pm.

I understand not wanting to rush customers, but this was a little excessive.
author: Gina K.

description:
When you're siting in this restaurant, you feel like you're taking a cruise along SF Bay. In fact, it s designed to look like a ship and the views are just great! 
The oysters are always super fresh! Always!!!
The drinks are strong and good. Great selection of wines-Duckhorn, champagne and many whites/reds. The food is good too.
The reviews about the waiters and staff...well it's assumed that people come here for somewhat romantic time to be spent together-so instead of waiting for your waiter or playing on your phone-enjoy each other's company and some good wine. Take advantage of this-there are other places where you get rushed to order and you're literally asked to GTF out. this isn't that place. Enjoy your time here!
author: Natalya V.

description:
Mario was very short w my auntie who called just a bit ago for just asking a couple basic questions (are you open on TG and what are they serving at this limited buffet). We heard it all on speaker. 

Also beware - they are only serving Thanksgiving buffet until 1600 hrs. 

After that you pay all carte! 

Very diff from last year and to make matters worse there is NO relevant info about what they are serving as part of the buffet. 

Surprised how rude this Mario person sounded.  Kinda in line w other critical reviews regarding good service (lack thereof).
author: Jacque P.

description:
Walking around Fisherman's wharf looking for the best fish and chips really didn't see anything appealing. We wanted somewhere nice and cool to sit and eat for lunch today was warm in San Fran which is not the norm in May. 

Walked down to Ghirardelli Square found this place, was really hungry at this point. The views had 3.5 stars but we gave it a shot anyway.

The view was gorgeous and we ordered the fish and chips.. Well we were surprised it was delicious so we ended finding great place after all for Fish and chips with a nice atmosphere and view !
author: BB B.

description: DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME. The star is based on our server's great service, but the (probably management and) kitchen are some of the worst I've seen. This was our 2nd trip to SF. 1st time we came here for lunch and everything was great. FF 15mos later and it all went downhill. We came for dinner and will never go back, not even with those great views. For starters I think the host's day was ruined by having to work. 3 adults and 3 kids were in our party. The kids meals were all basic and without complaint. My sister-in-law and I ordered Copper River sockeye and my husband ordered scallops. His wasn't ready with the rest of the meals, and he would have to wait an additional 25min while watching us eat. Then my SIL's fish was completely raw in the center (mine was cooked). She returned it and sat around another for 20min with my husband waiting for food. She received another plate of food with a new piece of salmon and it was more raw than the first piece! My husband's scallops were good albeit so late we could've been done with dinner by then. My SIL gave up on her dinner and ordered another serving of her appetizer. I thought my salmon was ok but spent the night sick in the bathroom because of it. Based on the reviews I'm not the only one who ended up with food poisoning. The server was excellent and obviously embarrassed by the debaucle. I hope for her sake she finds a better job.
author: Joanne W.

description: Must do in Ghiardeli square.   Grab a drink and a view.   Food looks and smells amazing but we just had time for a drink and a view.  Will come back next year!!
author: Jennifer T.

description: Head of restaurant was a DBag. Restaurant looked empty and we arrived 10 minutes early for our reservation and he refused to sit us. Told us he "'might be able to sit us on time" but couldn't promise. Asked if we could order at bar and he acted like we were crazy. Went to bar and waited 15 minutes before even being approached by a waiter and then left. 0 out of 10 service.
author: Josh P.

description:
This has got to be dinner with the best view. 
Restaurant is a little pricey but the view makes up for it. 
Had fish and chips which was gorgeous. Tartare sauce not quite as good as home but still good. 
Sourdough served before the meal. 
Tried the the truffle macaroni which was to die for! 
Would probably go back.
author: Madison S.

description:
We had our rehearsal dinner for 75 people in the Captain's Room on September 9, 2016. In the chaos that is planning a wedding, McCormick & Kuleto's was a steady anchor. We worked with Kristin McDonald to plan the event. I know her name because she was a real person, always available, kind, and organized. Menu planning was a breeze. I made my own floral arrangements and dropped them off earlier in the day, and everything Kristin said would happen, did! Staff were expecting me! They knew where to put them! It was just awesome and easy.

The night the event was a raging success. Staff was accommodating and flexible. They were all unflappable, totally professional, and just really went the extra mile to make us feel special.

In all of our research, this was among the most affordable place to have a rehearsal dinner in SF. So there's that, too... which was really, really helpful. This was a total win for banquet dining.
author: Johanna S.

description:
Well, it's OK. 
The location of the restaurant is great, you can see the sunsets during the dinner. But the every dish lacks of a specialty. Tastes were not bad but not very good.
author: May T.

description: The only good thing about this place is the view. Other than that, the front host was so unreasonable for asking us to wait almost 20 mins and the place had a lot of seats available. Plus, the cocktails were awful.
author: Gina T.

description: Came here for lunch on a Thursday, wasn't crowded at all so we didn't expect to spend so long waiting for everything. Literally--everything. Granted we were seated immediately, after that our waitress was the slowest person on the planet. We never got our bread even though she came by and said "I'll have your read right over" at least 5 times. The food was decent, a little overpriced but hey the view was great! I wouldn't recommend or go back.
author: Brittany B.

description: The food was pretty good for the price and the bar atmosphere (where I ate) was good. The bartender on my side of the bar was terrible, but the other bartender saved him. They have good window views of the bay.
author: Jay S.

description: Over all I had a great experience.   I always see this restaurant and only now got to try their food.   Costumer service was attentive and personal.  Out of five different dishes that we ordered, three came out pretty solid and strong.
author: Cielo E.

description: Bar opens at 11:30 ... It's pouring outside and it's 11:25, no one is in the restaurant and the bartender tells us to come back. We went back and walked in, same bartender ... no greeting, doesn't even acknowledge that we walked in. Such a well known name and such crappy service. SHAME ON YOU!!!
author: Cheryl T.

description: Went there during a brief layover and ordered off the happy hour menu. My drink, the lavender mojito, was fantastic; my fish tacos and salmon poke were just okay at best. Would go back for a drink and the views (view of the pier from the restaurant is fantastic), but wouldn't return for the food itself.
author: Danielle F.

description:
We had our annual Easter brunch at this lovely restaurant for the 5th year in a row.  The buffet is perfect for a family brunch, with some interesting offerings such as oysters rockefeller and enough salmon and shrimp to satisfy any seafood lover.  Gigantic omelettes, carved prime rib and ham as well.
Our server this year was Joseph, and he was wonderful-best I've had.  I always feel badly for the staff who have to work these holidays, so I truly appreciate when their service is exceptional.  Even though there is a self service area for mimosa's and bloody marys, Joseph went ahead and got our drinks for us, and was so pleasant the entire time.  Joseph, you are a gem!!
The only reason I did not give 5 stars was the somewhat lacking offerings for dessert.  Usually, this is the weak link of their  buffet.
author: rachel l.

description: I was pretty disappointed when dining here this evening. Years ago, my husband and I were really impressed with both the food and service. I've always wanted to come back and tonight my husband planned an anniversary dinner date. He read the yelp reviews before making a reservation and thought maybe people were just being too picky. This is a big nope. When he called to make the reservation, the woman he spoke to was very friendly and stated that since it was our anniversary, she would make make a note if it and make sure we had the "best table in the house"... We checked in early to have a cocktail at the bar and when we got there the one of the two older gentlemen could not locate our dinner reservation. There was also no note that it was for an anniversary. The hosts had no personality. You really need people to be friendly and welcoming, especially when patrons are coming in. We sat at the bar and enjoyed our drinks along with the company of the bar tender. If I had know better, I would have just stayed at the bar and let him help us the rest of the evening. When we finally sat down, we weren't even acknowledged by our waiter for a long time. We weren't in any rush but at any other restaurant we would have already been welcomed and asked about drinks. We noticed he also had a table of ten meaning there was was no way our 2 person order would compete with but still, we are also paying customers. On top of this, since we look "young" waiters have always made us a lower priority even though we are millennials with money to spend. We were served cold bread. The crab cocktail was great but really not worth the price for the portion. I ordered the lobster bisque and my husband was craving clam chowder. The bisque, again, was great. The clam chowder had a weird seasoning and bacon added... Why?? I don't know why restaurants insist on trying to change up clam chowder but this was not what we had wanted at all. For our main course, we decided to split the grilled sturgeon. I was happy to see this on the menu since not many places seem to offer it. The sturgeon was cooked perfectly along with the mashed potatoes. The veggies needed more flavor and the string beans tasted like dirt. We had also ordered a side of the truffle Mac n cheese, but of course, the waiter forgot to put this into the kitchen. When it did come out, it had no flavor and was basically noodles swimming in milk....  disappointing. This restaurant is a great location, has a great view of the bay and a great and beautiful atmosphere but they really need to step it up. I gave this place 3 stars because it wasn't all bad but there is a definite need for improvement.
author: Nicole P.

description: The salmon was over-grilled, and tasted slightly bitter. I was a bit disappointed, but the service was good. The environment was beautiful with large windows and a sweeping view of the ocean. Still, I don't think it's worth the price.
author: Gabby C.

description:
Watch your bill here folks ours was jacked with deserts we never ordered!

Besides horrible service and an unpleasant server the fish was over done and it took close to 45 mins for oysters.

It was bad service starting with the host who left a huge crowd just standing in front of the restaurant for 20 mins.

Our sides were watery and over salted, for McCormicks I expected more
author: Carl P.

description: Food was good. Not great but good. Services was slow. 3 stars mostly let down but the service. Wouldn't bother going back.
author: Kyle H.

description:
$12.28 for a vodka martini straight up... the bartender had to give me back PENNIES...PENNIES! Round up M&K.

4 Stars because the food is really good.
author: Justin C.

description:
Great location and ocean view
Came here during happy hour 
$1 oysters so fresh
Must get their hummus and cioppino $29.95
WE try everything on the happy menu it was just ok 
great drinks from bar
author: Mochi A.

description:
Nice place. Great view. Food was ok. Had the fish kinda average. nothing special. girlfriends said her meal was good. I would come back. Very little parking. all street parking.
This  could be a great place 4 stars. If they put a little more effort into the food.
author: Brent K.

description:
THIS REVIEW IS DEDICATED TO FUTURE PDC BROTHERS. Because M&K seems to be the banquet tradition :P

First piece of advice: get the steak and salmon, despite the seemingly exotic seductions of the cod entree. Trust me on this.

But, but, why should we trust you, Adele? Because I tried both dishes. For banquet, my twin had ordered the duo PETIT FILET MIGNON with sauce bordelaise and GRILLED SALMON with apple reduction lemon butter, served with sides of mashed potatoes and steamed vegetables (http://s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/ztTAL3lR65scqrigK4gZqw/l.jpg). It seems that the steaks were all done medium-rare, which greatly upset some people. But the salmon was quite good--not fantastic, but better than the fish I got. Which was the...

ROASTED LING COD stuffed with crab, shrimp, brie and a lemon butter sauce, served with julienned vegetables and roasted Fingerling potatoes (http://s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/ETeQmzNVY3aP_frjA6gPqA/l.jpg). This dish was a discordant wreck, honestly. I guess I'm not a big fan of cod, as it was fairly tasteless. The crab-shrimp-brie stuffing was way too buttery, and the easily-mushed insides clashed with the rubbery, stringy texture of the cod. The potatoes were sitting in oil and were readily devoured by my twin (hahaha). The only thing I enjoyed on my plate was the steamed vegetables...but the only way they could have messed that up was to have given me rotten vegetables.

We started with the NEW ENGLAND CLAM CHOWDER, which is thick, creamy, salty, and has a decent amount of clam chunks. Paired with the complimentary bread, it served as a great meal opener for a relatively mediocre meal. We ended with a FLOURLESS CHOCOLATE CAKE (http://s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/n6iOX1-5GboB1XqooAkRdA/l.jpg), which had a pleasing raspberry reduction. But, I have this thing about flourless cakes: you either go dense and velvety, or you go moist and fudgy. And this cake didn't quite hit either, with its somewhat airy texture and borderline semisweet tones. It wasn't bad, but the fact that I wasn't stealing helpings of everyone else's slices says something.

Since I came for a huge group banquet, M&K was a fantastic social experience. The dining area is expansive and provides a great backdrop of San Francisco. Service was subpar, as I had to satisfy my unquenchable thirst by downing everyone else's water. And I've heard that this place has a great happy hour, though the speed to get drinks at the bar seems to say otherwise. For most fancy expensive meals, I try to concentrate on the food, but for once I was glad to have had company to distract me from the mediocre mass-produced entrees that lowlighted this evening.
author: Adele F.

description: We had a wonderful burger during happy hour along with an Anchor Steam. It is by far the best Happy Hour I have ever attended. The view is fantastic, the bartenders are great, and the location is festive. This is a must do if visiting SF or if a local like us. We row out of the Aquatic Park (down the street) and this is a great sophisticated place to enjoy after a row or before a meeting. Just go!
author: Marianne D.

description: Bad experience. Mentioned wife's 50 bday. No recognition. Food overpriced. Waitress recommended sole and came out soggy.  Cioppino average and also highly recommended.  View great and that's it. Yelp rating should have scared us away at this price point.   Manager didn't care. Not that busy either...
author: Russ L.

description: Just took a large group of 16 people there for a work dinner.  We had Rachel as our waitress and she was super!  Great food and good deserts!
author: Kelly G.

description: We celebrated my sisters bday on Super Bowl Sunday and had a great time.  Great view, very good food and fantastic friendly service.  Reggie was great, engaging and attentive to our party of ten.  Food prices are a tad on the expensive side, but it is located on a touristy spot of San Francisco so understandable.  Great job Reggie!
author: Joel M.

description: Thank you guys for your great food and thank you "BILL" for your great service.  I will admit this was a freebies for us Veterans after the Veterans Day Parade but it couldn't be beat.  I can't say enough nice things about them.  I had the steak medallions and asked for "medium rare" and surprise of surprises it actually arrived medium rare.  That has never happened to me ever, in my life to ask for medium rare and actually get medium rare.  As other's have said the view can't be beat!  This is the third year in a row we've come here after the Veterans Day parade and the third year in a row we've had great food.  Many places that offer "freebies" have a limited menu of one or two items.  McCormick and Kuleto had about a dozen delicious entrees to chose from.  They can't be beat.
author: Robert H.

description: Over cooked steak, even at medium rare.  Tasted like previously cooked steak warmed up.  The views are great.  Just as you'd expect from a place with great views, the food does everything to disappoint.
author: Frank J.

description:
Had dinner here for my mom's 50th birthday. Researched for a "nice restaurant near the water" just as my mom requested. Great views, amazing food, pretty good service.

We walked in around 6pm, on a Saturday with no reservation. We got seated right away. Our waiter made us feel welcomed, BUT our the host he Was bland in personality.

We mentioned to our waiter that we were celebrating my moms birthday, he pretty nice.

I ordered herb shrimp, spinach and polenta. Pretty amazing. My brother had the rack of lamb, he loved it and said he'd be back for it again. 

It took a pretty long time to get our bill, but our waiter was getting a delicious little dessert for my mom ready with a candle. We didn't request it, but he made it happen. Nice touch!

The views were gorgeous, the food but not over the top spectacular but awesome.

Host not friendly, waiter super nice. 
I'd return for lunch and try something else to give it another try.
author: Rhema F.

description: Unfortunately I had a very disturbing situation occur on Father's Day, June 19, 2017.   When we entered the restaurant I asked the person at the desk if we could have seating for two. He told me the restaurant was completely booked and that we could sit in the bar and it happens to be the same menu. First of all about 3/4 of the tables in the restaurant where empty. But we went upstairs and sat at the bar. A few minutes later I could hear him telling a group of three something similar. That group happened to come up to the bar and we asked them what did the person at the front desk say.  They were told that they would have a 40 minute wait  to be seated.  They had not made a prior reservation, just as we had not. Yet they were told in 40 minutes they could be seated and we were told the restaurant was completely booked. And we came in before they did. I then went on open table and was able to  make a reservation for 5:30 PM. It was currently 5:12 PM. At 5:30 PM I went to the front desk told the gentleman we had a reservation for 5:30pm. I asked him why he told us the restaurant was completely booked. He claims that open  table should not have been allowing more reservations. Now the backstory to all of this is that I and my boyfriend are African-American  and the three people who were told they would be seated in 40 minutes were Caucasian. I don't usually look to racism as a source of an issue but this time I really don't see any other way to look at  It.  I am extremely disappointed...
author: Pheleta S.

description:
Disaster...Christmas dinner 2015 was a turning point for McCormick & Kuleto's. 

Conclusion: high quality food, well prepared and presented, BUT poor management is killing this landmark. GM Toby Hughes has jumped the shark. The only redeeming values are the kitchen staff and Kuleto's design work.

The food is still 4.5-star solid after decades of eating there, but McCormick & Kuleto's angered the mass of people waiting inside and freezing outside for a table because they overbooked. Reservations were disappointingly meaningless.

It was a little scary at about 8:15 pm as people started getting pushy, angry...bordering on festival seating at the Who concert in Cincinnati (1979). 

The kitchen was slow due to the oversubscription of reservations, the wait staff wasn't well trained on the special menu. Management's fault. I had to ask a manager for water and bread for the table. He lowered himself to busboy status and complied. No apologies. 

We gave our server a generous tip because he had to deal with poor management on the biggest night of the year. Thanks server David! 

Goodbye, Toby.
author: David W.

description: Great service through the host and that's where it fell apart. Our server didn't get to our table for 10 minutes, once we did order and get our food, I asked for some condiments and we didn't see her again. 15 minutes later, we spoke with the manager and he comped our meal. Nice enough, still, we won't return.
author: Clarke J.

description:
I'll be honest: I didn't want to like this place. 

In a world surrounded by artisanal espresso shots and free-range beer, I've grown accustomed to eschewing chain restaurants. And while I don't really care what people think about my life choices, it's a bit weird to tell your friends that you had a good time at said chain restaurant while they wax poetic about the virtues of State Bird Provisions, etc. 

"Oh, that Keane. He's so pedestrian."

I am, in fact, a proud pedestrian.

I first sampled McCormick & Kuleto's during a Yelp Elite Event many years ago. Brunch items were served and we had ample servings of Bloody Marys. I had an amazing time, of course. The morning view of the water was stunning and the staff were hospitable. I didn't think this experience counted, as I was heavily soused and the entire restaurant was closed just for us; it wasn't representative of how the restaurant normally functions with customers. 

My second time here was for brunch several years later. I was immediately amazed by the great prices for a restaurant with a view of the waterfront. They also provide large mimosas and a diverse offering of Bloody Marys for around $6 per drink. The food was phenomenal (I ordered the Ahi Niçoise Salad), there was no wait to get in and we got a table right by the giant windows. I've never had an easier brunch experience in San Francisco. Ever.

The most recent visit was for dinner. This was a more elegant experience, though it's a casual restaurant. I had the Stuffed Atlantic Salmon, which was an orgasm in the mouth (that is honestly the best way to describe it -- it should also be noted that they use locally sourced produce and seafood whenever possible). But what made it even more fun was that my friend was acquainted with the "Wow" Manager of the restaurant, Geoffrey Faller. He told us fun stories and made sure we had a great time. The waitress we had was also really friendly, and the two of them brought out a lighthearted attitude that made the whole experience unique.

So, as science will tell us, sometimes it takes several conclusions to conclusively say whether a thing is true. In this case, the "thing" is that McCormick & Kuleto's is a pretty great restaurant.
author: Keane L.

description:
This is one of my favorite places to go in San Francisco! Their food is delicious, the ocean view is beautiful, and there's a parking garage attached the building. 

On my vist last weekend, we shared escargot and the crab/mango/avocado tower for an appetizer. My main course was the salmon with edamame risotto, and my boyfriend got the Oscar style rib-eye steak. Everything was amazing! My salmon had perfectly crisped skin and was packed with flavor. The edamame risotto was one of the best foods I've ever eaten. Would highly recommend this restaurant for anyone seeking an ocean view and convenient parking. The staff was very friendly & welcoming, and prices are on par with any other steakhouse. Since we arrived at noon on a Monday, we didn't need a reservation. However, if planning for a big group or on a weekend night, you might need to call ahead. The atmosphere is incredibly relaxing and the restaurant features gigantic windows so that your view is not compromised. 

We've gone to several other steakhouses in SF, and almost all have been a hassle - either having to walk a very long distance or use valet.  This one is located in Ghirardelli Square and is nestled among a variety of cute shops. It's also right across the street from a beach walkway in case you want to walk it off after stuffing yourself to capacity at this tasty restaurant.
author: Carla M.

description:
Review is for a wedding banquet hosted here. I was not totally impressed with the food. Every other McCormick's I have been to before had managed to conjure up better lobster tails and filet mignon. Perhaps it was no fault of the restaurant that most of the entrees were served lukewarm. Guests arrived late and took too long to be seated. Whatever happened to the flavors was just beyond me. Food tasted bland and the lobster tail was borderline overcooked.

The venue itself is lovely though. It is right by fisherman's wharf and the dining room has the perfect view of beautiful bay. That, you can't really beat.
author: Mona W.

description: Service is great, and perfect view if you get the window table. Try to call in to make reservation. Fresh seafood and great varieties.
author: Ray K.

description: Fantastic views! But you can't eat that. Food marginal flavor. We had the surf & turf, mahi-mahi. The clam chowder was good. So was the Lobster bisque. The wait staff was as friendly as a cocker spaniel at meal time. We are Landry's Select Members and are used to a bit better
author: Richard D.

description:
Despite the 3-star review, we decided to give it a shot. Now I'm regretting it. I made a reservation but they refused to seat us without everyone being here. Wtf?! what's the point of having a reservation then?  To top that off, they don't even have enough waiting space. So we have to wait outside in the cold.  What a great way to make your customers feel unwelcomed.  Very, very poor first impression.  I wanted to order some appetizers while we wait, but they obviously don't want that. We could have ordered drinks and multiple appetizers during the 30-minute wait, but the management clearly do not want that.  Zero-stars. 

Food:

Our food was actually mostly quite good, except my friend's fish.  I enjoyed the corn and crab chowder, mixed green salad, side dishes, and pork chop.  Four-stars. 

Dining Service:

Our waiter was just great. Very professional, yet friendly. 

So, the average is about 4 stars.
author: William L.

description: My husband & I came here for our 17th wedding anniversary. We had the most wonderful experience. At a very reasonable price and with a Beautiful view.  The atmosphere relaxing. The crab and lobster dip delicious!  The scallops tender and the ribeye ...omg!!  The Our waitress was polite and attentive. The food amazing. Would go here again in a heart beat
author: April S.

description:
Having dinner and the view is outstanding.  I can clearly see Alcatraz on a clear San Francisco day.

The scallops are done just right and the stuffed salmon is extremely tasty.

I'd highly recommend this place for lunch or dinner.
author: Greg W.

description:
McCormick & Kuleto's Seafood & Steaks located in San Francisco's historic Ghiradelli Square. 
Had the perfect Christmas Eve dinner that consisted of Hawaiian Seared Ahi Tuna for appetizer followed by an entree of Whole Dungeness Crab with veggies. The atmosphere was excellent with spectacular views atop San Francisco and a beautifully lit Christmas tree within view.
author: Darrin H.

description:
With fantastic views, McCormick & Kuleto's is a good place to dine if you can get one of those window seats on a gorgeous San Francisco day. I had been here once before but was looking forward to their lauded but ever elusive happy hour since I could never get here by 6pm. 

At first glance, the food deals are truly good. I mean a half pound cheeseburger with fries for $4? Can't argue there. Since I was at McCormicks, I knew I wanted some sort of seafood and hence the mussels with the romesco sauce and lemon aioli but there was definitely no way I was going to say no to a fried chicken slider. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mccormick-and-kuletos-san-francisco?select=0000Qq9Jh8cmDZ_iszCY2g#0000Qq9Jh8cmDZ_iszCY2g) Alas the food was decent but not great. I liked the mussels and the rich and nutty romesco sauce. The sliders however were disappointing. Squashing the biscuit down defeated the purpose since it made it tough versus fluffy and flakey. Here's my tip: take the top off and use it a a vessel to soak up the romesco sauce and eat the fried chicken and jalepeno aioli like an open-faced sandwich. Done. 

All in, it's a decent happy hour at McCormick & Kuleto's but with no drink specials and beers on tap at $7.50, the allure of the happy hour starts to pale considering other options around. Still worth it to stop by for a quick bite on a gorgeous San Francisco day though.
author: Jon L.

description: Stopped by for lunch today. It was pretty empty. We were seated promptly at a wonderful booth. We waited for over 15 minutes at the table before anyone even acknowledged we were there. Thankfully the hostess noticed and apologized and brought us water. It was another 10 minutes before anyone else came. We ordered drinks and prawn cocktail (it was fair) and lobster bisque (very good) as apps. My son had the 6oz filet with macaroni (it was average....I've had better for much less) and I had the crab legs (ok at best). I used to love this place years ago. But when I'm paying $150 for lunch for 2, I expect more than "just ok". I won't be back and that makes me sad.
author: Jane J.

description:
if you want to pay for the view worth every penny. Overpriced for what you get. Saturday March 4 i ordered  the scallops wrapped in pancetta for $32.00. I asked the waitress "do you get a good amount?  Her reply "YES" most people get that on the menu. What you actually get a a good helping of mashed potatoes covered with a small amount of sauteed spinach with 4 very small scallops wrapped in pancetta. i could have gone to trader joes and bought the box of scollops wrapped in bacon for under $10.
Im still kicking myself for not sending it back.
author: akasha s.

description: Wonderful food and we had a great Scotch ale. My husband had the best Filet and lobster we have had in a long time. I had a great sirloin. Service was okay otherwise they would have received a 5. Not bad pricing for San Fran
author: Melissa B.

description: Excellent service! I made reservations the day before for my boyfriends birthday and they printed menus with a happy birthday message personalize for him on the top! I am thoroughly impressed!
author: Cassidy R.

description: This place used to be really good. I'm only in town once a year and this was my "go to" restaurant. The waiter Peter we ver inattentive, we literally had to ask for EVERYTHING! More bread, a glass of water, wet Hans towel after crab legs. Crab legs were not fresh, taste like freezer. How does a well known San Francisco restaurant run out of sour Doug bread. We asked for more bread and waiter brought back French baguette. Didn't tell us it was different until we pointed it out. Food and service sucked...
author: Phyllis D.

description:
We stopped in to sit at the bar and order some calamari.  
AWESOME view!
They had a happy hour two fish tacos for five.  So delicious we ordered another and left the calamari for last!
Ambiance five star. 
Dinner looked super pricey. But hit this up for happy hour specials.  We were stuffed.
author: Mimi B.

description: Very disappointed with our experience at McCormicks & Kuletos. Beginning with drinks at the bar and the bartenders arguing with each other. Very tense and uncomfortable. Reservation for dinner at 6:45, the host befuddled with seating guests, had to ask the waiter if he could take another table. What? Well, we should have walked away at that point. The booth seats had food on them, when I said something to the host, he walked away.  The view was beautiful and the food was delicious. Waiter was close to useless. No offer of dessert or coffee, just dropped off the check. Beware.
author: Jill L.

description: If you're looking for a pretty view of the bay then this is the place to go. Located in ghiradelli square it's an old school restaurant with the usual things on the menu seafood and steaks. Food was ok steak was supposed to be medium but most peoples were rare. Seafood dishes were good so was the bread. If you're a tourist you will probably like this restaurant
author: lyn m.

description:
First of all. Listen to all reviews. I'm a big advocate on judging a place on the "average" reviews. Sometimes people have bad experiences which I compare to the good ones. This place def. had a trend of more bad reviews than good ones. 

I got a $100 American Express e-gift card for Christmas and thought it would be a good idea to buy the $80 for $100 dinner from costco online to take my fiancé out for a valentines dinner. Based on my statement above, I decided to give the place a shot since it would give us a reason to go to San Fran, have a semi free dinner and enjoy ourselves. 

Once we were seated we started to notice ALL the bad review trends come alive. First off, before we even ordered we saw a food runner bring food near our area and not not where he was going with it. He asked us if this was our food, then went to another table and asked them which we both said no. The waiter finally came around and pointed him in the correct direction. No joke, this happened three times within a 20 min time period - I actually found this quite comical. 

We ordered two appetizers and some wine to begin. The clams came out to our table after the food runner tried bringing it to another table, lol. They had cut up sausage in the sauce? When does spicy sausage get served with clams? Anyway, it wasn't that great. I ordered filet and lobster tail for dinner. The lobster tail was not good at all. However, the filet mignon was really good!!! I was surprised I found a diamond in the rough. It still wasn't worth the price. My fiancé ordered their special (lobster tail with crab). The crab was full of mayonnaise plopped on top of her lobster tail. Gross. Not worth the price. 

We spent $180 on two appetizers. Two $50 lobster tail entrees and four glasses of wine. Didn't care too much since half of it was free, but will never come back here again. 

I gave two stars because the filet was really good.
author: Mike J.

description: My wife and I had our anniversary dinner here and they made it very special. They sat us in a special view window with VIP treatment and printed our name on our special menus. Our server was Bridget and she couldn't have been any better. The food we selected was wonderful and we will definitely be back in the future. Thanks for making our night special!
author: Ray S.

description: Great food.  Loved the salmon sandwich.  The Cobb salad was very good.  Great sparkling flight.  Jessica our server was lovely.
author: Amy S.

description: Great view, great food...but they selective choose if your WORTHY...to be seated!!! They decide your worth! Now I fully understand discrimination.
author: Susan K.

description:
This review if for the bar on a lazy afternoon only.

We popped in after walking the tourist area to rest our feet.  We went to the bar and ordered a couple of drinks and had great service from the bartender.  He made great drinks and was on top of service.  While I can't say much about the food, the bar was a great time on a lazy afternoon.
author: Shawn M.

description: Worst place ever !!!!!!ZERO STAR AT THIS POINT !!!!! First off the server was rude he had this bright pink lipstick on which is not a problem I just want to help identify who I'm talking about so in case you do go you know who not to be around. WHEN WE WERE SEATED THERE WAS SMASHED FLYS ON THE WINDOW. We ordered our food which took so long when we got the food a huge FLY LANDED ON MY DAM PASTA!!!! I SWEAR I HAVE NEVER BEEN IN AN INSIDE SEATING RESTAURANT AND A FAT HORSE FLY GO ON MY FOOD. The waiter took the food away. Didn't even ask if I wanted it remade ... I'm not sure about most people but when a fly flys on your food you lose your appetite completely. THE SMASHED FLYS ON THE WINDOWS KILLED IT ALL. Then they have the nerve to charge me for the food that I didn't eat. We ordered two dishes my uncle ate one but lost his appetite after seeing that huge ask fly. The nerve for the manager whom was wearing glasses and bald head to say I have to pay for the fish my uncle ate like wtf he was so rude I told him we're not paying for ANYTHING AFTER SEEMING THAT HUGE HORSE FLY AND SMASHED ONES ON THE WINDOW HELL NO! I told him I refuse to pay for this service he kept going back and forth with me finally said its fine go on about your way. RUDELY I SAID IM GOING TO YELP THIS EXPERIENCE HE SAID GO ON AHEAD LEAVE I LITERALLY WAS SHOCKED WHAT AN ASZHOLE overall my experience here is definitely below one star it is the worst place to go to I can't believe I even actually went there should I yelped it first I'm surprised it's three starred should be zero*I do not recommend nobody to go here at all.  I wish I was able to capture the fly on the plate but I was so shocked that it was there and if you do order something and experience what I've experienced definitely not worth going. People pretty much go here for the view of the war but honestly go outside and enjoy it it's not worth the service!!!!!
author: Lei S.

description: I went there for my Birthday last week and the experience was wonderful. I had my own menu with Happy Birthday on it. That blew me away. Our waitress Jessica was great. I had Crab Claws, and so wonderful. I highly recommend this restaurant and sit looking at the water.
author: Judi G.

description: We had a huge party for a 21st birthday (15) we were able to make a reservation the Day before. Service was amazing and food was beyond amazing. I will for sure eat here again.
author: Renee M.

description: The only reason I would give this restaurant is for the view and food. It took 1 full hour to get our food. Our salads came before the bread basket. The air conditioning was blasting all evening. After numerous requests to change the temperature we decided to go outside to warm up. That's right, it was warmer outside in San Francisco at 10 pm than in the restaurant. The bathrooms were filthy dirty - but warmer than than the restaurant. If you don't mind filthy restrooms, freezing cold temperatures and want to spend 3-4 hours for dinner then this is the restaurant for you. AWFUL customer service.
author: Susan P.

description: I wish I could give this restaurant a zero star review. The customer service is a complete joke. I would expect customer service like this from a fast food place, not a restaurant overlooking the Bay. My wife and I were freezing during dinner and asked multiple times to have the AC adjusted, but the management couldn't care less. You're just dollar signs to them. Go elsewhere
author: Hunter D.

description: Absolutely the worst service I have had from any restaurant ever.  Even though we got there at open and they were dead, other tables got served while our table was completely ignored for 50 minutes until we complained.  Getting any kind of service from getting drinks to having our main entree served always took effort on our part and never once did they seem to recognize how badly they were treating us.  Ruined Boxing Day lunch with my mom!  Will never go there again ever!
author: Todd P.

description: The host was arrogant.  Our waitress was very friendly, but was not good with refills.  Everything took forever.  I mean way too long when they weren't busy.  I used to love this place.  Food was not good either.  Skip it.  Plenty of other fancy places to spend big bucks.  This wasn't it.
author: Q Q.

description: WOW!!!! AMAZING!!!! I'm so thrilled that we came her for dinner. It was my birthday and we spent the day mostly shopping and sight seeing as we live a few hours away and only come to the City a few times a year. We had hit or miss service at various stores in the mall and I was upset about how we were treated at VS. Anyways it was a long day and after all that we just wanted dinner. My husband and I came here for my birthday dinner and we waited about 10 minutes before our Waiter Marvin came but they were so busy and he apologized and was so nice that we weren't even upset we waited that long. Our service was fantastic!!! Marvin our waiter was on point with everything, he was polite and he remember it was my birthday and brought me a birthday dessert. I was so pleased with the food!!! We will be back very soon!!!! I will always remember I was treated amazing and come back here every time we come to the city.
author: Taylore-Marie S.

description: Extremely nice location with sub par food. The fish and chips were a fail! The fish batter tasted like flour... And it came out soggy. The tarter sauce was a watered down version and runny. I'm pretty confident the coleslaw came from Sysco. The service was average.
author: Jenny B.

description:
We primarily went to this restaurant for the shell fish, especially the king crab. As per my husband, it was awful. No flavour and very small legs. He was wondering if it was snow crab. His prawn appetizer was just adequate. My vegetarian meal was just ok. His coffee was luke warm. Certainly not worth the prices.
The views are wonderful and we had very good service, hence the two stars.
author: Kim W.

description: We were very disappointed in the food and the prices.  The experience was not a pleasant one.  The drinks were good but very pricey.
author: T C.

description:
Good place for happy hour. Good prices, the $5 cheeseburger & fries combo is a great deal, especially in this touristy area. They have a pretty big HH menu- we had the fish tacos- decent, a little bland, not the best I've ever had, dugout fries- too spicy and garlicky for my tastes, wings- amazing, more of an Asian taste vs your typical buffalo hot wings. 
Service- average, views- amazing! 
Will do happy hour again here someday
author: J C.

description: Great service. Excellent food. Will be back! I kniw its a short review but what else can i say? Dimply the best. They validate parking!
author: Jorydude r.

description: GREAT VIEW OF THE BAY! I stopped in for a few afternoon beers on the 4th of July. Hadn't been before, so I didn't really know what to expect. I quickly realized that most of the other customers are also upscale, intelligent people. The hilarious bartender, "Rachel", did one hell of a great job! The prices are a little inflated, but I guess that's to be expected in this particular area of San Francisco. I would definitely visit again. Cheers!
author: James B.

description:
Pass On This One

This was my second time dining here. Last year, and again this year my colleagues selected this restaurant for our group dinner. I had a very so-so experience last year, and this year my experience was genuinely bad.

We had reservations for our party of 10. When our group was complete, we were seated promptly, but not given menus by the host. We waited for a full ten minutes before a server arrived to take drink orders. We then had to ask him for menus, which it took him a few minutes to obtain.

Drink orders followed, and were filled, and the server nicely agreed to provide us with separate checks. We then had a pretty long wait to finally order food. We ordered calamari, clam chowder or salad, and entrees.

The calamari, clam chowder and salads were delivered in a fairly reasonable timeframe, and consumed. The calamari was good, and the clam chowder was rich and savory, but lacked substance in the form of vegetables and clams. We then waited and waited (at least 40 minutes) for our entrees to arrive. 

My dish, the Pan Seared Sea Scallops from the Featured Items section of the menu, looked ok, but my first bite of the butternut puree was extremely salty. My first fork of the sautéed greens was so salty that they left my tongue with a stinging sensation. That saltiness was what had permeated the puree. The dish was completely inedible.

When the server returned after a few minutes with the last of the entrees, I explained the problem. He took the plate away and returned in about 10 minutes with a freshly made plate, with freshly cooked greens. The scallops were just warm, were on the small side, didn't have much of a sear or much seasoning, but thankfully were not over cooked. For a $32 dish, this didn't cut it. It wasn't inedible like the original dish, and I was hungry, so I ate most of it. I wasn't tempted to clean my plate.

Beyond my own complaint, my companions indicated that the Petrale Sole was very dry, and the single order of White Clam Linguini was bland, going un-eaten after the first taste. As the table was cleared, the completely full dish was taken away without question at to why.

Everyone was tired and ready to leave (we had been there for 2 1/2 hours) and so we opted to have dessert and coffee elsewhere (rather than have another lengthy wait), and requested our checks. We all agreed that we had been there too long.

To his credit, our server produced our separate checks relatively quickly, and without complaint. We were not charged an automatic gratuity as a large party, which was refreshing. My check for chowder, and the scallop entrée (no drinks) was $44, and not a good value for the food quality. 

As I indicated at the start, my first experience here last year wasn't one that caused me to want to go back. This year, I yielded to the organizer tried to give it a second chance. In the future, I will pass on dining here.

I have enjoyed McCormick & Schmick's in Arizona (before they closed) and Minnesota, and will visit them again, but NOT this restaurant ever again.
author: Faridah S.

description: The restaurant is nestled in such a beautiful location, but everything about this place comes up short. The server brought us bread in his hands to refill the plate. The crab, avocado and mango salad was not seasoned whatsoever and the dressing does nothing for this dish. We have currently been waiting 40 minutes for a crab/sweet corn chowder and braised short ribs, so I have nothing but time to kill, considering my mood and the atmosphere is dead too. The couple next to us has already walked out because they didn't get any service for 15 minutes. Our server has been behind the bar and may be held hostage and forgotten about us.
author: Aileen M.

description:
Slow slow slow service with one waiter waiting multiple large groups.  For what I am about to pay I would not recommend.

Well now 1-1/2hours in, no main course.  Still waiting for the last 20 minutes after salad.

Food was subpar.  One refill on drinks after I asked.  Top 5 worse dining experience ever for just two people at one table.  Either hire more help or limit groups.  I would never recommend to anyone!

Any now my wife was up all night with an upset stomach from this place.  STAY AWAY!!!



Well it's been two weeks since I left my review.  I was contacted and was told "corporate" would call.  Well I'm still waiting, waiting, waiting, I now hear crickets.  No response from corporate.  Their service is as bad as the restaurants.

DO NOT EAT HERE.  WORSE FOOD AND SERVICE I HAVE EVER HAD!!!!
author: Brian R.

description: The service was horrible. Starting from the bartender, and ending at the manager. With a reservation and a special request, after waiting for 30 Minutes, we got seated at a table by the kitchen, when there where at least 10 open tables in better areas. The bartender was the rudest bartender we have ever had. We have been traveling here for years and brought numerous business clients. We will never return again. Once we did get sat, a waiter didn't show up for 15 minutes, even to offer water.
author: Ailyn C.

description: Took some guests here for lobster and crab. They didn't have the whole lobster or crab eventough they told me during the day when I called. So that was a disappointment. The food is mediocre. Great location. Calamari appetizer, oysters and filet were good. Fish and chips was too oily and over cooked.
author: Gokhan G.

description: Our experience this past Saturday was terrible!  We had 8:00pm reservations. They sat us right away & then ignored us all night. We were there for nearly 3 hours. Our drinks were never refilled, it took 35 minutes to get bread, one meal wasn't even brought to the table until the rest of our family was done (that was a wedge salad...how hard can that be?) & our dessert espresso drinks were served to us cold. The waitress was constantly sitting on the bench by the reservations check in chatting with who we believe was the manager. We frequently dine here, but don't think we will be back after this ridiculous service!
author: Shannon D.

description:
Night cap at McCormick & Kuletos. 

On the menu:
Mango Mojito, Grey Goose & Club Soda, and White Zin
Appetizers: Carnitas Tacos, Mussels, and Ahi Tuna Tartar

Food was ok.
author: Ela M.

description:
Upscale restaurant with a breathtaking view of the bay. Came here over the weekend to celebrate my cousin's graduation. The service was great, our waiter was attentive to our every need and went above and beyond to make sure that we all got what we wanted. The food was delicious and all cooked perfectly. 

The only reason why I didn't give this place 5 stars was because of little details. This place is an expensive restaurant, the plates can range anywhere between $20-$55. When paying prices like that, I would want everything to be near perfect. I know that expensive restaurants tend to have more modest portions, which is fine, but here at McCormick's, they use extremely large plates where our food took up just one small area. To me, it was kind of a turn off in terms of presentation. 

However, the chef was able to make a customized dish for my grandma, who is extremely picky with her food, so that was definitely a nice touch. And overall the experience was great. Definitely not in my budget to come here too often, but I would recommend this place for special occasions. And the location is located in a tourist area, so there are plenty of things to do after your meal.
author: Anita L.

description:
This restaurant attracted me by its location and a nice bay view. I was there with my husband and few friends, and we got a table  right next to the window. So we enjoyed pretty ocean view while waiting our orders. I ordered beef steak, which was alright. The wine that I had ( can't remember the name of it unfortunately) wasn't impressing. Our waiter couldn't give us much help on wine selection. I would say they need some improvements on customer service, but in overall it was fine. 
I gave 4 stars mostly for the excellent bay view, and probably would recommend this place to my friends.
author: Galina C.

description: Great food, friendly staff and beautiful views! The bread bowl clam chowder was excellent. We tried the crab tower, pesto gnocchi, halibut and stuffed salmon. We would order each again.
author: Suzie M.

description: We went to this place during our last night in San Francisco with a group of 12. We had a wonderful time. The location alone was great, overlooking the Bay!!! The food was delicious. I had crab stuffed  Pacific Salmon and it was very good. Fun times!!
author: Javier M.

description:
The HAPPY HOUR IS AMAZING!!! Got nostalgic about McCormick and Schmick's in Chicago and came in with Renu for happy hour one evening.

Ambience:
I made reservations for a table by the large windows with views of the water, but apparently that is only for people who are eating their expensive dinner! Oh well, back to the high top tables i went.

Food:
+Half pound cheeseburger and fries- only $3.95 and it was delicious! THere is a drink minimum of $5 to have happy hour so I opted for the
+ Sunset cocktail and it was also amazing and very large.
+Chicken Sliders- my friend got these but it was pretty dry

Service:
Their service at the happy hour bar was VERY attentive as the waiter kept checking on me every 5 minutes to see if i needed anything. 

Basically, amazing happy hour and I would def come back!

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description:
Where do we begin?

For starters, once we walked into the restaurant, (even though it was 75% empty), the host was not overwhelmed in any way, yet he was not very friendly either. This is a Landry's property and instead of going to Bubba Gumps, we decided to try this place. The price is comparable to that of Bubba Gumps for two entrees. It was a little bit more pricey, but it has a completely different atmosphere. 

We were seated in a booth overlooking the bay. We had a nice view of Alcatraz and the Golden Gate through the panoramic windows. 

I had the clam linguini and my girlfriend had the ahi tuna. The ahi tuna was not worth the price. The entire dish seemed to be pulled out of the refrigerator: the tuna (although seared very lightly) was cold, the rice was cold, the seaweed salad was cold and the dish it was served on was cold. The description sounds great, but order something else!

The clam linguini was pretty good with a very generous helping of clams (both in the shell and out of the shell. If I were to go back again, I would have this again. 

The service was sub-par. They were very friendly but everyone seemed to walk around lackadaisically. Even when mistakes happened (ordered a coke, not a diet coke), they just seemed to walk off with no gusto and come back when the time suited their schedule. 

Not my top choice of places to dine near Fisherman's Whard/Ghirardelli Square. Then again, neither is the Bubba Gumps.
author: Charles K.

description: I have been to this restaurant before and enjoyed it. However my visit on Saturday was not good. The service was slow and not professional. Our appetizer plates took a while before they were cleared from the table. Our food was slow to come out to the table. I was never asked if another glass of wine was needed. The Caesar Salad was pitiful for $10.00. All lettuce, croutons and some cheese. The main courses were good in general, but the veggies were overlooked.
author: Bruce H.

description:
This place is horribly overpriced. We ordered the crab, avocado, and mango tower to start. It had little to no flavor. We also had the clam chowder, which was good but not spectacular. 

My friend had the shrimp scampi, which, again, didn't really have any flavor. I ordered the shrimp and crab roll and it was a cold salad stuffed into a sourdough roll that was too tough to chew. 

Overall, the bill was over $100 and I wouldn't pay $20 to eat the same meal again.
author: Kristin R.

description:
My family and I went here for Christmas.. although our server, David, was very nice, things went awry when I saw my bank account...but to that topic later.

I had informed both the server and the manager (later by phone) that their Alaskan crab legs were rubbery and the shell was was as well (you couldn't crack it at all - you actually needed sharp scissors) - otherwise, the food was just ok, and could've saved 60% off by going to Red Lobster (better food). But it was Christmas, so we were thankful...there was no suggestion of a replacement and I know I should've asked, but it's too late now.  Yet, that didn't ruin our lunch...for this overpriced get-up.  

Anyway, 4-5 days later, I noticed my bank bill. I had tipped the waiter 20% in cash. But guess what he did? He wrote in ANOTHER $$$ on top of my cash tip on to my credit card charge, when I had previously indicated ZERO on the tip and totaled it correctly...yet he made his tip a total of 40% and erased or maybe printed another slip to override mine. 

I called the mgr, Melissa, and she lied to me and said at first that the slip was blank, but when I called 4 days later to check if she processed a corporate refund, she said she did witness my receipt in which I indicated a ZERO for the tip and the total was the right amount I had written in.  She claimed she would discipline her server, David, but she wasn't apologetic about the predicament, esp given that this is a case of FRAUD!  It's been 6 days, and I haven't gotten a credit yet, but I will follow up on this next wk.  

Horrible customer service and substandard food...Even the people that checks you in do not smile and treat u like a number...just wanted to treat my family, but this place is not even worth the view or the hefty parking fee that's involved when you eat here...You're better off going to pier 39 and getting something off a ma and pop stand.
author: Sydney B.

description: Keep coming back in the hope that things will have changed for the better, but no joy. The bartenders who work well even when there are under pressure is one redeeming feature, and of course the view from the bar.
author: Ifti K.

description: Got the mussel and  the Mac and cheese. Along with a few cocktails... The  mussel sauce was delish but the mussels were pathetic! Mac and cheese was okay... Not as decadent as I thought it would be with Gruyere and truffle.
author: Annie B.

description:
You pay for the views. The view from the restaurant is excellent and hard to beat. The food though is average and overpriced. We ordered a single crab cake ($16!) which was nothing special. Also got the beef medallions for the entree which also was average. I was not a fan of the sauce that comes on the beef and the mashed potatoes we ordered were not great at all. The mashed potatoes had an odd texture and seemed to dry out my mouth.

The service was good at our visit, so no complaints there.

One of the biggest things that drove me nuts at this visit is that there was a party next to us that was allowed to bring their lap dog into the restaurant and sit in a booth. On a couple of occasions the dog barked, and the party tried to hide their dog. The party was rude and not respectful to other patrons. It's disappointing that the management didn't have the nerve to ask the party to leave. 

This is an expensive restaurant that many people can't afford to go to very often. We felt we were robbed from having a nice dinner at this restaurant due to the dog sitting next to us.Even McDonald's doesn't allow pets.
author: JC E.

description:
Experience, food, and server were awesome!! Very happy we chose to finally eat here.  Marc was incredible! I like when servers will pass your table often but not interrupt you every time. He makes his presents known and you can shake him down when you need to. :D 
   Menu is higher priced if on need to know basis. 

  My husband and I had eaten just three hours before at the mall so needless to say, we were not staving. However, I still ordered a whole crab. A pound 1/2... I couldn't finish a crab for the first time in my 41 years of existence! Dungeness is my favorite food next to artichokes. ~ Also had coffee which was good. Smooth... Perfect dinner coffee. 

I love the way the menu displays where their food comes from....

My husband ordered Mahi Mahi special with blackened seasonings. Sooooo good! Maybe another reason I didn't finish my crab, I was picking at his fish and garlic mashed potato's. Truffle Mac and cheese... 
Yummy too! 

  I highly recommend! There is enough on the menu to our liking, we will be back...
author: Sarah W.

description:
Valentine's Day is one of the busiest days of the year to find a nice restaurant to have dinner at. Therefore, my boyfriend and I always make reservations a month or two in advance. This year we decided to book a dinner at McCormick's and Kuleto's. We figured they would provide the perfect view over the water for a nice Valentine's dinner. 
We arrived a half hour prior to our reservation, checked in, and went to the bar to wait. The bar was of course full and busy, but we were still able to get bartended and find a small table. We ordered a couple of their specialty drinks, one of which they forgot to serve with its lemon sugared rim (described on the cocktail menu) and the other they ran out of. A waiter came to find us at the bar when our table was ready which was about 30 minutes past the scheduled reservation. He took us to our table and shortly after our waiter came with our menus.
I had original received a phone call from the restaurant a few days before Valentine's day to confirm the reservation and at the time I asked if there was going to be a set menu for that specific day or if the regular menu would be available. I was told that there would be no special menu, but when we looked at our menu that night, it was a completely new, set menu. We ordered something off the new menu, only to have our waiter come back 20 minutes later and tell me they had run out of the entrée I ordered, so I chose I new entrée. 10 minutes later my waiter comes back to tell me that they ran out of the side I ordered so I choose a new one off the set menu. My boyfriend went all out that night and ordered the most expensive entrée, Surf n Turf, which was listed on the menu as King Crab Legs and filet mignon. When he received his plate it had nothing more than a third of a crab leg and a steak the size and thickness of the smallest pork chop you can imagine. It was a very disappointing experience as far as customer service and quality and portions the food. 
The only good thing was the view.
author: Mercedes M.

description: Nice early dinner with a table by the window.  Gruyere Mac and cheese was bubbly hot and yummy.  Sea scallops on squash with kale was awesome.
author: Teresa C.

description: First time eating here. Very nice. Too loud for a conversation. Waiters were a little too busy. Absolutely gorgeous view! The linguine and clams was filled with clams. Crème brûlée was delicious.
author: Erika H.

description:
Food was great, however service was horrible.  Our server didn't make an appearance once we were served.  No one seemed to care as I was looking around looking for our server.  Finally a gentleman in a suit came by and asked what I needed. 

The sides we ordered never came and the excuse we were given was that our 'forgot to write it down' since I ordered them after she 'closed her book'.  Since we were done with our meal, our server offered us a free dessert.  She tried....
author: BC L.

description: Impressive sea view when we were having dinner and watched the sun to go down. Beautiful food here although they are not so fantastic in taste. Pricy for the location and view. Good place!
author: Yuzhou C.

description:
My family-in-law and I came here this past Saturday to celebrate Father's Day.  I was glad they had a table for six even though we did not have any reservations.  

When we were first seated, I can tell our waiter was not having a good day because my sister-in-law and I witnessed him rudely talking, in a demanding tone of voice, to his coworker saying, "Are you going to get this table water?"  His coworker walked passed him while he was still talking.  Our waiter rolled his eyes and shifted his attitude to a welcoming tone of voice when we ordered our food.  

Food was good, but service was very slow.  Our entrée came in 45 minutes after we ordered it.  I don't recall our waiter checking in our table and saying, "How is everything?  Is there anything else I can give you at this moment?"

My shrimp in my shrimp scampi was a bit overcooked. 

The waiter gave my father-in-law and husband complementary desserts for Father's Day. 

Food was decent, but not memorable.  I may want to come here again with reservations and when it is not busy.
author: Carlene R.

description:
Stopped by last Wednesday night for a quick bite with my son. The place was about half full with no wait. We were seated immediately and then it happened...nothing. No greeting, no server. We waited exactly 10 minutes (only because we were talking) and then got up and left. 

Don't waste your time here.
author: Or C.

description: While our server was great and the sourdough bread delicious, my filet came out thin, well done and dry (when ordered medium), the manager is what ended us walking out on our meal (We offered to pay but he said if we don't want to eat it not to pay). We had an anniversary table right at the window and booked for the sunset. While the sun was going down another server tried to put the screens down to block our view to accommodate another patron further back. We asked for a little bit of window without it so we could still see out. The server gave us an attitude but complied. My husband didn't appreciate the attitude and mentioned such to a manager who apologized. Shortly there after another server came out to take the screen down, we again mentioned we wanted it up. So a different manger came over to take the screen down all the way (over half of the screens were still up in the restaurant). At this point our entrees had already been delivered and we saw the pathetic filet. My husband told the manager to simply bring our check if it's mandatory to bring the screens down when we have asked repeatedly for them to be up. The manager said if we didn't eat our food and want to go to simply go. This is the first restaurant we left in the middle of. Absolutely awful!!!!
author: Rachel C.

description: We were there about 2 hours ago..our presence was not even acknowledged after waiting for about 7-10 minutes at the bar..there were 3 bartenders/employees more interested on putting glasses away.. then acknowledging and/or serving patrons..we weren't the only ones being ignored...such a nice venue and location, but useless if customer service is lacking  I guess they don't know that their glassware  isn't going anywhere, but patrons/customer will go somewhere where they want their business, like we did.
author: Angiel S.

description:
What a horrible experience! The gentleman/host at the front door was extremely rude. I had reservations for a party of 14 on a Friday night and we arrived in two separate groups. Half of my group arrived first and was sitting at the bar and waiting. Apparently they will not seat your party unless most or all of your party arrives. Upon arrival the host says "your party is at the bar." I then ask "can we be seated first?" He said "go get your party and then I'll seat you." But he said this in an extremely rude manner. Very unprofessional. 

Next, when I originally made the reservation, I was told we would have two round tables of 8 and 7 seats. We ended up with a table of 9 and a small table of 5. What a horrible set up for our party. I'd also asked a host walking by to help find another table arrangement and she said she was going to check. But I never heard or seen from her the rest of the night. 

All in all, what a horrible experience and unprofessional and unorganized staff. I was skeptical on why a nice restaurant had 3 stars on Yelp but now I understand why. Save your money and go elsewhere. Food was just OK.

Only positive thing was our waiter, Peter was nice and attentive. Too bad the rest of the staff wasn't.

I usually don't write reviews but this was such a horrible experience, it was worth mentioning.
author: Anthony H.

description: The food was so good but I just don't like the way they place the restroom. It's hard to find.
author: Truc M.

description: Food was great. Service and wait time got them 2 stars. Saw our waitress once. Had to ask someone for water and menus. Another waiter came to our rescue after 45 minutes. And we were seated in the front. Crab cakes..4 stars!
author: Stevette S.

description: Would not know if the food was good or bad. We went there to eat, and with a half empty restaurant, we were seated in the back of the restaurant, by the kitchen.  No one else was within 50 feet of us. I guess they don't take too kindly to black people wanting to eat at their  establishment. Not expensive or exclusive, most of the places we eat at, at home, cost more and are nicer. Worst experience ever while on vacation.
author: Andrea M.

description:
I agree with everyone else's review that the service here is horrendous, and as was the food. Came here with the big familia on Christmas day for lunch. We were split up into two tables, which is fine. But we each had our own server - which was awkward (as a side note, does anyone else experience poor service at a restaurant when you have 6+ people in your party, because the gratuity is automatically added at that point - how rude and disingenuous). 

The food, drinks, water, etc took wayy too long.  A bloody mary was almost forgotten, and finally arrived 30 minutes later. The appetizers and entrees, when they arrived, were congealed and cold, because they likely were sitting by the kitchen for way too long.

The scallops I had were gross, and too oily. The radicchio that the scallops sat on were too bitter. The cauliflower puree, was not pureed at all. It was not smooth and definitely was grainy.

The rib eye was too oily. Overcooked. 

All the fish was dry and had this congealed look over it.

Never again. Waste of calories and money.
author: Vanessa K.

description: I have dined at McCormick & Kuleto's in the past.  This will be the last time at this particular location.  Ordered two wines,  both were served in dirty glasses.  I showed the server the dirty glasses and asked for new wine in clean glasses.  I literally watched her get new glasses inspect them for cleanliness and then pour the wine from the dirty glasses into the clean glasses.  Upon seeing this, I immediately approached her and told her that was unacceptable and let her know that we would be leaving.
author: Cam P.

description:
We first arrived to very friendly nice warm welcoming ppl. Then our waiter served us, he was very unhappy and uninterested in our table. He proceeded to not show care and wasn't happy throughout the night. They were not very accommodating. I only wanted fried calamari and they had it on the menu however it was a dish with muscles and shrimp.(stuff I don't like). The restaurant couldn't just bring some fried calamari if we didn't orders the muscles and shrimp.(a little ridiculous)  The view was pretty amazing,food was nothing special. Good but not great. 

2 stars due to poor server , decent food.
author: Riley G.

description:
Nothing special, except for the prices, which were higher than average in the area. 
Place looks ritzy, pretends to be, but clearly is not! Food is average at best, was not served hot, my scallops were bland, the espressos were also cold. Servers were not very attentive, the entite place was very cold (a/c on), so we dined in thick sweaters or jackets.
