CAN'T RECOMMEND !!!
author: Axel B.

description: Terrible service. as we walked in the host was to busy reading the menu!? We stood there for about 5 minutes and had to REQUEST to be seated. The restaurant was almost empty. As we sat down we waited for 15 minutes. NOBODY came to us, not to even get the drink order. There were more waiters than tables but somehow we didn't get any attention whatsoever. We just got up and walked away! And that's how you lose business!
author: Alyona B.

description: My hubby, daughter and I came here for happy hour (3/10/2017). He sat at the bar and ordered drinks and appetizers. The bartenders are professionals and good at what they do. A lady next to me had a plate of oysters. She commented at how good they were. I believe one half of an oyster is $1.25. Not bad considering the size was pretty good. We order ordered chicken satay, salmon poke and hummus. Did not wait long for the appetizers.  All were good. We enjoyed the drinks, appetizers, atmosphere and bartenders! Hope to go back there again!
author: Christine K.

description: Had an amazing waiter-Justin, the food was great. Would return just for the great service and location. Thanks!!
author: Ranee W.

description:
Filet was very good ! Mashed potatoes awesome!
Wedge was perfect!
Our waiter "Paola"gave us our drinks and before our appetizers came we were out of waters and a soft drink the entire meal, never refilled .
Poor service deserves poor tip!
author: B H.

description:
I took my family and friends here for the view and a good meal during a recent visit to San Francisco.  The view didn't disappoint; nearly everything else did.  
We arrived around 5:30, there was plenty of staff and our waiter was friendly and helpful,  But somehow the kitchen must have been overwhelmed.  Each of the five appetizers arrived at different times; the last was the easiest--clam chowder, which came ten minutes after the other guests had finished.  The sturgeon was overcooked; the pasta special had cold crabmeat dumped on the top.  The entrees took too long to arrive.
I was very disappointed that such an expensive place turned out to be only a tourist trap.
author: Laurence M.

description:
Unfortunately nothing special. We had a dinner there last week. Food is ok, but very average. Service is again very average. 
Not a bad location,  but as we were there for dinner and sun alredy set, it is pitch black outside. So you are not paying for a view ether. Very dated decor throughout the place.
Nothing memorable here.
author: Max P.

description:
I was so let down from this restaurant...I have been to the McCormicks in San Jose and was very impressed by their food, I had to try the one in SF.

First we waited forever to be seated when the restaurant was clearly not busy. Then when we were seated, the waiter took forever getting us water and bread.

I had to order the cioppino since we were in the bay and it was pretty good, I just wish it had a little more broth. I also ordered the mac and cheese...OH EM GEE!!!! Probably the best dish on our table. The truffle makes it taste different from other mac and cheeses, and the breading gives it texture.

Unfortunately, there was a hair in my boyfriends fish plate and the manager refused that it couldn't be, even when we showed him that it was CLEARLY on the plate.

At the end the manager did comp his meal. Will I ever go back...NO...big disappointment
author: Jerrica N.

description: I was really disappointed in my meal here. I ordered the pan seared sea scallops and they were waaaay overcooked. I can't believe the expo person let that dish leave the pass. Gordon Ramsey would have lost his mind. Additionally, the parsnip puree was crazy sweet...lay off the sugar. Finally, the wilted greens were super oily. All around a really poor dish. The server didn't come back to our table until everyone else was done eating so I didn't have the opportunity to send it back reasonably. I did however inform the server of the issue when he finally did come back and asked if I wanted a box for my barely touched, full plate. He said "Oh so sorry" and still put the item on the bill.
author: Shelley S.

description: The absolute worst dining experience ever.  Manager had an attitude.  Very unsatisfied and would not recommend.
author: Susan M.

description:
Hard to believe that it's been over 2.5 years since I've dined here.  Let me preface by saying that this part of town is not exactly my cup of tea, filled with tourists in shorts and San Francisco sweatshirts.  Celebrating my dad's 90th, not an easy feat, making a dinner reservation here was an automatic.  Here's what we had:

Appetizers (shared)
1) Steamed mussels - Cooked in a white wine sauce with small sausage pieces, this was tasty.  The sauce made for great bread dipping.

2) Fried calamari - Served with marinara sauce, it was okay and as expected.

3) Gazpacho with dungeness crab (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=04bWiWOT2JEd0HN2IxCcOg&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - Seasonal summery soup perfectly complemented by the buttery avocado and tasty crab meat.

Entree
4) Jumbo shrimp scampi with linguini (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=lvo0Go3jmjYm3r559kSH5w&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - Opting for a lighter entree after a heavy lunch, this fit the bill.  The tomatoes and garlic were enough flavoring for both the pasta and the shrimp.

Because of an evening appointment, I was unable to share the recommended banana cream pie dessert.  Because we were here for an early dinner (6:15 pm reservations), the dining room was just filling up as I left with area locals, Japanese tourists, and romantic couples.  The combination of relatively large menu choices, a panoramic Bay view, and efficient service makes this a popular dining destination. Despite being less than a frequent regular, the host remembered me and spoke to me like a long lost friend.  The personal birthday wish on each of our menus brought smiles to us and left a lasting impression.  By pure coincidence, during our birthday toast, our neighboring table asked about my dad's age and told us that they were also celebrating their dad's 90th birthday this same evening.  When he returned from the lieu, my dad and he shared birthday wishes and talked about their backgrounds.  My father brought a smile to my face when he mentioned that he just thought about McCormick's a few weeks ago, wondering when we last ate here.  Happy that his birthday wish came true and smiles filled the evening.
author: Mike C.

description:
I have eaten here multiple times during the past year but this is my first review -- I've had mixed reviews over my multiple visits. 

If you come here during a holiday, be aware that they will likely have a limited special menu that day (which is not surprising but they should say so on their website or OpenTable if reserving through them). I had intended to order the clam chowder but found out that it wasn't on the holiday menu, which was not a big deal..

The prices appeared a little inflated vs the website, perhaps due to the holiday as well (could be wrong).

Paid $16 for a small bowl of lobster soup - it was more like the size of a big cup. 

Ordered the duck breast for my entree which was meh but the sides of chopped carrots and potatoes that were combined were basically flavorless (and reminded me of those chopped frozen veggies that I ate as a child - carrots & peas). 

My friend's prime rib was ordered 'medium rare' and it sure looked well-done to both of us (they opted not to send it back). 

The butter for our sourdough bread was delicious if that's anything.

Lastly, if you order water, don't say 'still' (vs 'tap' or 'carbonated') or you risk getting a bottle of Italian spring water on your bill for $7. **Tip for business: waitstaff should clarify if you want tap or spring water even if someone asks for 'still' water. 

Nice views, good service. 

Based on past two-three visits I am no longer impressed with the view and was disappointed in the meal.
author: D L.

description: Food was delicious and the views were outstanding!  Nice place to get a good meal. Nice place for a special meal.
author: Susy S.

description: We stopped in to enjoy a glass of wine after a long day of walking around San Francisco. The bartender was short and rude to us and basically told us to sit in our seat and wait for a server rather than order from the bar, which is where we were anyways! After ordering, we received our bill and realized there was a 5% surcharge, which is charged to "offset the cost of doing business in San Francisco." We found that to be absurd and will not be  coming back. There are plenty of other restaurants in the area that don't charge you such a ridiculous "surcharge." We suggest taking your business elsewhere!
author: Brett L.

description: The the dungeness crab, try not to get the sidewalk crab save yourself for McCormick & Kuleto's.
author: T R.

description:
Didn't really like this place though our friends said it had a great reputation.  The server was nothing more than cordial.  My husband liked the steak he had at Waterfront the night before much more than this place.  I agreed that the steak didn't taste like much.  I don't east steak often, but I'd say there have been several that my husband has cooked on the grill that have tasted quite a bit better seasoning wise. 

The view was amazing.  That's the best thing about the place.  That's where they are getting my 2 stars from - atmosphere, ambiance, and view of the water.  That can't be beat. . . . or  . . . well . . . let's just say if it can, I haven't found it yet.  ;-)
author: Katherine S.

description:
My friend and I stopped in after the airshow Sunday. The older gentleman bartender was serving us or should I say - not serving us or anyone else who was ethnic. Not only did we wait a ridiculous 30 some minutes for a bowl of soup but we watched as the two African American women in the bar were told to wait some 15-20 mins (just for drinks). All the while he was ever attentive as he served 4 Caucasian women. When we asked to speak to the manager we heard the bartender tell him to transfer us to anyone else. 

The food - the soup finally arrived literally less than 3 minutes after we complained about the wait almost immediately. It was delicious but soured by the taste of negligence and racial profiling. 

I used to work for this company when I was 18 - I started as a host. I quit because the guest told me "this is why your kind should work in the back or go back to your own country" and my manager responded "the customer is always right."
author: Collette M.

description:
My little brother doesn't get to go out to eat at "fancy" type places to often.  So on his week visit I made a point to take him to places that were a little more high brow than Golden Corral (his favorite restaurant).

I knew he didn't get out much when they put bread and butter on the table and the butter was in those little golf balls and he pointed at it and asked what they were.

We were sat promptly in a booth raised up over the bottom floor with a beautiful view of the water and park.

They had specials that included all Lobster.  My little brother wanted only a bowl of Mussels.

I wanted a simple salad with ranch dressing.  No, I had to order a salad on their salad menu.  I went with the Baby Greens Salad.  Its not what I wanted and it sucked on top of that.  

I'm also not supposed to eat unpasteurized cheeses (pregnancy rule) and this one had Blue Cheese Crumbles.  I had to pick most of them off.  The candied Walnuts were good.  I picked most of those out and ate them.   They just really need to put a basic salad on their menu with a choice of dressings.

For my main meal I had the Lobster Bisque.  They served it in a bowl with little pile of Lobster meat in the middle then poured the Bisque over the top. 

I could tell the Bisque was sitting out because there was a skin on it when he poured it in front of me.  It also got cold really fast too.  That's how I knew it had been sitting out.

It was good though.  Not the best Lobster Bisque in the world but it worked for the moment.

My brother loved his mussels.  The broth smelled really good and I talked him into sopping it up with bread when he was done.  I wish I could have had some too. (Another pregnancy no-no)

They had an extensive cocktail menu and would like to come back and bring my husband to enjoy them.  Possibly give the food another chance.
author: Ivy R.

description:
Frequented this place a few times.  I am a Bay Area Native.  Service here is horrible, starting with the Front Desk person.  His accent is so thick, one can barely understand him.  I am not concerned with an accent, but his disposition is so cold.  No smile, no hello.  Just a plain rude man.

Food is mediocre at best.  Service is slow.  Servers are more concerned with chit chatting then they are with making sure your dining experience is a good one.

Carpets are dirty, as is the windows.
author: G S.

description:
We came here after a long day in SF and after walking around the entire city. It was such a gorgeous restaurant and the location was amazing. Afterwards, we went to get ice cream at Ghiradhelli's! Our server was this adorable Russian woman who was knowledgeable about everything in San Francisco and she was amazing. 

We had a variety of dishes:
Oysters Rockefeller. Spinach and Cheese baked into the oyster and sitting on a bed of salt. It was amazing. It melts in your mouth and it was cooked to the right amount that way the oyster wasn't dried up.
Escargot: It was served in such cute pastry shells and were very decadent. 
Ahi Tuna and all the sides like wasabi, salads and sauces was amazing. 
Crab pasta, the snap peas in it were beautiful. They literally were so fresh, they popped in your mouth and then it was a great sweet contrast with the creamy pasta. 

Overall, the meal was amazing and it was worth going to! I think that since it is a chain, I wouldn't go again until I had tried a lot of other restaurants.
author: Julianne Z.

description: Great experience! Went with a native San Franciscan who had never been to this restaurant. We got a great booth facing the window. We arrived and saw the last of the sunset which was phenomenal! The food was very delicious and even though they had just ran out of the stuffed salmon the waitress recommended a great replacement of the Ahi Tuna.  I was blown away by the service, food, and drink!
author: Yvonne H.

description:
I normally enjoy eating at this chain, but a recent experience deterred me from ever returning.

We had a reservation for a party of 10 on a Sunday night. We checked in to the hosts and they told us to wait in the bar. We waited in the bar for 40 minutes, checking in with the hosts on multiple occasions during that time. They repeatedly told us that our table was still being made... for 40 minutes. Finally they told us our table was ready, and our group sighed in relief as we sat down. Little did we know...

It took 5 minutes for the waitress to finally acknowledge us. She took our drink order (mainly water) and we politely asked for her to bring us bread. For the next 20 minutes we waited and waited, no bread or drinks in sight. We asked every waiter, host, and bus boy that walked by if they would please bring us our long overdue drinks and bread. After asking 6 different times, the drinks came out, but only a few of them. We had to ask again for the other drinks, and they said, "Right away." It was not "right away;" it took another 5 minutes. 

The drinks finally arrived but our bread was still not to be seen. We asked the next waiter we saw if he would get the manager. The manager came and we asked him for bread. A few minutes later, he brought us bread, but not nearly enough for a party of this size. My mother asked if he could bring us more bread and he snarked, "You have to be patient, ma'am." He then mumbled passive aggressive remarks under his breath. He brought us one more small plate of bread and acted like he was doing us a huge favor.

At this point, our water had not been refilled once, even after asking twice. In addition, the preset wine glasses were left on the table, even though no one ordered wine. Upscale restaurants typically follow the etiquette of removing wine glasses if no one orders wine, but not McCormick & Kuleto's. 

Once our appetizers arrived, we had lost our will to eat. Our entrees took another 12 minutes to arrive, but came out at staggered times. The food wasn't bad, luckily, but was not up to the standard we expect when paying such exorbitant amounts.

All in all, I am HIGHLY displeased with my experience at McCormick & Kuleto's. The workers are rude and inattentive, the manager is pretentious, and the food was NOT worth the wait. DO NOT GO.
author: Deanna M.

description:
This is a tourist trap disguised as a fancy steakhouse- don't fall for it. While the views and the restaurant itself are very nice, the service was unfriendly and the food was mediocre, especially for the price. Everyone I came here with ordered steaks and a variety of sides: mac & cheese, gnocchi, mushrooms, asparagus. They were not impressed. I had a taste of my son's mac & cheese-it was bland and had a strange texture. I ordered the cioppinio and the broth was flavorful but it only came with one small crostini and the seafood was mostly calamari. Where I come from, we use squid as bait so.. I wasn't impressed either. 
All that being said, if you insist on eating in the area and you prioritize ambience over quality of food, there are worse places you could spend too much money.
author: Rocio G.

description:
Beautiful setting w/ a great view, particularly during the sunset hours. For the month of October, you're also able to see a fireworks show around 8:30PM on Saturdays. It was an unexpected bonus for us.

View aside, the food was ok. My husband didn't like the steak - not enough char and a bit on the blander side. My other cousins had the Cioppino - tasty if you can ignore the fact that the crab legs were gamey. The meat also had a powdery consistency which means it wasn't fresh. I had the halibut and it was perfectly cooked and flakey. No complaints there. The side dish of mushrooms were yummy.

We ordered more wine towards the end which took forever to come. The waiters kept bringing the food to the wrong person. Not a big deal but don't drop the food in front of who you think ordered it only to be told it's the wrong person. They could've just asked who ordered it instead.
author: Julie L.

description:
Beware!!!! I planned a graduation party for my nephew at McCormick & Kuleto's, they were deceptive about the contract. I ordered 4 bottles (according to contract anything in excess patron would be send to the bar only) of wine they brought out 5 additional bottles that no one ordered, wine was wasted, glasses were left full of wine, they continued to pour even when guests declined. I was shocked at the end of the event to find out I was charged in excess of 500$ for the additional wine. 

Also, there were 7 less guests than expected. The Event Planner Kristin did not divulge that I would be charged for the 7 guests that did not show and they refused to give us those additional meals that we were forced to pay for.
The General Manager Tobey Hughes was condescending, aggressive, and rude. The Event planner Kristin Mc Donald was deceptive and manipulative.

I plan a lot of these gatherings and this was the worse experience.
Take heed!
author: Andy T.

description: Caesar salad had so much dressing on it that it was inedible. One person in party asked for no onions and had them on both his salad and his entree. Clam chowder was good and entrees seemed good for the table. Crab dip was very good. That's where the praise ends. We had a 10 person table and the waiter didn't tell us until after our meal he couldn't split the tab for us. We had four separate couples and two individuals but he gave us one check. Then he tried to get us to sign up for a rewards card by making it seem like they would take 25$ off meal. All it did was give us points that would give us money towards a future meal after we already told him that there wasn't a restaurant where we were from AND it added 25$ to our bill as a sign up fee. I mean seriously who wants to add money to their bill that was already 500$! The waiter was nice but I would definitely not recommend eating here.
author: Jessica B.

description:
My husband ordered pork chops for dinner this past Sunday, April 19, 2015, and within the hour he got food poisoning and threw up all night . We drove one hour to enjoy a nice dinner. So it was very disappointing to get food poisoning on a $200 dinner for two. Just not acceptable. We both had the same appetizers and side dish. The clam appetizer had a delicious buttery garlic sauce. The escargot appetizer was not good. Quite plain and was served lukewarm. The only difference in our mealwas the main course. I had the Stuffed Atlantic Salmon (farm raised but deliciously prepared) 
We have dined here twice. Hostess is usually courteous but not particularly welcoming. Servers do a much better job of service.
Nice view of the bay. Decor and ambiance is fine.
author: Liuba B.

description: Lovely location but very disappointed with food service during happy hour.  We had been looking forward to revisiting this restaurant.  Had to cancel food order due to slowness (had a scheduled tour time).  Server not necessarily rude, but in our opinion, definitely had tourist burn out attitude.
author: Dani D.

description: Visited here on our san fran trip. We had the sturgeon which was awesome. We had the tuna tar tar which was fabulous. and they literally served us the best clam chowder in the sour bread dough that we ever had ! Great place.
author: Florie Q.

description:
I wish I could give this place 0 stars. Point blank period this place is TERRIBLE! Iv never been so angry with a restaurant. It is not cheap...which isn't the issue. The issues that my family and I had at this restaurant was 1. Servers are extremely rude!  2. They do nothing to make upset guest happy and 3. Food is terrible. They served my cousin a burned steak. A BURNED steak!!!! And when we politely asked to have it sent back, they brought back the SAME BURNED steak and said that it was intentionally suppose to be like that and that it was the "chefs style and personal touch for his cooking". Like what!? The steak was completely black and hard, he couldn't eat it. Then my little brothers clam chowder was way too salty! I get it sometimes  recipes call for a lot of salt but it was so salty he couldn't even eat it. When we mentioned the salty clam chowder they once again refused to do anything about it and basically gave us a huge TOO BAD. 
Don't ever come here. The only nice thing about this place was the view, but it comes at a crappy cost. Don't waste your time or money! There were 10 in our party and we don't mind spending money on good food... But we all had complaints about this place and we will never come back here again. Save yourself from a bad experience.
author: Karen C.

description: Poor service, was looking forward to having a nice dinner, but their service is unprofessional. Waited for over half an hour and no server. Never coming back again, seriously f**k this shit hole.
author: Jose V.

description:
Wow, how the mighty have fallen. This place was a bold yet hidden gem for years in SF, but my last visits have been strangely underwhelming. 

The view is the same, the decor is the same, the outfits and staff look about the same, the food seems about the same, but something isn't right. It's kind of on the periphery of your vision. Little but important mistakes the waiter makes, ham-handed sloppiness in the food prep, mix ups and quantity of food going down... And the outright insult was the phony bill tack-on hidden in small type at the menu bottom stating something to the effect of "5% extra will be added to your bill FOR THE COST OF DOING BUSINESS IN SAN FRANCISCO." Jeezus Christmas! 

I know some restaurant owners are still pissed off that the $2.20/hr food handlers are now "entitled" to healthcare and maybe a sick day, but if that is hurting your bottom line then just RAISE AND LIST THE PRICES TO WHAT YOU WILL ACTUALLY BE CHARGING! Do you really think the tourists and business drones on expense accounts will balk and eat at Lori's instead when the tiny hunk of iceberg is honestly listed at $10.49 rather than passive-aggressively misrepresented as costing $9.99? SF business owners, give it a rest and just list the price you want us to pay IN ONE PLACE! Grow some balls! Do you hide a 5% DISCOUNT at the bottom of your restaurants in cheaper towns for the "cost of doing business" for the lax regulations and vulnerable workers you employ? Same logic.

I understand one issue affecting the quality of McCormick and Kuleto's is the recent sale to a chain that runs Bubba Gumps and some other iffy places. Like I said, the food was still within what used to be the quality, clam chowder, crab cakes, linguini still ok, but it ain't the same place we used to visit and love for years gone by.
author: T J.

description: Fabulous view, excellent drinks and food that should have been first class but missed the mark in the details.  No sear on scallops spoiled what otherwise would have been a great dish. Would go again strictly for the view.
author: Gretchen P.

description:
Even though I'm from Portland, home of McCormick & Schmick's, it doesn't mean that I automatically adore their restaurants. So it was quite a relief that our special family dinner in San Francisco turned out so well. 

This location has very special significance for members of our family and the views make you fall in love with San Francisco all over again. We did a few things right when planning our group dinner. Our reservation was made for an early seating, so we had very warm and personal service throughout our meal. We had a lovely large table near the end on the main level so it almost felt like a private dining room.

Even though we had a large party and requested several alterations to the standard menu to accommodate vegetarians, kids, etc. everything came as specifically ordered without the server writing down a single note. She was totally on her game. They also had very good, reasonably priced options on the kids' menu.

We were there to celebrate a very special birthday and when we arrived the daily menu had a personal birthday greeting printed on the top, she was greeted by the staff and given a lovely chocolate dessert at the end of our meal. She was treated very well on her special day and all the little touches made for a memorable evening.

The only downside was that I ordered the wrong thing. One of those 'looks good on paper' miscues, so I was the only one who didn't enjoy my meal. I do not recommend the pan seared sea scallops with Roasted Snake River Farms Kurobuta Pork Belly and lentils. My prior experiences with M&S should have taught me to keep it simple and order one of the fresh items of the day simply prepared, but instead I took a risk and it didn't pay off.

Even though we had a lovely evening, this isn't the place I'd typically choose when visiting San Francisco, but for this particular event and group it was just right.
author: Jen K.

description:
I came in over Mother's Day weekend with my boyfriend and his family. We came in midday and sat at the bar hoping we could stop to grab a casual drink as we passed on through this beautiful square but instead we got the WORST of the WORST service by our bartender. I was appalled by his arrogant pompous attitude and how he straight up ignored us the whole time we were there. 

I became even more irritated as I tried to get his attention to get out of this hell hole but he wouldn't give us the time of day.  This bastard made me feel like a hostage who was stuck to pay this bill for his less than adequate service.  

We were so outraged by his inconsiderate, apathetic, & rude service that we left swearing to never eat at this establishment again. I wish I could give them negative 20 stars for his disappointing service. 

His name might of been Glen. I wish I knew for sure so I could complain to the manager for allowing someone like him to represent the restaurant the way he did. I'm sorry buddy that your life sucks as a bartender but you better recognize that every customer deserves adequate service. If you can't, then get out of the freaking profession because not only are you making yourself look bad, but you're making your staff look bad, as well as McCormick's. Thanks for ruining my Mother's Day.  

Either way, I hope karma kicks you a nice one in the future.
author: Jennifer C. L.

description: This restaurant deserves a 0 star. They had the worst service imaginable. We sat for an hour waiting just for bread to get to our table. Not only that but we ordered appetizers and those did not get to our table until we were almost done with our dinner. They never filled our waters even when we asked for it. Lastly, the restaurant was freezing. It took us asking 4 people to get them to turn the heat up, yet they never did. Food is good, but you have to starve to enjoy it. DO NOT COME HERE THERE ARE WAY BETTER PLACED IN SAM FRANCISCO TO EAT.
author: Bradley P.

description: What a VIEW! We came for a work dinner and had a solid but not spectacular steak/seafood dinner. Servers were excellent. We also found glass in our chowder, which was disturbing. First time I had chowder in years, and I was really enjoying it too.... I mean, that is really unacceptable. At least no one got hurt.
author: Vivian H.

description: Very disappointing!  My hubby and I usually stop in here at least once when in SF. On Sunday, 3-5-17, we arrived a bit before noon. Staff inside see us at the door but do not acknowledge us.  We relax in the square until a bit after noon. Entering from the top bar area and again are not acknowledged. We make our way to the hostess station where they seem confused by someone finally and shuffling menus seats us. Beautiful view (the good stops here). We had to flag down someone to order drinks. The waiter had ZERO clue about Bloody Marys even though the have the entire back of the drink menu listing their several types Bloody Marys. We say we would like two Bloody Marys.  He says ok and starts to walk away.  NO mention of all the other choices.  I stop him and say, one spicy and one mild please. One would think at a place with an entire section for Bloody Marys would make a decent one?!?!  NOPE.  BLAND! Undrinkable (we did not drink them) and $12 each. We ordered food prior to tasting them. Crab Louis $29, Claw Chowder Bowl $13 (decent), and Fish and Chips.  The Crab Louis was horrible. 4 canned black olives, un-ripe and untrimmed tomato (one in quarters), old lettuce, over cooked (grey around the yoke) egg, and crab drowned in Thousand Island dressing.  Not good for $9 much less $29!  The fish in the fish in chips disintegrated when cut.  Fries were good but not for $20!  Hubby had to track down waiter again to order a beer.  We should have just left!!  $124 for terrible lunch for 2!?!?!?
author: Julie M.

description: I wish I could give an extra 5 stars  ! I absolutely love this place. I have visited three times & every time I had the best meals & Birthday. Super friendly staff !  They even helped me cut my cake and wrap it up so I can be on my way home . Im a native San franciscan & I drive 45 min. Away just to dine & have a glass of wine here & I don't mind. I've had two birthday celebrations & One Graduation celebration all turned out nice . Love the ambiance the noise level is tolerant & the view I always fall in love with ! Will be dining there friday .
author: Noneofyour B.

description:
Classy ambiance and beautiful waterfront view! Food was okay,service was terrible! The food took forever to come ( almost an hour ) and dishes were served and set down incorrectly, then taken away for a different table?! 
Have heard good things about their happy hour, may try and return for that !
author: heather z.

description:
Strong service. 

Likely the best scallops I've ever had prepared. Mussels were flavorful and massive. Great crab cake. 

Completely awesome views of the bay!!
author: M F.

description:
After Landry's bought out the McCormick's franchise, some of the restaurants went downhill in quality. 
I experienced this firsthand at a different McCormick's location. So, it made me leery to eat at McCormick & Kulteo's in San Francisco...

However, the quality of food seemed to be unaffected by the changes. My meal was pallet pleasing.

Everything wasn't entirely unchanged, though. It used to be that if you were a preferred member you received a complimentary one-bite appetizer. I guess that is no more. And we had to specifically ask for a bread basket, which seemed odd.

I had this particular meal on a Saturday around 2PM. My party was seated immediately. There were a LOT of young families eating at that time. 

Our server wasn't overly-attentive, but she didn't neglect us either. The service was entirely average.

My meal, though, was above average! I know McCormick's is a chain, but they know how to do seafood!
I had the house salad (w/ candied walnuts), and my entree was the Parmesan crusted sole. It was everything I'd come to expect. High-quality.

I'd eat here again in a heartbeat. For the most part, this particular McCormick location escaped the buyout unscathed.
author: Brooke S.

description:
Flew from SNA to have valentines day dinner at McCormicks & Koleto and had reservations.  Hope to have happy hour after a day of visiting SF.  No happy hour on this day.  Decided to go ahead and be seated.  Reception acted like I did not have a reservation and not very friendly, but able to have a nice table.  Menu was not as good ad expected.  Started off with crab, mango, advocado w/orange vignette salad and braised pork belly.  Crab had no taste pork fantastic.  Main course sea bass and cioppino.   Bass was great cioppino was not.  Very small broken clams most had no meat in them.  Chips of clam shells in broth.  Squid no taste along with the shrimp.  I believe pieces of fish was salmon.  One very small snow crab leg that was so small couldn't open and have any meat inside.  Was given cracker, but no need to use.  Bread was so hard unable to even soak up sauce.  Service was great but never asked how our food is after being served.  Ate about a third of a small amount of cioppino and couldn't eat any more as all seafood was dry.  The only thing tasty in this dish was the mussels. 
Our previous experiences eating at this restaurant  and all Mcormicks & Smith been fantastic, but not this day.
author: Lynda B.

description:
Rookie server, bad service. horrible food all of our party of five thought so. Would skip this restaurant. Wouldn't allow zero stars so 
Had to give it one
author: Kari W.

description: Fantastic view, but the worst service ever! Slow, cold food, no one seems to care! Food just OK. Have a drink and enjoy the view, but that's it!
author: John W.

description:
Went here for a last minute, easy option, cause we were starving and exhausted after a long-haul flight. I'm a vegetarian unlike the other people I went with (who really wanted steak) so I only had limited options to chose from on the menu. 

The restaurants location in Ghirardelli square and proximity to Fishermans Wharf make it a very touristy spot (which shows in their pricing too), which we were aware of but decided to go with it anyway. 

The views of the Bay are beautiful, which we really got to enjoy at our window table. I ordered the Mushroom & Cheese Ravioli, because they were the only warm vegetarian option I found. The portion was just right, and they tasted nice and were just what I needed. 

The service was good, too and I liked that we were not immediately presented with a check when being served our last course, like we've been in almost every other, cheaper American restaurant. 

I'm giving 4 stars instead of five for a lack of other veggie options and because I know that the filet mignon a friend of mine ordered wasn't quite medium rare like her ordered, which you should expect for a price of $36.99.
author: Lisa T.

description: I give this restaurant 4 stars for it's great location and it's view of the bay. But for everything else, the food was ok. Definitely over priced, but I wouldn't be too surprised since it's near the pier. Customer service can be a little slow if the restaurant is busy.
author: Jadelann J.

description:
Ok--I'll confess--we played hooky today and decided to hang out near Aquatic Park.
The weather was beautiful this afternoon so we plopped down on a park bench and took in the gorgeous views that our fair city has to offer.

Since McCormick and Kuleto's was right up the street - we decided to have a late lunch there.

Normally, I would steer clear of eating in such a touristy area but I am so glad that we did.  From the Gloria Ferrer bubbly to the espresso after lunch--everything was thumb's up--including the service and the views.

They do their best to offer local fare and we did our best to order and consume it:

Gloria Ferrer, Blanc de Noir, Sonoma, CA, NV 12.00 a glass.

Marin Miyagi Oysters, Tomales Bay, CA
Fanny Bay Oysters, Baynes Sound B.C.
Kumamoto Oysters, Humboldt Bay, CA
Hog Island Oysters, Tomales Bay, CA
6 oysters 16.95 12 oysters 33.95
We ordered 2 of each to start things off and couldn't have been happier with the 
assortment.

Steamed Manila Clams with Garlic, White Wine and Fresh Herbs .....................................................10.95

Dungeness Crab Strozzapretti Pasta with Pt. Reyes Blue Cheese, Walnuts and Sugar Snap Peas ............ 27.95
Wow--there was quite a bit of crab served with this dish!

Fish and Chips Anchor Steam Beer Battered and
Breaded Rockfish, Fries, Tartar Sauce...... 18.95
The serving size is generous.

Lesson learned--do your homework first before dining--even in touristy areas.
You might be surprised at what you'll find.
author: Thomas D.

description: Good service but slow.  Food was not memorable.  Just ok.  Noisy.  Great view!  Good cocktails and wine list.
author: Chary P.

description: Great Filet! Kristen, our server was knowledgeable and accommodating. My dad said his chicken was superb. Views were great, too!
author: Skylar V.

description: We had our rehearsal dinner here and were very happy with the food and service. Everything was delicious and our servers were very nice and attentive. We worked with Kristin to get everything booked and coordinated and she was awesome - so nice and helpful, and patient with all our changes. We also thought it was a great location for our out of town guests given the gorgeous views. Thanks McCormick & Kuleto's for a great rehearsal dinner experience for us and our guests!
author: Julie H.

description:
I made a reservation for 20..ok, so half the party got there..and they said as long as half is there we could be seated..liars..ok so then our party changed to 13, and we still couldn't be seated..we then had a few more people coming..so 15..ok now i feel bad that I had to tell the host...but damn the host was so rude about it..why would it matter if you guys already have seating arrangements already? so then the full party is going..20..then they gave us crap..ok i get it..but next thing you know it was two round tables, not even one..and it was already available..so why be so rude? it's unnecessary.

so after a long wait..we had to wait again for the server..the server even asked, if it's ok if the food came out for us first if we ordered first..ok..so we got the apps..

fried calamari - pretty good..not that big of a portion though..though the sauce was really good with the bread...

mango crab avocado tower - very good..sauce was sweet..not too bad

alderwood salmon - the fish was firm..cooked well for me..i like my salmon on the firmer side..tho some might say it's over cooked..the balsamic reduction is really good with the onions..

other people were not satisfied with their food..beef medallion was too try, dill salmon was not great, the snapper was not snappy..

we waited more than 2 hours for our food..turns out they waited for all dishes to be prepared..which is messed up because 3 people came late and they waited..but the server originally said we'll get our food up next..the waiter was really rude..no accountability what so ever..it was a bday and yet no singing or bday cake..really? horrible..

i have to admit, it's a nice place and all..the view is nice at night..but the service suck balls..
author: Minerva L.

description: I really liked the food. I felt the quality was great and interesting flare to the food.
author: Harmie P.

description: Very good place and good service! Me and my friends ordered different food like Mussel and Cream Clam Chowder (strong recommend) and Salmon and shrimp pasta, big portion!!!! nice view! Definitely will take friends come back here
author: Momoko S.

description:
Nice place.  Good View of the Bay.  It just didn't impress me as a top notch place to eat.

Dungeness Crab over pasta --- three of us selected it.  The dish was made with blue cheese, which simply overpowered the crab.

It's not like they have a horrible problem, just this dish didn't work.
author: Brad H.

description: Ate here on Christmas Day. Overpriced and the service was awful. Our server spilled multiple items including another tables dessert which she left on the floor and multiple employees walked by and left it there- for 20 minutes! My daughter ordered the crab appetizer and it had crab shells in it. The worst part was when our server came and grabbed the wine glasses from our table and walked them over to the table next to us and poured their wine into them and served them wine IN OUR DIRTY GLASSES. Disgusted.
author: Renee W.

description: Very pretty restaurant with white tablecloths, great location, and helpful servers. We were a family of 12 last night, and the table at the window was ready for us. The food was just what we wanted--fresh, tasty, fun to try.  We had drinks and appetizers, and the helpful server offered suggestions, and we enjoyed everything. The price surprised us at being lower than what we guessed for all we got.
author: Linda B.

description:
First time I ate here, had the Ahi Tuna Niçoise Salad made with Fingerling Potatoes, French Beans and Nicoise Olives, and Tomato. It was like no other Nicoise, I've ever had in my life and absolutely delicious. No lettuce, just sweet tomatoes and the most amazing dressing! It was light, yet very filling... and Ahi Tuna was seared just right. 

The view from this restaurant is gorgeous! If you happen to sit in the dining area, the restaurant is overlooking the entire bay! It's wonderful. It is also sitting right in Ghiradelli Square, which is a great people watching spot if you are sitting at the bar. If you are a SF native, it's fun to go here, because it feels tourist-y, but not as cheesy as the Double-Decker Bus and you get to meet people visiting from all over the world. ;-)
author: Cassandra E.

description:
Had serious doubts about this restaurant due to bad reviews but made a reservation anyway because of proximity to our hotel and the scenic view. When I made the reservation I was told a table for 2 would be no problem. Upon arrival, the restaurant was practically empty but we were told the (vacant) tables by windows were for 4 or more people and we were seated elsewhere. The hostess told us the man we spoke with shouldn't have told us we could have a window table.  We decided to leave and go elsewhere and found a wonderful restaurant called Albano where we had a wonderful dinner with impeccable service.

Owners and management - so much wasted potential and opportunity.
author: Michelle S.

description:
My review is for Happy Hour ... I've been to McCormick & Schmitt's so I wouldn't necessarily go here for dinner with so many local choices nearby. (Although the food is undoubtedly fresh)

This is simply the best happy hour in Fisherman's Wharf for someone who wants a cheap meal and some inexpensive drinks. First of all, a mixed drink with house liquor is $5. The house pours aren't terrible and the best part is they make their drinks with freshly squeezed juice which makes all the difference in the world. For $5 you will get a generous pour of house booze and then the bartender will cut and orange in half and squeeze both halves into your glass with a large press. Great screwdriver!

The happy hour menu almost looks like a misprint. $3.99 for a 1/2 lb. cheeseburger with fries? And this is one of the best cheeseburgers I have had! Not some miniscule microwaved slider. The steamed clams for $5.99 come with the most amazing butter/garlic sauce. They will give you some extra sourdough bread to eat it with. Where else can you get a meal and a drink for around $10?

The bar is classy with lots of wood ... and the giant panoramic glass windows look right out into the Bay. You can see all the boats and Alcatraz. Seats at the bar aren't always easy to find ... they do have some tables as well. Happy hour runs from 3-6 (I believe) Monday through Friday (I believe).

Honestly, there is something great about getting a good deal. Obviously, I'd pay for quality ... but trust me, you will be telling your friends about the best $4 cheeseburger you ate one day. This place is a happy hour legend. The bartenders are a bit 'meat-heady' but not overly annoying.
author: E T.

description: Friends took us here for our wedding anniversary.  We got there early, before 6:30 PM.  Not much of a wait & service is excellent.  Our waiter was very attentive.  I had a delicious Lavender Mojito to start the night.  Ordered the lobster & realized that dinner's vegetable is "broccolini" only.  When the lobster arrived, it looked like shrimp.  Very small, the taste was good.  The company was much better than the food...
author: MonaJean A.

description:
The worst restaurant I eat so far. 
All the dishes came in different time, god was horrible and the service super bad. 
All this treatment for an expensive bill. 
Avoid a bad time, don't eat here!
author: Ezequiel K.

description: I would not recommend this restaurant. Four of us visiting from out of town had dinner here and were treated very rudely by the maitre d' when we asked for a table without reservations. The restaurant was not busy and there were several open tables by the window with great views. He said they would have to set a table up and it would be a few minutes. After 10 minutes he took us to a table by the kitchen entrance in the flow of traffic of all the waiters and busboys. We said that wasn't acceptable and he made us wait another 10 minutes to clear a small booth. We should have left at that point, but stayed and had a so-so dinner. We talked to the Manager on the way out and he said he would address the individual, but no compensation for us. Stay away!
author: J W.

description:
I've enjoyed other McCormick's locations, including Spenger's in Berkeley and M&S Grill in Tigard and Sacramento. I expected similar quality here, but alas! it was not to be found.

Good: Wait staff was polite and friendly. View of the bay was outstanding.

Bad: Party of ten at next table were screaming and laughing at full volume. Was hard to endure on a Sunday morning. 

Ugly: Classic Eggs Benedict. Sad, pathetic, lonely little eggs had been sitting in a tray somewhere for much too long. Muffins were so hard they wouldn't cut with a knife. Eggs were overcooked and dry. Hollandaise sauce was scant, and what there was was dry and crusty, cracked and flaky. Not a pretty sight. I didn't eat it; instead, went on to the potatoes. No good -- they were only half cooked and crunchy. 

Conclusion: I expect better from McCormick's. I hope they'll correct the situation. The prices were reasonable for a Sunday brunch type of thing. I'll continue patronizing McCormick's, but probably not at this location, at least for a year or so.
author: Tom P.

description: The food was good, the view was great, the service was okay. The restaurant is on the fancy side. I split the salmon with vegetables with my mom. The salmon was REALLY good! We also got this eggplant mozzarella appetizer, which was presented all fancily and saucy. Its on the pricey side, but Its a nice restaurant. We were looking for a more casual, cheaper restaurant when we were walking around Ghiradelli Square, but hunger led us here. It seems like a quaint date place or a nice place to go for a family dinner.
author: Tricia M.

description:
Oh, I really wanted to like this place.  I mean it's a beautiful restaurant, with a great view.  We had a window table, so it was extra nice.  but the service... and the food.  both meh.  sorry to say it just didn't wow me.

service:  we didn't read reviews ahead of time, but reading them now, i get what people are saying.  service wasn't great.  we were told it would be a 15 minute wait for our table. no problem... we head to the bar.  the guy there takes our order, and says tabs don't transfer, we'll have to close out before going to the restaurant.  well then the hostess comes along, and says she has our transfer tab.  uhm... ok?  so we head to our lovely table.  and wait. (and wait... and wait... and wait...)  eventually, the appetizer we ordered at the bar shows up.  no drinks. not even water.  well we finish the app.  still waiting.  finally we grab a guy walking by and ask if we could get our server to come by.  she then appears like magic, then heads off to get our drinks. or so she said. but we wait... sigh.  dinner service was a bit better. but the initial start really set the evening off on a low note.

food:  it was... ok.  dishes ordered at our table:  baked brie, clam chowder, crab cakes, scampi, stuffed salmon, carpaccio, ahi.  the baked brie was good.  clam chowder was met with good reviews as well.  crab cakes were very nice.  it's one big cake, not 2-3 small ones, so sharing the dish is interesting.  stuffed salmon was good, but a very small portion.  scampi is not something i'd order again.  heavy garlic taste, but that's about it.  otherwise, quite bland.  

drinks:  i tried the blackberry cocktail, and it was pretty yummy.  

again, the views are nice, but it's not worth going.  the prices are very high for some mediocre food and service that needs improving.  not somewhere i'd visit again.
author: Linnea E.

description: They get 3 stars for the view. The view is just.... breath taking and their wine display is gorgeous . The food is not amazing, typical steakhouse food. They do have tasty cocktails and a bacon wrapped shrimp appetizer that's pretty phenomenal. Their corkage fee is $25 and so far I've been there twice and would definitely go back.
author: Belen V.

description: Horrible!!!!! Food sucked and SERVICE sucked too!!! Servers and bar tenders were rude, the food was cold and the bread was rock hard. Never again!
author: Summer F.

description:
Beautiful beautiful, and  I mean BEAUTIFUL restaurant. 

AMBIANCE
Lovely decor, romantically dim, astounding view, and interesting architecture. I love how they use the space, how the floor plan is laid out. There are levels like a movie theater would and we're all watching the sunset as our imax movie. Each booth is separated and provides great intimacy between you and your date. 

SERVICE
Our host was certainly not the most gracious, but our server was nothing short of polite and lovable. She tended to our needs and made great conversation with us. She came to check up on us quite often but she wasn't overbearing. We also got great wine recommendations from her.

EATS
Lobster Bites - Part of their Spring Specials. A lobster tail worth of lightly fried lobster nuggets. Comes with a lemon aioli sauce and a butter sauce. Both sauces complimented the delicate little lobster pieces well in their own way. Totally delicious and somewhat worth the $20 pricetag for 6 little pieces.

Jumbo Shrimp Linguini - Big shrimps, a lot of noodles, and no flavor. Lightly seasoned with olive oil but nothing special. Date was probably hoping for more of a cream sauce and was mildly disappointed. 

Grilled Capino (?) - Also in their Spring Specials. A dense buttery fish grilled to perfection. The sides though were less than the best to pair with my fish. A jalapeno popper; not even a good one at that. Jalapeno popper was very mushy and fell apart upon the first touching of my fork. Delicious fish otherwise.

I can probably live with myself if I didn't come back for dinner anymore, at least by choice. But I'd come back to try their renowned Happy Hour.
author: Azn B.

description:
Sure, it's touristy. It's Ghirardelli Square for crying out loud. But that's because it's in a beautiful location, it's fun, spacious, and has a fabulous menu. I've been coming here since I was 12 and don't plan to stop!

My mom and I typically sit in Jim's section (do it - he's amazing, attentive, and will give you great recommendations), but everyone who works there is terrific. 

The view is fantastic. If you're lucky enough to sit on the upper level, or sit near the windows, you're in for a treat. My mom and I were so lucky to be at the window during a fireworks show! Such a treat.

The seafood is amazing (per my mom) - every time we go, she chooses something new and it's equally amazing. My sisters and I area all obsessed with the mashed potatoes. Seriously, the best you've ever had. When we were younger, we called it "The Yummy Mashed Potato Place" - okay, we still do.

Anything on their wine list will make you happy (bottles and glasses).

Try visiting on Thanksgiving. They offer a really fun menu!
author: Leah W.

description: After reading the reviews I was a little nervous.  Very nice upscale place.  Great atmosphere and a great view.   Food was great and we didn't have to wait long like I read in other reviews.    They did bring us cold bread and frozen butter which clearly made no sense.  I asked the waitress how I was suppose to spread that.  Lol.  She brought me another tray of butter that I think was even harder.   Anyways minus that it was an over all good experience.  Staff was ok. Nothing special
author: Steve C.

description:
I've been in this place many times and overall pretty positive experience.

PROS:
Great variety of fresh seafood and fish, changed daily and by season (plus multiple choices of Oysters) 
Decent selection of local wines (all my favorites - they have them)
Convenient location and parking (they validate)
Even if it's consider to be "touristy" place - they deliver good food
They have nice "Reward program" for frequent goers like me and multiple locations in SF Bay Area and thru US

CONS:
Service - it's can be GOOD or not so GOOD (based on 30+ trips to this place over period of 10+ years)

However, if you comparing to other, strictly "touristy" restaurants in the area (Fisherman's Wharf) - "McCormick & Kuleto's" will be my primary choice ;-)
author: Peter B.

description: Came here for a Veterans Day lunch! Great food!! Our server JC was really great and was very attentive!!! The view was also amazing !!!! Thanks so much!!
author: Kimmylou C.

description: This review is for their happy hour, one of the best happy hours I've found in the area, including the Marina.  Very nice interior, nice setting, easy parking that time of day on a weekday, and great service.  Their happy hour food and drinks have always been amazing, been here about 2-3 times, just for happy hour.  I recommend it to all my friends.  Never had dinner before at this place, the reviews don't seem so great for that.
author: Sintia M.

description:
My bf and I came to eat here for lunch. The inside is real nice and big. We sat next to the window and wow the view was amazing. Our waiter was real friendly.

I ordered the clam chowder, and I must say that is one of the best clam chowder's I've had. It was so tasty, smooth, not too heavy and just had the perfect taste. They have the sourdough bowl but I wanted to eat somewhat light and just got a cup. My bf had the ahi tuna melt and it was delicious! The sourdough bread was so crisp, and the tuna was fresh and just melts in your mouth. Overall had a great experience and would definitely come here again. 

This rating is based on a first time visit, so maybe their other food may not be as good but I when I go back I'll make sure to order something else and update.
author: Vanessa M.

description: Ordered the sparkling wine flights with tapas. Been 40 mins and got the wine but no sign of tapas. Horrid service. No wonder it is practically empty on a Saturday afternoon. Sad.
author: Neha K.

description:
We had early reservations for dinner at 6:30 pm and were promptly seated in a nice booth overlooking patrons below and a large view of the bay.  Good start.  The waiter was friendly and got our order quickly but I could smell cigarette in his breath which was offensive.  I ordered a half dozen oysters which came quickly because I think they are pre-shucked.  They were dried out but tasted okay.  The ones I had at the ferry building for breakfast were much better and juicy!

I ordered the sturgeon and my wife ordered the cioppino.  The sturgeon was overcooked and dry and the cioppino was just okay.  I've been to other McC's and they have been much better.

If you do go and you are wearing a short dress, don't sit on the upper booths facing the bay.  If I was looking, I would be able to see right into you from the lower booth.  The partition at my booth should be higher so I can't see your table.
Bless you.
author: Robert M.

description: Okay this place looks promising. Great views and very nice setting but the food is over priced and just ok.  The waiter was nice enough but not very attentive.  After finding out we weren't too hungry and ordering light, he didn't rerun to offer water at all. My husband had a salad and soup.  The soup was room temperature and the lettuce was not that fresh. I had the Baby Greens Salad, which was very good and earned the two stars just by itself.  The Lobster Bisque was OK, but nothing special and had a large piece of shell in it so I subtracted a star because of that.  All in all, the li cation is great if you're staying on Fisher Man's Wharf and need to eat, but the food and service are lack luster.
author: Mary A.

description: I usually don't post reviews but felt that I had to because of the truly awful experience. It took over an hour for our entrees to be served. When they finally arrived several dishes were cold. The items were sent back only to be returned luke warm and inedible. Also the room we were seated in was freezing. It felt like the air conditioner was on despite being a cold December evening. As a San Franciscan native I would never return or recommend this restaurant.
author: Gina H.

description:
Go to the Bar for Happy Hour.   We've become fans of looking for restaurants with a great happy hours.   In the overpriced tourist driven fisherman's wharf area, we stumbled on McC & K on our last visit to the Bay Area.

At 3PM the service was friendly and attentive,  the drinks (beer and wine) were reasonable.   And the appetizers  were great.   

Value, quality, and service.  It was great.
author: Robert B.

description: we were here for father's day today.  we walked in without reservations and was surprised to see that it wasn't busy.   now, we understand.  the view was  great , however, the food was surprisingly disappointing.  the snapper with ginger was very salty.  the salmon was very salty.  my friend's son ordered a stead medium and it came out well done.  gross.  I guess location doesn't always translate to quality.   would not recommend it.
author: C N.

description: Had a cioppino with white wine and garlic sauce with a side of pasta. It was a disappointment! Both items were full of butter! Everyone at the table had to skim off the thick layer of butter. This is extremely unhealthy......way over what is acceptable for restaurant foods! See pictures below for yourself. Your blood vessels are screaming for help after eating that bowl of butter. I rinsed the food with water...With $$$, I won't come back for a good while.
author: Elm E.

description:
When traveling, I prefer to eat at local restaurants, not chains. However, I was assured by my fellow work colleagues that McCormick & Kuleto's was different. How right they were, but not for the reason you'd expect.

Full disclosure -- I've eaten at several McCormick & Schmick's. I've dined at the Atlanta location probably half a dozen times over the last few years. One thing guaranteed at good chain restaurants is consistency. I've always had a decent experience at M&S. Not so M&K.

There are three redeeming qualities of this Bay area tourist trap. First, the location. Fisherman's Wharf offers excellent views of Maritime Park and the ocean. Second, the interior decor is quite lovely, with an upscale nautical theme. Finally, the drinks are excellent. I started with a ginger and lime caipirinha, and it was everything I'd hoped it would be -- strong, not too sweet, and quite refreshing. I'd planned to drink it with the appetizers our table ordered: oysters on the half shell; crab cakes; shrimp cocktail; mussels. Alas, my glass was drained, the sourdough bread basket was empty, and our entire group was reduced to sad, longing looks at the food trays that passed our table before our server returned. 

Except, it wasn't our server. It was someone, perhaps a manager, since she was not dressed like the other servers, coming over to take additional drink orders. Not to introduce herself, not to apologize for the 45-minute wait or explain the delay. Just to see if we'd care for anything else to drink. Curious.

After the drinks were delivered, our appetizers finally made their grand entrance. (Again, not by our original server.) As hungry as we were, we should have been overjoyed with the presentation of the seafood platters. Unfortunately, the oysters were uncleaned and gritty. Tasty enough, but for the price they should have been more carefully plated. The mussels with chorizo were decent, but I could have used more sourdough bread to sop up the sauce. (Service disappeared again as soon as the plates were down.) The crab cakes and shrimp were so-so, and so not worth the price.

We were all ready to hit Ghirardelli's for dessert when our entrees finally showed. The restaurant boasts their cioppino is the best in San Francisco, but my table-mates disagreed. The seafood was good and fresh, but the sauce was on the weird side, with little of the rich tomato broth in sight. My sashimi entree was okay - the local salmon was the tastiest of the three fish served - but for the price it was a disappointment. Sensing a trend here? 

We skipped coffee and dessert in favor of Ghiradelli's. It turned out to be the right call.

Bad service, unexceptional and inconsistent seafood dishes, and high prices. Also, great views, lovely decor, and fine libations. Your call.
author: Maria S.

description:
I had dinner at McC&K for a professional event recently.  It was a sponsored event so I can't comment on prices or value, but thought it would be useful to give an evaluation of food quality and service.

The dinner was served buffet style and I tried a bit of everything.  Spinach salad was a welcome sight and I loaded up on uniformly fresh leaves full of iron and B vitamins.  The roasted vegetables and the garlic roasted potatoes were good.  But the main dishes of chicken and fish were tasteless.  A good chicken breast is tender enough to be cut with a fork, but it took maximum force from my massive triceps to cut this one with a fork.  The desert was a tall, light tiramisu, which was good, but could have been better if served chilled instead of at room temperature and slowly tilting over like the leaning tower of pizza.   

And that brings up service.  It was bad to the point of being comical.  All of the food at the buffet was cooked, but by the time it was served it was room temperature (and they did not use anything to warm it at the buffet). The tiramisu had been sitting awhile before serving also.  I could not communicate with any of the waiters in English and had to give my empty dinner plate to one of them to make room to move the desert in front of me.  Final blunder was the waiter who reached over 2 people to pour coffee for one of our group.  My impression was not that the wait staff was lazy or ill-mannered but that they just didn't know any better.

The views from the massive glass windows and the spaciousness created by the high ceilings saved McC&K at NorthPoint from a 1 star rating.  Simply training the staff to serve food at an edible temperature would get another star (assuming the prices are reasonable).
author: K K.

description: The service was not equivalent to the pricing. Did not offer another drink, did not come to refill the water. It's supposed to be an upscale restaurant but it wasn't
author: Briana R.

description:
Came here with my wife for our anniversary dinner last week. Everything from welcome to drinks to food to service was great. I see a lot of people on here giving this restaurant two-three stars and voicing their complaints. But I guess to each their own.

My parents recently stopped by their downtown San Jose location called McCormick & Schmick's and enjoyed it too.
author: Vlad F.

description: I have been here numerous times in the past. Last weekend, being my most recent visit, my boyfriend and I, had lunch.  We had oysters and calamari for appetizers. The oysters were fresh and delicious. It didn't have that soapy ocean flavor to it. We then, had the snapper and halibut along with the sauteed mushrooms and mashed potatoes. The ginger lime sauce for the snapper was really tasty and a perfect pair for the fish. Overall, our experience was great.
author: Anna N.

description: Came here for a late dinner last Thursday night.  The restaurant is in a great location and very pretty.  Ordered the crab cakes which were really good, but aesthetically I wish they weren't covered in fried parsnips so I could actually see them!  I tried my friend's shrimp entree and they were totally overcooked and rubbery.  Very disappointing.  But one thing I thought was delicious was the gnocchi in pesto.  The loved the pesto and it was my first time having gnocchi.  Yum!  All in all I had a good time here.  I'm not sure what the bill ended up being so I can't speak much about the value, but I don't recall the entrees being too overpriced.  A nice restaurant to check out if you're in the neighborhood!
author: Elena N.

description:
This past weekend, we ate at McCormick & Kuleto's to celebrate my daughter's birthday.  I opted for this restaurant since it's in Ghiradelli Square and we were going Crown & Crumpet later that afternoon.

The views offered are gorgeous.  Being able to look out at the ocean with the beautiful weather we were having Sunday afternoon while enjoying good company is a plus to any meal.

The service we had was great.  Out waitress was very courteous and friendly, always checked to make sure that we were taken care of.  

I ordered the 6 oz. filet mignon, which was a bit disappointing.  I ordered it medium well but when I cut into the meat, there was no pink to be found anywhere.  While this did make it safe for me to share my meal with my one year old son, it was disappointing that they did not get my order correct.  The veggie salad that came with the filet was tasty, but a bit too soggy.

I was shocked to see that the restaurant doesn't already add gratuity to the bill if you have a group.

The service was great, but I've eaten at Cheesecake Factories with better food and better prices.
author: Janina M.

description:
We received a warm greeting and were seated quickly despite being an hour early for our reservation. Had listed it was an early birthday celebration and received special menus we could keep. :-) 

However, we did not get the view of the bridge as requested and the service was the worst I've had in years! Especially for being a high end restaurant that KNEW we were celebrating.  I would not recommend for a special night out. Future trips to SF will not include this establishment.
author: Shannon S.

description:
It was our 2nd visit yesterday,  to have lunch...  I saw they have added a "tapas" menu...Great addition.. We ordered fingerling potatoes with smoked trout and creme fraiche...One of the most delicious bites I have ever put in my mouth... Then , we had the candied pears and blue cheese...Divine..

Our entree, which my friend and I split, was an amazing pasta. Dungeness Crab Strozzapretti Pasta -
 Pt. Reyes Blue Cheese, Rusticella D'Abruzzo Pasta, Walnuts and Sugar Snap Peas.. I can only reccomend you try this dish. I did a happy dance when it hit my tongue.
Londa was our server, and service was excellent...Never mind the fantastic view. This restaurant is so much better than the tourist  traps down the street.. And the list of types of seafood on the menu is extensive... I will return again and again.. My rating may even go up after I go at dinner time...
author: ToniLee F.

description:
The view here of SF Bay from their lower dining area can'tbe beat. Above average food. But it ain't cheap. Excellent service though. Our party of 6 got a windowside table on a Sunday afternoon without a wait.

The sashimi sampler plate (6 pieces, $24) was outstanding, especiacially the celery/cucumber topping that came with the ginger & wasabi. 
 
I was visiting from Texas, and wanted the tourist standard - clam chowder in a sour dough bread bowl. It was great. I had some of my wife's salmon BLT. Nice piece of fish on toasted bread and a generous amount of bacon.

We all enjoyed the meal. If you want an upscale meal with a view and don't ming. Shelling out a little denaro, this might be a place for you...
author: Scott B.

description:
+ :
 this place has an amazing view!
 It has an elegant ambiance.
Our waiter was nice and friendly.
- :
Food is nothing extraordinary. The best thing on our table was the Cesar salad. It wasn't decorated but it had a great taste.
My friend liked the clam chowder soup.
We ordered shrimp scampi and halibut.
The texture of both dishes was great it was cooked very well. The decoration was 3 out of 5. And taste was 2 out of 5.
I didn't like the behavior of the receptionist.
He wasn't friendly at all :( common man! I was expecting a little more kindness :P
I'm not sure if I go there again or recommend it to my friends.
author: Shirin Z.

description:
Oct 4, 2015 - Brunch
My wife and I decided for a late breakfast as we toured San Francisco and decided to go here for a bite to eat.  It is located in Ghiradeli Square, near the water on Beach Street.  We were given a nice table for two along the windows with an incredible view.  OK, enough, onto the food.

FOOD: Excellent.  We started with a bowl of the Crab & Corn Chowder soup.  To die for!!  Excellent flavor, consistency and loaded with crab meat.  Not over powered with corn.  We split the bowl - plenty, as it is very rich.

Ordered a smoked salmon eggs benedict and my wife ordered a crab stuffed omelette.  Both were outstanding.  Very well prepared and excellent presentation.  The was no shortage of smoked salmon on the benedict.  Hollandaise sauce was excellent too.

Each came with home fries - well seasoned, perfectly prepared

My wife's omellette was overstuffed with crab meat, tomatoes and cheese.  She really enjoyed it.

DRINK: Bloody Marys were the drink of choice and what an excellent choice it was.  Well seasoned and topped with olives, onion, lime and stalk of celery.  And only $6.00 each for about a 16 oz. glass.  

SERVICE:  Waiter was knowledgable, friendly and accommodating.  Service was just right.

AMBIENCE: quiet, great views of harbor, water and a glimpse of the Golden Gate Bridge.

QUANTITY: More than enough - very generous servingsb - drink and food

VALUE: Excellent.
author: Frederick K.

description: Went here for a drink with the wife. Great dirty martini and lemon drop, wonderful view. I then asked the bartender for something a little different and I'm picky. He made me a gin gimlet with basil it's my new favorite. Bradley was an excellent bartender very knowledgable.
author: Chris D.

description: This place has a beautiful view of the water, just a glimpse of the bridge but the view is well worth it. Our waitress was very helpful and knew the menu well which was full of fresh fish/seafood items and some turf choices if that's your deal. Tons of craft drinks, Mirco brews, and a full wine selection. Also it's right next ghiradelly's square so great place to walk around and get some sweets after
author: Zach M.

description:
Fantastic daytime view - just gorgeous. Excellent service - every single person was friendly and polite. Clean. Sound level was perfect...didn't have to shout to hear each other. The drinks were perfectly made. Everything was comfortable and tasty and nice.

And the clam chowder was in my personal top 3. Fresh, tasty, perfect. 

Each McCormick restaurant has it's own personality - I really love this one.
author: Angela L.

description:
Had dinner here the other night as part of my friend's bachelorette party weekend and I was really looking forward to the food after reading the menu. We started with the crab cake and calamari which were both good (I liked the crab cake more). 

For my entree, I ordered the 8 oz. filet mignon and requested that it was cooked medium-rare. When it came it out, it looked delicious! However, when I cut into the corner of it, it was pretty well-done. I thought, "Okay, that was just the thin corner so the middle should be perfect." I cut straight into the middle to check and it was medium-well (dry-ish pink in the middle, not juicy at all). I brought this to our server's attention who took it back to the kitchen. My friend got the 9 oz. top sirloin and requested medium-rare but her's came out medium-well too (they took hers back also).

It was probably at most another 15-20 minutes for our replacements to come out. They served the sirloin first and it was perfect. Mine took another minute to come out and it looked okay at first. I cut into one portion, more -- pink than the first one I was served. I decided to cut into the thickest part to make my conclusion and it was still medium-well. How is it possible to mess up a filet mignon TWICE?! I tried to eat some but it didn't taste good at all. 

The manager or general manager came to find out if the replacements were more to our expectation and I flat out said, "No." I showed him that it was still overcooked. He apologized for the inconvenience again and offered to have another one made. I declined as most of my friends were already done with their food and that I'd just eat the vegetables served with the filet mignon. To be honest, I don't think the third would have been any better. He then offered to comp any desserts we wanted.

So there's that.

For desert, the rest of my friends shared an espresso creme brulee which was so-so. I had a slice of blueberry cheesecake for myself which was pretty good. We were given our bill and looked over the deductions. We noticed that I was still getting partially charged for the filet mignon and needed to let our server know. While waiting for her to come back around, I started to get severe stomach pains. I had to excuse myself to the restroom and that was not a fun experience. We were able to get the bill figured out in the end but I ended up getting sick from something. The pains continued until after I returned to our hotel which was about an hour and a half after we all ate.

Just a bad and disappointing experience. The wait staff was very polite so that's why it's 2-stars.
author: Kristina L.

description: This place looked cool. My Fiance and I went, they took our order, took an hour and 10 minutes to get our food, then when it was brought, my food was cold. They never offered to comp anything. Won't be going back.
author: Darien W.

description:
My boyfriend took me here for our anniversary and our overall experience here was great. We were seated in a booth facing the ocean and the Maritime Park. I really enjoyed the atmosphere of the restaurant. The lights were dimmed and we even had our own lamp on our table. 

We ordered the White Clam Linguini and the Hawaiian Tombo Tuna. Both dishes were very good and the price was decent considering it's a seafood restaurant.

I would most likely come here again in the future :)
author: Michelle S.

description:
I decided to come here since it was close to where I got some ice cream and I didn't want to travel very far to get a meal. When I came here I was hoping that this was not part of the McCormick and Schmick chain. Ever since the chain was taken over last year by Landry's Restaurants the food has really gone down in terms of quality.

The restaurant is located in a fantastic place with stunning views of the Bay. However, that is where the great experience stops. I sat at the bar and I ordered the fish and chips. They used rock fish which was not a good choice. The fish was very bland so they used a heavy batter coating to try and add some flavor which it did not. I used to go to McCormick and Schmick in Los Angeles at least two to three times a month but haven't been back since the corporate take over. Unfortunately, I probably won't be returning to this restaurant as well.
author: Jim A.

description: Amazing views of the Bay. Mediocre & overpriced food. Service was enthusiastic and friendly. They have a premium spot in front of the Bay, and don't seem to work too hard on the flavors and originality of the menu.
author: candide o.

description:
Not great value. 

Service: 4.
Food: 3

We went for lunch, and the entrees were priced around $20. It was decent quality but seriously we could have had better. It's a chain, no particular dish stood out.

It's convenient because it is located near The Tech Museum
author: Ian L.

description:
My wife & I decided to chow here due to location & view (plus another) ... and we were definitely not disappointed.  We had reservations for two & were promptly seated at the time reserved.  My wife wanted a seat near the window, but the gentleman seating us stated all the tables had a great view ... and again we were not disappointed (we actually had an intimate curved benched seat located on the second deck overlooking the window tables, so in actuality it had a better view & was more private).  My wife had the seared scallops & she loved it.  I had the lamb & this was the only minus of the Nite ... It really wasn't that good (just a bit too chewy for my liking).  All in all ... It was a fantastic evening for us.  We weren't looking to be blown away from the food ... but, we were looking for a great view & to be treated well since we actually worked hard for a the money spent.  Kudos to the crew!  The Service, the view, & the chow were great. And Thank you Marybeth for the great hospitality.  

*On a side note we attempted to make reservations to the Slanted Door 2hrs prior & were scoffed at & treated as if we were idiots.  Visiting from San Diego we didn't realize the high demand to chow here ... but, it was pretty lame & unprofessional of the young lady to treat us like that.  I get it ... it's a happening badass place, but Cmon guys show some class.
