I give it up to the manager (Michele) for basically doing her job & trying to do damage control, but there's absolutely no reason for anybody to be treated that way ... especially if it's unwarranted & over freaken food!  So again,
Thank you "McCormicks & Kuletos" for saving our 15th anniversary date Nite
author: Manori O.

description:
I called Sales Mgr. Linda Ligouiri the day before and set up a birthday dinner for my wife and her party of six ladies.  When seated, the party got a panoramic window seating.  Linda provided a beautiful B-Day Card, a menu that had a birthday wish and her name on it and every staff that came to the table ask for my wife by name and made presentations to honor her. Service was A+ to say the least.

The food came in a timely manner and presentation was very nice.  All the ladies loved the food that they ordered .  Your restaurant made the day very special.  We along with the ladies who came from Los Angeles will always recommend this restaurant.
author: T N.

description: Slow service, annoying loud bad music. Food was pretty good. Nice variety. Great view.
author: Carolyn H.

description:
Fabulous view, tasteful food and excellent service. 
We came in for dinner with party of five and no reservation. Successfully seated on the best table with the best view with only less than 10 minutes wait. 
Our server was very friendly and informative in helping us with the menu. 
Highly recommended!
author: Lidia H.

description:
Great views on nice days...and even not nice days.

We went here for wine and apps between meals after the San Fran Marathon.  It was a beautiful day and we just ordered small plates but they were tasty  I considered this above McCormick and Schmick's.  I'd say the tuna quality was better and the wine list is better.
author: Rich V.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here to celebrate my birthday.   I made opentable reservations and asked if we could have a nice table with a view since it was my birthday.   When we arrived, the restaurant seemed pretty empty, two tables in the bar area, and a few in the dining room.  The hostess greeting us with a smile and showed us to our table with a nice view of the Bay.  Only after I sat down that I noticed that on my menu said Happy Birthday_(My name)__!   That was a nice special touch.  

For the food, he ordered the salmon club with fries.   It was good, but nothing over the top.  The salmon had nice grill marks and the bacon complimented the sandwich.   Some of the fries had too much salt.  Would've been nice if there were other herbs like parsley or rosemary to season the fries than just salt. 

I ordered the pork chop with sauteed mixed veggies.  Again, good but not something to crave over.   The chop was nicely grilled, but was on the salty side.  The vegetable were all julienne and did not have that much flavor.   The cuts were not uniformed and there were large pieces of bell peppers that did nothing for the dish, but add color.  

Order the Margarita from the curly mustache bartender. Yum!!
author: Myra E.

description:
Stopped by for a late night bite in the bar area. Initially crowded at 9:30, but cleared out pretty quickly. There was a large group of loud women that treated the bartender like a stripper... Other than that, it was a nice chill atmosphere. Server was good and quick. Drinks came out pretty weak. She mentioned that they had ran out of Jameson and will definitely have the bartender add another complimentary shot. 
Raw oyster were good. We had some small ones that the name i do not recall. Just trusted the server. The crab and mango salad was ok. Not enough crab. The chiopino was good. Lots and lots of seafood. I would have liked more broth. The star if the night was the steam clams. The broth was delicious. Add a little drawn butter and some bread, and you are all set. I could have drank the whole thing. 
All in all, a great place for a bite. Would probably only return if we stayed at the Fairmont again.
author: Danny S.

description: Good food while taking in the sunset over the bay can't get much better.
author: Donna P.

description:
After a full day of sight seeing and being on my feet, this was a perfect place to grab a quick happy hour before my dinner. 

McCormick & Kuleto is located in the Ghiradelli Square which is perfect when you need a cold vodka/soda ($5). They offered many appetizers at reasonable prices such as cheeseburgers and calamari. But save your appetite for other San Francisco known restaurants compared to a chain like this.
author: Santi T.

description:
Due to unexpected circumstances, both my partner and I found ourselves off work for the next 2 weeks.  So we chose to view this time as our vacation and play tourists in our own 'backyard' (neighborhood).  With that mindset, we entered McCormick and Kuleto's yesterday mid-afternoon.  

The last time we were here was when we celebrated Thanksgiving with my mom and 2 of my sisters a few years back.  My memory of the place was pleasant, though being a properly snobby San Franciscan, I thought we should leave these types of establishments for the tourists, not for us locals who are more in-the-know.

However, since we are being tourist-y, why not do what a tourist would?  The moment we entered the restaurant, we were immediately entranced with the sweeping view of the bay and the adjacent Marin Headland and Angel Island, shrouded in a film of clouds.  What we didn't know was that they have Happy Hour, 3-6pm, Mon.-Fri.!  I ended up having the cheeseburger with fries.  A 1/2 lb. burger that is quite tasty and juicy, even if they served it well-done after I told our waitress that I wanted it medium rare when she asked.  But for $4, it's really unbeatable.  My partner ordered their steamed clams and steamed mussels, both at $6 per order.  She also really enjoyed both her selections.  

With the breathtaking panorama that the restaurant provides and  such affordable HH prices, I say, fellow locals, you owe it to yourself to be a "tourist" for a few hours and give this place a try.  I know we'll be back!
author: Yvette F.

description: Not a great experience, rude bartending staff. Only thing good about this place was the views.
author: Susan F.

description: I coordinated a private dining experience recently here. Kristin was prompt and responsive and so easy to work with. She made our experience exactly as we wanted and I would highly recommend anyone who needs a private dining room to make this location your choice. My colleagues and I can't wait to have another dinner here.
author: Ashley T.

description:
Well, it's been a week since we dined here on New Year's Eve.  Let me just say, I've worked in the industry for 8 years and I've never seen, nor heard of an experience quite like mine.  May I share?

The restaurant is beautiful, but actually reminded us of a cruise ship.  We were seated at our table right away, despite being late for our 7:00 reservation.  Once we were seated, I asked the hostess to show me to the restroom.  She led me across the hardwood floors towards the stairs and as I took my first step, I slipped and fell down all 6 stairs in my fancy New Year's gown.  It was embarrassing and very painful.  The hostess and one of the servers asked me if I was okay and all I wanted to do was escape to the bathroom to hide.

When I returned to the table my left hip was radiating with heat and I was very shaky.  The server said he heard me fall.  When I mentioned that the floor was slippery he responded sarcastically, "Oh, so it's our fault you fell."  I didn't care for that remark.

The Oysters and Crab Cakes were excellent.  The cucumber martini was also delicious.  I ordered the Chef's Duck special and my husband ordered a filet with Point Reyes blue cheese.  Both were good, not great.

When we received our bill ($300 with 25% tip for 3 people - we never skimp on the server's tip, especially on a holiday) I was surprised that nobody had come by the table to make sure I was alright.  I wasn't looking for sympathy, nor for my bill to be discounted, but come on!!!  In these situations a manager needs to check on the guest to make sure everything is okay.  I left very disappointed and very bruised.

For the next 2 days I was in bad shape and it hurt to walk.  I am now sitting on my left cheek because I am black and blue on the right side.  My experience just goes to show that this restaurant does not care about its guests.  We won't be back anytime soon.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Based on all the bad reviews I have read AFTER I ate there, I almost thought I was lying to myself about my experience there. But I wasn't. Some people are just hard to please, apparently.

I took my girlfriend to SF from LA for a quick get away for a few days. We stumbled upon this place on complete accident, but I really wanted to take her there. We went back to the hotel, made reservations for 8:30, and came back for a late dinner. Upon arrival, I was more than pleased with how beautiful the restaurant was inside. Very classy. For reference, yes, it is a little pricey, but you pay for what you get. Our waitress was a woman from Russia who was very pleasant! I am younger (25, my girl is 23) so we definitely get the age discrimination when we go out, but this woman was so sweet, and I didn't feel "left out" or "ignored." (I'm a great tipper btw, so the sweeter you are, the more you get. Fortunately for her, she found that out).

We started with a Caesar Salad which was delicious, and we both decided on getting the Stuffed Atlantic Salmon (her and I basically share a brain) with Dungeness Crab, Bay Shrimp, Argula, Sun Dried Tomatoes, Peppers, and Brie Cheese. She got a side of Mashed Potatoes, and I got steamed asparagus. Oh my goodness, my mouth is watering just thinking about it right now. The food was incredible.

I was so impressed with the quality of the salmon. It, not exaggerating, melted in my mouth. The quality of the food was so great, and was well worth the price. I read some reviews stating this was a "tourist trap" and they jack up the prices for that reason, but sometimes you have to realize that you ARE paying a little for that location. With that said, I walked away so satisfied with my experience, that the $120 dollars I paid (Including tip) didn't even phase me. That is tough to leave somewhere spending that much money on a dinner for two feeling fully satisfied. Thank you! I will return next time I am in SF.
author: Chris S.

description:
Had a 7:00 reservation and didn't get our food until 9:30 pm.

Service left a lot to be desired...
author: George S. W.

description:
Had dinner here with my parents and my mother has request I put in this review on her behalf:

"For 10yrs my husband & I have dinned at this fine restaurant at least 2-3 times a year for our birthdays & anniversary. The highlight to my meals here woulds always be dessert; specifically their "Chocolate Bag" item. 

Just imagine... a chocolate bag filled with chocolate mousse, topped with whipped cream, fresh mixed berries, and drizzled with a berry sauce. The perfect dish to satisfy the Chocoholic that I am!

But what a disappointment it was tonight discover within the first two bites they have reduced this dish to a LIGHT chocolate cream (which seemed more light whipped cream) and fresh fruit in a chocolate bag. Don't get me wrong our server, Mathew, was GREAT and his manager were very nice and sorry about my disappointment & did explain it was a recent change to lighten up the dish. Which I do understand menu changes due to seasonal items (that is way I am still giving a good rating,) but the "Chocolate Bag" is their main chocolate dessert item and being located within the Ghirardelli Square I would expect more from their chocolate dish.

Again... the service (Thank You Again Mathew!!!), appetizers, entrees, tequila, and wine were AMAZING! It was just so Sad my meal had ended on a sad note."
author: Alexandra A.

description:
I made reservations for my anniversary dinner last June (I let them know it was an anniversary dinner) and made just two special requests. 
1) A Booth Seat.
2) A View.
Not only did McCormick & Kuleto's get it right, they also had special headers on our menus saying, " Happy Anniversary"!! This was a big surprise; coupled with the amazing view and the perfect booth seat, McCormick & Kuleto's really made the night that much more special!! Not to mention, the food was fantastic! 

I would definitely recommend this restaurant to my friends.
author: Travis T.

description:
If you want to have an amazing view with your dinner this is the place to be. 
If you want amazing food, this is not exactly the place to be. 
The host was very pleasant and friendly when he sat us down but initially he did not greet us. We just waited and waited for him to acknowledge us. Finally I just went up to his stand and he said he was working on a table for us. It would be nice if he had told us that.
My boyfriend ordered the clam chowder. They add bacon to it which I found rather odd. 
I ordered the snapper with a lime sauce. The lime sauce overpowered the fish and the zucchini side that came with it was rather bland. The boyfriend had the scallops. He liked the cauliflower puree but left half of the scallops uneaten. 
The best part of the meal was the carrot cake we had for dessert. 
I guess we won't be returning anytime soon.
author: Sophia C.

description: We had my daughter's wedding reception here. From the planning to the big day they were so helpful. Kaori helped us with the planning, decision making and was very clear on their expectations.  They allowed us to drop off 3 large bins of decorations and they did all the decorating the morning of the wedding. And they did it perfectly. It was the perfect location for photos - the bride & groom even had their picture taken on a cable car! All the staff worked hard to meet our every need and make sure the day went smoothly. This is the perfect San Francisco venue with delicious food and beautiful views. Plus it's nice to have the parking garage right underneath so people don't have to circle around looking for street parking.
author: Laura S.

description:
We had a great meal here!  Together with my husband and my parents we had:

- carpaccio appetizer
- Mahi Mahi
- Scallops
- Seared Ahi Tuna
- Creme Brulee

And multiple drinks.....

I absolutely loved my Mahi Mahi.  It was encrusted with macadamia nuts and served with plantains.  Literally, one of the best meals I've had in a long time. It tasted buttery and nutty.  Yummy!!!!

Our waiter was great!  Once he realized that my husband and father were going to give him a hard time, he was teasing us back.  They absolutely loved it!  The service was a great speed, not too rushed, but I always felt like we had food on our table.  The only bad thing was how much food I ate!!!
author: Daryl S.

description: Great service. The food expected and mediocre. The wine/beer selection average, the bread not warm/normal, the calamari average. The red snapper was on the verge of being dry and the medium-rare steak was more than medium. The vegetable sides were the same for both plates.....and the strawberry ny cheesecake tasted out of a box :(. The staff was very accommodating but there was nothing impressive about the food/drink. Eh. At least we tried it once!
author: Zara S.

description: Nice view. Expensive and less than average food. Fish and chips full of oil. Good derive which does not compensate for the mediocre food.
author: Yaron T.

description:
The wait staff is outstanding! The food is incredibly delicious! The environment is very classy yet not enough to be obnoxious. The prices are waaaaaaay too high and very elitist so really if you're interested in a dinner for two under 200 dollars, go elsewhere. 

But you'll love it. Come and dine and drink, watch the sunset over the bay, stay a while. 

It's right in Giridelli Square and gets crowded.
author: Kim P.

description:
Five stars for the view, five stars for the service and five stars for the food. 
Why oh why can't you guys be closer to me :(

Came in to have lunch and what a great experience it was. 

The only issue is the parking but just like all sf there's not much... after this you can take the trolley or walk the museums :)
author: Javer X.

description:
The view and location is great, but the food was average and the service below that.  

My water was never refilled until i asked and the waitress bearly came to check on us.  

The lobster bisque was great and probably our favorite thing here.  The crusted Mahi was not very flavorble  and was just okay.

Overall In a city on the bay, I'm sure I can find a restaurant with better food and better service easily
author: Salim G.

description: So glad I didn't see the ratings before our visit. We ended our evening here after a long day in SF. The atmosphere was relaxing. The ambiance was extravagant and elegant. The service was great. Although the waiter was forgetful a couple of times and forgot our bread refill and our add-on lobster, he was still very cordial.  The lobster bisque was amazing and we enjoyed the escargo. The escargo bread was crisp, which was unique, but tasty.  Blueberry cheesecake to end the night. Overall we were delighted and would return and recommend.
author: Lori G.

description: Very good service and great sea food. The view of the Bay was incredible. Well worth the money.
author: Bradley V.

description: I was hesitant to eat here based on the low rating here on yelp, but I had no say.  I actually didn't mind the food that I ordered while sitting at the bar.  You can order from the full menu, but the bar menu had decently priced selections.  I chose the spanish tortilla with mushroom, spinach, and cheese.  In Spain, a tortilla is like a thick omelette, so I was kind of disappointed when I saw my paper-thin omelette on the plate.  Even though it wasn't authentic, I thought it tasted fine and for the price ($6), I really couldn't complain.
author: Jenn C.

description: I came here for lunch with come family friends and McCormick's has improved over the years. The service was on point and the restaurant has a beautiful view, but the food was hit or miss. There were some really good dishes. I personally recommend the dungeonous crab tower as the appetizer. As for my main course, I had ordered a crab and shrimp sandwich. It was okay, not bad, but not spectacular. It was a little heavy and I couldn't finish the entire thing. I think maybe if I ordered something else, I would have enjoyed the meal more. Overall, I do think this place is worth another try and I would come back. Also the dishes are huge, which makes up for the expensive prices. I'd recommend maybe sharing an entree with someone since the portions are so huge.
author: Laura C.

description: If I could give this place zero stars I would.  For the price I'm paying I expect to be treated w respect and the food to be amazing. Waiter was rude. I asked for medium prime rib because the waiter recommended it. I got beef jerky. I've never had worse prime rib in my life. Go anywhere else. Go to a hot dog stand and enjoy a decent meal.
author: Emanuel R.

description:
Say what you will about a juggernaut chain restaurant in San Francisco, but McCormick & Kuleto's does a pretty bang up job along the water's edge in Ghirardelli Square. 

Of the hundreds of McCormicks locations that exist across the United States of America, this is one of a handful that's actually locally owned and operated. You see, Pat Kuleto is a legendary fixture in the SF restaurant scene, and with his name attached to the project, it takes less of a corporate structure, and adheres itself to a local frame of mind. So for those who wouldn't dream of stepping foot inside due to the horrific notion of supporting something other than a mom and pop operation, rest assured you actually are supporting something with a local tie in.

With that being said, there's a lot to love about this particular establishment. They have a kick ass happy hour that's always changing, but it's always guaranteed to be an amazing deal, and the views of the San Francisco Bay from the northern area of the leeway can't be beat. Seriously, the glances you take in from the Captain's Room and the Bayview Room are rivaled by nobody in this 7X7 stretch of land we occupy. On a nice day, a hearty meal and a glass of bubbly by the large bay windows are just the thing to put you in the mood for an easy, breezy day on the coast. 

Parking in the area can be a bit of a nightmare, so plan accordingly, or better yet... be kind to the environment and take a bus!
author: Ruggy J.

description: Love this place. i am a member. My friend and i have appetizers here once a month. great food, service, staff, and awesome bartenders. Will never stop eating here.
author: Kimberly S.

description:
The view here was great. My wife and I brought my parents here for late lunch/ early dinner. 

The food left much to be desired. We ordered the steak medium rare, and it came out well done, and room temperature. 

We left this place really disappointed with the food.
author: Jamie L.

description:
We're locals and have eaten here before with pleasant success.
Not today. There are still great views, but be careful of the menu. We brought guest and three of us ordered a seared ahi sandwich. We were very disappointed when it came as processed tuna with mayo on seared sourdough. I asked if it was Ahi? And that I'd expected a fillet. The waitress said it's Ahi and dismissed the question. Nothing special and will not be back anytime soon.
author: John H.

description: Dirty dishes.  Obnoxious host.  Spoiled lettuce.  I guess it's impressive they got "blue cheese on a wedge of lettuce" correct.  A good view, and certainly easy & safe for tourists.
author: Scott C.

description:
Came here with a large party and the place was surprisingly empty for dinner service. The restaurant is pretty and I'm sure the view would be lovely during the daytime. The service was generally good but I thought the solicitation to join their loyalty club was kind of awkward. 

As for the food, the delicious included the Miyagi oysters, beet salad, clams, crab cakes and most of the fish entrees (some salmon iterations and one of the white fish). I'd say the scallops were just okay for $30 - I received two large scallops and two small ones, and the cauliflower mash it came with was too heavy and buttery. I was also told the steaks were average as well. Stay away from the cioppino though - tons of limp calamari and the soup was a bit too tart for my liking. 

I would have given it 4 stars if the prices were more reasonable, but I think if you're going to charge $30-$40 per entree, your food should be pretty amazeballs. Would def come back to try out their lauded happy hour, though! 

PARKING: They validate in the Ghiradelli square garage for 90 minutes for $2 and then usual pricing after that. Don't know what the usual pricing is, but I think 90 minutes is definitely not long enough for dinner. You might have to meter it.

TIP: You can get two $50 gift cards at Costco for $80, and they let you stack them. We used 8 of them. EIGHT. NOM.
author: Jenny J.

description: Food is good. View is amazing. Service is shocking - in sincere, fake smiles and verging on rude.
author: Chris L.

description:
Aweful. The service was horrible, food ok.
Who has one waiter , waiting on  4 tables of 
6 - 10 people?  The whole experience was aweful. The host was rude and maybe should have helped out

.
author: elaine c.

description: We went with a group of 17 and we had one server, the view is great, food is average and comparable to any higher end chain restaurant, the real issue in my mind is the bad service, when you entertain  a group of people and you spend over $2500 the last thing you want your group to talk about is the bad service and how they have to wait 15 minutes to get a drink! Or how they have to wait for every thing, this restaurant has a lot to build on but it has to fix the poor service issues!
author: Adam H.

description: We like this restaurant because of the view and service. The food is pricey, and there may be better restaurants, but not with a view like this. From host, to bar, to servers, everyone is attentive and professional. I love the soothing and muted decor, there isn't a bad seat in the house. Our meals have always been better than average.
author: LB G.

description:
If you want a good fish dish, this place will satisfy your fish cravings! My bf and I came here a while back on a Saturday night for dinner.  We just walked in and were seated promptly.  The waiter took our order and served us our drinks.  Very normal. 

My bf and I were just chatting away about our wonderful day in SF.  Since were were so into our conversations, we didn't notice that maybe, just maybe, 20 minutes went by? All of a sudden, we were greeted by one of the chefs that came to our table.  He started talking to us which I then noticed slowly became an apology? An apology that our food was accidentally delivered to another party and we would have to wait just a few more minutes.  We were totally fine and thought an apology from the chef was just not necessary at all.

Our dishes came out minutes after the Chef talked to us and it was delicious.  Mango salsa paired with any fish is always a home-run in my book! Then, we got desserts as planned.  

When the bill came, we were stunned that they took 50% off our bill plus FREE desserts?! Very pleased.
author: Cindy T.

description: As an industry couple from Las Vegas..we expected a lot from a nice looking place like this. Unfortunately, this place was a big let down..service was the worst I've very had, and I had to complain to a manager for the first time in my life. No surprise, what a let down again..I guess complaining doesn't mean you'll get anything fixed. Manager was nice but nice doesn't improve service. I will not be visiting this place ever again.
author: Daniel E.

description:
Mediocre food, stinky mussels and so-so service.

But on top of that - they don't like returning customers! We came there for a drink during the day and decided to return for dinner. Then my husband gave them a credit card to pay - the server made a comment "that this card was already used here today and she needs to check if it was stolen!!"  Is she just stupid or RACIST??

I will inform all my foodies community about it.
author: Galina B.

description:
This review is only for the happy hour food and service!

Food: 4.5 stars
Service: 2.5 stars
Overall: 3.5 stars

--refer to pictures!--

1) Deviled Eggs (with truffle oil and tobiko caviar)--  $1.95
This is small, but freaking delicious. 

2) Half Pound Cheeseburger-- $2.95
The bread was burned crisp and dry. It taste like an average burger,  nothing special but its price tag. 

3) Chicken Wings (chipotle sauce)-- $3.95
Too sweet and salty.

4) Steamed Manila Clams-- $4.95
You can definitely taste the wine in this, and the broth is delicious. Clams were small, but the sauce made up for it. 

5) Shrimp Nachos-- $4.95
My favorite nachos ever. I love how they made the chips; it's light and crisp, absolutely perfect. 

This place has a great view of the bay, but not so much if you're sitting at the happy hour bar area.

It is very pricey here for the regular priced food, but cheap during happy hours. Super cheap eats, but not so much for the alcohol. 

There was only one waitress during the happy hour, and she couldn't manage all the tables. My friend and I had a hard time just to flag her down for something, including the check. We felt neglected..

If you're parked at the Ghirardelli Square Garage, this place offers a validation coupon up to 90 minutes, and you would only pay $2.25.

In conclusion: Cheap eats + good food= will come back again!
author: Sandy T.

description:
Nice place. Food is punching above its weight, and it's a bit pricey, but clearly you're also paying for the location and view.

We really liked our server, who volunteered to split our check (without us even asking!) and deftly handled our six person group. Very nice service all around, actually.
author: emma d.

description:
My boyfriend and I came without a Reservation and they were able to accommodate us right away. The hostess seemed very nice. 
After being seated we waited for our server for quite a while to come serve us. After he arrived he didn't make any pleasantries and went right into, "what can I get you guys?" 
Not Really What I Expected for a nice restaurant.  
I ordered the chicken and my boyfriend ordered the salmon. 
Our waiter then brought us some bread that resembled a french baguette, but it was so hard it was like cracking into cement :-/ 
Our dinner finally came and I sent back the spinach I had ordered a la carte, not knowing steamed veggies would be with it. Our waiter was accommodating and didn't seem to care. 
The chicken was good, yet almost flavorless. His salmon came with spinach and mushroom risotto on the side. He liked everything but the spinach (to me it seemed ok). 
We got dessert, creme brulee, and it was pretty good. A lot of places left un-flamed with raw sugar. But still creamy and good consistency. 
Our bill was $86. And we left thinking what the hell just happened?? Not worth it whatsoever. No.  Maybe for lunch one day for the view, otherwise it was a loss.
author: Jessica J.

description: Worst service I've ever had! Food below average! What a disappointment! A waste of one of our two nights in San Fransico!
author: Jennifer C.

description: This is one of my favorite places (if you are looking to impress your spouse). But honestly it is way to expensive. I rather a different place. Too fancy.
author: Allan S.

description:
I was disappointed about my lunch today, They had petrale sole listed as an SF classic.
I am used to it at Tadich's and expected same quality. NOT so--it comes out cooked in a parmesan cheese sauce, which was seemingly fried and thus burned. For a supposed fish house, it is a major disappointment for me, a Bay Area lifer. Moreover, the sides were few and so-so.
My wife had an a tasty salmon sandwich which she liked.
I ate her pineapple fruit dish, which helped offset the fried cheese/fish flavor.

The service was friendly, but very slow, especially for a business lunch and we had meetings to attend. The view is great but does offset my plate's taste. The executive chef needs to rethink this plate, or at least give choices for its preparation. We came away disappointed.

Parking: be sure to request validation. It was not volunteered.
author: D K.

description:
This restaurant boasts one of the best views in San Francisco.  Located in Ghirardelli Square, overlooking the Maritime Park, Hyde Street Pier, Aquatic Park and Alcatraxz in the distance, I love to nosh as the sun sets over the Golden Gate.

Although you can find better seafood in this wonderful coastal city, McCormick & Kuleto's does a great job preparing the finest available fresh seafood (menus change daily), and did I mention, "you can't beat the view"?

This is an elegant restaurant, but you should feel comfortable dressing casually since it is located next to the home of the Ghirardelli Chocolate Factory, a major tourist spot!

Service is always friendly and efficient, but plan on spending some time here to fully enjoy the ambience.
author: Mark O.

description:
Bomb ass surf and turf. Bring a lady here, start with martinis and you'll have her pants down buy the end of the nite!

Classy joint, not for losers or ugly people.
author: John C.

description:
I have to say, this restaurant has gone downhill. I used to prefer it because it was unlike so many of the other tourist traps in the wharf; now it has become one. It's way too expensive now. I don't know what happened, but if I understand correctly they got bought out about six months ago. Now everything is more expensive and the place lacks that personal vibe it used to have. I have sent so many tourists to this restaurant over the years, and I regret it. I went last week and the service was very apathetic, the food overpriced, and very average. It disappoints me how bad their business model is. Instead of taking care of the people who take care of them, McCormick & Kuleto's new owners have a macroeconomic approach, more interested in the bottom line than investing in how it is achieved. Fuck this restaurant.

Fog Harbor is way better.
author: Nate L.

description: Horrible waitstaff-Okay food.  A disappointment. Only in SF for two days and I feel I got robbed for dinner.
author: Steve G.

description: We made reservations for the 4th of July this year over 3 months in advance. We arrived at 7:45 for our 8pm reservation and were told they over booked the reservations. We were finally seated at 8:30 but it was not too bad because of the view. It was a great firework display and this is the best place to watch them. One issue we had is the "special" menu for the 4th. It seemed that the prices were all inflated for that night. My wife ordered the king crab legs $55. They were good but not $55 good. The rest of the food was similar. Good but not great. I'd like to try the restaurant on another night when you don't feel gouged just for the view.
author: Mark C.

description: Five star view, unfortunately my meal was slightly burned and the staff unattentive (I finished my drink before the main dish arrived the new one arrived well after I had finished.... I loved the view but doubt I will  be back.
author: Mark B.

description: When you go to a Restaurant for Christmas you look for the best in everything: food, service but also Christmas Spirit. None of them we found. The service the worst, it was late, but very late, missing Plates, did not retrieve glasses and plates from the table, so bad. The food was cold, it took so long between plates, and not even close to what we expected when we choose this rest for Christmas. But worst the way they treat us on this special day. It's better if they don't open rather than do this awful job. They must ensure the people that work during this holidays understand the importance of their commitment to quality in food and service. I decide not to get angry yesterday but also decide to let them know they ruin my Christmas dinner. Not recommended specially if you plan to go on New Year's Eve
author: Blanca D.

description: The wife and I think is a lite over rated! Food was average no taste on shrimp pasta  or fish :(! Or maybe I'm to picky?? Now the boulevard Resturant DAM that was good, but no beautiful sunset view like McCormick !! I think u pay for the view not for the food!
author: Serg B.

description: Wine selection is about it. Nothing more regarding food or service! Steer clear and look elsewhere!
author: Aaron W.

description: We had a great waiter and the service was excellent. The problem is the food is getting mediocre from the years past when the food was better. Nothing stood as great even with shrimp, black cod, and salmon on special tonight.  I thought the dish lacked flavor and freshness that I'm used to getting from McCormicks.  We had crabcakes, shrimp, sashimi, oysters, calamari, and lump crab for appetizers and nothing was worth fighting over,  love the views and the place but something happened to their food that's not working.
author: Steve T.

description: Did was fantastic! View is great! Food sourced locally. I got the cioppino and the shrimp kiss add an app. All well done.
author: Stephen L.

description: We had dinner at McCormick and Kuletos last night. The service was horrible and the food was very average. We had a table of five and all of us where disappointed.  Money not well spent.
author: Heather A.

description: This would've been a 5 star; however, towards the end of our dinner...it went down hill from there. Great scenery, beautiful setting, romantic, service is a little slow but good food. We went for my sister's 30th bday and she had the filet & lobster. Well, half way through her meal, our waiter accidentally spilled half of her cocktail on her lobster so he said he was going to take it back to the kitchen and replace it, so we said cool...okay...thanks! Now, when he brought the "new" meal back to her, he said "oh! We even got you a new lobster" and OMG no it wasn't!!...the entire meal was just plated on a new plate with her old food! I was sooo mad & very disappointed!! Who does that?? Even Applebees would've given her a whole new meal. I mean, we ain't high class to demand a new plate, we ain't low class either and went ghetto on the waiter and refused to pay for the meal. We just want them to do the right thing. Bringing her old food back & just replating it was so wrong on a different level! I mean...it was gross because her lobster was drenched in her cocktail! Sheesh. So, we asked to speak to the manager (which he took a while to get to our table). Don't get me wrong, our waiter was sweet and very professional...it was a simple mistake. What got me was our waiter also thought my Sis received a whole new plate because that's what the kitchen told him. To end this, let me just say...the Kitchen handled it wrong, Waiter was sweet and Manager was cool. The Manager did take a long while resolving the issue but eventually comped her meal and we finally celebrated her birthday with a yummy warm chocolate cake & vanilla bean ice cream.
author: Maiyiv T.

description:
Of course, the view is incredible! Our party of nine all enjoyed their meals and had no complaints about the quality, but no one raved either. I ordered the Atlantic Stuffed Salmon with a Baby Greens Salad, and the table had Shrimp Cocktails and Calamari for appetizers. I particularly liked the Calamari - it's wasn't too greasy, and it with was tossed with some peppers for some kick.

What took this from 3 stars to 2 for me was the service. I ordered a bottle of wine, and after I took a taste, approved, and rest of the table was served, the waiter did not come back to my glass. We also waited incredibly long for our orders to be taken. Our appetizers came, and we had to put our large menus in our laps so we could have access to the plates and utensils. Our order wasn't taken until we were long finished with the appetizers. I also expected there to be special items that the server would describe to us with his words, but that was missing.

I would go back though, for the view and good company, and cross my fingers that the service would be better.
author: Cecilia H.

description:
Came here after a long, but nice family trip to the South Bay; plus my mom had gift cards to use so we decided to try this steakhouse.  We decided to play "tourist" for the evening, as this place is located in a tourist trap (Ghiradelli Square).  Upon arriving, we told the hostess we RSVP'd and requested, since the sun was still out, that we sit at a table with the view of The Rock.  Right as we were seated, I couldn't help but grab my phone and snap a photo of the gorgeous scenery; living on the other side of the city, by the beach, rarely do I get a full, fantastic view of Alcatraz,  Hyde Street Pier, Tiburon, and Treasure Island!  After that excitement, our waiter, Josh, comes and greets us with a genuine smile, fills our glasses and kept the atmosphere light when I saw a spot on my dirty glass (which he changed out quickly); he returns with my new glass, and at that point he politely offers some recommendations for appetizers; we went with his suggestion: the mango-avocado salad.  A light, flavorful dish, that's not too filling, but enough to hold you 'til the entrees arrive.  I like how the salad, though it seemed like enough for 1 - 2 persons, was just enough for us to "sample" so gives us something to look forward to next time.

Moving on to the entrees, I had the stuffed Atlantic salmon, another one of Josh's recommendations.  The fish was cooked to my liking: moist and tender, very flavorful...no fishy taste whatsoever.  Great recommendation, Josh!

Dessert: Upon arriving at McCormick & Kuleto's, the 6 chocolate dessert offerings quickly caught my eye.  Yes, I am a sucker for sweets and couldn't help picking out what dessert I'm possibly going to have; so many looked so yummy.  Since 3/4 of us are little - not lactose, we each picked a chocolate dessert, while 1 of us picked out the fruit tart.  Needless to say, too bad the chocolate desserts were only offered for a limited of time.  I would've gone back, just for the dessert...lol. Delightful and decadent.  I was expecting something heavy, but to my surprise, the desserts were definitely light and flavorful; a very nice touch to the end of our meal.  

For a chain restaurant, this place is pretty good; If the manager is reading this, I'd suggest promoting Josh, or at least raising his pay; If he's taken them, he must've taken his Hospitality Management courses seriously because he definitely knows how to take care of his clients; he's able to strike up a light conversation; able to catch any mistakes/errors (ex: dirty glassware, drops something, etc.) before clients say anything, all while keeping the atmosphere light when catching such errors;  provides great recommendations; seems very genuine in making sure guests are comfortable, enjoying their food, atmosphere, and environment -- never hurries us out even when the dinner rush was beginning.  We pretty much ate from sunrise (sun was still bright early evening) to sundown.  And by the time we were done, our tummies were full...time for a stroll in Ghiradelli Square!
author: Jessica S.

description:
went there for our mom's big birthday.  we had a large group.  Great view.  Great service.  Our rib eye steak was a huge disappointment.  

Really Expensive for what you get
author: Kevin L.

description: Very nice and fancy place :) once in a while I like to spoil myself and my fam bam. I ordered the king crab legs for everyone to taste yum
author: Dennis C.

description:
I recently got married at San Francisco City Hall. We had a small group of friends and family join us for the day and I used the Dolphin Room at McCormick & Kuleto's for our private dinner afterward. My then fiance and I had visited so many place in the city but everything seemed either too pricey, or kinda boring. I really wanted somewhere with ambiance and a view. The room here was perfect because they have a low minimum to reserve the room and the view can't be beat. 

So why the 1 star rating? Service. Terrible, terrible service. Our event coordinator, Linda, takes the majority of the blame here. From pretty much day one, she failed to respond to phone calls and emails, she promised to "get that to you today" or "send that before I go on vacation" but never did. The only way to get the information we needed was repeatedly contacting her. 

Fast forward to the night of the dinner. Here's a few things that went wrong to name a few: 
1. Linda, while on the premises, was no where to be seen. Even when my friends arrived early to set up different items for our "reception" she made no appearance. 
2. Our wishes were ignored as far as seating our guests. We'd paid for appetizers for our guests to keep them occupied while we took some pictures. They were to be served on the patio. That didn't happen. They were served in the dining room and so guests went ahead and sat down. I had no chance to get pictures of the room before it was "used" looking. 
3. We were told that some appetizers would be held for my new husband and I to sample when we arrived. This didn't happen. When we did track down Linda to ask about it, she sent down totally different appetizers than what had been served to our guests, including a seafood item even though she new I am allergic to seafood and it was on our contract. 
4. After pictures, we were driving over to the venue and one guest texted us that they were already taking dinner orders. Are you kidding me? Not only did guests get seated early, but they started taking orders before the bride and groom had arrived??? So so bad. 
5. The food was......bland, to say the least. More than one of my guests sent there dinner back because it was in-editable. 
6. Finally, the cash bar. More than one guest told me that different liquors that were served upstairs in the main restaurant were not available to them at my event , even after they had asked. This sent my guests upstairs to the bar to buy drinks which took away from my minimum food and beverage cost. So, so disappointing. 

I would not suggest this place at all for an event. Of all of the different vendors I've worked with, this was the worst. There are a lot of restaurants in San Francisco, so keep looking.
author: Gina J.

description:
Best happy hour in San Francisco.  We dined at the bar, ordered Hummus and Clams..delish!  Only $8.00!  

Be prepared, the service is slow, but we weren't in a hurry :)
author: Crystal I.

description: I'm an event planner and sent a group of guests there this past Saturday. The guests were very pleased with the service, food and wine list . Chloe was the lead that evening and did a brilliant job. My main reason for this review is to give a huge shout out to Kristen M the sales manager who was able to fit our group at short notice on a busy Saturday night, as well as be patient as I needed to trouble shoot some internal procedures to make it happen . She was polite, courteous and very helpful at all times !! Thanks Kristen!!!
author: Janiece L.

description:
The food was good let me mention that upfront.  Nice setting and atmosphere. I am giving this 2Stars due to MANAGEMENT at restaurant.  I came here as a send off for my daughter going to college with my wife and son. We came here for a nice evening.

Our order took forever and I am not exaggerating. After complaining to waitress another time I learned that the kitchen got slammed by a private party of 40 all ordering off menu.  Our ticket somehow got misplaced or lost. Food finally arrives about 1:45 minutes after we ordered. Thank goodness we ordered some appetizers to start. 

I was told manager would come over to talk with me. The manager helped deliver our food and apologized for the delay and attempted to leave without any further comments. I stopped him in his tracks and he still didn't really address what happened. It was only after I asked how he was going to attempt to make things right did he make some adjustments to our bill. 

What really pissed me off was had I not said anything he wold have just walked away!
author: Hugh M.

description:
It was the most beautiful clear day in San francisco so friends and I chose this place.
The view was amazing...but everything else well ,sucked.
For starters the host is completely un-welcoming..the service is very slow..had to ask for bread and water ..just over all Lousy service ...food is nothing special and overpriced...considering all of the great choices the city has to offer ,this was definitely a bad pick..will not return
author: alexia c.

description: Overpriced, over hyped, snob feast. If that's your style - you'll love it. By far, our worst experience in the Bay Area.
author: Steven P.

description: They would get 5 stars if they still had the crab tater tot appetizers.  We love this place.  And in SF the views can't be beat
author: Jeremy B.

description: We had a lovely dinner. The escargot was amazing and the highlight of the meal in my opinion. The shrimp kiss was also delightful. Entrees were good. The view alone is a reason to visit as well as the truly hospitable and charismatic wait staff. Delicious food, beautiful view, and welcoming staff.
author: Madison W.

description: Came here with family from out of town for Mothers day wkend. Service was good. Cioppino is the best but everything else was sadly not as impressed at.  Food was so small compared to the platter boat it was served on. Fish was dry and over cooked. At least the view was worth it. I was a little embarrassed to have taken my family here... We have been here a many other times over the years and it just wasn't up to par this time.
author: Ka'Neki M.

description: This is the second time we have been in this establishment,  first time 1 year ago it was just a place to have a drink and rest our feet from touring around the Warf area. This time we made it to happy hour and enjoyed  a couple happy hour food specials, oysters for a dollar each, hummus with pita chips and a burger. My girl and I shared everything and it was plentiful and tasteful. With 2 drinks each and food it was around 50 dollars including tip. Get there early to find a parking spot close as parking is a hard thing to find. The view is awesome (the main reason we came again) located in the Giradelli block, Awesome!!!!
author: Timothy R.

description:
I wasn't expecting to like this place, but I really did enjoy my meal.

New England Clam Chowder - a great chowder - it arrived warm and creamy, but it wasn't overwhelming with creaminess.  

Parmesan Crusted Sole - An excellent dish.  The fish was flavorful and cooked perfectly.  The crust was a bit crunchy and savory/sweet.  It had a nice, creamy butter sauce and some capers to add hints of saltiness, which was really good.  

Polenta Cake - I really like their polenta...I assume it has a ton of butter or something, because it's really tasty.  The tangy/sweet marinara sauce added a nice Mediterranean flavor to it and complemented the rest of the entrée.

Upside Down Apple Walnut Pie - An awesome and inventive pie with sweet apples balanced with the earthy taste from the walnuts.  It was fairly dense, just the way I like my desserts.  Some nice vanilla ice cream arrived with it and was perfect. 

Chocolate Fudge Truffle Cake - Less like cake and more like fudge...a thick and decadent piece of cake that would make any chocoholic satisfied.

Since this is in Ghirardelli Square and close to Fisherman's Warf, I was expecting something bad or just okay, but I actually really enjoyed my meal.  Other reviews seem to be hit-or-miss as well, but the specific items I ordered were very good.
author: Ken G.

description:
This place has a great location- because the view is beautiful.

I was really hoping to love this place- but they do not know how to manage busy days. My boyfriend made reservations for us at 8:30 and we did not get seated until 9:25ish. That is ridiculous. I understand it is a busy night- but to not be able to manage the amount of reservations in a timely manner is not a good business to me. 

After the wait- I was being positive- and said to myself the food will pay off for the wait....

Boy was I wrong- it was nothing I would choose to eat again. Plain- tasteless- and I would have honestly preferred an in-n-out burger down by the shore...which is just sad...

Service was okay- nothing out of the ordinary.
author: Corie C.

description:
We had a reservation and got in for dinner fairly quick.  The service was outstanding.  They even brought us a special menu that said "Happy Anniversary" with the date on it. The waiter Justin, was incredibly attentive, polite and had the best customer service I have received at this restaurant so far and far superior than customer service I have received at other restaurants.

We ordered the shrimp kiss for appetizer (shrimp wrapped in bacon and filled with jalapeño cream cheese).  It was very flavorful.  It came with a fried onion ring stack that was absolutely delicious!  The batter melted in my mouth and had the perfect crunch.  Yummy.

For dinner I had the garlic shrimp scampi linguini and my husband ordered the lobster with a side of garlic mashed potatoes.  We both enjoyed our dinners, my shrimp was large and tender and everything tasted great, but that delicious onion ring stack is what really stood out to me.

I took a slice of banana cream pie home for dessert and it was okay, I would've preferred a graham cracker crust and more banana/less cool whip.


Overall, the waiter Justin and those onion rings were outstanding.
author: Lora P.

description:
Excellent view of the bay. The large glass windows shield the wind which is a plus. 
Service is ok. The waiter when asked for a recommendation said sword fish because it is filling and then tapped his belly. 
The petrale sole fish came too greasy and part of it tasted just like fried bread crumbs. 5 hidden fishbones hidden in the fish filet. Dangerous to say the least. 
The sword fish is great. The vegetables that come as a side are peppers and tomatoes and don't complement the fish well.
author: Tom M.

description:
I'm gonna have to give it 5 stars. Bf and I came here for our post-valentines date. We had a view facing the ocean and it was so nice. I wish we had come earlier so we could see the sunset! This is a fine dining restaurant. Prices are high, but that's expected. Everything we ordered was delicious. No joke. The calamari, the lobster ravioli, and the stuffed Alaskan salmon. OMG. SOOOOOOO delicious!!! The stuffed salmon was so rich and tasty and literally just melted in my mouth. It was so good. We would have ordered dessert, but we were too stuffed already! 
It's also cool cuz fishermans wharf is right there. We walked to pier 39 after to walk off our food. Luckily the weather was perfect that night, and even though a lot of the places were closed or closing since it was getting late, we still enjoyed the walk around. 

It was a great date, indeed.
author: Andrea M.

description: Can't beat the view, food and service were really good, not cheap but with the money.
author: Sean D.

description:
It was a truly sad night for me eating here for the first time in about 8 years. When I was going to Sonoma State my parents came to visit and we ate here. It was quite possibly the BEST steak I've ever eaten, as a matter of fact, if man and meat could mate, I would have had that steaks babies! This meal was the one that I compared all other fine steak houses to until this past weekend.

The service was terrible! It's rare that we leave less than 18%, but this girl got about 15.5% and she should consider herself lucky! The food was okay. My steak was nothing special, and the julienne vegetables were coated in garlic, so I opted out of eating them. Husband had the shrimp trio special and he was in heaven. Mom ordered a pork chop and she said it was extremely dry. Dad had macadamia nut crusted mahi mahi and he said that was good. The garlic mashed potatoes were the crowning achievement of dinner, they felt like silk on the tongue, and you couldn't taste the garlic at all. 

My mom ordered a drink, the "Southern Belle" and as I sat at the table thinking that our food was taking a ridiculous amount of time, here comes our server with my mom's drink she had literally ordered about 20 minutes before. The drink was TERRIBLE! 

The men's room had a bread basket to hold the paper towels and the women's room had no paper towels at all. Perhaps no one told that staff that this is supposed to be an upscale restaurant.
author: Laura T.

description:
What happened to the good service and cleanliness? Man, this place has rapidly diminished at the rate of no return! Friends and I came here two months ago for my last night in SF before moving back to Los Angeles.  Our server was extremely slow and inattentive.  It took a long time to get water, bread, etc. Bussers and our server would very seldom, if ever, take finished dishes from the table.  

As usual, the clam chowder was good. The petrole sole was so so; it lacked adequate lemon butter with capers. The sides that came with the entree were extremely bland. What happened to the garlic mashed potatoes and green beans? Why did you guys fix something that wasn't broken?  

We ordered lemonades, but our server never brought them. A different server, who we know well, Alvin, brought them to our table. I guess they had been sitting at the bar for a while...obviously quite a while!  

I didn't realize Alvin was working that night until it was too late. If we would have known Alvin was there, we would have requested to be seated in his section. The bartender Rama was really cool and on top of it...as usual.
author: Steve C.

description: We ordered the crab cake, and two Surf n Turf. The food was good, the lobster tail was a tad too salty but decent. My husband had to move seats because there was water leaking from the ceiling it was dripping on his shoulder! also when we got our glasses one of them was dirty, the waiter apologized and got us a new one. I was upset to have payed a surcharge of ($7.74) plus taxes $24. Nowhere in the menu did it say there was a surcharge it was just tacked on when we got our bill. I still tipped the waiter over 15% from our bill, I regret doing so had I known about the surcharge going towards their medical insurance. Not worth the $200 we spent.
author: Nansi R.

description: Came here after wine tasting and found out it was HAPPY HOUR. Can't miss out on that I say. As long as you sit at the bar but you can order from the main menu too. We ordered from the happy hour menu initially. We got the tuna sushi, chicken satay (initially we ordered the wings but they were out), and oysters. I am by far not an oyster person at all but my sister talked me into trying. So I told her if she dressed it I would try it AND boy did she. The vinegar sauce they had was so good. I also got the clam chowder which was OMG!!! Even my mom ate it and she doesn't like any seafood. Our waitress was AMAZING and so patient because we as a trio are quite demanding. My mom wanted hot sauce, she brought us tabasco and then brought some chili flakes. That made my moms day. For the main course we ordered the surf and turf. Now I like my steak to bleed on the plate but I always order medium rare. The meal did take a long time to come so we order sides of some veggies too a la carte. We got the asparagus, spinach and the mushrooms. When the entree came the steak was a little overcooked so we told Emily and no questions asked she took it back and brought us a whole new one with more veggies. The lobster was a little dry but the butter sauce made up for it. The view from the bar is absolutely beautiful and breathe taking. Great environment, especially with great company. Will definitely be back.
author: Pooja B.

description:
I'm a fan of McCormick & Schmick restaurants. I get the newsletter emails that tempt me into coming back for their seafood specials. I've been coming to McCormick and Kuletos for awhile, so when I received the Valentine's special I made the reservation. Turns out the special advertised items were not on the menu. Doh! 

The place was packed, but we were seated immediately after checking in. We were seated at a very nice booth with bay views.

We ordered two glasses of Sparkling Rose Champagne, Clam Chowder and Iceberg Lettuce Salad to start. The Clam Chowder is really tasty and the salad dressing was pretty good. 

For my main course I tried to order a 1/2 of a crab, which they were out of. Then the Crab cocktail, out again. I almost ordered a whole crab, but went with the sashimi platter from the raw bar. 

My date ordered the Lobster Ravioli which was great in a creamy sauce with bits of lobster in it. It was quite good. 

The food was great and I was reminded how much I like this restaurant, although I did not get my crab on. :(
author: Rebekah T.

description:
McCormick & Kuleto's looks like they've been around forever. It's a great place to enjoy lunch, brunch, and dinner.

Location: It's located in the heart of Ghirardelli Square. Absolutely stunning views of SF bay. Beautiful. Breathtaking. 

Ambiance: Classic and classy decor, more upscale. Ideal location for a brunch w/spectacular views of the water.

Service: personable and friendly staff.

Food: wonderful selection of brunch goodies. Our group enjoyed all of the stations: crab, oysters, prime rib, salmon, omelet and egg benedicts, sweet crepes flambay w/ Grand Marnier & oranges, fruits, & Ghirardelli vanilla ice cream. I can't forget the trays of bruschetta topped w/ chunky tomatoes, garlic, & onions, devilled eggs with a hint of truffle oil (rich, but definitely a wonderful treat), and brie-stuffed pastry.  

Favorite: The prime rib carving station!! Tender, cooked to your liking, and served w/ your choice of green Taragon aioli and a sweet honey mustard sauce w/ a hint of Horseradish. Simply devine. The carver was very nice, patiently explaining what each sauce was although there was a huge line behind me.

Bottom line: the perfect restaurant for brunch! I will definitely be back here!! =)
author: Joy A.

description:
Haven't been here in years.  It was just as I'd remembered.  The service was friendly and attentive but not too.  

This is a gorgeous restaurant with amazing views.  I met a date there and we watched the sun go down as we chatted over cocktails.  We had no wait for a table whatsoever on a Sunday evening.

I ordered a shrimp cocktail which was yummy and my friend had oysters which he said were delicious.  He had linguini with clams--I guess he liked it, his plate was empty!  I had surf and turf.  The filet mignon was cooked perfectly as was the lobster tail.  DELICIOUS.  Normally, I don't get dessert.  I had the pecan pie.  Again, wonderful.  

We were never rushed, the restaurant was filling up as we were leaving.  The staff smiling and friendly and informative as we left (which way to get a cab?!)   Both I and my date would return again.  and again.
author: Louisa R.

description: Such a disappointing end to my husbands birthday. Seems the server pre judged us that because we were young we weren't worth his time. Lousy and rude service combined with the fact that my husband asked for medium well and got a super rare steak made for a waste of money. We ordered alcoholic drinks and appetisers but we were totally disrespected. Nobody asked if he would like a to-go box for his uneaten steak, because nobody cared. It sucks that being polite and not wanting to cause a scene about the steak resulted in a waste because the server didn't want to waste his time asking us how our meal was. I will never go to this restaurant again. At any of its locations.
author: Jenny R.

description:
Wonderful service.  I hosted a recent brunch for a social club's anniversary, and that day's menu mentioned our event.  Meals were tasty.  View from window tables was good.  We all enjoyed the experience.

Susan H.
author: Susan H.

description:
AMAZING happy hour !!! nothing on their happy hour menu is more than $7.  the catch is you have to purchase a drink from them.  

Get their $4 hamburger w/ fries!!! yes it amazing and yes its only $4.
author: JY L.

description: The best Happy Hour in the city.  I feel like you can't find happy hour deals anywhere in the city.  The food is an absolute steal!  Everything on their HH menu is tasty and the drinks are awesome!  Unfortunately, it's in a touristy part of town but where isn't touristy in the city nowadays!  The view isn't too shabby either ;)
author: Danielle V.

description:
The only reason this place gets two starts is because it has a great view.  We had a table of six and no one liked their food.  Some people were polite and said it was ok but the food sucked.  The calamari was horrible and my salmon (which I asked for as rare) was dry and overcooked.  I would have sent it back but I didn't want to prolong the experience any further.  Our waitress was average at best.

If you're in the area and looking for a cool place to get a cocktail and maybe a simple appetizer or two this place would be a good choice but don't waste your time eating here!
author: Peter B.

description: Amazing place. I was only hungry enough to order a couple appetizers and dessert but it was amazing. Perfect service from the lovely Adriana! I'll def be back to enjoy more!
author: Celeste G.

description:
Worst experience I have ever had in my hometown. They have a staff that operates as though the place is closing within a few days which might explain why the extremly poor customer service. The group sat down thinking we might have dinner and the ladies thought can we have a couple of Pina Coladas before we decide. It took the bartender 10 minutes before it dawned on him people were waiting for him and only because I indicated to him that they wanted to order. When I informed him that they wanted the Pina Coladas he had the most perplexed look on his face as though I was speaking Russion. He finally spit it out that he did not know how. We had been in a couple of weeks earlier and that man made them. I would never walk by this place let alone go in!

Spoke to the manager who was wandering around outside the shops at Ghiradelli and he could have cared less. The place is closing anyway right? At least thats the feeling I got from the manager as well.

Hope the new place is better!
author: Jim S.

description:
We went to McCormick & Kuleto's to meet some friends.  Our friends had recommended the restaurant.  I had been there years before and remembered that it was costly and lackluster.  I was pleasantly surprised at its transformation.

We were early and were made to feel very comfortable while we waited.  We were escorted way back to a potential banquet room set up for individual diners.  We were right at the window overlooking the beautiful bay.  Our waiter was very capable and we never wanted for service.  Though they were out of my first wine selection, I chose another that worked out well.  I had a very nice and generously portioned beet salad.  I then had the halibut cheeks as an entree. They were in a tasty broth with vegetable cooked so that they had just the right amount of bite left in them.  My wife had the sole and the portion was quite generous.  She enjoyed the fish very much.  The chef came out and visited.  I thought that was a nice touch. My wife was given her email so that she could ask for a recipe for a dessert she liked quite well.  We'll be back.
author: Daniel G.

description: The food was good, but the service really went downhill as other people said, especially those Asian waiters. I think they don't like to serve other Asian people, I am an Asian. You can tell they have an attitude problems at the Asian customers compare to the others. Bad...
author: Racky W.

description: After walking around the wharf area, and checking out a gallery with a Salvador Dali exhibit I decided to have a steak. The best thing about this place is the view of the harbor. A gorgeous view of the water and Alcatraz off in the distance. VERY romantic kind of ambience. You could totally dress up and have a fancy date night here. My dang phone died right after I checked in so no pics! I had a filet mignon, some veggies and a great salad. For dessert I had a nice Laphroaig 10 year. About $65.00 including the drink just for little old me.
author: Shane N.

description:
The food was good but due to the service from this place i will not eat here again! 
The reason for one star is my girlfriend and I went here for our Valentine's Day dinner. 
Ended up being ignored by The staff resulting In waiting over an hour for Service after being seated.  It took them 20 minutes to bring us water, another 20 to being us bread, 15 minutes to take our order, 25 minutes to get an appetizer, another 25 to get our entrees, and 15 minutes just to get a refill on our drinks (another after having to remind our server). People who had arrived well after we had been seated were getting served their bread, water, and drinks In short order followed by a wait of No more than 5-10 minutes for their appetizers. This severely got on my nerves.  I asked to speak to a manager and The manager gave no sign that she was even concerned or cared.  She even had the nerve to bring The server over to us to talk when we wanted to voice our problems with our server making it awkward.  


My girlfriend had already been in tears over how the night was turning out at this place and we weren't the only couple that was experiencing this.  I had gone through this same experience In Las Vegas but I never expected this from an establishment that I had eaten at its other restaurants never having this problem.  I believe that the staff as well as it's managers need some serious retraining on how to treat patrons of the restaurant they work in otherwise they have no place being in the Restaurant or hospitality business. I only recommend this place if you want to be treated like dirt as well as ignored, taking forever to get anything.
author: Dominic Y.

description: Ambience is great.  Crab cakes are great.  Food was small portions and my ahii tuna was not good.  The service was not the best.   He tried hard but was to busy.  It was average at best.  I proably wpuld not eat hear again.
author: Jason T.

description:
We had a company holiday party here the week of December 17th. Before eating, we headed to the bar, which had a nice water view and ambience. Warning: your dirty martini will cost you $15! It was strong and good, but that's one pricey drink not including tip.

The food was buffet-style with roast beef (overcooked), chicken (very dry), mash potatoes and steamed veggies (super soft - almost baby food style). As you can imagine, the food was not that great especially for the rumored $60/person! Each person had one glass of wine and no more. 

I would not recommend this place for the food for our next company holiday party. There are so many fine restaurants in San Francisco.

The only exception here is the staff. Everyone was friendly, hospitable and nice. They were professionals.
author: Kit S.

description:
From reading the below reviews, it looks like it's not a great place to come in for special events or holidays. I went with 3 other people to a Thursday night dinner and I had an amazing experience. 

The view is amazing, if you dine at the tables near the window, but we sat in the bar area. I ordered clam chowder and a beet salad, and the beet salad was absolutely AMAZING. My boyfriend ordered scallops and those were really good too (I stole some). 

The only thing I would complain about is that the service IS a little slow, but for us, it wasn't a make-it-or-break-it kind of slow. It was more like, just when you start to think about how long it's been since you ordered, your food would come!
author: Amanda P.

description:
I was contacted by their customer service via Yelp.  Person doesn't even bother addressing me by name (which is on my review), simply a 

"Hi, I would like to get your phone number so that our corporate side can look into this and discuss. Thanks."

Maybe I am hoping for too much, but this is what I would expect from a fast food chain, not a restaurant that is marketing itself as providing a premier dining experience.
author: Tony Y.

description: Great view and service. Unfortunately the food did not match up to it.  The Alaskan King crab was like eating cardboard. Overcooked and dry. The warm butter is what saved it.  Won't be going back there.
author: Nicko K.

description:
I had a late lunch at this restaurant on 9/27/2014. The hostess was on the phone when my friends and I arrived, we waited patiently for her to finish the call with another customer. Once she was finished I expected to be seated, the phone rang again and she picked it up, I expected her to put the caller on hold and seat us but she gave priority to the caller, the call went on for minutes while we waited. At some point I tried to get her attention and was ignored, my friend who became impatient tried to get her attention by waving at her.  Finally she finished with the call and was ready to seat us and explained that because she was all by herself she couldn't not answer the phone. Her intentions were good but restaurant management needs to train the hostess to understand how to simply ask callers to hold while she attended to the people who were waiting in line. I had no problem waiting for her to finish the 1st call which also took a long time, since that call was already in progress when I got there, but the 2nd call she took was not acceptable and making us wait to finish her 2nd call was very bad customer service. 

The place is beautiful with lovely views of the bay. Our waitress was efficient and pleasant. I ordered the cioppino which was not good, the sauce tasted too salty and the seafood was overcooked.  Over all our experience was not one that I look forward to repeating.
author: Mali E.

description:
My dad and I decided to go to McCormick & Kuleto's for Thanksgiving this year to try out their Thanksgiving dinner (what a deal for only $18.95!) I made reservations the week before and unfortunately could only get at table at 8pm.

 The restaurant was PACKED and we didn't get seated until 8:20pm, didn't get to place our order until 8:40pm, and didn't eat until 9:20pm. This on its own would normally rate this as a 1 star for service, but I understand that this was a busy holiday day, so I'll cut them some slack. I think for next year they should up their staff though.

I've been a fan of McCormick and Schmick's for years and think this restaurant in their chain is just as good. They have a nice selection of fish and meat and you get a good amount of food for what you pay.

Service: Poor on Thanksgiving, but I'll give them a pass
Food: GREAT!
Location: Great! Who can beat a view of the bay and the GG Bridge?
Ambiance: Classy
Value: Good
author: Monika C.

description:
This review is for their happy hour (M-F 3-6PM).  We had a dozen fresh oysters off their regular menu and had the Chipotle Fish Taco (comes with 2) and Spicy Chipotle Steamed Mussels off their Happy Hour menu.  I wasn't expecting much out of the fish taco, but it was actually pretty good.  Both of these Happy Hour items were $3.95.  Good deal and pretty fulfilling.  The Half Pound Cheeseburger for $2.95 was tempting, but I had to save room for dinner so decided to save it for next time.  

Service was pretty slow that it took awhile to place our orders, get refills, and get our check.
author: Erica S.

description:
Steer clear of happy hour, service sucks!!!
just going in to grab a few beers and appitizers with the family and though you cannot beat the prices they will not let the bar staff (females) serve in the real restaurant adjacent to the lounge..... they'd die under the pressure.
author: Robert B.

description:
It's New Year's Eve and we're walking around Fisherman's Wharf deciding where oh where should go we go for a nice dinner and a good view of the night we are about to embrace for the last night out in 2011?  I remembered the old black man who is always at the bottom of the steps of McCormick & Kuleto's singin his heart out about all the passersby as they go up and down the stairs to Ghiradelli Square.  We headed that way to see what was happenin over there in the hopes I could get myself a serenade... 

From outside on the sidewalk the warm lighting of McCormick & Kuleto's lured us closer and closer.  As we started up the stairs we saw the NYE decor and all the patrons in their best attire.  Shiny short skirts on all the ladies and crisply pressed shirts on the men with their best set of cuff links they own.  It was just where we wanted to start the night off right.  "Table for two?"  Zak inquired.  

The hostess looked a little worried, but smiled at us and said "Walk ins?  ok, let me see what I can do."  They quickly found us a nice booth just one row over fromthe windows overlooking the bay.  It was perfect!  

Complimentary glass of Champagne?  Don't mind if I do!  Things were starting off better than expected with trying to get into a place on NYE at 7pm for Dinner (and it was a Saturday night).  

Our server recommended the Chef's special of the night which was a Filet Mignon over a bed of fresh spinach, garlic mash potatoes, and topped with fresh Lobster.  We just had to!  How can you not hear all that and stop the drool if you don't just order it and devour!?  

We started with the Black Mussels.  They were placed in a shallow sea of Jalapeno Cilantro Butter and stirred in Linguica.  It was my first time having Mussels and let me tell ya... It's going to be VERY hard to top that.  They were amazing!  I was dipping my bread in the butter sauce there at the end.  In heaven!  So delicious!! 

When my entree came there were HUGE chunks of fresh lobster on there!  So big that as the server sat down my plate the chunks were losing their balance atop the Filet and tumbling down onto my plate.  It was a thing of pure beauty.  It would take an hour to get that much plump lobster out of the shell to enjoy.  And there is was just sitting there nestled in the mashed potatos and spinach... shining up at me... ready for the fork to enter it and bring it up to my lips.  Oh yah!  YUMMY!  

I can honestly say... and I've been saying it a couple times a day since New Year's Eve... That was one of THE BEST dinners I've had in my life.  It was perfect.  

The service was divine.  Suggested entree was a hit!  Drinks?  We ALWAYS custom order our drinks wherever we go and he didn't bat a lash when we gave him the % of puree to club soda and gin we wanted for our perfectly designed NYE cocktails we were dreaming of.  

I've been there before and I'll go there again.  This place never let's me down.  

Happy New Year, everyone!
author: Jessica W.

description: My husband and I found this place after searching for fine dining seafood restaurants in the bay area. The restaurant is rather large on the inside and well decorated. It has a pretty formal atmosphere. We made a reservation at open table, so we were immediately seated at a lovely table near the window when we arrived. A nearby table directly next to the window opened up, and our server happily moved us so we could have a better view of the water. Our server, Justin, was very knowledgeable, friendly, and attentive. We started off with bruschetta, which was delicious. Then, I had the swordfish which came with a veggie mix on the side. My husband got a steak which also came with veggies. We split a family size truffle mac and cheese. Our dinner was amazing and very fresh. We each had a glass of La Crema wine from Sonoma, which was honestly pretty much the best wine I've ever had. For dessert, we shared the upside down apple walnut pie with ice cream. OMG so good! We loved this place and will be back if we ever come to the area again.
author: Christina G.

description:
Had brunch yesterday, for a birthday celebration.  First for the good stuff; view is amazing on a beautiful day as it was yesterday. The bay is so beautiful and any seat is a good seat at this place. The table bread was amazing. SF sourdough from Bodini Bakery you can't go wrong. The wait staff was pleasant and efficient. It was good to see my friends and enjoy their company.

The bad; I order a Cesar salad with calamari.  It was NOT a Cesar, the lettuce was romaine and shredded with fried calamari thrown in.  Even though I knew this was NOT a Cesar, I ate it anyways because for a salad it took over 1 hr and I was starving. A friend ordered the Linguini with Clams, I was told the natural clams were good but very small which (I saw and they were) and it was assumed someone threw in "canned clams" to compensate but it made the whole dishes to salty. Another friend had fish, but sent it back because it just was not good. All dishes are way overpriced; yes it is a tourist trap. I didn't pick the place, I was invited, and therefore I will not go back, even if invited. There are plenty other restaurants in the area; I suggest you go somewhere else.
author: Susie S.

description: Would have given this place 4-5 stars, but it's SO COLD inside!
