I love the food and service, but it was SO cold inside tonight--literally EVERYONE I observed around our table in there was wearing their coat AND scarf, including myself. My party notified management FOUR times and brought it up to our server TWICE that it was FREEZING in there, but they didn't take any action. We were there 3 hours, and there was no change in temperature. Very cheap move for an otherwise nice restaurant. We would have stayed longer for coffee/drinks after dinner, but everyone at our table was so cold that we decided to leave.
author: Christina Y.

description: The view is pretty good.. you get to look at a pirate ship and crazy people swimming in the bay from your seat.... but the food is seriously lacking. I came here with a big (150) group and we were served a plated meal. I know that, that doesn't always make for the best meal, but it was really not good. The sourdough bread was cold, the salad didn't have dressing and the fish and steak were also cold when they finally arrives 2 hours into our being there. Bleh.
author: Marie D.

description:
We came here for the MIL's 75th b-day after our Bay Cruise. We told them the occasion when we made reservations and the menus were customized with a "Happy 75th Birthday!!" printed at the top. Nice touch.

I scanned the menu and there it was "Kurobuta pork belly" (aka Berkshire (aka Black Pig (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kurobuta))). I go weak at the knees when I see that and quickly decided on the Sea Scallops with roasted Kurobuta pork belly with a Crab Cake starter. The g/f got the Parmesan Crusted Petrale Sole with capers.

The crab cake was deliciously crabby with tasty lemon butter sauce. The main course was mixed for me. I thought the portion was small for almost $30 with 2 scallops and 2 meager pieces of pork. The first bite of scallop was SUPER SALTY; I almost spit it out. Luckily I persevered because the rest of the dish didn't share that level of seasoning. The Kurobuta pork was also a bit disappointing with one piece roasted to a crisp (aka burned) and inedible. The second piece was much better though also a bit salty.

On the flip side, my g/f's sole was very well done with a nicely tangy lemon caper sauce. Her mom also gushed over her Halibut Cheeks so by that measure the dinner was definitely a success. 

I think I have bad luck picking dishes. Either that or I'm a pickier eater than most.

Service was a bit spotty with our waiter disappearing for long stretches of time forcing us to send other servers in search of him. He did get along great with my g/f's niece, which, I can attest to, is no easy task.

Decent place to bring out-of-town guests, but not a place on my regular rotation.

Food: 2.5 stars for mine, 3.5 overall
Service 3 stars
View: 4 stars. Would be 5 without the unsightly aquatic park construction.
author: Andrew C.

description: We went happy hour on Thursday. It wasn't uber busy.  There were 4 in our party and we were able to get a table quickly.  The waitress, Lindsay(sp) was very friendly and provided us with very good service.   Happy hour prices were  $5 drafts (3 choices) that I had which were good.  And they had several cocktail options at various prices.  The food was okay... but hey it's happy hour and I primarily was drinking.  Would recommend it to anyone looking to hang out for a few hours.
author: Jay V.

description:
Just to clarify, Happy Hour is from 3 - 6pm!

Parking - plentiful, but $3 per HOUR metered parking.

Food -
To enjoy happy hour, there's a $3 drink minimum.  DO NOT GET THE SMALL BOTTLED soda (it's like flat soda)!  You should try the raspberry lemonade or peach lemonade ($4)!  The alcoholic drinks are expensive and won't make you happy during this hour [Mimosa $11, Blueberry Lemon Drop - $6-7].

2LB BURGER + FRIES (@$2.95 are you out of your mind?) - it's a full size burger with fries for $3, WHERE THE HELL CAN YOU GET THAT KINDA DEAL?! 

Manila Clams $4.95 - ahh clams! pretty darn delicious

Mussels in Marinara Sauce $1.95 - again, WHERE THE HELL DO YOU GET A DEAL LIKE THIS?!

Sweet Potato Fries - a bit on the buttery side, but it's only $1.95!

Chicken Sliders - Pretty small fried chicken pieces with honey mustard (and I usually hate mustard), but it was GOOOOD!

BBQ Sesame w/ Wasabi Buffalo Wings - buffalo wings are drenched in the flavorful bbq sesame sauce, you should ask them to take out the wasabi dressing (even though its very mild and only drizzled over some parts).  This kinda made me thirsty!

Service - average/slow since there's only the bartender serving guests in this area.

BUT MUST COME FOR CHEAP FOOD!
author: Steph L.

description: Great view. Great cocktails. Great service. For that I give 4 stars. The Food was ok but nothing special. A bit too pricy for this quality of food. Too bad they fall short on that because it's really a good location and the cocktails are fantastic.
author: Sue D.

description: My wife and I were hungry when we arrived at Fisherman's Wharf for the Ghirardelli Chocolate Festival.(We really should've waited cause we ate alot of chocolate after our meals) Anyway, so we went out to McCormick & Kuleto's to find ourselves and thoughtful led to our seats with a great view of the bay and the festival being prepared.  She had a delicious New England Clam Chowder and I had the Grilled Salmon Sandwich.  The waiter was extra courteous and patient at all times.  We would love to have dinner there next time in the future.
author: Ben D.

description:
Great dinner spot. Seafood and and everything from the turf here is delicious. Check out the sea bass - you'll swear it belongs on the dessert menu.

Local hints: Check it out for happy hour (some of the best deals in The City), if making dinner reservations ask for a window seat (or one of the top floor booths), and if it's a special occasion give them a call and let them know ... for my girlfriends birthday dinner they printed her name on a special menu for us - it was a nice touch.
author: Greg V.

description: Went to happy hour here last Thursday. Our waitress, Lindsey, was simply amazing. I felt like she genuinely cared that we had a good time in San Fran. She even gave us a handwritten list of places to go to check out night life. I ordered a strawberry drink and didn't like it and she did not appear to be upset that I sent my drink back. I'm usually not comfortable sending food and drinks back at restaurants, but she went out of her way to make sure that I was happy with my drink. I would definitely go back!!!
author: Janice G.

description:
I had a hard time between 3 & 4 stars.
I went lowered just because the food is okay. Nothing amazing. I feel like I have had better. But the service is wonderful and that is why I continue to come here.
I enjoyed the friendly nature of the staff, I've called in advance for bday's and they print "happy birthday" with the person's name on the menu. C'mon, that is just so sweet. It's always suprising to ppl when they see that.
The atmosphere is great, you can have a nice meal with no interruptions, can get a bit loud at times but this restaurant has a great view of the bay.
author: francis c.

description:
Everything about this place is mediocre -- except the prices. When we can't think of another place to go, we'll pretty happily eat here, but it's not the first recommendation I'd give.

The food is decent, but there's always something that you want done a little better with an order. It's definitely edible, but not amazing. In my opinion it's a bit too pricy for the average quality.

The service gets a little worse at dinner when there are many customers (and there are MANY customers -- it gets really loud). They do provide what you ask though, so not really any complaints here.

The decorations are quite nice, and the view is great.

The one cozy place here is the bar, but when I asked for an orange juice after being told it's fresh-squeezed, and was brought something obviously mixed with water and juice from a bottle, well...
author: D B.

description:
Super yum, though the crabbers' strike screwed us on getting Dungeoness for dinner.

Get the crab cake. Worth it. 

Also, bring your extra large billfold.
author: Mike I.

description: Came here on a Saturday night and immediately got seated. The view was amazing and so was the food! We were out of towners and just stumbled on this restaurant while looking for somewhere to dine. Our server was amazing and so sweet to us. I will definitely be coming back next time I'm in the city!
author: Sophia S.

description:
My wife and I had reservations for 6:30pm on Valentine's Day and were not seated until after 7pm. There were people we spoke with that had 5:45pm reservations and got seated shortly before us. The hosts were short with guests and almost every employee acted like it was an inconvenience to take care of guests. The bar was out of a couple of tap beers and were not at all pleasant to deal with. Amidst the crowd of people standing around waiting to be seated, servers were running into guests and not apologizing or saying "excuse me" or "I'm sorry." We were finally seated and ordered drinks and our meal and was visited by our server (Justin H.) MAYBE three times in the 90 minutes we were there. 

The food was pretty good but the service was terrible. The hosts and staff made us and many others around us feel unwelcome. I am surprised at how unprepared everyone at the restaurant seemed to be for Valentine's Day what is obviously always a very busy night. We will never return to this restaurant. There are way too many other options in the area to tolerate this type of service.
author: John K.

description: View is great. Food mediocre at best, comparable to Denny's.  Fish tasted old, over-cooked. Service was friendly, but mediocre food really brings this place down.
author: M E.

description:
I used to love this place, and would go here about every other trip to the City.  Today, however, reminded me to go outside of any standard place in SF.  

The service was soooo slow, the glasses and silverware had water spots all over, the waiter totally FORGOT our appetizer (the biggest reason I wanted this lunch...it is the hamachi sushimi appetizer with truffle oil!).  

When I asked him if we were getting our app while he was delivering our entrees, he said that he forgot, 'because he was so busy.'  The restaurant was only about 35% occupied!  We had to ask for bread.

This is not what it used to be, and not up to the Kuletto name anymore at all.  

Probably won't be back anytime very soon.....
author: Warren A.

description:
Parents visiting from Hawaii picked to eat here for Thanksgiving dinner. They offered a very reasonable turkey meal for $18.95 which included stuffing, gravy, cranberry sauce, veggies, and sides for an additional $5-8. Although I did not personally order this, I did get to taste my boyfriend's who did. Nothing special. Lame that you have to pay extra for mashed potatoes or some kind of starch. We didn't realize til after we left, but they forgot to give the cranberry sauce.

We had crab cakes, a spicy tuna roll, and an ahi sashimi appetizer which all were only okay- definitely not worth their prices.

I ordered the dungenous crab bleu cheese pasta for my main meal. Waiter said bleu cheese strongness of flavor is a 6/10, however, it was about a 8-9/10 even for me, who has a pretty strong pallet. 

I would've gave only two stars, however I did have an order of their mac & cheese side dish, which was very delish. Lots of flavor & the bread topping made it have a good crisp consistency.
author: Alysha K.

description: We went into the nearly empty restaurant and they tried to seat us in the back near the kitchen door; not the restaurant experience we are looking for.
author: Larry C.

description:
Found wanting. Quite underwhelming; was disappointed.  Clearly an example of location-based demand because pricing and ambiance does not match with the actual food placed on the plate.  M&S partnership with Kuleto, the over-hyped west coast restaurant designer. Been wanting to try this since we have fond memories of living close to McCormick Schmicks in L.A. and going there for happy hour and great views.  Here it's more like McCormick and Schmucks because you feel like a schmuck for getting sucked into dinner here.  We had Chef Liz's special fish. Despite having a cool first name, her fish was actually borderline overcooked and unimpressive, little flavors. Blah.  In a lovely group of four, no one was impressed with their food.  We all left dissatisfied.
 
Two stars for a nice view but food absolutely unworthy of choosing to have dinner here.
author: Liz K.

description:
You  expect a lot when u plan to spend $200 for a dinner for 2 but this place didn't even fulfill the basics. 

- We made reservations thru Yelp. Hosts seemed discombobulated, disorganized and stressed out. 
- We were seated at a horrible table! I thought they said there was no bad seat in the house! We were brought to the back area and offered a seat at this LARGE 4-person square table right (there were only 2 of us) beside the building staircase with what seemed to be a spotlight at our table. I WAS INSULTED that they would think this would be a table they could offer anyone! They moved us to a table by the host after we complained. 
- Server was not friendly and clumsily set down our plates on top of others! 
- food was horrible. Don't order the escargot. 
- Chowder was cold but cup and plate were hot which means it had been sitting under a heat lamp for some time
- eggplant appetizer was good but nothing to write about. 
Instead of having a romantic dinner, we ended up with a horrible evening. 
Never coming back.
author: Vanessa G.

description:
I know McCormick & Kuleto's is in the heart of tourist town SF but I still expected more.  Sure, the views are gorgeous of the bay (dine during the day to really enjoy the views).  But the food is overpriced for the quality of what you get and really not very creative ... or if creative (like scallops served over beans) it isn't a great combination.  I mean, the bread they serve is literally like a loaf of dense dry wonder bread served cold.  This is SF people.  Boudin is right down the street.  At least serve some warm sourdough bread.  I love bread.  Actually slightly addicted to it. But after my first bite of this "bread", I left it untouched.

The food isn't bad, it is just average in a town where there are so many delicious restaurant options.  Even in Ghiradelli Square, I think Ana Mandara is supposed to be better but it doesn't have the view).

The house salad was fine (prefer my walnuts to be candied), the wedge salad was good, the seafood in the cioppino was fresh and pretty generous, the scallops were cooked well although the beans on the bottom were an odd pairing.  

So fair warning.  Go for the views if your a tourist.  If you're a local, enjoy the views by walking along the water and go eat somewhere else.  The food is fine, but I'm giving it 2 stars because compared to the other options in SF and the prices here are high and the bread, oh the bread, so disappointing.
author: Laura F.

description: In a nutshell: condescending server, tragically poorly cooked and overpriced Filet Mignon. Sent it back, and they tried to charge us for two. In short, I wouldn't recommend it to anyone looking for a good meal.
author: JJ A.

description:
The location is wonderful and the decor reflects a high end establishment,  those are the only reason I gave them one star. If it were possible I would have given them a minus one star rating.  

We walked in the door and were greeted by a hostess who was dressed more like she should be working at Appleby's. Our waiter was inattentive and surly and didn't know how to pour wine properly (the bottle should never rest on the glass). The lousy service could have been overlooked if the food had been more than marginal. 

We ordered the petite filet mignon and lobster, the filet was bland and the lobster  was dry and over cooked? It was served with some soggy vegetables we have yet to identify. We also ordered the ahi appetizer which was bland and much more work to eat then it needed to be. We didn't stick around for dessert and we won't be going back.
author: Crystal J.

description:
3.5 stars.

Came for lunch on Sunday before the Giant's game.  At the Fisherman's Warf area right across the Maritime Museum (Aquatic Park boathouse building).  Street (metered) or indoor garage parking available (discount validation from restaurant -remember to ask)

Ordered:
Prawn cocktail : $15.95 - fresh & good
Ceasar Salad  : $ 8.95  - with anchovies, large enough to share, fresh good
Range chicken : $19.95 - w/green beans, zuccini- very good
Lobster Ravioli : $ 24.94- about 6 large raviolis in cream sauce and med. chunks of lobster - very good
Carrot cake       : $ 7.95 - carrot & pineapple (large piece - not very good)

To go order:
Sushi - California roll & Spicey Tuna = $8.95 & $9.95 (it was fresh, not spectacular)

Service : very good
Ambiance : nice, touristy, nice view of Aquatic park, large windows
Price : not bad for a tourist area
author: Rpm R.

description: My family and I like to eat here during the holidays.  Their menu never disappoints me and the view of the Golden Gate Bridge is always beautiful.
author: Vira P.

description: Wow- how does this get good reviews? Had the NY Steak with Gnocchi and the steak might have been the worst I've had
author: RJ J.

description: Went in for happy hour (3pm-6pm). The menu is really limited for happy hour, cant order from the regular menu. Only tapas in the bar area. What was a pretty good deal is the 3.99 half pound burger. Come with fries, its a great deal. I went with the fish tacos which were seasoned and pan fried instead of battered and deep fried, which was pleasant, however when i picked ip the taco the corn tortilla fell apart right away. Then i went with the chicken sliders served on a mini mini english muffin, it was so-so, i like the jalapeno aoili. Not many beeres to choose from, only 3, which were 5$ each. Hmm ill keep walking next time i come upon this place.
author: Ray P.

description: We visited for my husband's birthday and couldn't have been happier with the service and special touches we received. First, we were seated at a table with a great view that was seemingly selected to give us some privacy from other, larger groups seated in the restaurant at the time. Almost immediately, the maître d' returned to the table to give us new menus that, to our surprise, had been printed just for us and wished my husband a happy birthday at the very top of the menu. So thoughtful! Jim, our server, was absolutely fabulous throughout our meal, offering great suggestions every step of the way. Dinner ended with an out-of-this-world brownie sundae (with a candle of course!), which was the perfect ending to a perfect dining experience. We couldn't have asked for more and we'll definitely be back again soon!!
author: Kristen L.

description:
If you're a tourist the ambiance is nice.  If you live in the bay, stay away.

Service was amazing but I expected more, more flavor that is. The view was amazing.  Great view does not make up for poor food.  I was there for christmas dinner.  This is the first time I've been disappointing by a christmas dinner, and I spend most of them alone. I don't mind paying a lot for food, on the other hand, I hate paying a lot for flavorless food.
author: Dr. Katharine H.

description:
Great views, nice ambiance. That's it.

Food was underwhelming. Wedge salad was bland--the one at Outback Steakhouse is a million times better. Think about that. I got the mango crab stack--it had a sauce on the plate that tasted rancid. One of the worst dishes I've ever eaten anywhere. Shrimp Kiss had blubbery bacon, and was overstuffed with cheese. I cannot believe how much I paid for such a horrible meal. Avoid.
author: Kaari J.

description:
HAPPY HOUR 3-6, 9 on

Vincent K. always beats me to the punch on these Happy Hour reviews so I will concede to his ranking and review. Yes, the venue is nice but keep in mind that if you're going there for happy hour you will be seated in the front bar area with, alas, no beautiful view of the bay. The food items are incredibly priced but with the low price comes a major lack of food quality. 

Standouts:
-Fried clams: on the more expensive side of the Happy Hour menu but my favorite. I'm using the term very loosely.
-Wings: Best thing on the menu with a delicious tangy sauce
-Burger: Definitely the most bang for your buck quantity-wise. Quality-wise - skip.
-Nachos: Oh hell no. You will find better ones at AT&T park or your nearest movie theater.
-Quesadilla: Another skip - Cheese between a tortilla. To make it yourself: 50 cents.

Even after ordering a ton of things between our group of seven I was completely unsatisfied and managed to convince the group to go to Fisherman's Wharf for some real seafood in the form of clam chowder. Not impressed and as the two-star rating clearly indicates: "Meh. I've experienced better."
author: Christina L.

description:
4 stars for the Mon-Fri, 3pm-6pm happy hour menu in the bar. Items range in price from $1.95 to $4.95. 

Let us just say they have an AWESOME Half Pound Cheeseburger (with cheddar! and fries!) for $2.95 during happy hour. It is so much food that the other night I couldn't even finish the fries and the fries and burger were DELICIOUS. 

Minus a stars as most drinks are still pricey, tho they'll usually have a draft special at $3.50....right now it's Sam Adams Summer Ale or Boston Lager. And they'll have some specialty cocktail at $6.50 or so.
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
What a horrible experience!  We came for a holiday party and the place was almost empty.  There was a table next to us celebrating a birthday party and we sent them over two bottles of champagne.  The two tables were pretty excited celebrating the holidays and a birthday and at some point, the manager came over and said we were to loud and asked us to leave.  This was very surprising considering there was absolutely no request to keep it down beforehand to keep the volume down.

We think we were asked to leave since it was pre-paid and had not utilized all of our tab. 

Beyond that, the food was far lower than average,  Everything was pretty greasy and the lobster was stringy.  Pretty much a huge tourist trap with overpriced below average food
author: Charles K.

description:
Although a bit more touristy than the restaurants I typically enjoy while in San Francisco my experience at McCormick & Kuleto's was a very positive one.  

The oysters we had as appetizers where outstandingly fresh and the Red Snapper I had for lunch was extremely good as well.  The friend I was with  had the Halibut, which he mentioned was excellent as well.

The lunch menu listed many great-sounding entrees and I would definitely consider another visit to check-out the seafood on the dinner menu.
author: Bob B.

description:
I attended a group lunch here today. We were in a "side room" which was separated from the main dining area by harmonica type doors.

The fixed meal consisted of mixed greens, salmon in a strange tasting fruity sauce, mashed potatoes and tasteless beans and carrots. For dessert there was a flourless chocolate cake.

My main complaint, however, was the incredibly slow and disorganized service. It took forever to bring out the main course despite the fact that all the salads had been pre-set at all seats. And I didn't get my dessert until the majority of my table had already finished there.

I give them two rather than one start since it was a "group lunch" and the view from the main room is great.
author: Nobbi L.

description: The food is great but I have to say the host is not that friendly and from my observation he cannot multitask and gets flustered. Ricardo is not a good representation of the restaurant especially when you go in. He has no customer service skills. He originally thought I was reserving for 12 and I told him plenty of times for 10! The difference in time to wait was 30 min. I clocked in at 6:30pm, he said an hour and a half=8:30pm!  uhm and hour and a half from 6:30 is 8PM!!!!!! I even tried calling since I was by the pier and he put me on hold for a half hour ask walked back and found him just hanging around. He is pushing business away and truly doesn't care much for the value of his position. We've been here a few times and my sister even rented out the large banquet room for their wedding anniversary dinner. I'd still come back because their linguine and clams is one of the best I've ever had.
author: J R.

description:
Typical tourist trap, invited and had to go. The highlight of the meal was an unexpected fireworks show on the bay. Now for everything else. Ordered 1.5 dozen oysters and they were creamy - yes in San Francisco they messed up oysters. Most of the other dishes had the presentation of a retirement home restaurant. They served a hot beet salad that was cold with almost no beets, a calamari dish that had more chili peppers than calamari. Swordfish was uninteresting but kudos to the cook it was moist. Apparently the linguini was good although I did not try it. My wife's seafood stew could have been cooked by a cook one - no flavor. 

Wine list had almost nothing other than Napa and Sonoma. At these prices more selection should exist. Very expensive - although I don't care when the foods good.

Best part of the meal was leaving before desert.
author: Christopher W.

description:
We really enjoyed our dining experience at McCormick & Kuleto's.  If you're not familiar with it... McCormick also owned the other 46 or so McCormick & Schmick's restaurants.

The seafood is good and the views of the San Francisco harbor are breathtaking.  It's nestled in the famed Ghirardelli Square along the Embarcadero.  After lunch or dinner, just stroll over to Ghirardelli's for a great dessert!
author: Steven L.

description:
My ultimate favorite dish here is the white clam linguine.  Though on the pricey ($19.95 dinner price) and skimpy side (as a whole entree), it does taste great and there are plenty of clams.  I had this with a side of white zinfandel and it felt like melt in my mouth paradise.  

I've had their 8 oz sirloin and was not too impressed.  I expected better tasting for a McCormick's steak, even if it is just an 8 oz sirloin.
author: Mary Ann M.

description: Amazing view. Good service. So why one star? The food is bad and very expensive. They must have survived on tourists who never return.
author: Jonathan R.

description: Arriving about two hours early, we were greeted kindly and directed to a cute bar seat where the happy hour drinks flowed like the mythic wines of Dionysus himself.  Around two hours later, we were seated by the windows of the lower restaurant with a beautiful view of the bay, lit with the Golden light of the late day sun, showering the room and the face of my beautiful partner with a warm ambiance of white gold. Our food decended on us like a pantheon of decadent flavors imbued upon the brush of Jackson Pollock himself. The portion sizes were large enough satiate the ravenous hunger of a thousand men, yet quality enough to sway the hearts of the hardest of food critics. The elation of pure enjoyment and happiness layed before me was enough to subdue the most chaotic of souls. The service was prompt and akin to that experienced by the royalty and Kings of old. As the sun sank behind the western Hills, the reality of the fact this experience was doomed to end by the nature of time alone was as soft as the gray light filtering through my now empty wine glass. Paradise does exist, for those who are willing to discover it, at McCormick & Kuleto's Seafood & Steaks.
author: Alex M.

description: We have been patrons of this restaurant for 25 years. It has been a go-to for celebrations and a neat place to bring out of town visitors. The star of the show is naturally the view. Absolutely stunning views of the bay, the Golden Gate, Marin, Alcatraz, etc. We came here on Saturday with a large party to celebrate a family event. While the service both at the bar and in the dining room was friendly and accommodating, the food was downright poor. Overcooked mussels, cold scallops and just overall poor execution. It's very, very tough to get a reservation at a decent place for a large party and Mc & K is always able to accommodate. I think after this last experience, I'll try harder to find a place where the prices are backed-up by the food. This place is definitely on the decline.
author: Mike B.

description: Very lovely place! My husband got the Ahi Tuna and loved it!!! I had the crab cakes which were rich and very good. The staff was super friendly and very helpful with the menu.
author: Audra S.

description:
The wait staff did a nice job, the food was just fair.  I had the sword fish entree with dungeness crab and it was a bit bland but edible.  Portion sizes were reasonable but not generous.

The view, however, was very nice and the chance to see the square that surrounded it (Ghiardelli square) was really pleasant.

The beer selections were nice and the bartender was funny and knowledgable.
author: James T.

description:
The Deals they have during Happy Hour are super Great!!!
where else can you get a cheese burger with fries for less than $3
We went on a good day, they were giving out free drinks,  
Everything we ordered on the HH menu was a great deal and tasted great
 
HH:
Cheese Burger, Asian noodles, Pulled Pork Sandwich, & Bruchetta. none of which costed more than $4 

The sampler plate of oysters was perfect! 
Only thing my GF had a issue with was with the Cippino was kinda bland, all the seafood that was in it was fresh and tasty. 

We will be going back for their $1 oysters on special Weds
author: Blake R.

description: We enjoyed a drink and some appetizers in the bar. The service was very quick and attentive. The bar menu was very limited, but the full menu was available. The crab cakes were great.
author: Hoya S.

description: I went here with a group of Interns I was with in San Francisco and it was the best idea we had! We sat in the bar area and were still able to see the amazing view of the bay. Their oysters are amazing and they have a pretty decent bar. Very friendly service!
author: Allison B.

description: Private party for 16 of us the Thursday night of Easter weekend for my grandmother's birthday. The room was set up nicely and the servers were fantastic. For an appetizer I had the crab cake and the bacon-crusted sturgeon for my entree. Both were quite delicious! My assorted relatives ordered many different things off the menu, for apps I saw mussels, shrimp cocktail, and oysters. No complaints from anyone! For entrees one cousin got the king crab legs, one got salmon, one got lobster. Again, everyone was pretty happy except my husband's steak was overdone (and quickly replaced with another)! It was a fun-filled evening, a great start to our trip to San Francisco.
author: Lana B.

description: Excellent drinks, food, and service! A bit pricey but very good! I had the crab cake, surf and turf( lobster tail, veggies, and filet  mignon) and my wife had the lobster bisque. All was great!
author: Daniel E.

description: My kids and I come here every couple of months when we are in San Francisco for a long weekend or for a tradeshow and we love the great sunset view of the Golden Gate (when you make a reservation, request a table by the windows with a view of the bridge!).  The menu has so much variety, everyone will find something they will love!  I love the swordfish with polenta while my kids usually devour the clam chowder bread bowl, the salmon, NY steak or fish & chips.  Don't forget to try the Shrimp kiss - it's bacon-wrapped, pepper-jack stuffed shrimp with corn salsa - wonderful!
author: Evelyn B.

description:
Came here this past weekend by accident. We were looking for a place to eat that was close to the club I was going to that night. saw this place and decided to go in. It was pretty pricey for food that wasn't really worth the price. But considering that it's in ghiradelli square and very touristy - i guess that explains the pricing. 

Had fish and chips and some clams. The sauce to the clams was extremely salty. The bread they brought us was cold. Fish and chips was alright, nothing too fancy about it.

i think the best part of the meal was the drinks we got. I enjoyed my ghiradelli chocolate mudslide very much :) and the customer service was great even though they forgot to give us utensils.
author: Carmen P.

description: Great food & Service but veggies slightly salty & sourdough tough... Good bartender Shannon...
author: Henry L.

description: Food was so so. Service really didn't match the price of the dinner. We asked for window or booth and didn't get it even though there was an opening. Asked for wine to be opened early and decanted and they didn't do it. They were setting up w a lot of noise next to us while we were trying to have out dinner.
author: Klaus G.

description: We stopped by for a late lunch and we had a table with great views of the water.   The service was fast and friendly.   The food was delicious!     The seafood cobb salad was fresh and packed with seafood.    We will definitely be back next time we are in SF.
author: Jacqueline W.

description:
M&K is my go-to lunch place when I play tour guide and have to dine near Fisherman's Wharf.  

The multi-tiered space is impressive with dramatic light fixtures and white clothed tables.  The view of the Bay is grand but it's mostly towards Alcatraz and Angel Island, with a peek of the Golden Gate Bridge.  The location at Ghiradhelli Square is easy to find, although you often have to dodge the mob lining outside the chocolate store.  There is even parking underneath.

Food is OK, with a large "safe" menu that caters to everyone.  My favorite for lunch is the enormous grilled salmon club sandwich, which is also one of the more reasonably priced items.  Stacked high with delicious salmon, bacon and a little too much bread.  Deconstruct it, eat the protein and save your carb intake for a glass or two of decent CA chardonnnay.  Service is generally fine, especially during lunch when it is not too busy.    

Location/Ambiance: 4 stars.  Food: 3 stars  Service: 3 stars
author: Yan L.

description:
Visited MCormicks & Kuletos 9/15.  Very disappointed in both the service and the food.
It took over an hour after seating to get our entrees served after following up with the waiter.  He said "the kitchen is backed up". But other parties who arrived after us already had entrees. 
The clam chowder was fine, my wife's salad was drowned in a vinegary dressing. Both our entrees were disappointing. Pacific snapper was overly covered with a bacon flavored sauce, the crab and pasta dish had at most 2 teaspoons of crab and the sauce was not appetizing.
Overall a very disappointing dinner.  Will not return.
author: Mike J.

description:
Went with the kids and in-laws for lunch after playing tourist at Pier 39 and Ghirardelli Square.

The place has a great view of Aquatic Park and the bay, and thanks to mother nature, a beautiful blue sky followed us wherever we went.

Funny story yo:

Me:  "hey grandma, check out the water down there, there's a seal swimming near shore (actually, it was swimmer).

GM:  "Oh, that's nice."

Me:  "HOLY SHITake, I THINK A SHARK JUST ATE THAT SWIMMER!!"

GM: "Oh, this is going to ruin my lunch, let's all move to a table without a view."

:|

Anywhos....I ordered the clam chowder and the iceberg wedge.  A few others in the party ordered soups also, and theirs all came but mine, and of course, our flippant waiter decided at that point to disappear.  I flagged down another waiter, told him to bust a move on my soup, and of course, my soup came (probably with some human excretions in it) with my entree.  So, I had to juggle both my app and my main dish in front of me on a table just the right size for our party - I was not happy.

My wedge was ok, the dressing a little runny, the bacon mediocre and the bleu cheese damn near extinct.  The wedge I had the night before at Jacks' in Pleasant Hill was far better. 

 I love Jake's in Portland, which, is owned by McCormick and Schmick (and M&K).  This experience didn't meet my expectations. The shark attack and the view were not enough to balance out the poor waiter and my tardy meal.

At least I got granny's dander up!!

Ya feel me??
author: Johnny L.

description: Solid seafood, but not as good as the original Jake's and McCormick & Schmick's in Portland.  I usually go for the stuffed salmon with shrimp, crab and brie cheese because it's the worst thing for your clogged arteries.  Their appetizers are always fresh, including the shrimp and crab cocktails, as well as the oysters.  Crab cakes are solid.  Pricey, but you get what you pay for.  The happy hour menu in the bar area is very reasonable and probably one of the best deals in town.
author: Gregory N.

description: From the greasy calamari to the tasteless shrimp scampi, overall a disappointing experience.
author: Jim G.

description:
I came here the other night for a going away dinner for one of my friends. We came on a Thursday so there was free parking galore, but oddly, the restaurant was still pretty busy.
I had the white clam linguini which was so-so, not bad but definitely not amazing. Though I do have to say that the white wine we chose paired wonderfully with the linguini, which definitely improved my dining experience.

Unfortunately our table was such that our view of the bay was obscured by another table and/or walls. But walking in there was a spectacular view of the water.

The service was a bit slow after we had initially been seated, but the waiter was friendly and tried to be as helpful as possible. 

I do have to say that the host could have been more friendly - myself and one other were the first of our party to arrive, so we checked in and were then asked to wait in the bar until the rest of our party arrived, which was fine, but when the rest of our party did arrive, a different host than the first was rather snippy with us because the rest of the party did not arrive until 10 minutes after our reservation time. I realize that restaurants want you to arrive on time, but sometimes things happen that are out of one's control. My point is that there's no reason to be rude to your customers just because they are late to their reservation time. Especially if PART of the party has already arrived.

To end on a more positive note now that my rant is done, this is really a gorgeous restaurant if you have a table that looks out on the water.
author: Claire L.

description:
We went to McCormick & Kuleto's for Christmas Dinner, and like the others that had experienced the mass chaos on the 25th, we had to wait over 40 minutes for our reservation.  The place definitely overbooked, as seen when the people who came in for a 7:15pm reservation were inquiring about their status at 7:45.  The host told us the wait was "10-15 minutes" which was an absolute lie given the way people were clustered around the entrance.  I'm sure many more people would have appreciated a little more honesty rather than having to sit and wait.

Once we sat down, you could tell our waiter was having a bad day and seemed like he was in a hurry to get us out.  Given that we came in towards the end of the night, my dad ordered the sole, only to find that it wasn't available.  The rest of us managed to get what we ordered.  I had the seared ahi tuna main dish, which was OK in that I've certainly had better.  I also had a glass of sirah, which was great.  

All in all, this place may be good on a non-Christmas day, but otherwise, you'd probably get faster service at the pizza joints around the wharf before here.
author: Lisa I.

description: Restaurant is at a great location, dining with beautiful views. Classy interior and excellent customer service. Food is delicious! I am impressed and satisfied with their food and service.
author: Emma M.

description: The views alone from this restaurant overlooking the bay is enough to give it 5 stars. I've been here for dinner and happy hour. All of their seafood selections for dinner have always been fresh and delicious. If making a reservation for dinner make sure to request a table by the window. I also love their happy hour. They have cocktail specials and a variety of happy hour deals that change occasionally. The fish tacos are always a good choice, their oysters are a great deal at $1 each, and for those that don't eat seafood they offer a full cheeseburger and fries for $5. Can't beat that in the area!
author: Sylvia W.

description:
Nothing more annoying than being asked if we have a reservation with the restaurant empty and telling us to wait to set a table when all the tables were set. Really...... staff needs to get a clue.
Food was mediocre at best, but the service was disappointing. The setting is nice, but not worth the disappointment. San Francisco offers too much to waste your time here.
author: Sherri P.

description: The food was rather tasteless. I ordered the swordfish which was meaty but not cooked well and had no flavor. My boyfriend ordered the salmon which was better but not great. The cocktails were nice. Not really worth the price. Although the ambiance and view are outstanding. The service is average. Nothing on the menu seemed outstanding or unique.
author: Tandis N.

description:
I went there with my client and his wife...we had a booth facing out looking at the Bay, unfortunately the weather wasn't cooperative, (foggy).  We were greeted and seated right away and the service was nothing short that fabulous!  The wine list was excellent, the food was great!  I started off with a bowl of clam chowder which was the best I've ever had...not too thick and not too watery either.  For my main dish, I had the Mahi Mahi with crusted macadamia nuts with plantains which was fabulous, I'm not much for seafood but this was awesome!  

Definitely will be going back there again!!!
author: Tony C.

description:
While I normally go to a place like McCormick & Kuleto's for their "Happy Hour Special", I came here for an impromptu dinner with two fine friends.  We marched past the happy hour folks at the bar, down those balcony steps, and into the main dining hall. The floor-to-ceiling windows opened out to an unobstructed view of the wharf and the bay.  Calling this a fancy place would be an understatement, considering all the well-dressed and more established-looking guests sitting at the other tables.  This place is kind of swank.

So we did what any semi-uncomfortable diners would do.  We ordered a bottle of their finest wine to pair with the four different types of raw oysters.  Next, we went for the buttery and surprisingly delicious plate of escargot (my first ever!).  For the main entrees, we got the sea scallops, the recommended sea bass, and a side of asparagus.  Keep in mind that the sea scallops come with pork.  Is that right?  As if the meal wasn't decadent enough, we topped off our meal with wedges of the cheesecake and pecan pie.

In the future, I wouldn't mind skipping the entrees and going straight for the desserts.  Everything else was good, but the sweets, oh! they were unbelievable!

In the realistic future, I'd come back here for the happy hour, order the cheeseburger, and split the pie with a friend.

There you have it.  The takeaway for the evening: the pie is aiight. (Happy Pi Day +0.01!)
author: Linda T.

description: Our gathering of friends and family really enjoyed this place.  My second visit to it.  Well prepared, excellent wait staff.  Food was good to outstanding,  My prawn cocktail appetizer was crisp succulent jumbo shrimp, with a really good sauce, followed by a mixed beet salad (good but I've had better), and then some sauteed diver scallops that were seared to perfection on a bed of buttered cauliflower puree.  The puree was really awesome though slightly underseasoned.  Two friends had ribeye steaks that they said were really great, another had a decadent looking wedge salad.  The view is spectacular of the San Francisco Bay and Alcatraz.  You almost feel like you are on a grand scale cruise ship, with the water glistening by your tableside.
author: David B.

description: The clam chowder at this place was amazing. Oysters, Jumbo Shrimp Scampi, Alaskan King Crab Legs were just as amazing. Patrick C. made the night fun, entertaining with great recommendations. He knew his food, wine and desserts! Thank you Patrick C for your service!
author: Kit T.

description:
I recently went here for a nice dinner with my parents because this restaurant, although in the heart of tourist central, always had the freshest seafood cooked to perfection and with stunning views over Aquatic Park and the San Francisco Bay. The wait staff is always professional and attentive and working hard to make your evening enjoyable. 

On this night both my dad and I had the Jumbo Shrimp Scampi Sauteed with white wine, garlic, roma tomatoes, lemon served or linguini. My dad and I agreed the shrimp was prepared perfectly and the linguini was good but this is a seafood restaurant serving pasta. I give this dish four stars and will try something else next time. 

My mom had the Hangtown Fry. This is Bacon and deep fried oysters over an omelet. After trying the meal and telling the waiter that she was not happy with her selection he removed it form the bill.

UPDATE: October, 2011
I came here with my girlfriend for the happy hour specials.
Great Fish Tacos for two $5.00
Big Cheese Burger (great) $ 3.00 (Amazing price!)
Fish Rockets (like Taquitos but fish) really tasty. $1.95
Mussels $4.95 good
Devil Egg $1.95 (2 eggs with caviar on top, yum!!) Totally worth it.
2 Anchor Steam Draft FULL PRICE $12.00
Total $ 33.00 

What a deal, we will be back for this.
author: Justin S.

description: I came here for dinner with friends and unfortunately not everyone enjoyed their meal and with good reason.  First off the drinks were great; the bartender poured well and made a good drink for all that ordered alcohol.  For those that ordered fish everyone enjoyed their fish, but it was good but not great.  This is where the rest was unhappy. For the 3 people that ordered steak, 2 of the steaks came out wrong, one was extremely rare when the person ordered it medium well and the other piece of meat was a little tough. All three ordered were filets.  I've been to other McCormick's and never had a bad meal, but after this experience I won't be going to the SF location.  We had 9 people in our party and many of them kept thinking we got 3rd tier chefs.  The only reason why I'm giving 3 stars is for the friendly and attentive staff and for the fish dishes.
author: Chris G.

description: Some straight up rude service with this bartender. I was just trying to ask what beers they have on tap. He just waved his hands towards their 10 beer taps without explaining what they still had. Like I could really read each one of the tiny labels on the handles from 20 feet away. O well decided to go to a different bar for drinks and appetizers where we could get some "actual" service.
author: R J.

description:
I organized a customer dinner here for 20 people in the Dolphin Room last week.
The staff were very easy to work with and very professional.

Everyone that attended the dinner was amazed by the views and the food was great.

Thank you to McCormick & Kuleto's for a great experience.
author: Elliot S.

description: On 09/10/16 myself and three family member chose to dine at this establishment.I found the restaurant to be very nice with great food. However, the service was absolutely terrible. My server (Alex), initially messed up my order  and did not include my Lobster Tail with my Filet Mignon . Once my Lobster was cooked and brought out by someone else she never bothered to apologize and never checked to see if we wanted/needed more water or cocktails. It was our intent to make a night of it so the additional cocktail could have easily meant another $60.00 in revenue towards our total bill. It appeared to me she though that her job was simply to serve the food and not "take care" of her guests and provide a pleasant dining experience.   We finished our meal and waited another 20 minutes at which time the server returned and asked if we wanted dessert. By this time I simply wanted to pay the bill with an 18% tip and leave (by the way I was overcharged for the "replacement Lobster"). On the way out, I expressed my dissatisfaction to the manager who seemed totally ambivalent to what took place.  The amazing thing is that in 2010 I came to this place for my birthday and the service was no better at that time they were known as McCormick & Schmidt. Given the the manger seemed not to care it is not surprising that his staff is lacking in their training. A word to the wise would be. San Francisco has many fine restaurants they provide exemplary service and a truly flawless dining experience. Please give ample thought to this review before choosing McCormick & Kuleto's.
author: Michael C.

description: Here's a tip don't go...the worst restaurant at fisherman's warth. The service is slow and horrible. The food is bad and the tap beer was warm.
author: Jim N.

description:
This is my absolute FAVORITE happy hour in SF because I feel like I'm getting away with murder.  I know the normal menu is so much more expensive $$$.

Happy Hour:

1. It has a phenomenal view of the water- you can see the golden gate bridge and marin across the way.

2. Happy hour food is $ and quality of food is A +++.

3. Service is great!

The happy hour is only in the bar area.

I usually get the $2.95 cheeseburger and fries with a drink.  Last night I went with my boyfriend.  He had $4.95 Curry Mussels and $4.95 Clams and a Stella.  I had the hummus plate (which is a lot of food for only $1.95)- fresh dish of hummus with olives and some diced tomatoes on top, served with toasted and cut up pita bread and sliced cucumbers.  I also had the chicken wings $3.95, and the drink special cosmo $3. 

Total bill for the two of us:  $27.

Every time I leave after eating at the happy hour, I feel bad for the people I see in the rest of the restaurant (probably tourists), that I know who are paying 3-5 x's more for their meal, as I leave satisfied having paid next to nothing in the same place.  I love McCormick & Kuleto's!
author: Kristina F.

description:
Went for happy hour, got a rude bartender, he was drunk too. He broke wine glasses, sent out bad drinks, spilt our drinks all over the table and didnt even notice. I ordered 1 chardonnay, mussels and clams. he accused me of ordering 2 chardonnays. He then spilt my friends beer and poured at least half my wine on the table. AND I STILL HAD TO PAY FOR IT

I waited for a good 20 minutes and my food NEVER came. I asked him how long the food took to come out and he said "how long do you want it to take? today? tomorrow? yesterday? now?" then accused me of NOT ordering anything.

The manager was no help all she said was you can sit somewhere else.I cant be everywhere at once.

BY FAR THE WORST EVER SERVICE IN MY LIFE.
author: Denyse Y.

description: Our dinner here was absolutely amazing, me and my wife both had the ribeyes and they were very delicious and cooked to our standards.  My wife ordered a drink that she didn't like and they replaced it with another w no charge.  Our waiter Aaron was great, he was funny, informative and even gave us pinpoint directions to a couple of spots we wanted to check out.  Top notch service, will definitely go back especially for the view.
author: Edward A.

description:
This place used to be good.  We've had Thanksgiving dinner here several times over the years and this past Thanksgiving will be our last.  To make a long story short:  The greeting staff was overwhelmed with the amount of people checking in for their reservations.  They took names and processed the next person and weren't directing people to the bar upstairs or to wait outside which resulted in a packed lobby area.  At one point a client came by to check on their status and they had been waiting for an hour!  We were seated about 45 minutes after we checked in (we were told our wait would be the customary 15 minutes).  

I ordered a seafood trio that consisted of salmon, halibut and crab cake with mashed potatoes. The salmon and halibut were overcooked and dry; the crab cake was the size of a sea scallop but really good.  We waited a little over a half hour before our collective orders to arrive.  What really put me off was our waiter.  He clearly did not want to work Thanksgiving night and I wish he didn't bother to come in.  

My sister commented on our way out: "What a waste."  Indeed.

Guess that really wasn't a very short story.  Sorry!


BBBBBBBBB       OOOOOOOOO      OOOOOOOOO       !!!!
BBBBBBBBBB   OOOOOOOOOO   OOOOOOOOOO     !!!!
BB               BB    OO                 OO    OO                  OO     !!!!
BB               BB    OO                 OO    OO                  OO     !!!!
BB               B       OO                 OO    OO                   OO    !!!!
BBBBBBBBB      OO                 OO    OO                  OO     !!!!
BB               B       OO                 OO     OO                 OO     !!!!
BB               BB    OO                  OO    OO                 OO     !!!!
BB               BB     OO                 OO    OO                 OO     !!!!
BBBBBBBBBB    OOOOOOOOOO   OOOOOOOOOO
BBBBBBBBB        OOOOOOOOO      OOOOOOOOO      !!!!


* For those keeping score - I definitely lost my high-pro glow from Buena Vista before my dinner arrived.
author: Ron M.

description:
I will say these positive things: The service is very friendly and the views are very pleasant. But this is a tourist joint to the nth degree. The menu is deliciously deceiving, with its intricate, exotic-yet-localized descriptions of savory fish dishes and superb dessert and wine pairings. But the actual meals? Meh. I suppose this is the kind of thing you can get away with in the out-of-towner part of town, though.

I had the mahi-mahi with fried plantains and mango salsa (if you could call it that), and I left wishing I had ordered something way less dry. I also had a taste of the scallops, and I hate to say it, but they were a bit rubbery. The desserts were slightly better, though I wished the chocolate torte had had more of an orange bent to it, as was advertised. Too bad, because they've got a great spot in Ghirardelli Square.
author: Stefanie L.

description:
Normally, we don't make a trip down to Fisherman's Wharf to have dinner, especially on a sunny and mild Saturday in the summer.  But we had a $50 gift certificate to use by the end of this month, and decided make the trip in and play tourist.  After penetrating through the traffic through the Wharf, and snagging a parking spot, we checked into the restaurant, were seated in a booth facing the Aquatic Park, and a view of Alcatraz.  With the beautiful weather and the clear view of the Bay, the hassle of getting into the Wharf was a long gone memory.  Ordered a Widmar Hefeweisen and enjoyed  the view.  Would have been happy with this without dinner.

Haven't been here in 12 years, and after reading some of the Yelp reviews, my expectations were guarded.  We started out with the Caesar salad and a bowl of steamed mussels in a red curry sauce.  The leaves of the salad fresh, not wilted, and the dressing coated them without being goopy.  Nice hint of anchovies and garlic, and shave Parmesan and Romano.  The mussels were excellent, especially the curry sauce.  The sauce was coconut based, with bits of garlic and fresh basil.  Didn't over power the mussels, and had a slight kick to it.  So good, I spooned up the sauce.

For entree, my wife ordered wild salmon with pesto and a corn cake.  I had halibut cheeks with risotto and caramelized pearl onions.  Good sized portions.  The salmon was very red, very firm (not dry), and very tasty.  The corn cake was light like a souffle, studded with corn.  My halibut cheeks were also very tender.  Risotto was very creamy with a slight citrusy taste to it.  Overall, my course was pretty rich, but very tasty.

We were too full for dessert, and since it was still light, we decided to walk around the Wharf to continue our date-nite without the kids.
author: Steve L.

description: The service was prompt, and the view was great. They had a decent wine list. The good stopped there. The steaks were tough, overcooked, and under seasoned. The vegetables were bland, cold, and undercooked. The fish was obviously frozen, and it was all bland and flavorless. Definitely not worth the price - by far.
author: Mike J.

description: My company holiday party was celebrated here and it was a treat. :-)  I had the Caponata Stuffed Conchiglioni Rusticella D'abruzzo Shells. Everyone complimented the food, as it looked amazing and was delicious. My bosses apparently take people here to wine and dine, as our company is only a convenient few blocks away. The view is incredible as the restaurant on the East side is all windows and overlooks the bay, Alcratraz, and the Golden Gate Bridge. I'd definitely go back.
author: Mindy T.

description: The steak was absolutely delicious. My wife had the mushroom ravioli and said that was fantastic too.  Couldn't give it 5 stars because sometimes the service was a little lacking with refilling drinks but when they needed to correct my order, they did so without any hesitation or attempting to make me feel bad. I would definitely return.
author: Matt U.

description: Desperately looking for a good place in San Francisco we asked our concierge where to go for dinner he suggested this restaurant. Upon arrival the restaurant is beautiful and has a great view. However ordered a crab cake and it was good but included a very hard portion of rib from the crab. Restaurant did nothing to take care of this, still charge me full price. Stuffed salmon was ordinary at best and my husband's scallops were paired with vegetables that did not work. Waiter was missing in action most of the evening and ended up spending way too much money for the food provided. Bottom line do not go here the view was not worth the ticket price.
author: Liana S.

description:
I like the overall vibe of the restaurant. It's nice and relaxing and has a nice view of the bay. Surprisingly not crowded ft thanksgiving.

I ordered the mahi mahi and it was pretty decent. Not the best fish I've tasted. I tried some of the top sirloin and it was nice and juicy. It tasted awesome with a side of mashed potatoes. And I liked the side of vegetables.

Dessert menu wasn't impressive. I'd recommend going outside to the ghirarrdeli ice cream shop.
author: Camilla G.

description: I had to let everyone in on this... get the crab cakes you will not be disappointed. I am a crab cake fanatic and order them on the regular and these crab cakes were to.die.for.
author: Liz B.

description:
WHAT A MAJOR DISAPPOINTMENT!!!

Ten years ago, this was one of my favorite places for seafood in SF because of the elegant atmosphere, competent service, expansive bay views and lots of fresh seafood to choose from.

Today I took mom for a birthday lunch and things just went from mediocre to "oh well, I know I won't ever be coming back here again".

1. On arrival, we were greeted by a Danny Bonaduce look alike and equally obnoxious "Hey guys, come on down".

2. The unfriendly, unhappy, unsmiling little hostess robotically led us to our table and unconvincingly told us to "enjoy your meal" without ever making eye contact.

3. We started with some KJ Chardonnay (always a winner) and the broiled green mussels appetizer. Nice presentation but wasted on our palates.  I've eaten better mussels at a hot dog stand.

4. Mama had the Atlantic salmon which was good but served with new potatoes.  Who the hell still serves new potatoes except in prisons or cheap wedding receptions at the local Motel 6?!  Slap that piece of fish on a bed of sauteed spinach with some garlic mashed underneath, period!!

5. I had the Alaskan halibut which for $27.00 should melt in my mouth!!  I cook better fish than this insipid piece of Gortons styrofoam on my plate and I'm not good at cooking fish. Oh and it also came with some scalloped new potatoes, some spinach and balsamic reduction.  Who the hell told this chef to put balsamic reduction on a piece of fish?  And why the hard on with these friggin' potatoes?  

6. During our meal, we had the pleasure of overhearing Danny Bonaduce's twin tell one of the staff that he was going to do an In and Out burger run.  Not a bad idea.  I'll give you $20 bucks to go fetch me a double double with fries and you can keep the change to buy yourself a new shirt without any armpit stains.

7. At this point, we decided to forego any dessert or espresso and just enjoy our conversation and company instead.

8. The service was the only positive about the restaurant.  Competent and capable, the guy reminded me of Rollie Fingers (Google it to find out why) and he did his job well.

Anyway, for now I'll just keep enjoying my gf's sea bass steamed with white wine, butter and lemon or head over to Capannina per un buon pesce!!

I just thought of one more thing as I write this; last year we dined at Kuleto's on Powell with some friends from Paris (France y'all, not Texas) and it sucked as well.  Not even the service merited a pat on the back.  I'm thinking that SF is somewhat overrated about the whole food scene.  It reminds me of a recent episode of Top Chef where this cocky young kid from SF with apparently "extensive family history in the restaurant business" totally choked when trying to make chicken piccata.
author: Anthony D.

description:
Dec 27, 2014:

Saturday afternoon, there was a one hour wait for a table at Scomas, so my wife, I and another couple decided to go to M&C for lunch.  M&C was about half full so no problem getting a table with a great view of SF bay.  The fried squid appetizer was good. Two of us ordered the cioppino, my favorite, and my wife ordered the grilled sturgeon. 
The food quality and quantity is certainly not as good as my previous visits.  Both bowls of cioppino were identical and included the two small back legs from a dungeness crab, and only one leg section had enough crab meat to even open up and eat.  They did provide us a large shell cracker, but there wasn't anything to use it on.  Each cioppino also contained two shrimp, one small very overcooked scallop, five mussels, and many small chunks of white fish.  The soup part was scarce and noticeably thinner and runnier than on previous occasions. Typically there is so much in the bowl that I have difficulty finishing this dish, but today I had no trouble.  My wife's sturgeon was a really small piece of fish, about 4 1/2 in long, 1 in wide, and about 1/2 in thick, and was served with a small portion of broccoli.  Each dinner item was around $30.  The service was very good and wait times were fine.  Well, I learned a lesson, next time I will get a reservation at Scomas, and will not return to M&C.


Previous Review, March 2014
Great seafood, friendly good service, reasonable prices, good bar, and the most spectacular view of S F bay, Alcatraz, and lots of boats. It's a little pricey, but it's certainly worth it. I've eaten there about 5 or 6 times, and always had a good experience.
author: Mike S.

description:
Oh the joys of Single Awareness Day!  I didn't want to be sitting at home, moping on Valentine's Day, and I was reluctant to drink the loneliness away too.  So my sister and I got all dressed up and headed to McCormick & Kuleto's.  

There is a large myriad of fresh fish on the menu, which they just got in that morning.  However, we had a hard time finding an item on the menu that just really sounded great when it came to the combination of the fish and the sauce or the way it was prepared.  

We ended up sharing an entree of grilled swordfish with a chipotle butter, along with two appetizers: red curry mussels and crab and shrimp cakes.  The crab cakes were small, and I felt like they were cheating a little when I read that there was also shrimp in it but I was proven wrong when it came out.  It was full of fresh crab, very little shrimp, and came with a very good red pepper aioli.  The mussels were also delicious, in a thai-style red curry.  The fish was a little dry and dense on the outsides, but was much better testing on the inside.  The potatoes that came with the fish were delicious, but the green beans were undercooked.  The patty of chiotle butter was absolute amazing.  I had to try really hard not to eat the whole chunk.  Lucky for me, my sister took care of it for me!    (Pictures of each dish uploaded.)

The waiter was very pleasant, and he didn't act rushed, despite the fact that it was Valentine's day.  Atmosphere -- a little crowded, but they have huge windows with great views.  Overall, my sister and I had a very enjoyable experience.  It made the 5mph traffic to the city that night worth it.
author: Carol L.

description:
I am tempted to give them five stars just to balance out some of the idiot reviewers who give them one star for stupid reasons that have nothing to do with the quality of the food or service, but honesty prevents me from doing that because the honest answer is "Yay! I'm a fan" not "WooHoo!, As good as it gets". There ARE better seafood restaurants in San Francisco, but it isn't a big list and few have as nice a view and setting.

I have always enjoyed their fresh oysters, they get a good variety and present them well.

I also love that they print their menu daily and the fish is always incredibly fresh and well prepared. I usually choose a fresh fish and get it grilled if it will grill well or sauteed, if it isn't a good grilling fish. 

They usually have interesting sides like sweet potato fries, mac n cheese with truffles and such that are good.

For desert, despite the fact that I am in Ghirardeli Square, I usually go for a cheese plate since they get some incredible cheeses from the local area.
author: Scott M.

description: First the good,  Our food was good. I had an asian fish dish that was very good.  My husband had a petite fillet and our other guest had a fish dish.  We shared the macaroni and cheese and spinach, both were really good.   Our waiter was nice,very comfortable and accommodating. Truly a good experience, not over the top great but good.  I would definitely go back BUT, I would make sure that I was not sitting by the kitchen door in the back part of the dining room.  This is a room that needs some attention to make it flow with the front room.  If you go, and you should, Do Not let them sit you back here.  Also, there were three people at the hostess stand when we left and not one of them looked up to say Good Night to us.  I just don't get that .  It's really rather rude.  Who knows, maybe something more important was going on other than saying good night to customer's that just spent hundreds of dollars to dine with you.  I'm not sure how difficult it is to raise your head and say good night especially when I said "Good night, Have a nice night"  Maybe the manager was off tonight.
author: Louanne S.

description:
I took my parents here for mothers day. It was apparently their "busiest day of the year", but we lucked out with a table with a view of the aquatic bay without any wait time!

I enjoyed their crab cake and lobster bisque. 

I also liked this drink called "Hot Paloma". It's mezcal w jalapeño.
author: Jason Z.

description:
Fabulous water view of the GGB, North Bay, Alcatraz and beyond.  The reason for the 3rd star!  Service was average.  Food was just ok.

Dozen oysters - Variety of 4, they were so so
Wedge salad - standard/good
Shrimp Scampi was mediocre  

Food wasn't TDF.  But again, did I mention the view?
author: Meredith K.

description:
I read the reviews and the overall 3 star rating,  and wasn't excited about trying this place out BUT I was blown away in a positive way.  The waterfront views are amazing, especially on a clear day - you can see alcatraz, the muni pier, the USS jeremiah and the gorgeous blue waters.  There is a private dining area downstairs with a separate entrance which is great for swanky soirees.  

This was a girls' night out and we had dinner on a Tuesday night - the place did get busy BUT probably not as bad as on weekends so I think our service levels we received may have been better than the other reviewers.  Our server Bert was on top of his game, we got a window seat with a view of the bay, and the food was deelish.  The entire staff was pretty attentive - filled water glasses, refills on bread basket, and the GM Toby even came out to say hello towards the end of our meal and offered dessert recommendations which were spot on.  

 For appetizers we had the calamari, the hearts of palm/strawberry/kiwi salad, and the beet salad.  I would recommend all 3.  We also tried the mac and cheese (super cheesy and rich), exotic mushroom (lots of different mushrooms sauteed together), and pesto gnocci sides - all were divine.  The clam chowder was really fresh.  Our entrees included mahi mahi crusted with macademia, sword fish and the 8 oz filet mignon (these shrink a lot so get the larger size if you are not sure).  We all liked our entrees but we had a lot of appetizers and sides, and wanted to save room for dessert SO we ate half of our entrees and  got to go boxes.  The portion size is okay - it's not really small but you may need to order a side or a dessert to get full.  The clear winner for dessert was the banana cream pie with toffee.  We also tried the coffee creme brule, and the pecan pie but the best of the desserts was the banana cream pie.  I can't wait to go back!!. 

 It is good for a business meal or special occasion.  The appetizers averaged $8 to $12, the entrees ranged from $16 to $35, the sides ranged from $5 to $10, and the desserts were around $7.  Seafood was fresh and they had grilled options for those trying to eat healthier.  I had to spend 2 hours at the gym the next day to help burn off some of the calories but it was worth it!

With the America's cup coming up, this is definitely the place to be to get good views and great food simultaneously.  It sounds like service can be spotty so i understand why others would review it lower but we had a great experience and I hope to be equally enthusiastic when I return again.
author: Bebe W.

description:
Happy Hour - Monday through Friday from  3 - 6 is probably the only reason why I would come to this tourist trap. 
 
While the Happy Hour selection is quite limited and there's a $2.50 requirement for drinks per a person, the food is good, NOT great. But really what can you expect from food that's all under $5? I was probably most impressed with the $1.95 burger and garlic sweet potato fries. The spicy ahi tuna roll tasted old. The mussel and clams were as big as my thumb nail. And if you're looking for good service, you're not going to find it here. At least not from my waitress.  

BTW, I've been here for dinner before, besides the view, it's nothing special.
author: Adrianna C.

description:
I usually don't like to splurge for lunch at a chain restaurant and McCormick & Kuleto's totally proved me right:

-Very cocky server. Like he knew there would be gratuity on the bill so he half assed his service and was a little too harsh on this humor. Helloooo, there are children at this table. 

-We requested another table away from the kitchen door. It's difficult to have a good time when we hear the staff talking crap about the people sitting at the tables or about each other. Isn't this supposed to be a classy place?

-The hostess gave us eye contact when we left but didn't say a word. No farewell, no thanks for stopping by, just looked back down at her menu (playing sudoku or something)

Seriously it was not busy for lunch and there was no one at the hostess stand when we left. People here need to smile more. Sheesh. 

At least the food was decent.
author: Steph C.

description: The downtown San Jose location is a lot better.  The cocktails were good, thus the 2 stars.  I highly do not recommend the crab cakes especially if you like the traditional method of cooking it.  There was no crunch to it, just a mushy texture in which I found hard to consume.  It was like eating a tuna fish sandwich minus the bread.  The view is nice and the waiters were pleasant.  My breaded sole was just blah as well.  We got the incorrect bill, and it took a while to straighten out and recalculate.  Worst off we left without getting our credit card back.  Had to return the following day and parking is horrible in that area, and it took about 10 minutes to retrieve the credit card as well.  This was definitely my last and only time to this location.
author: Mary T.

description: Food was pretty good the view was awesome!  Went with another family they were pretty goods with the kids, even brought an extra seat for the dolls our girls had.  The mash potatoes and the pesto gnocchi were very good.  The 6oz steak was very well done although not seasoned.
author: John C.

description: Went here for dinner on a weekday while traveling in the area with a small group. We all enjoyed our meal very much. Most of us had seafood but I was able to taste the steak which was great. Is this the best restaurant in town? No probably not. But for the location, good service (albeit it was not busy) the prices were good, drinks and food were very good. One note though, while I'm sure their desserts are just fine, Ghirardelli Square is the location, get dessert there!
author: Paul T.

description: My girlfriend and I arrived 15 minutes early for our 8:45pm reservation, after waiting for 20 minutes we politely checked on our table, where the man at the front desk assured us it would only "be a few minutes." Another 20 minutes go by when a random employee asked if we had been helped yet. He heard our situation and prompted the irritated workers to finally seat us. We sat down and ordered our food and drinks kindly and immediately as we were hungry and 45 minutes behind our reservation at this point. 15 minutes go by where the waiter passed us multiple times and never brought water or bread. Realizing that we were close to spending $100 on our meal, we decided the service was no where near where we had hoped it would be. We had been saving our money from our minimum wage jobs to get dressed up and have a nice meal. What a disappointment. We left our table (an hour into this nightmare) and spoke with two men at the front desk. We expressed our frustration and disappointment when they replied "yeah, sorry, have a great night. Bye." Incredibly disappointed, we walked down the street to the Blue Mermaid where we were treated as humans again. We will NEVER recommend anyone come to this place and waste your time or money. Unless you want to feel as if you are a waste of their time.
author: Nick L.

description:
It was cute for the fact that my boyfriend took me to an Italian place. But it was not good on how the food taste. We got the mushroom ravioli- there were 6 of them for $30. 6 ravioli for $30... REALLY? Who knew? It was pretty over priced and we were still hungry after spending $70 on this meal...
I know it's suppose to be romantic and classy, but the only light that was in the room were the candles and the dim lighting. Can barely see. 
The service is really good though, and the wait is not that long even if you made reservation because the restaurant is really big.
author: DANA L.

description:
Had my wedding reception here, and was very appreciative of the service provided. The food was great and the views amazing!
Thank you Linda, for making my reception wonderful! I give you SIX stars!!
author: Michele A.

description: I have to admit being completely shocked by other recent reviews of this restaurant, as they seem pretty negative. I have only been here twice - the first time was five years ago, and then again this past weekend. Each time, I've been pretty impressed, treated with such great customer service, and had a great dining experience. The food is incredible, and the views are beautiful. It was romantic date night for me, and the staff provided exactly what I asked for. I really like this place and highly recommend it!
author: Terry D.

description:
We chose McCormick & Kuleto's for our day-after Valentine's Day dinner because my partner's company threw a dinner party there and gave each employee $20 gift card. After reading prior reviews on Yelp with 3 1/2 stars from nearly 350 reviews, I had my reservations intact.

We originally had a 745pm reservation made on Opentable.com and when we arrived 30 min. earlier than scheduled, they seated us promptly (+1 point). Only problem was that, our seats wasn't facing (or even near) the window seats with the views that were raved about in the Yelp reviews. We were placed in a table that FACED diners with views of the SF Bay, literally. Instead of being seated across from each other, we were given a rectangular table with a bench on one side as the only option, forcing us to side BESIDE each other (-1 point), while watching the people with the view eat. Awkward.

After reviewing the menu and placing our appetizer orders, I went to the restroom and on my way back, I had spotted a couple having finished with dinner and ask a passing waiter if we can take that spot. He gave me the reassuring wink and said for me to "wait a few minutes while if it's available". Even before I made my way back to my original bench/chair, I saw a new couple being seated at the recently vacant table. I was just starting to accept our seat arrangements, when the couple from the table across from us stood and left. Now I knew that I had to make my move. The waiter remembered and had us promptly moved into the table with chairs on opposite ends. (+1). (score is even)

We started with the appetizers: steamed manila clams and dungeness crab cake. The clams were seasoned just right but we found the crab cakes to be swimming in too much oil (they say it was the lemon butter sauce) that drowned out the flavor (-1). The crispy parsnips in the crab cakes added texture, as well. 

For the main meal, I had the Sacramento Delta Sturgeon and my dinner partner had the Macadamia Nut Crusted Mahi Mahi. I found the Sturgeon to be meatier (a bit tough) than what I had expected; texture reminded me of an old tire. (-1). I enjoyed the fact that the sturgeon was bacon crusted and the ghnocchi that came with my meal was soft and delightful, as well as the sugar snap peas being cooked perfectly al dente. I had only a small taste of the mahi mahi, but I remembered the combination of guava and manga sauces and how it complimented the fish. (+1)

Since we had eaten like kings with two appetizers and entree plates the size of medium pizza pans, we opted out of dessert. For an upscale restaurant with picturesque views, the price was expected: bill came to $100 (w/tax and tip incl). Considering that all four appetizer and entree dishes consisted of seafood, it was a fair price (+1).

Final tally: +1. Not likely to come back here any time soon.

Suggestions:

I'd like to see less butter sauce used in the crab cakes and the sturgeon could have been softer in texture and instead of tasting as fishy as the hold of a derelict tuna boat.
