Fix the awkward seating arrangements. Diners do not want to sit beside each, but rather across from each other.
author: Carloalexi M.

description:
I would give this place 3.5 stars. I'm only going to comment on the happy hour which might be one of the cheapest in the city. $2 and $3 appetizers and $3-$5 dollar drinks are great. Plus you can't beat the view. The restaurant is basically right near the water and has a nice view of the Bay, the Golden Gate Bridge and Marin. 

So what brings it down your ask? To be honest I'm not sure. Maybe its just that the place is so nice, you expect things, i.e. the food, to be better and they aren't. Maybe because its next to Ghridella Square, the place feels like a high class tourist trap or a glorified Olive Garden. I'm going to have to go back for dinner and then revisit my review to see if anything has changed. stay tuned.
author: Lenneal G.

description: My husband and I made reservations for this restaurant for Valentine's Day. Our reservations were for 3:45 p.m.  It normally takes an hour to get to SF from our home in the east bay.  That particular day, the bay bridge was a mess and it took us two additional hours. We called the restaurant at 3:40 and spoke with a woman that said not to worry, they'd been getting many calls from people stuck on the bridge. They moved our reservation to 4:15. They said if we were going to be later than that, to give them a call.  We called again at 4:10 and told them we were close but we're at least 30 minutes away.  They said no problem, and to just come in.  We got there at 4:50.  A man up front said he'd given our table away and could not hold it.  My husband was ready to leave but I said absolutely not and asked for the manager.  I told the manager that we had called three times and twice they told us not to worry and reset the time and then the last time just said to come in. I said I would understand had we been told that one of the times we called but they never said that until we got there.  The manager said he'd seat us and to wait 20 min.  We were seated within 10 minutes at a table right by the window with a beautiful view.  We had to wait 40 minutes before someone took our order and we had to find a server. A server told us that our server had not shown up for work yet and they'd have to find us a server.  My advice, don't go on any day of celebration or holiday.  The food was great though.
author: Deborah S.

description:
I enjoyed my visit here, I liked it.

Came here on fourth of July for a late lunch early dinner. They had a promotion on their lobster $20 but the lobster was a bit dry and barely had any meat. But my boyfriend didn't mind because it was $20 (where the heck can you get lobeter for 20 bucks?!). I had the filet mignon which I enjoyed and the veggies they used were tasty. 

The restaurant itself was really nice, surrounded by windows so no matter where you sat you had the view of the ocean. =)

Since it was the fourth, they only had reserved seating after 6pm (we got there at 5:45) but the front desk manager was kind enough to sit us at a table and told us to not get caught sitting at a reserved table. I don't think it was a big deal for us to sit since it was pretty dead in the restaurant. (However, it could be because they were waiting on the guests who were reserved). But it was nice that they still sat us and were kind about it.

Best part ? Their samples for wine tasting. Three full glasses (not samples) came in this cool looking tree that sat in the middle of the table and it only cost $12! 

I'd definitely come back to dine again!
author: Kat S.

description:
Call me a tourist, call me whatever, I don't care - I love McCormick & Kuleto's.  Four years ago, my boyfriend and I had our first date here, and several more after.  Three years ago, when we had to move back to the east coast, we had dinner here for our last night in San Francisco.  Two years ago, we had after-dinner desserts here on our first visit back to the city, and upon leaving we walked right out to the bay and what-do-you-know, he popped the question.  Right there in front of the restaurant.  So of course, it makes sense that when we went back to SF for our anniversary, our last stop would be here.

Would you believe it, but they remembered us?  I honestly don't know how or what kind of magic records they keep, but the host sat us at our favorite "first date" table and he mentioned seating us there almost FOUR YEARS AGO.  Amazing.  My mouth hung open for a full three-five minutes. The menu, which they change and print each day, had "Happy 1st Anniversary" across the top since I mentioned it when making the reservation.   Our waiter sent us an amazing dessert on the house to celebrate.  The staff went way beyond good customer service, and we were so touched and impressed by how special they made us feel.

Now, onto the review.  Service was great the entire night - our water glasses were always full, the food came out quickly, and our waiter had great recommendations for food and wine. I tried the halibut special and my husband tried the scallops special.   Since the menu changes so frequently, I'm not going to go into details about the dishes, but the food was pretty darn good.  Not A+ but a solid B.  For dessert we tried the chocolate box, which has been on the menu forever and is totally delicious.  

The views were awesome as always.  I can't think of another restaurant in the city that offers such fabulous panoramic views of the bay.  Despite the proximity to Fisherman's Wharf, the decor inside is upscale and there's absolutely no hint of "tourist district" anywhere.  Not a cheesy ship's wheel or 3-D crab in sight.  Very tasteful.

All in all, this is a special restaurant and I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a nice night out in the city for any occasion.  Have realistic expectations about the food (it's not Gary Danko) and I think you'll be happy with the experience.
author: Kristen W.

description:
The view from the restaurant was gorgeous.  The killer was the 1 star service.  I won't comment on the mediocre food because the service left a really bad taste in my mouth.  

I wanted to dine here because I heard good things through my yelp friends who attended the Yelp Elite Event.  So I made reservations at 7:15pm but we got there an hour early and requested a table by the window.  The host assured us that we would get a table by the window when our entire party arrived.   Fair enough.  So we waited at the bar, had drinks and appetizers.  When our entire party of three was present, I reminded the host to seat us by the window.  Unfortunately he decided to escort me through the entire restaurant only to tell me he could not put us at the table by the window EVEN THOUGH I pointed out to him the 3 vacant tables by the window.  We were so irritated!!

Needless to say, we went somewhere else for dinner that evening and we will not waste our money at this restaurant ever again.
author: Hannah C.

description: This place sucked. Menu on door said drink specials on back. After sitting down they say there are no drink specials. Ordered local draft beers only to have waitress come back and say bar is closed for remodel and no beers on tap!!  How don't you know this BEFORE taking an order. Oh and we were only table at bar so it wasn't busy either.  there is a better bar underneath this place!!
author: Josh G.

description: Always a good time and the fish is surprisingly fresh and cooked to pefection.  I haven't been in years but the views are gorgeous and they are located in Ghirardelli Square.  Although the food is good, service is okay and overall experiences not very memorable.
author: Shiho F.

description:
We held a large (90 person) rehearsal dinner for my son's wedding, at McCormick & Kuleto's. Everything was excellent. Linda and Susan, the event coordinators, were great, always there when I called, or returned my call immediately. In addition, they had very helpful suggestions for the event. The staff and service during the dinner were excellent. Thanks Jackie (event captain), for being so responsive.
Everybody at the party praised the food. I can't finish, without mentioning the venue. The views are spectacular, and that immediately creates an ambiance and festive mood for the party.
author: Anna L.

description:
We've taken out of town guests here or shared special occasions like birthdays and graduations here.  It's the best place to treat your guests or yourself when you're feeling a bit touristy and are in the Ghiradelli Park area.

They do not fail in delivering delicious and fresh seafood.  They have a variety of ways they prepare it both traditional and fusion-style.  

As for ambiance, the high ceilings with beautiful Tiffany-style lightings, big bay windows overlooking the bay gives you breath-taking views.

Service is always wonderful here.  If you have a special occasion, they even type up your celebrant and the occasion on the menu for you to take home as a remembrance.

We've ordered the Chilean sea bass with mango salsa on potato risotto, halbut wrapped in puff pastry with huckleberry sauce, mango mustard snapper, crab louis salad, shrimp scampi, scallops and pork belly, oysters from their raw bar, and clam chowder....all were very delicious. 

Their menu changes frequently with what they can find fresh, so just come with a hungry tummy - I think anything you order will just be delicious!

Be mindful you're in the touristy area of SF - so you will be paying a lot...but it's okay to splurge once in awhile.
author: JJAMZ C.

description:
For special events, this is definitely a happenin' place.  

I've been here for 2 - a YEE and an engagement party, and the hor d'oeuvres have been awesome every time.  I've had shrimp cocktail, bacon-wrapped scallops, stuffed mushrooms, salmon, and prime rib here.  My favorite dish was actually the stuffed mushrooms.  They were so flavorful!

Service was good and what I would expect for the price range of the restaurant, but it didn't blow me away.  I think that's why I didn't give McC&K the 5th star -- food, service, decor were all above average and great, but there was nothing notably unique/distinguishing that set it apart from restaurants of its caliber  (e.g. lobster white truffle mac n cheese at Circa or deep fried green beans at Coco500).

That being said though, I'd recommend this place for a special event and still consider it a safe & secure bet as far as delivering good food and service.

They also make pretty tasty and well spiced Bloody Mary's --and I've had enough to comment on a good Bloody!

I'd definitely want to come back here and try a full meal!
author: Alice C.

description: We have been coming here for at least 10 years for special occasions and have never had a bad experience. It is perfect for parties of 6-8 because they have large round tables right by the windows with a wonderful view of the bay and golden gate. We always make a reservation. It is not cheap to dine here but the food is wonderful. I had seared ahi tuna last night that melted in my mouth and the portion was generous. The service was perfect and everyone else also loved their meal. The reason we keep coming back is not just the nice decor, view and food. We enjoy being able to carry on a conversation in a normal voice and hear everyone at the table without a problem.
author: Rosanne C.

description: Nice place in ghiradelli square to hv happy hour! Food was very good, prices reasonable...I would come back next time in the area.
author: Carol L.

description: Great happy hour. We came early at 4 and dealt with minimal crowd. The bartender was really nice and took time to go over the beers with us. The place has a great view of the bay.
author: Nathan H.

description:
Food = good
Service = great
Prices = pricey
Seating = plentiful, and comfortable.

Unfortunately, we could feel the vibe of tourists here... sorry, but it's true.  

We were only here for a special occasion...let's keep it that way.
author: Fannie S.

description: HORRIBLE Service at its best! Reservation for 7PM means nothing, and crappy seats to top it off. Food was Ok, a little above average! I don't recommend this place. I agree with all other yelps reviewers who gave this place a 1 star review. I had to reduce 20 percent tip to 10 percent, it would have been $0.00 if it wasn't for New Years Eve!
author: Mearedey T.

description:
I came here for brunch and had a great time. The views were great especially since it was a warm, sunny day. There was so much food and wine devoured it's a little hard to remember everything I stuffed into my mouth..but from what I do remember I had the...
-crab
-oysters
-eggs benedict (heard the eggs florentine was good too)
-salmon
-prime rib
-some sort of cheese pastry
-sweet crepes
-bruschetta
-deviled eggs

whoa.. listing the food sure looks like a lot but I enjoyed every min of it. I'd definitely come back and check out the happy hour..
author: Raquel T.

description: Ambiance is great, but the food it just so mediocre. I feel like I leave an arm and a leg every time I go here but still am not satisfied. Great to try out for one time on a special date, but not a place I'd want to go to every weekend.
author: Denis G.

description:
Some reviewers did not enjoy their time at McCormick's, but I had a perfectly delectable time eating a culinary seafood masterpiece several birthdays ago.  I cannot remember what it was specifically beyond a very tender fish, but it was layered, fine tasting and gobbled up quick.

Years before that, when I was still a young'n, my dad took my sister and me here while in SF during Fleet Week, and I got a shrimp sandwich of some sort.  At that point, I still believed that all shrimp were to be breaded, like prawns at a Chinese food restaurant, so when that wasn't the case (and they were still cold to boot), I wasn't satisfied.  But in retrospect, I would love that dish.

It ain't no Denny's for several reasons: the food is not traditional, it's more expensive, it's largely seafood and there's a great bay view right out the window.  If those attributes can satisfy you like they did me, you will enjoy eating here.
author: Garett T.

description:
Came here for a great dinner last night. Used open table at 900pm and was able to be seated right away.  Each item were well prepared and cooked on point...our menu choices were.
Dungeness Crab, Mango and Avocado Tower with Chive and Citrus Essences.................................17.95
Escargot with Parsley Garlic Butter, Bouchee Pastries ..........................................................................11.45
Sacramento Delta Sturgeon Neuske's Applewood Bacon Crusted
Fricassee of English and Sugar Snap Peas, Potato Gnocchi and Sherry Brown Butter Sauce ................31.50
Alaskan Halibut
Wrapped in a Crispy Crepe with Crab Shrimp Mousse, Leek Blanquette, Wild Huckleberry Sauce ......33.95
Maine lobster salad.........24.95
Melon soup with lemon sorbet.....i forget
and another icecream desert i forget
Dinner for four ppl $191 w/o tip thats with two absinthe cocktails too.. ha
YUMs!    4/5 judochops!
author: Dustin G.

description: Spectacular sunset view.  Cozy ambiance.  But it was the food that drew me in, attracted my taste buds, and kept me coming back for more.
author: Kit P.

description: We really wanted it to be a great experience to celebrate Christmas, but the majority of us left disappointed.  Perhaps our expectations were too high to think that a Fisherman's Wharf restaurant could offer panoramic views and good food (especially given the $$$ prices - more about that later).  Steak and prime rib cuts were tough.  Salmon and scallop dishes were overcooked.  The people who ordered cioppino seemed to be the only ones satisfied as they cleaned off their plate - but maybe that's because they were starving given how long we had to wait for our food.  Granted, we had a large party and you try to cut them some slack but then this is a restaurant and it should be prepared for a large holiday crowd (both on the floor and in the kitchen).  Surprised to arrive to find a Christmas menu that was about 30% of what was available on the regular dinner menu.  Also surprised that the restaurant jacked up the prices for the holiday menu items.  The waiter tried to make the best of the situation but there was only so much he could do by himself when he has so many other tables to attend to.  He provided service with a smile.  Too bad everything else fell far short.
author: Will L.

description:
I don't get the 3 stars... yes, this place can be full of tourists and if I was living in almost any other city in the US I might say it's a bit overpriced, but despite that I really enjoy McCormick & Kuleto's. 

I've been a few times for lunch and brunch but never dinner. 

The view can't be beat - the service is attentive - there's not usually much of a wait if any.

For food and drinks, I highly recommend:
+ the Salmon club. WOWZERS that thing is good...
+ Fish & Chips
+ any of the $5 brunch bloody marys
+ the hamachi sashimi with avocado, basil and truffle oil
+ the Crab Louie - tons of crab (though Swan's still has the best Louie in my book)
+ the jalapeno spicy paloma (brunch drink ) - AMAZINGLY BALANCED

I hear the Happy Hour is great  -  one day I'm going to have to skip out of work early to check it out.
author: Emily C.

description:
I love this place!!!

The view of the bay and the service is outstanding! The seafood was excellent and I  loved my martini's. This is one to visit for sure. 

After you can go right down to Ghiradelli and have one of their famous hot fudge sundae's...please know that this sundae is built for three! Fabulous!
author: J S.

description:
This is a really touristy place to go...kind of the standard dinner spot for out-of-towners.

The view is fantastic, the service is decent, but none of the food blew me away. The seared tuna was probably my favorite.
author: Pascal F.

description: I loved the experience and view by the water ... This was a very romantic place & I loved the lovely atmosphere... Filet migon  was delicious & I enjoyed my dessert ...
author: Habibti A.

description:
McCormick & Kuleto makes some pretty killer Sea Food dishes some people think their prices are pretty high but luckily I never had to pay for a meal here since all the Tech companies would treat us back in the day.

Try their lobster dishes and they have a good wine selection if your into that.
author: Benjamin K.

description: The view is beautiful but the service ruins the entire experience. We ate at McCormick and Kuleto's last year when we were in San Fran and had a pretty poor experience. (meat undercooked and bad service) We thought we would try it again this year, but we were yet again disappointed. We specifically told the server that our meat needed to be medium well and again we had to return our food because it was undercooked. When I am paying 30.00 plus dollars for a entrée I expect it to be perfect the first time not recooked. Our server could care less. Our water glasses were empty a majority of our dinner, and our server was no where to be found. We had two terrible experiences and are done trying. The food is average and the service is terrible, this restaurant is not worth it there are so many AMAZING steak and seafood restaurants in San fran.
author: Britt W.

description: Made a reservation on open table on Saturday and got the confirmation within minutes. Arrived and asked the host if he could by any chance get us a table next to the window to enjoy the beautiful views that the restaurant has to offer. Went to to the bar to have a few drink while our table was prepared when our waiter grabbed us he took us to a table right next to the window with the best view in the house. Next to the great service and food they really know how to take care of their customers. Everything you look for in a restaurant especially in the City !
author: John Y.

description:
I would have given this place a 3 if our server wasn't so bad. I mean, bless her heart, she probably just needs a lil more practice is all. The happy hour prices are amazing, and more in our price range, but unfortunately happy hour is M-F till 6 and Sundays from 8-10, which we were 3 hours early for, lame. 

What we ordered:
-side of gnocchi with pesto: wasn't horrible but it tasted like the kind I can get at the grocery store, but i'm a gnocchi snob, so that may have been just my tastebuds
-romesco mussels: the mussels were small, but they tasted pretty good, the sauce was tasty, but i thought it was too much that they might have been trying to cover something up
-empanadas: puff pastry was delicious, i wasn't a fan of the filling. and also it came with a tasty sauce. again, with the sauce. you shouldn't need to cover everything in sauce. also, i think my idea of empanadas are different, but my friend totally loved them.
-side of fries: they were alright, nothing special
-calamari: the sauce that came with was pretty tasty, but at the bottom of the bowl of calamari there was a ton of oil, grossed me out.

my iced tea refills never had ice in it! hello, how easy is it to refill it with fresh ice?

also, our server was clearing our table as we were trying to sign our checks. ummm, no!

as for everything else on the menu, i couldnt afford an arm and a leg. i would be willing to try this place again on two occasions. 1 if someone is treating me and 2 for happy hour.
author: Carrie G.

description: Went here for dinner while on a long weekend trip to SF.  The best thing was the view of the bay!  I wasn't too hungry so I just ordered the lobster bisque soup and a crab cake.  There was plenty of lobster for the soup, but the broth was barely warm.  Crab cake was ok but had an overpowering lemon sauce that I didn't care for.   Service was very slow and the waiter never asked if we needed anything else.  I was expecting better for the prices!
author: Wendy H.

description: I always have a good time here. Great views and great food. I have never been disappointed. The décor is very dramatic and rich looking. Staff are all super friendly and professional. Lots of good memories made here.
author: CA W.

description: Went here with my wife for New Year's Eve.  Beautiful restaurant, nice water view, good location (in Ghirardelli Square), amazing food, and good wine selection.  Pretty much did not see our waiter the whole night, but I will blame that on the fact that it was really busy since it was a holiday.
author: Christopher B.

description:
My fiance and I came here to check out the place as a possible wedding reception location.  We dined here on a Saturday evening in 3/2007.  We sat in the main dining room area in a booth that faced directly to the water. The main dining room is adjacent to the Bay View room.  The view was spectacular.  The service was quick, efficient, but almost factory like. Maybe it's because we were facing the water and the walkway, we saw servers constantly speeding by.

The food was good.  It wasn't mouthwatering memorable.  We ordered popcorn shrimp.  The shrimp tasted a bit under cooked and without the dipping sauce, it didn't have much flavor .  I ordered a grilled sea bass with ginger and cilantro sauce.  The fish was moist and flavorful.  I think for the price, I expected a little more fish. I already knew this would be the case reading other reviews, but wanted to check it out for ourselves.  The triple berry dessert was a bit bitter and tart.  The crust consistency was like an expired frozen pie crust.

Looking only at the space as a possible wedding venue, we probably will pass.  We were thinking of renting out the Captain Room.  The Captain room is at the end, passing the main dining room and the Bay View Room. It's a good size room, but if you are only renting out the Captain room, you'll have to walk through the Bay View room to get to the restroom.  The restroom is located downstairs.  The space would work if we rented out both the Captain and Bay View room, but we didn't need that much space.  The Captain room does not have a separate outdoor entrance, so you'll have to walk through the main dining room to get to the room.  The Bay View room's view is beautiful. There are windows along one entire side. The Captain Room's view of the water is more limited.

Other stuff, it's a kid-friendly place. We saw lots of kids and parents with strollers.
author: traveler Y.

description: This place would be nothing without the tourist destination and the views. The meal started out OK. I was with my family and family friends from Spain, we were speaking Spanish among ourselves but We all speak and understand English perfectly well. Unfortunately,  our ignorant server took it upon himself to assume we were all idiots and when he wasnt being impatient and passive aggressive he was just flat out condescending and rude. Food was expensive and bland,  my seafood dish didnt taste fresh and came out cold, however my food runner was attentive and the only one that made sure to correct the problem since our waiter could not be bothered with us.  One star for the view and another for the poor food runner doing our awful waiters job for him. wont be coming back.
author: V L.

description: Amazing views!  Food was good.  Service was so-so.  Had to wait quite a while for a table even though we had a reservation. Table was definitely worth the wait though.  The views of the Bay were spectacular.
author: Rhonda J.

description:
The atmosphere and view are great.
The food is pretty good. The prices are not bad considering the location.
author: Josh D.

description: Wow. We came here for lunch in remembrance/celebration of a loved one. Business was very slow and we waited nearly ten minutes to be seated. The first woman approached us only to answer the phone to take a possible reservation while numerous staff were mingling, having ignored the phone while drinking cocktails around the bar. A second woman, eventually, approached and acted as though we weren't patrons and said, "Do you need something?". Uh, yeah, we're waiting to be seated. First red flag! I was already close to leaving because of that behavior but opted to give them another chance. We were seated, though the woman, instead of inquiring which seats we would like, pulled a chair out, expectantly and gruffly agreed when my wife chose a different seat. Once we stated that we  were SF natives and weren't concerned about the view so much, her attitude changed a bit. Second red flag. The server arrived, pleasantly enough, took our order and came back with additional utensils for the crab, missing a spoon with crusty gunk on it and failed to ever come by to inquire about the food and drink. Third red flag. At $55 per plate, we were, understandably, expecting quality fare, however, the filet mignon and lobster were over-done (medium rare is NOT medium well and your lobster should not be something you hit with a racket). The side dishes were under-seasoned and oily, the macaroni a step up from Kraft, the mushrooms old and over cooked, the king crab legs warm, the plating ramshackle. While we waited for the server to come by , we asked someone else instead who got her attention. As I waited for my second martini, we overheard the bartender drop the shaker and my wife went up to the bar to retrieve my second drink and unlike the first, had bottom shelf gin (A Gilbey's bottle beside it) and no olives (are they trying to get over on people by serving a decent cocktail followed by crap?). Numerous staff were mingling and throwing back alcohol - clearly their intent was not to be attentive to their patrons but to their own little party. $200 later we left unhappy and regretted that we could have gone to Safeway and made a better meal for less because the cooks clearly no longer take pride in their food and are accustomed to providing mediocre touristy fare to people enticed by a nice view and white linens. So much for attempting to have a nice meal in memorium. Had I known better, I would not have justified spending this much at this restaurant were it not that it was a place where my departed loved one liked to take his girlfriend on dates. I can only hope that their experiences were better...
author: Liz F.

description: Christmas dinner ruined. Planned our entire stay in the City around our "weeks ago made 8:15" dinner reservation. We arrived 15 minutes early at 8:00. only to be told right off the bat that "we are running 15 minutes late so it will be 8:30". They suggest we wait in the bar with a promise they WILL find us. Sit in bar. Waitress comes to our table, removes pervious patrons glasses, doesn't wipe table. Asks what we want. We ask for a beer and wine menu. Wait several minutes for that. Finally at 8:15 she takes our drink order. Drinks (2 beers) arrive after 15 minutes as other patrons order directly from bar while we wait and wait. Never supplied an appetizer menu. Waitress delivers the wrong beer. Hostess dude comes thru bar looking for folks at 8:30, we inquire about our table. Promised just a few minutes. Ask again at 8:45. Just a "few more minutes". Cocktail hostess is long gone by the way. She doesn't seem to interested in helping us. We give up on getting a second round from our bar table and order directly from bartender, where I get the correct beer this time. At 9:00 I ask AGAIN when will be seated for our 8:15 reservation and get told the table will be "ready in a moment". Finish second beer. We notice the restaurant is thinning out, the bar is getting empty, folks arriving after us have long ago been seated. At 9:15, and hour after our 8:15 reservation and an hour and fifteen after arriving we are told that our table HAD been ready but they couldn't find us in the bar! WTF?! At this point we are so disappointed and exacerbated by the lousy service that the thought of paying $55.00 per item ala carte, plus probably $50.00 on "side dishes" for each of us, that it was best to "bail" and stop the bleeding. At least I woke up this morning without having spent $250 dollars at a lousy restaurant. From what I see of the food reviews here, we were smart. I can't comment on the food, because we never got any. The prices seem exorbitant for a place that acts like they don't care and is filled with patrons that dress for Christmas Dinner like it's a raiders game.
author: pete s.

description: I give the 3 stars just for the good food. We had reservations for a party of 4 asking for a table in front of the big window, while this is not garunteed they do their best to accommodate comfortable seating and that is not what we got. Apon arrival there was a massive crowd clearly over powering the multitude of non-productive staff members standing at the front, none of which greeted us at all. After waiting 10 minutes a gentleman approached us stating abruptly "Are you the party of 4?". He then proceeded to take us to a booth which was situated across from the tables with a view- we would've been OK with this booth however it was extremely small in size I mean for example I felt cramped and claustrophobic when seated and I am 5 ft and  105 pounds and the rest of my party was extremely uncomfortable. about 10 to 15 minutes later they finally offered to move us to a back room with a view table we were excited and pleased with the view however this room was extremely cold as if they had air-conditioning on and no heat at all! at this point we were happy to be at a comfortable table and we just wanted to eat. at first Our waiter seemed friendly and accommodating but that didn't last. he focused on the large parties around us 2 of which ordered after us but got their food first. after waiting 45 minutes for our food we clearly became irritated. he never came over to apologize or to make sure we were okay. when the food was finally served by a different waiter who was much nicer, it was delicious. for such a beautiful establishment we expected more from the staff they need better training and skills to provide friendly warm service. for the prices of this place you're better off spending your money somewhere else where you'll get better service.
author: Emily D.

description: Listen to the reviews - I didn't.   NEVER come here!  Our waiter was great, but had an awful experience because of the manager.  Sent back a steak because it was medium well and not medium rare.  Manager insisted I go to the kitchen to see that it looks red.  Who cares?? It obviously wasn't what we wanted.  WHO insists that it's something it's not?  The MAIN MANAGER of this restaurant does.  They did it, but he was OFFENDED by it.  Wow really?  I thought you were in the SERVICE industry.  Guess not.
author: Enrica S.

description: We arrived for a late lunch but still window tables we filled. Menu was extensive and creative. All four of us thought the food was well prepared and presented. Staff was friendly and attentive. Our waiter, Kim, helped us with our selections and took excellent care of us. We definitely go here again.
author: Jack B.

description: As regular customers we were sadly disappointed on our last visit on May 23rd. the long wait (45 min +)  between ordering and served time was totally unacceptable. We stayed since it was past 9pm too late to find another dining place...bad move on us.  The food was lukewarm at best and not well seasoned. A total failure!!!
author: David` R.

description:
I went here for lunch last Saturday. I had the Halibut which was fresh and and well done. The wait wasn't bad either and the waitress did check on us every 2-3 minutes which was nice. 

Drinks were decently strong. Only thing that kept it from being a 5 star is that we couldn't get a seat by the window because they were so full. But that's hardly the restaurant's fault
author: Phil R.

description:
One star for service, one for the view.  I've dined here twice for dinner, once for lunch.  Never have I been served anything worth rating.  My recent visit was for lunch.  I ordered the seared ahi tuna salad.  Regrettably, the tuna had been seared many hours ago or perhaps the day before, pre-assembled with the salad and chilled.  The tuna was dried out and "tangy" . . . not a desirable flavor for rare tuna.  Not wanting to risk getting ill, I asked if they could prepare a salad with freshly seared tuna and was told they could not.  Big red flag.
Our server graciously offered to get me something else so I thought I'd be safe and order a burger . . . medium rare.  The burger served to me, perhaps like the tuna, seemed to have been cooked before my order.  It was beyond well-done, dry and cold.  I didn't want to order another burger or make another selection so I enjoyed the fries and the view.  Service was very good but what a shame that management would let the kitchen put their servers in such a position to put such poor food on a diner's table.  Wish I could say my dinner experiences were better . . .but they weren't.
I want to like this restaurant . . . I really do . . . as a local, I even joined their preferred customer club.  I would love to support them regularly, but wow, the food is terrible and this is a restaurant after all.
author: Stephen C.

description: Horrible service.  Out to celebrate a graduation and service was slow and waiter did not attend to table.  When you pay this  much for food staff should be attentive to table.  Very disappointed.
author: Monica H.

description:
I have been to this place several times, both for dinner and a few for brunch. This place is great, the seafood and the meat are both delicious and the service is great too. The calamari is super great and The sauce they give you for it is so yummy, they also provide you with bread before the meal and that's always a plus for me. My best experience here was for brunch, I had the steak, eggs and French toast meal and it was AWESOME and perfectly priced too. The location is super nice, you get a view of the bay from pretty much anywhere but I always get lucky and sit very near the window, so close that I can see the nuts swimming in the freezing cold ocean. This place gets 5 stars for being awesome, not sure why the overall score is 3 stars but that is totally wrong everyone should try this place at least once and I'm site of they do they'll come back.

Enjoy!!!
The Curious Foodie.
author: Leo C.

description:
Came for lunch on a Sunday for a birthday celebration. The restaurant itself is beautiful with great views of the Bay. They validate parking at the Ghirardelli garage, which is also convenient. 

We ordered the petrale sole, grilled Atlantic salmon, lamb top sirloin, and crab omelet. Food was decent, though pretty standard for American and a little on the greasy side. The best part was the fresh baked bread.

Not a great place for a birthday celebration though... just candles and they don't even comp it! Also, not discreet at all when using a gift card! Overall, good view and convenient location. Nothing special for celebrating. Our waiter was Garry...
author: Sarah M.

description:
Seriously bad. Management poor and full of excuses.  We were offered a tapas menu with the wine paring -ooops no wine from paring menu.  Oops out of that tapas. The one tapas we got was so-so.  Bartenders frustrated and not too good.  

On the good side beer was cold - and Giants were winning.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: Wonderful food and awesome views. Great place to go with guests from overseas.
author: Petra D.

description: Great view of the Bay while you dine, nice drinks, I usually hate mojitos but their brown sugar mojito is great.  Tasty oysters too.
author: Sean M.

description: My husband and I got married on valentines day and came here for lunch with our family. The wait staff was pleasant and accommodating. We were placed in a corner with a beautiful view. The food was ok, nothing to shout about. Swordfish was nice and tender, cooked very well. My husbands steak though was very bland and dry and the lemonade was nasty. I'm not sure went wrong but it was pretty gross. Overall though, experience was good.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Food here isn't the greatest nor the cheapest and you're basically paying for the view.. but what a nice view it is... make sure to get a table right by the windows so you get a nice panorama view of the bay. came here with my friends and we got the calamari and this crab/lobster tower for apps. the calamari was a little tough.. im not even sure what the other thing was but it was tasty. i got the clam w/ linguine and they do give you HELLA clams but the portion overall wasnt the best. the bread seems to be from boudin's so thats good but they should warm it up before so taht the butter melts

overall this place is one time thing. i will come here only if im invited out for something special
author: edward k.

description: I don't recommend this place, the view is beautiful but I was not impressed with the food. The service was also really slow.
author: Ana A.

description: I thought this place was great. We came across it after hearing about it from my dad. They took us in right away for lunch even though we didn't have reservations. Our waiter was a funny guy, but some of the staff seemed quite snobby. I ordered the macadamia crusted mahi mahi. It was soooo good. It came with Guava butter and fried Plantains, and man, it was different from anything I've ever eaten. My grandpa ordered a salad, and that was great too. I'd love to come back here some time.
author: Kayla M.

description: Fantastic.  We came as tourists from the east coast with three kids under 5.  We walked in right as they opened (as we try to do with the kids).  We got a table with a breathtaking view of alcatraz.  This is a fairly upscale restaurant, but they are still very kid-friendly, with the BEST mac and cheese I have ever had in my life!  We ordered the grilled melon and prosciutto, the mango crab tower, and some entrees off the daily specials menu.  Everything was absolutely delcious and our server was delightful.  He went out of his way to find a wine I would like and was very friendly to the children.  We all kept sneaking bites of the macaroni even with the gourmet meals in front of us!  I will go back in a heartbeat next time I'm in SF.  We decided to forgo dessert in favor of Ghirardelli just across the square :)
author: Jackie M.

description:
I would highly recommend this restaurant for Happy Hour (weekdays until 6pm only). The prices are cheap for Happy Hour with a good menu selection. They will also validate your parking for 1 1/2 hrs. There's a parking lot right by the restaurant.

This place is expensive for dinners. However, it's a great restaurant with a beautiful view (very romantic and perfect for any special occasions). Make sure you call in advanced to reserve a window table. You will have the view of Aquatic Park. It's located in Fisherman's Wharf (Ghirardelli Sq area).

The seafood here is bursting with flavors...must try the Seafood Cioppino. My ex-bf's family love this restaurant, so we came here a couple of times for dinner. I had a bday dinner here once as well. Great service and very attentive! Just remember this place is somewhat of a tourist trap and it's pricey!
author: Melanie B.

description:
Have the brunch - enjoy the views!

The food was wonderful.  The service EVEN BETTER.  The views PRICELESS!
author: Sharon C.

description: Good food and great views overlooking the bay.  Halibut and risotto was delicious.  Go for the 8oz glass of wine.
author: Rose L.

description: Came here on Valentine's dinner and of course they were really busy. It was great they were still able to seat us quickly even though we were late from all traffic going into the city. We didn't have to wait long for our food once it was ordered. My review really is based on the food. Ordered the crab cake and clam chowder which was really good.  For dinner we had filet mignon med. rare and stuffed salmon with a side of mash potatoes. It was ok, nothing to great that we needed to come back for. Sat in the bay view room but view was ok as the view at night wasn't as lit, mostly dark waters your staring at. Overall it was ok, nothing spectacular or nothing to negative other than they don't offer valet.
author: Crystal B.

description:
Let me just start out by saying that the best thing this place has going for it is the AMAZING view of the bay.  You really can't beat it, best time to go would be early evening just as the sun is starting to set.

I've been to McCormick & Kuleto's many times over the years. I was recently here for a company event. The service was great as always, the Kuleto's guys always get an A+ for service. 

The menu selections are also great, the different items are paired well and preparation and presentation are always great. However, I have to say that the flavor off the food, the experience of eating there, just isn't what it used to be. Perhaps it was because I was there for a group event and they just banged out food for 100 people for the sake of service. 

I wouldn't dismiss McCormick & Kuleto's ever. This particular location with the tiered seating that looks out onto the bay is impressive and really makes a great dinning experience. 

I just think that the back of the house team is getting a little long in the tooth and the menu needs serious revamping.
author: Leo V.

description:
I have been here many times with my sister and my friends. I DEFINITELY think it is under rated. So far this is my favorite seafood joint in the city. 

I truly have not experienced the bad service that some have mentioned. It does get busy, but the service I have had has always been prompt, informative and friendly. 

They change the menu daily according to what they get in fresh. They have so many different preparations and types of fish. I have yet to be disappointed..... 

From my memory... the most recent was one of the most delicious Cioppinos I have tasted! A combo of fish, clams, mussels, shrimp, and scallops is served in garlic, wine and butter sauce with a boat of spicy marinara on the side to pour over per your liking. It was so flavorful and had so much food, I was able to share. My mouth is watering just thinking about it and have been looking forward to going back for more! 

Other times I have had some sort of fish (tuna, mahi, petrale sole, snapper and halibut) and I don't recall ever a disappointment. The crab cakes are a bit small but tasty. I highly recommend the crab mango avocado tower as well. Very tasty =) 

Looking forward to going back!
author: Cathy C.

description: Tuesday was a fantastic server and I had a great time there.  We got a nice bottle of wine, suggested by the server after the featured wine was out of stock.  Rancho Sisquoc Tre Vini--very good.  I had the stuffed salmon with lobster bisque (amazing bisque, so many big chunks of meat and the presentation was very cool).  My date got a filet with a side of gnocchi.  The steak was good, but not great, although I loved the gnocchi.  I will definitely come back here to try some more dishes!
author: Annie C.

description:
This restaurant is in a primo location (+1 star) and they ride off that. The view is great but the food is blehh. One of the people at our table got a fish in some kind of borscht. My mom makes borscht...good borscht. This was crap - and disgusting to be served the way it was...with fish?! Seriously?!! We sent it back and got something more decent, I guess. 

The service was whatever...I mean we had to keep telling the waiter to take back half the food because it was horrible. He was fairly accomodating, so +1 star for taking away our food with a smile...? 

Moving on. 

The oysters - EWWWW!!!! let's just say, they weren't exactly fresh. At all. I'm glad I chose to avoid those...but I feel bad for everyone else at the table who had the detrimental experience of actually trying them :(

Beware of the oysters here!!! Which is really sad, seeing as how this is a seafood restaurant. 

The food is so mediocre and badly prepared, it's better just to go elsewhere. Preferably a place that doesn't hand out fish filet floating in red soup mix... :|

Lots of fluff and still a no-go.
author: Diana T.

description:
I went here for a team dinner while on a business trip.  It was a pretty nice restaurant, and I'm glad that my company picked up the tab!  This is one of those San Francisco classic surf and turf restaurants, but they focus a little more on the surf portion, being that they are located in Ghiradelli Square, right off the water.

The cocktails are great here, as many other reviewers have noted.  I had the Caipirinha, which I'm still not able to pronounce, but it was great.  Lots of fresh lime.  I'd love to come here again, if just for the cocktails.

The menu has lots of oysters, which is great if you love them, but if you're like me and don't go out of your way to order them, you'll be a little overwhelmed.  And the best oysters they had, came from Washington state, which was ironic as thats where I was traveling from for this business trip.

Sticking true to my Pacific North West home, I had the Smoked Salmon which was excellent.  It was nicely smoked, not too over powering but just the right amount to taste it over the greens, but I was jealous my co-worker's scallops with pork cheeks.

The lobster bisque looked great too.  It was a production to have it served: tableside, over a pile of crab in a soup plate, a dish of bisque was poured and it was just beautiful.  I've really got to remember to order bisque more often.

Our server was great with wine recommendation; she nailed my co-workers request for a smooth but full red wine.  She (and a few others) really took care of our group of 13 people, water glasses were never empty, the  food came as close together as you can for 13 diners.  We were offered a appetizer sampler (off menu) that was right-sized for our group, but had a few more raw fish items that the people from Wisconsin dared.

Business dinner or dinner date, this is an alright place to go in the City.
author: Beau R.

description: I'll make this review short and simple. Great for happy hour, with scenic views and the smell of chocolate nearby, you can't beat the $3 drinks and tasty appetizer specials. However, I came for dinner with a group of friends for my last birthday and everything was subpar. Everyone at my table had some issues with their  food, and the server took a long time to take our orders. The views at night were nice, but I'm only coming back for happy hour during the week. They even show the local sports games at the bar, so it's a nice place to be and the bar staff are super cool.
author: E D.

description:
If you're looking for a good San Francisco restaurant, this is NOT the place!

I went with a large party for dinner, and while the views were great, the food was not.  No one at our table enjoyed their meal.  I got a bowl of clam chowder, which was so-so...until I almost broke a tooth biting down on a piece of shell; and sweet potato fries, which were soggy and limp.  I shared a shrimp kiss with a friend, and while I love the taste of bacon, I was unable to discern any other flavor in the dish. Disappointing.  

The service was terrible--salads and entrees were forgotten, and drinks were not refilled.

Overall, not a good experience.
author: candace a.

description: Three friends and I had Christmas lunch here yesterday. How I found parking right off Ghiradelli Square and how we arrived on time is a small holiday miracle. And admittedly my review is biased by having a great time with friends, overlooking the entire SF Bay on a bright clear sunny day and having a $50 gift card. Nonetheless, we all found the food delicious. Yes the service was initially slow, they were quite crowded, but our server was friendly and attentive. I couldn't decide what to order but ended up going for a traditional Cioppino. The seafood stew was full of fish, calamari, scallops and a dungeness crab claw, and the broth was wonderfully garlicky and tomatoey (is that a word?). hearty sourdough bread was a valuable addition dipped in the stew of course. Yummy.  My partner, a very picky eater, thoroughly enjoyed the shrimp scampi, and my other friends scarfed down the scallops. one small miss: the fried calamari isn't worth it. I'll go here again one day, the entire package is appealing and attractive and the food is very good. (Note to self: don't accurately describe what calamari tentacles are to my partner ever again. He almost ate it.).
author: Richard A.

description: What an amazing restaurant. I had the crab pasta with blue cheese cream sauce. Simply amazing.  The service was outstanding as was the view.  As someone who eats out all the time due to work travel, I found this place as good as any.
author: Doug O.

description:
Our hotel was within walking distance to this famous restaurant.  It wasn't a busy night so we got a window side table.  I ordered seemingly simple fish and chips.  Their were crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside without being excessively oily.

To go with it of course I ordered an Anchor Steam.

As usual, the waiter was a real professional, friendly without being intrusive, knowledgeable and attend to our every needs.
author: Daniel C.

description:
They offered a very reasonable Thanksgiving dish at $18.95. Unlike most restaurants in the city where they want to charge $30+ for turkey and stuffing. 
I've walked by this restaurant many times and usually with such a breathtaking view, their food would be just soso. 
There were four of us and none of us end up ordering the Thanksgiving dish because the seafood dishes that passed by us looked so fresh and yummy. 
My Ciopinno was excellent, it included crab legs, two large scallopes, prawns, claims, mussells, calamari and several pieces of fish. The sauce was very tasty I wish I had more bread to dip them in. 

We were seated on time and was surprised on how much staff they had on this holiday. 

Overall, this is a solid seafood restaruant that has the best view in the Fisherman's wharf area. Prices aren't cheap but they give you a pretty big protion and their seafood was fresh. Great place for a romantic dinner.
author: Maggie C.

description: Great dinner last night.  We arrived about 5:30 and got a window table.  The view of the bay made it worth arriving early.  The seafood and service were great.
author: Bill R.

description:
On how my experience at this McCormick and Kuleto's was both ruined and saved by a Yelp Elite event.  

We decided to come here this Saturday to have the first adult lunch with a friend and her husband that just had a baby.  They were ready to join the world again, and this place is within walking distance of their apartment.  

Upon arriving, we were seated promptly in a table with a great view, right next to their event space.  Nosy that we are, we asked what was going on, and we were told that it was a Yelp Elite party.  

Twenty five minutes after we ordered, our waiter comes to the table to let us know that they had run out of the lobster for the lobster salad I had ordered.  Um, first; twenty five minutes to notice that?  Second, um, I wonder who ate ALL the lobster (hope you had fun, Yelp Elite!)?  Third; the waiter forgot that my husband had ordered the same dish,and ran off after he got my alternative selection.  We had to call him back, and although he was super confused about who ordered what, he still kinda refused to write anything down.  I wonder where their top waiters were that day? :).  

Bread "promptly" followed (30 minutes in).  

The food was okay.  Nothing really creative about it, but it looked fresh. Had the seafood salad, which was nicely portioned, but nothing to write home about.  My husband had the pork sandwich which had way too much mayo and sauce.    

So the good thing, is that our experience gave us plenty to talk and laugh about, and our friends were able to forget baby talk at least a little bit that day!  I
author: Vivian P.

description: First of all I respected the location and view, but that's about it. I had reservations, but still had to wait to get serviced. Then the food took over an hour and fifteen minutes to come and wasn't even good... I could have gotten more food and better service for $3.75 at McDonalds. Not coming back.
author: Raquel D.

description: I'm giving this place one star only because my plate was hot and good. We went in last night...we had a huge party...we were 15. We made a reservation but we waited 40 minutes to get seated. After we were seated everything looked a little bit better..we had some drinks and appetizers but we barely had our waters refilled and it took them forever to take our order. After ordering, we received our food an hour later. Luckily my plate was good and hot. My friends' stake was cold and they weren't even asked how they want their stake cooked. One of my friends spoke with the manager several times thinking that the service will improve but it did not. This place was one of my worst experiences. I was hoping that they will offer excellent customer service since it's a fancier restaurant. I will NEVER  be back!
author: Silvia T.

description:
it's not a restaurant that i would have wanted to come on any other day, but last night was honoring our veteran's day so came here with the boyfriend to try out the restaurant. i personally think its a very nice restaurant with huge windows to look out into the bay and golden gate bridge and great service. we were offered complimentary fountain drink with our meal and they checked up on us to see if we were doing okay and made sure we had bread on our table at all times

as for the food, it was good, but nothing outstanding, except the LOBSTER BISQUE. this is my first time having lobster bisque so i have nothing to compare it to, but it was reallyyy good. they bring out a plate with pre-peeled crab legs and pour the hot bisque over the crab meat. it was soo warm and savory and full of flavors. i've eaten many good things at many different restaurants with my boyfriend and this was the first time i have ever heard him say "this is hella good!"

the fried calamari was okay, not the best, and it reminded me of those salt and pepper fried shrimp we get at chinese restaurants

i only sampled a bite of the mahi mahi (one of the choices on the veterans menu) most places that ive tried mahi mahi at were pretty bland, but this one had a good spicy kick to it and was paired with green curry. 

i don't usually get salmon at restaurants because i always find it bland and very dry but i went along with a couple people's suggestions on yelp to get the stuffed salmon and i wasn't disappointed. it was still a little bland to me, but with some salt, it's actually one of the better salmons ive tasted outside of a home cooked one. it was stuffed with a very cheesy crab mixture and i couldn't figure out what sauce it came with, but it was good with the salmon and the assorted vegetables it came with.

overall it was a really nice dining experience. the manager of the restaurant came to every table that had a veteran to take a souvenir polaroid picture. althooo i do wish she could've taken a picture of US instead of just him alone since i loveee polaroid pictures :P until next year november!
author: Katherine C.

description: I've eaten here numerous times over the years and the past 3 times it has completely let us down in every way!  It took forever to be seated even having reservations.  The server never refilled our tea, or water without having to be asked.  It took 35 min just to get one of the two appetizers we ordered... When it arrived it was hardley even warm and the batter was semi mushy.  (Calamari) it took another 30 minutes to get the other, which was a simple bowl of soup ( it was hot ) The food finally came another 30 minutes after that only to be luke warm to cold when it did arrive!   I don't pay nearly $40 a person to wait so long and to have cold food served to me!  We sent back the food and were brought new plates. (Both orders were cold). When they did bring new plates the sides were still served cold!  The last time I ate here we had the same issues with cold food and loooong waits for food!  This was NOT a good experience.  The food tasted like mass produced "gourmet" seafood.  It was just average and way over priced for what we experienced.  I wasn't asking for a discount on my meal but one was never offerd even though we were patient and polite.  In most upper scale establishments, this would be common practice.  I think the service here has declined tremendously over the years.  There are far better places nearby to spend you money... I'd suggest avoiding this place until they get their act together.
author: Steven M.

description:
We decided to check this place out for New Year's Eve dinner. We made reservations for 7 and specifically asked for a table with a view. We arrived at 7 and had to wait for 20 minutes for a table that was on the opposite side of the restaurant so far away from the water that you couldn't even see it. 
After being sat we then sat for another 20 minutes before water was offered, which was filled only once and never refilled. 
The cocktails then came late, we ordered the same ones and one came garnished the other didn't (a big pet peeve of mine since I'm a former waiter / bar tender). 
The food took forever, I ordered the chiapino and the marinara sauce tasted like gross pizza sauce. 
The server never checked on us once and we had to flag him down for a check where he finally said oh do you want desert?  
Don't go here. It's overpriced low quality food and drink. But the customer service is what takes the cake it's a horrendous place that happens to sit on a nice piece of real estate. Terrible way to start New Year's Eve.
author: marc d.

description: Stumbled upon this place while spending the day down by the piers.  Walked in around 6 on a Saturday night and got an excellent table  with a wonderful view.  Apparently, they are updating the place - the changes so far look great.  The place had a good amount of people -  not packed.  Service was good and food was enjoyable.  It was a nice, relaxing, non-rushed dinner experience.  PS. the pumpkin cheesecake is decadent!!
author: Jennifer A.

description:
Mc&K- You are slipping folks.

You can usually count on this venue to more than deliver on the promise of their wide-reaching and appetizing menu.

The quality has always been first rate.

But not today...

Yes! The crab was sweet and fresh. And YES, the parmesan crusted sole was a hit. The panko-crusted oysters nicely crispy and still cool inside. Perfect.

But NO! waiting for over 20 minutes for the wine to come and then more time passing until we could find the waiter to order and then having the entree served on top of the appetizer, not amusing!
Butter  had fridge burn and bread did not seem fresh. 

Worst of all, little children were running wild and SCREAMING through the restaurant- unchecked by either parents or management. 

And our light bites and a bottle of wine brought us to $200 with no coffee or desert.

Up the quality and class or I'm out a here....
author: Kathleen C.

description: Fantastic location for lunch, looking out over the Bay. Attentive service. AND the food was great. What more could you ask?
author: Neil R.

description: The view is absolutely gorgeous; the food is OK. Two of us ordered the king salmon special and loved it, mushroom risotto plus spinach. I ordered the cioppino and it was OK. It just seems that if you have the word seafood in your name that your seafood should be fresh. Another ordered the crab louis and ate most of it.  Thank goodness we had gift cards from Costco. Oh and they add 5% to the bill help them absorb the "cost of doing business in SF". Plus they suggest a gratuity of 18-20%.
author: M Y.

description: Decent food. But OMG the service is terrible. Took us forever to get our food and even longer for the bill.
author: Lee M.

description: Well worth the stop for apps and drinks just to enjoy the view!
author: Lisa R.

description:
View - there's a nice view at pretty much any of the tables. The restaurant is tiered so that there are plenty of U-shaped booths to glaze out and enjoy the view.

Food:
Clam chowder - I ordered a bowl and my hubby had it in a bread bowl. BIG difference! Mine seemed like it got cold really quickly while his was still steaming as he tore into the bread bowl! Tasty, but definitely creamy and filling. Lots of tasty clams and bacon! I think I might just get a cup next time though.

Mac & cheese - or as listed on the menu as a side dish, "macaroni, gruyere and truffles".  This sounded so good...and it was! After a little added salt, it was so yum. It was obvious that the whole dish had been in the oven because it stayed amazingly hot throughout the meal. The top was covered with breadcrumbs for an added crunch! I would totally get it again and probably eat it as my main course because I only got through half of it...very filling when paired with a bowl of their clam chowder.

Would I go again? - yes! It had a nice and relaxing atmosphere, server was very friendly, and the food was good. I would probably come back with a few other people and just share their apps and sides!
author: Belinda O.

description:
The view here is AMAZING - a true San Francisco feel!  But, the exorbitant prices and slow, inattentive service soured the whole experience.  Two of us shared a caesar salad, had a surf and turf entree, the Chilean Sea Bass entree and two sides and had NO alcohol.  Two+ hours later, we emerged $110 poorer (food and tax; no tip).

I'm so upset with myself for falling into this tourist trap!  There are so many great choices in San Francisco - I shouldn't have wasted my time and money here and you shouldn't either!
author: Tone C.

description:
Wow. The wife and I had reservations here while we were in town for the Fancy Food show. Once I realized that this place  is basically McCormick & Schmicks I instantly got sick to my stomach. I've been to M&S all throughout the country and they consistently have bad service. It must be in their corporate culture or something.

Our server didn't greet us for 15 mins no joke. The hostess, nice woman, noticed we hadn't been greeted yet and the server appeared quickly dropped down waters, mumbled something and ran off. 7-8 mins go by and then he comes back says, I'll take your drinks now and get your dinner in a minute. No hello, no welcome, no my name is ... The manager made her way over. Nice woman, but too young and without enough experience to really fix the mess. She apologized, bought our drinks, sent us apps, however we had already made reservations at Gary Denko down the street. 

I want to love this place so much, but it won't let me. They do have tasty oysters, Kumomotos to die for, so I tell you what - have drinks and apps at the bar! Ku
author: Tim S.

description: View was fabulous and that is why I am giving one star.  We thought it would be like McCormick & Schmicks in Charlotte.. The fish was covered with some type of cracker Like substance.  I believe it was to hide the fish that tasted horrific. Husband's crab cakes were decent but was covered with same stuff.  Service was OK but not terrific. Pecan pie served cold.  Had some in Charleston SC the week before that was served warm  and was delicious. If you want view only, go for it.  If you want good food, go somewhere else.
author: Kathy G.

description:
Went back for their happy hour special again recently.  The appetizers, especially their hamburger is still a great deal during happy hour, but yow...their drinks are definitely at downtown/wharf pricing.  $9.50 for a Stoli screwdriver and $10.00 for an Absolut Citron Soda (same as Ketel One).  I was planning to drink a lot more, but that turned me off.  I don't mind paying those kind of prices in upscale places downtown, but that's not what I come here for.  Just as well since I was going to a wine class and tasting at Cellar 360 afterwards anyway.  

If you're looking for a bargain happy hour, their wines by the glass are more reasonably priced.  Funny, I thought it was the opposite last time I was there...maybe they have more reasonable wine choices now.

Also, their calamari appetizer (regular menu item) didn't blow me away, but wasn't bad and was very reasonably priced at $6.95.  Because of their killer happy hour burger and the calamari pricing, I will keep it at four stars despite the steep cost of cocktails.
author: Roy N.

description: This is the best happy hor in my opinion.  my hsband does not drink, so he pigged on brgers, fries, nachos.  I got the margaritas for myself, and we were both happy.  the food offerings from 3 to 6 in the bar cannot be beat.  its laid back, the atmosphere is old school dining with barbary coast vibe and views.  i worked for spengers in berkeley, who are owned by this whole resto grop, and they are fresh, sstainable, and good to their employees.  so i respect this place.
author: yayoi s.

description:
Ive dined at the Las Vegas location when I lived in Nevada but it was named McCormick & Schmicks. Maybe its the Kuleto's that makes it not so great. 

White grape & basil martini...amazing, especially on a warm day. Its definitely a tourest trap so that should have been my first red flag. Im really not a fan of most restruants in the Pier 39 area, but my friend & I were beyond starving at this point and couldnt think of anywhere else around to eat. 

Overall I would skip the food here. Besides the great view of the ocean, this place doesn't have the spice I need for me to come back.
author: Meg O.

description:
Went here for a wonderful dinner with family. 

We were sat at a window table... gorgeous views! We had an early reservation at 5:30pm on a Saturday, and it was nice to get seated earlier than most - - so that we could enjoy our conversation. The restaurant definitely got busier and louder as our meal progressed. 

Service was great, everyone's fish was great. The bread that they served was a little on the bland side. 

The location was wonderful - at Ghiradhelli Square. We were surprised how much $ they validated the parking ticket. Our parking tab was around $20 (we strolled for a bit after dinner), and the restaurant validated $10.00 worth.
author: Jessica A.

description:
Okay, so my brother has been trying to get me to McCormick and Kuleto's in San Francisco for years; however, every time we're in the area we either just had lunch or we were pressed for time.  I figured today we would ring in 2015 with lunch at this place after all the past excuses.  

The weather was awesome today; bright clear views in all directions around the bay.  The air was crisp, and my party of six felt our timing was just right for our lunch at McCormick and Kuleto's.  Our luck was holding pretty true; we were seated almost immediately at arguably one of the best tables in the restaurant.  Then our fortune started to fade, we ordered the calamari, and due to the size of our party we chose to go with two (2) large servings ($12.99 ea.).  The calamari option sounded like a great choice; heck we were in San Francisco.  Well, not only was the calamari overdone (rubbery) the large portions turned out to not too large....strike one.  We ordered our main courses, two in my party selected the Ahi Tuna Melt ($14.49 ea.), one selected the Salmon Club Sandwich ($16.99), one selected the Chicken Caesar Salad ($15.49), one selected the Crab and Bay Shrimp Roll ($19.99) and I stepped up to the plate and ordered the Pan Seared Sea Scallops ($31.99.)  My wife and one of the others in my party that ordered the Tuna Melts were not happy with the taste or quality of their meals; the tuna was not an Ahi Tuna steak but was chopped and mixed with onions; plus the Gruyere cheese used was not paired appropriately with this dish....strike two.  My daughter's Chicken salad was okay, although she mentioned that the chicken did not taste consistent, some was cold and rubbery and some was warm.  The worse surprise was the Scallop dish...picture six very small scallops served on a bed of wilted leaves on top of orange slop.  The serving dish was roughly 6" x 12", and these poor quality scallops were presented in this manner.  I struggled to finish the scallops, and completely disregarded the rest.  Within literally 5 minutes one of the bus waiters came by to take my plate....strike THREE.  

In the end, $216.26 wasted including the tip (can't blame the waiter for this debacle.) The moral of this story is do not waste your time and money at this place; there are plenty of other culinary opportunities that await you in San Francisco.
author: Dennis G.

description: Thanksgiving Dinner - After walking in without a reservation last year, we made a reservation this year and that snagged us a window table overlooking San Francisco Bay.   Our server, Jackie, was personable and efficient.  The holiday menu was delightful.  This year we had higher expectations and McCormick & Kuleto's delivered.
author: Dan P.

description: We were expecting more from this restaurant. We were part of a large group and many meals were cold. It looks like a great place maybe we caught them on an off night.
author: Trevor V.

description: Food and ambiance is great... but....Made and confirmed reservations for two for window seating. Get to restaurant, see our table (The only open 2 person table near the windows). Talk to host who is talking to another party. Other party (two people as well) slip the host a $50. Host proceeds to take that party to the table which I reserved. I have never seen that in my entire life. They seat us at a seat in the back. I am furious and demand to have a window seat. Another hostess finds a table ( a 4 person table) and we proceed to be seated there. I can barely hear/talk to my date seated across from me.
author: Daniel S.

description:
Normally I wouldn't have gone to this place since it looks like a tourist trap and is very expensive. But someone else was paying so they got to make the choice.

The place was half empty when we got there but service took an age. While our waitress was very nice (one star) the food was very disappointing. The soup came out first, with a skin on it, and was not what one would call hot. It's cooking 101 that you serve soup last because of the skin problem.

The ahi tuna was middling at best and the price was far too high. Charging $30 for a 6oz steak takes shameless profiteering to new levels.

Add in that the bar closed at 11pm , although we could still buy wine by the bottle and you had a very unsatisfactory experience. The extra star comes for the view, which is great, but I'd have liked to have given this place 1 1/2 stars.
author: Iain T.

description:
Came back for Happy Hour last week and I was fairly surprised.  Burger for $5 during happy hour. Fish tacos were solid.  Sweet potato fries were crispy and solid. 

We had a great time here. Def. will keep in mind for HH if I didn't work so far away from it.
author: AhLin C.

description: I had a great experience here with two others. They both went with rib eyes, and I went with a crab pasta. Appetizers were a shrimp cocktail and a heirloom tomato/fried feta dish. Everything was very tasty and well presented. The banana pie was very good, pecan pie a little too nutty, if that's possible. Views are a great backdrop to a great meal.
author: Alan S.

description:
I'm not going to tell you this is the best fish/seafood place in San Francisco. And I'm not giving it 5 stars. But hey - this place deserves better notices than some of the comments that have been posted. We got  a great table next to a window with a fabulous view of San Francisco Bay. Our server was attentive, knowledgeable, and eager to please. My sister-in-law wanted crab. It was fresh and in season. She was a little hesitant, never having tackled a whole crab before. The server provided an encouraging nudge. She went for it and loved it. 

Lotsa choices on the menu - everything from fresh, plainly grilled fish to creative combinations. I had monkfish stuffed with chorizo served on a root vegetable hash. It was great. My wife had a tough time deciding. Last time we ate here, she had salmon stuffed with crab, shrimp, and brie cheese. She liked it so much that she considered ordering it again. Instead, she tried halibut with crab shrimp mousse served with leeks and huckleberry sauce. Much to her dismay, she liked that so well that she doesn't know which to order next time we're there.

Was it pricey? Yes. But we all felt it was a good value for the money.

So, let's see. Great view, friendly service, wonderful food -  yup, I'm a fan.
author: Steven K.

description: Great way of the north of San Francisco Bay, although if you come after dark, you can't see much. Best to have lunch here, then walk down Fisherman's Wharf for cheap seafood and sourdough clam chowder.
author: Jeremy O.

description:
I went there with another couple for Thanksgiving dinner with reservations for 8.15pm. We had to wait in the bar for 15 minutes until the white dirty blond hair female hostess brought us over to what she considered a table for 4.. The table was a temporary table with 4 folding chairs next to the swinging doors of the kitchen. I mean my head would be approx. 4 feet away. I asked her if we could move over to a regular table near the window away from the active kitchen doors. She said the regular tables were already taken although we didn't see anyone there. Then we looked at the worst seats in the place and decided not to even sit down there.

 As we started to move away to leave the place, the headwaiter came over and asked what was wrong. We told him and he agreed. He then went over to a much better table and began to clear off the table for us. While we were standing away from the table waiting for him to clear it, the female hostess came over to my wife and I and said " Hey that was the only table available, why did you complain!" My wife said that since we had reservations and such that we should not have to seat at a lousy table with folding seats next to a active kitchen doorway with no view. The hostess then became angry and started yelling at us and said that everyone has reservations and that we would have to take the lousy table with its poor location! 

That was enough and I told my friends that we would leave since we were now afraid of not only bad service but that something might happen to our food. The head waiter came over and said he was sorry and that she was new. He offered us a bottle of champagne, but for us it was too late. We went across the street and had a nice dinner there.
author: Jim C.

description: Best happy hour service ever.  The food is so cheap and is well worth it.  I went with a rather large party and we ordered everything on the menu.  The item that was most worth it was the burger with fries for $2.99.   You can't really go wrong there when it is a 1/2 lb burger.  I have also been here in a banquet setting as well and it is very nice and the ambiance is great.  The view into the bay is very beautiful and its just a nice atmosphere for the restaurant.
author: Lawrence E.

description: I don't get the the 3 Stars. That is why I had to write. I have returned a number of times. The Food. The Service. The Atmosphere. The View.  They can not be great every night but but I find it enjoyable every time I go and they are very accommodating. Maybe I just tip well... LOL.
author: Michael M.

description: My wife and I come to San Francisco every fall, and always try to eat at a different place at least once while we are there.  We had planed on going up to Nob Hill, but we were tired and walked to McCormick.  The meal was great, from the appetizers to the desserts.  The service was as good as anywhere in the City.  Yes it is pricey, but so are most good places in San Francisco.  Nice view and good atmosphere.
author: Roy H.

description: So interestingly I forwarded this review to MC&K's corporate office over a week ago, and heard NOTHING back from them.  Obliviously they care nothing about their consumers and just prey on unsuspecting tourists.
author: David P.

description:
Happy Hour Review (3-6pm)

It's a difficult star rating between 2 and 3 foodwise, but for the venue, its between a 3 and a 4 so that's why 3 is the final review.  The venue is certainly nice and fancy with the ocean and all, but the construction site out in front just doesn't quite make it all that appealing.

My usual happy hour crew, (including Christina L) were off to it again, but this time we were drawn in by the $2-4 items.  Not a bad place to spend for happy hour in these economic times, but you do get what you pay for. 
- ($2) Sweet Potato fries: despite Christina's dislike, these are indeed good.
- ($3) Burger and fries: even though it looks great, the burger is quite tasteless and dry.  I liked the fries on it though.
- ($5) Battered clams - probably the hottest plate on the menu, these turned out alright
- ($4) Special Drafts - not bad
- ($3?) Asian wings - another hot item on the plates
- $(2) Cheese nachos - i don't know what cheese they use, but they should stop, it isn't creamy enough and it just turns all hard after 1 minute out.

For $2-4 happy hour, I'd prefer Phoenix's
author: Vincent K.

description:
I've been in a few times on break or taking some food to go after my shifts. 

However I haven't been in for happy hour... 6-8$ Martini's and mixed drinks not bad considering the area. But since I'm a totally fatty I will be talking about the amazing happy hour food selection...
