Cheeseburger and fries.. $2.39 WTF. That was such a steal! Half pound burger with delicious fries. That alone will get me coming back.
The quesadilla was so so. 

When I haven't come to happy hour I usually get a cesar salad with chicken (sooo good!) or some type of sandwich.

Overall I have never had a bad experience here. I love the food. A bit pricey but it's to be expected. 

all and all, in the words or larry david- preetaaay preetaaaay pretty good.
author: Amanda S.

description:
Terrific Evening view of the Bay from the front of Ghiradelli Square made all the better by a friendly and attentive staff. Server was particularly helpful with suggestions.

Great Cioppino, juicy steaks, and tasty Salmon left adults and children happy and definitely wanting to return.
author: J B.

description: The food was pretty good but the service was terrible...waited forever to get our food. waiter came back twice saying they were out of what I ordered...would have been nice if I didn't have to wait an eternity before finding that out! Great view of the bay.
author: Lou S.

description:
This review is only for the Happy Hour at the bar.

We had heard about the happy hour and the bargains at the bar.  I believe the happy hour is from 4-6 only during the weekdays.  We arrived on a Wednesday in mid-July right in the midst of tourist season. It wasn't that busy in the bar area, but the cocktail waitress did not have any busboys to clear tables.  We think her name was Victoria and she kept cool and was very cordial while she scurried around clearing and setting tables and taking orders.  We ordered a couple of cheese burgers for $2.95 apiece and a side of mussels for about $2.50.  These are full size meals and not miniatures.  Of course there is a minimum of one drink required per patron.  We felt the food was very good for the price and the service was excellent.
author: Robert J.

description:
My husband, a friend and I just finished dinner.  The food was pretty good, but the service was poor.  After being seated, our waitress took our drink orders and brought our drinks, but then she disappeared.  We watched her give great service to a table of 8, while we sat there for 20 minutes waiting to place our dinner order.  Finally in frustration, we flagged down an assistant manager, who ended up taking our order and bringing our food.  Despite the fact that I pointed out to this assistant manager that our service was poor, very little was done to improve the situation.  We ended up being served by this assistant manager, our original waitress occasionally, and a few servers.  At the end of the meal. I asked to speak to the manager.  All he could say was that he was sorry for the poor, inattentive service, but offered nothing else.  

The manager told us that the place has had a change in ownership.  This change has apparently not been for the better.  Needless to say, we won't be returning.  The service the restaurant provided was clearly not commensurate with the prices they charge.
author: David G.

description:
I've been to McCormick & Kuleto's several times. Most recently, I went there for Yelp's Elite Bubbles 'n' Brunch event. On previous occasions, I've been there for dinner. Each time, I received exceptional service whether it was my $50 dinner per person or my free brunch tasting event through Yelp. 

Food: Folks come here for the seafood and you really can't go wrong from eating their seafood. I had their salmon before for dinner and it was excellent. I've had some great crab cake here too. During the brunch, I really enjoyed the mandarin orange crepes and the apple cheese turnover. Consistently, the ingredients are quite fresh and I like how things weren't too sweet. I must say, however, the devil eggs I had this past weekend were a bit too salty. I also feel that portions are sizable for the type of restaurant and cuisine.

Service: I've always had great service here. Friendly staff who are attentive and care. It fits the experience.

Ambiance: This place has a more graceful, classy feel to it not to mention great panoramic views. I never feel rushed here which is one of the reasons that people pay a bit more to eat at a nice sit down restaurant.

Parking: I've never had trouble finding metered parking around this place. It's near Pier 39, but closer to Aquatic Park and in a section with slightly more street parking. Meters run 3 dollars per hour. There's also several parking garages nearby.

Tip: If you need Internet, there's free Internet at Ghiradelli Square. Just log in and "accept" the conditions and you get free Internet!

More on the upscale/mid-upscale side and a great place to take a dinner date or a brunch surprise for the rents (or even Mother's Day!).
author: Tina C.

description: Located at Ghirardelli Square. Gorgeous views of the San Francisco Bay and Aquatic Park from the huge dining room. The food here is good but nothing special. The Seared Chilean Sea Bass was cooked just right and tasty. The food is OK but the view is great
author: Les W.

description:
One of my best friends and I are always looking for a good happy hour.  It was only 3 o'clock, but we figured, 'There's gotta be SOME PLACE that's doing happy hour right now!'  And to our surprise there was!  McCormick & Kuleto's has happy hour from 3p-6p.  

They have really good food from $1.95-$4.95.  Being the "ballers-on-a-budget" that we are, we were satisfied with that.  According to their calendar of happy hour events they were serving 5 Sam Adams summer ale for $25.  However, the waitress said it was a mistake and instead offered us $2.50 sam adams on tap (10x better!)  

We ordered the chicken sliders, steamed mussels, fish tacos, hummus, and spicy tuna roll.  All of that with 3 beers each the total was $32.  

We were very happy with the service and the fact that the waitress (Charisse) made up for the calendar being wrong.  Open seating at the bar when you get there  and it wasn't packed..but then again-it was a Tuesday afternoon at 4:30pm.
author: CeeCee W.

description: Lovely meal, attentive service, excellent wine selection. The pan-seared scallops with chili oil were prepared to perfection, the cioppino was superb, and the pumpkin cheesecake was so light and delicate, "like eating Christmas" we kept saying to each other. Combined with the spectacular view, it was a most memorable evening.
author: Jayne A.

description:
Ok,

This is truly a tourist place, but I had family in town staying at the new Fairmont and we dropped in for a quick breakfast in the bar and I was pretty surprised.
The crab cakes are so of the best in the city, though expensive for the serving size (tourist thing again). 
The bloodies were big, spicy and solid.
The bartender rocked!
Overall, I gotta say that you can do a lot worse in Fisherman's Wharf on a Sunday morning.
author: Lucky L.

description: Very disappointing experience!! My wife and I enjoy nice dinners and we've walked over by there several times and decided to have a nice dinner Saturday night. We made a reservation, showed up and were seated a nice booth with view of the bay and from that point on the experience went down hill quickly! We sat at that booth with empty wine glasses and a drink menu for 10 minutes before we were approached by our horrible server. We were never brought a glass of water or offered any bread. Our server just simple asked us if we were ready to order? Order what?? drinks, appetizer or dinner it took so long for him to get to table we knew we had to order everything at once or we wouldn't see him again. I finally get my drink from the bar and think it's going to get better from here. My wife and I both order filets with a few side dishes when they come to the table they are undercooked, cold and absolutely flavorless from the steak to the side dishes!! Honestly we could have better food and service from a street vendor and saved $150.
author: Tracy F.

description: McCormicks & Kuleto's was a great experience for dinning with our children. Is this a place that I would take my wife to on a date night? NO...I would opt for WaterBar or Epic Roast House for sure. However, for a night out with the family I think it is a great place to go. Our service was fantstic (Christina) did a great job! Food was great, view was awesome.
author: Kurt S.

description:
I had dinner here while in SF on business in September.  I had the smoked beef carpaccio appetizer and grilled sea scallop with bouillabaisse broth and flageolet beans (rather unusual to have beans with scallop).  The carpaccio is (basically) raw beef, so I squeezed the tangerines slices over the beef which makes it delicious.  A very nice start to an excellent dinner.  The grilled scallops were very nicely done and very succulent (don't believe I just wrote that); not overcooked or undercooked, but just with a tiny bit of translucent flesh in the middle.
This place is expensive (even on per diem), but I think it is worth checking out.
author: Guy K.

description:
12/16/09 20:00 

McCormick & Kuleto's, what has happened to your outstanding service??

2 glasses of Fess Parker Riesling took about 10-15+ minutes to arrive at our table. FAIL

Ordered 2 of the Dungeness Crab Cakes and only ONE order was brought to the table. Informed the waiter I had placed two orders and second order arrived 10 minutes later. FAIL

One order of the house salad and one order of clam chowder which was served within an acceptable time frame. 

Ordered  the creme brulee which was served quickly. 

I was trying to locate our waiter to get the check, our waiter was no where to be found. Finally found the waiter, paid the check and quickly went to the restroom leaving our jackets and gloves at the table. 

Upon returning to the table the gloves made like Casper and disappeared. We searched high and low and could not find the gloves. Finally a bus-person noticed that we are trying to find something and informed us the gloves are at the front desk.. Why would someone pick up the gloves while the jackets were left at the table??   

I have visited this location in the past and must say it WAS in my top five for service but something definitely  has gone wrong with the quality of service.

I would cut them a break if it was busy but the place was half empty.

The only reason I brought my date here was because of the outstanding service I receive in the past..Neither one of us were impressed..What a shame this place has gone downhill !!!
author: Reggie R.

description:
I wasn't enthused with this place at all. I came here for a wedding.. The restaurant wasn't anything special. Only thing they had going for them is the view of the water. 

I had the steak. It was extremely DRY! Really bad. I am guessing it is because they make the food all at once and cook it for a long time. Wasn't anything special. 

Walking down the bathroom was a drag. You had to walk down the stairs. Not sure if there was an elevator. ( they are suppose to.) I do have to say the bathrooms were nice.
author: lee v.

description: Awful over-priced place with really bad service. It took forever to take our order, get our food and finally get the bill paid. This is my first and last unfortunately.
author: Errol D.

description: My mom and I were able to get a seat in good time, but when we sat down, we played the waiting game ever so patiently. We sat at our table waiting to have someone come to us, but no one came, so after 30 minutes of nothingness, we decided to leave. In all honesty, I feel no one came to us because we were of Asian decent. Everyone at the restaurant, staff and eaters, appeared to be "Caucasian" and the waiters seemed to avoid us. When we left, the host at the front didn't even acknowledge us. It was one of the weirdest moments ever.
author: Ike D.

description: Okay. Being a native SF-can, I know that tourist spots are just that and to not expect much. But one of the tests I use at many restaurants is to order their Calamari. If it's good (meaning not too dark with old oil, etc.) then the rest of the menu tends to be great. Ditto here.
author: Mashimaro M.

description: Service was slow and unattentive. Food was $$$ and only okay. I would say not worth it.
author: Jason C.

description:
Make a recervation with a 2 weeks waiting period, are group got slit on two tables. Waiter rude, we asked them for bread, he respond "just wait a minute" Food over price and not good. I friend of my didn't even eat it. To many sur charges.
I will never go back to eat there.
author: Micahela C.

description:
EXCELLENT VIEW AND FOOD!!!   we will definetley be going back . i had the stuffed crab it was amazing !!  my husband had the steak and it was cooked perfect .

beautiful view of bay  ! 
prices are very reasonable and compare with other restaurants facing the water!!
author: Jay D.

description: Great views of the Bay from around the dining room.  Our waitress was great, the martinis were tasty, and the food was pretty delicious.
author: Amy J.

description:
McCormick & Kuleto's has been donating appetizers for the Helpers Holiday Party at Ghirardelli Square for years.  The event was on November 11th.  The appetizers were delicious and the presentation impecabble.  They are top notch in every way.
BTW - I'll be going there for lunch tomorrow!
author: Rita H.

description: We were here for wine and dessert after dinner at Joe's crab shack. And we told the waiter so before we took the table. The food and wine were good but the staffs were unprofessional. We ordered $100 for just dessert and wine which we were fine with.But the waiters were kind of rude and this supposed to be a fine dining restaurant, their manner should be up to standard. The view and the restaurant set up are nice though.
author: Suabot J.

description:
Came for the view and a splurge of a nice meal.  Have to say waiter (Mike) is only reason we had a pleasant experience.  It was obvious he went out of his way to make up for the rude behavior of Mario (the maitre d').  When we arrived we approached Ricardo for a very late dinner midweek.  There were obviously tables open by the large windows and we asked if we could be seated at one of them.  Mario was on the phone at the time looking very important.  Ricardo began to show us to our table, when Mario hurried over and moved us to another table towards the back.  He claimed there were others who had reserved the table we had originally wanted.  He was short in communication and rude, turned on his heel and left.  Mike swooped in and made the dinner memorable from then on, even though we had to deal with noise and interruption from a party in the adjoining room, a view less than stellar looking at buildings and not the Golden Gate Bridge, and an incredible 45 minute gap between bread being served and dinner arriving due to the "kitchen backup with the large party seated nearby", and the private party in the enclosed room.  And, when we left those tables were still open........

I'd been to this location years before when it was McCormick & Schmick.  I had magical memories of the view, the dinner, the service.

Guess you can't go back........

I will say without Mike this would be a one-star review.  And, once the food was served (finally) it was delicious.

Please work with your maitre d', Mario, and remind him although he is full of self-importance it is your patrons that ultimately pay his paycheck.  He needs a lesson in humility and customer service.

And reward Mike and keep him on your staff.  I'm certain he is the only reason you are getting repeat business and referrals from many of your guests.  Without him, you will be viewed as an over-priced, outdated, stuffy location that is in need of updating.  Someone else will be happy to take the location and serve up delicious food and service to match.  The view isn't going anywhere.

And to the patrons, ask for Mike.
author: J J.

description:
I give it four stars for the setting and the view, particularly the booths in
 the main dining room.  You feel like a king (or queen).

Great spot to bring a date, or to impress visitors.

Go with the seafood.

Get a grapefruit juice, all juices are fresh squeezed to order.


The staff is pretty lively and professional.  

The only "not so great" expereince I had there was from Carl the bartender...seemed like he was grouchy and hung over and my drink had no booze in it.

The oysters are delicious.

The chocolate basket for dessert...wow.
author: Thomas f.

description: Great view. Ok service and food 3+.  Good thing about this place kitchen is open till 11pm.
author: S H.

description:
New chef, new recipes.  They are back on my personal list of places to go.  

We had a family feast here this afternoon.  Looking out at the perfectly calm Bay water, with small boats moored in Aquatic Park, fire boats spouting to clean their fire hoses, and South End Rowing Club swimmers paddling back and forth in the chilly water, the whole scene was idyllic.  Our waiter was very attentive and agreeable.  

Everyone enjoyed the new menu.  We started with crab cakes and fried oysters, and a bottle of Orvieto white wine.  The new chef does not put filling in the crab cakes!  

I ordered parmesan encrusted petrale sole for my entree, which was not too buttery, despite the fact that I could see the butter in the plate.  Green beans and carrots complemented the sole, along with garlic mashed potatoes.  I must say that parmesan makes a much nicer crust than bread crumbs.  

We found out that the chocolate bag was still available for dessert, but on our waiter's enthusiastic recommendation I split a slice of pecan-crusted  chocolate torte with My Lady.  The chocolate was fudge-thick, but it still had a very pure chocolate flavor.  More wine, and then coffee, rounded out the meal for me.  

Although mother-in-law covered the bill (thanks, Mom!) my impression was that the prices were about the same as before.
author: David D.

description:
First time I came here, I order pork chops with potatoes and vegetables on the side.. Nothing special. No "WOW". My fault though.. Stupid of me to order pork chops at a restaurant that specializes in seafood... I probably could've made it better at home. The service was great though, I was talking to my friends about how much I was craving clam chowder, and the waiter overheard me and brought one out for me! ON the house! When we've all almost finished eating, I was talking to my friend how I was craving chocolate cake. UNEXPECTEDLY, he brought out a slice of chocolate cake on the house AGAIN. He was toooo nice. Once we've all shared and finish the cake, he asked if we could taste-test a new cheese dish they were going to put on the menu for the season... It was a dish with 5 different kind of cheeses? A bit vague in my memory, sorry =/. But the service was defiitely 5 stars!!!

I came here a 2nd time. Different waiter, he acted very snobby and wasn't pleased to give out separate checks. I ordered crab cakes(15 bucks) and chill prawns(18 bucks) as appetizers (i have a big appetite!!) Crab cakes were DELICIOUS. prawns were PERFECT, sweet and yummy. LOVED IT. My main dish was the stuff salmon with dungeness crab and shrimp, mash potatoes and string beans on the side. I believe that night I found love... My favorite seafood dish EVER. I dont think im gonna try anything new for a while, because I've fallen in love with this dish. It's that good!!

I forgot to add, decoration was very nice and elegant. Beautiful large windows that show the ocean front views. Bring your date here, and it'll be a great night =).
author: Judy K.

description: This place is a has been. The view is always amazing and will always be amazing, you cannot get any better unless you are on a boat. But the service was awful! We were a party of 7, they need more staff per table, the waitstaff needs assistance. The service was honestly the worst and the food was not worth the wait. The GM did come to our table twice to apologize for the slow service and dessert was compd. Still on the fence whether I will return again. we were sat at the table at 7:15 and did not leave until 10:30.
author: Olivia G.

description:
I came here once for my sister's birthday and they were great about service and making sure my sister was happy. We did an online reservation and they we glad to seat us next to a view of the ocean. it was really beautiful. They also personalized their menu (printed new ones) that actually said Happy Birthday with my sister's name. What kind of restaurant ever does that?!?!

Anyway, the food was enjoyable. Of course everything was super fresh because everything came right from the ocean. I'm not a big fan of seafood, so the review is bias. My family seemed to enjoy everything though. This rating is mainly based on service. They were absolutely spectacular. As we ordered, they didn't even write down our orders; waiters go all on memory. 

They answered our questions very well. Which fish were meatier, flaky, light and so on. They made sure we ordered exactly what we wanted. I give the service a great big PLUS. 

But if you're looking for a good seafood restaurant, I would go to one on a pier. This place is quite overpriced for the fancy atmosphere and great view. The food is decent.
author: Katie C.

description:
I have been to McCormick & Schmick's restaurants all over the country--including ones in Southern California, Portland and Ohio--and have always enjoyed the food and service. Unfortunately, today I decided to try this location for happy hour and I was disappointed.

Have you ever waited so long for service only to be told what you decided on was out? But..you don't want to say you need a few more minutes, because you know it'll be HOURS before anyone gets back to you.  So I quickly decided on the clams and a bloody mary off the happy hour menu and waited to see the portion on the clams before I got anything else. 

Meanwhile, I waited...and waited...and finally 25 minutes later my tiny cup of tiny clams arrived with very little fanfare from me. Keep in mind that I ordered the same thing before at Jake's (the McCormick & Shmicks in Portland) for the same price, but the quality and quantity were both a LOT better there. Do I even need to mention that the bartender needed to tell his food runner twice that his order was incomplete for the customers sitting next to me? Somehow I got that funny feeling that I'm not the only one who was disappointed here..neither the customers nor the workers here seemed especially happy.

Being charged $12 for a tasteless bloody mary during happy hour was also mildly annoying, especially when my first two drink choices were out. How about calling it UNhappy hour instead?

On a high note there is a beautiful view of the bay from here if you sit in the dining room, but almost every rinky dink tourist trap restaurant on the wharf does too.
author: Natalie M.

description: We held our wedding reception here last week on a Friday afternoon, and it was great. Great views. Good food. Courteous, professional, and helpful staff.  We used the Bayview room for hours-devours and the Captain's room for dining and dancing.  For our guest count of 70-something, it was more than big enough.
author: Jeremy B.

description:
I've been to several McCormick & Schmicks primarily out of convenience and the food stays consistent. The service is good and the views at this establishment are great. Lots of tourists frequent here due because its located in Ghiradelli square and the proximity to Fisherman's Wharf. 

If you are a local avoid, there are better and more interesting seafood restaurants not swarming with tourists. If you are visiting then go if you don't know any locals because you will get average to good seafood, good service, and great views. And of course they will serve sour dough bread
author: Leslie C.

description: I have been to numerous M&S restaurants around the country. While I have always enjoyed them, lately the food seems average at best. Saturday was a special occasion as it was my kids' first time in San Francisco. My wife and I wanted them to experience great food and a beautiful view. We loved McCormick & Kuletos years ago and figured they would too. The disappointment started as we walked in the door. Despite adding a note to my Open Table reservation that said it was a special family occasion and requesting a table along the window, the host acted like A) he didn't have this info and B) it was annoying him. During dinner, the service was absent. My wife's water glass and my son's Coke glass were empty for 20 minutes, we were never offered bread and no one stopped by to see if we needed anything. And that was after my wife said she was going to order a glass of wine after she had an extra minute to look at the wine list. Once we did order, I was disappointed with the food quality. I ordered a "Jumbo Prawn Cocktail" for $16. It was 4 shrimp that had been butterflied and were a little tough from being over cooked. They were very small shrimp - about 2" long from tail to the end of the meat. In fact my daughter had better shrimp in her scampi dinner order. The meal was ok overall from a taste standpoint. And the view is magnificent. But I am done with the entire chain of M&S restaurants. Too expensive for average food, terrible service and a cold reception at the front door. How could this chain miss what made them originally successful?
author: Todd L.

description: I don't know why everyone bags on this place so hard. The location and view is incomparable, the food is alright and the decor is old school. Though I must agree in that there are too many other great places for seafood, for the same price, but that's what you get when you're in Fisherman's Wharf. Service was a little choppy, but when we left a business card in the fishbowl by the door, we were invited to come back with a gift certificate. It earns three stars from me being a decent place to dine.
author: Chelsea P.

description: Waiter took 7 minutes to say hello. Water was always empty. Never offered local seafood or beers. Never brought ice cream I had ordered. Experience was novice at best. Food cold and uncooked. Host staff not personable. We were there for 45 minutes before we had anything to eat.
author: Joe G.

description:
Came here with my out of town family for Christmas dinner. We had a reservation for 5:45 and when we arrived it was packed, tons of increasingly antsy/pushy people in the front. We were told that the wait would "only be a few minutes", but it turned out to be a good 30 minutes or so. At first I thought the majority of the crowd were people without reservations, but I quickly realized that the restaurant obviously overbooked (my family and I waited over near the bar and I could look down see the computer monitor, there were tons of reservations for a very small timeslot). After about 15 minutes, a waitress started handing out free champagne to people who were waiting. 

We finally got seated around 6:15, luckily, in an area far from the front of the restaurant. Our waiter disappeared for a long time after we ordered our drinks. My mom really wanted crab, but they were all out, which sucked (she was looking forward to having crab since before she even arrived in town). You'd think they'd have more crab for the holiday weekend, but whatevs. We got free clam chowder while we waited since the kitchen was backed up, and our food came out around 7. I had grilled salmon with lemon butter, it was nice and fresh. The food was good, but I don't think it was worth the wait. I guess one good thing about waiting so long was that I was definitely hungry by the time we got our food. I've come here once or twice in the past, and from what I remember, the food was good, but not mind blowingly amazing.  

3 stars for the food
-1 for being hella overbooked and slow
author: Paige C.

description:
"Plus the atmosphere is more cracking there."  Really, Jons W.?  You came to McCormick and Kuleto's looking for a "cracking atmosphere?!"  What the hell does that even mean?  Do you also go to McDonald's for a romantic atmosphere?

The food here is amazing - this is my favorite seafood place in the city, but there is a first place tie with Aqua...  For now, anyways.   I had the Mahi Mahi and it had the best chimichurri sauce that was honestly a PERFECT compliment.  Mashed taters were great, too.  I had some friends in town and they, too, were VERY pleased with their meals.  Couldn't tell you what they had, I don't think I even looked up from my plate until I was finished.  I had a piece of swordfish on my plate at some point and that, too was great. 

The atmosphere indeed was NOT cracking.  But had it been, I would have left.  Its quiet, it's romantic (at night), cozy, sophisticated.   It gets crowded at dinner, but we went for lunch and it was about half full.  I have always had great service.  Prompt and attentive, I'd be surprised if that wasn't the case for every patron.  The views of the Bay are fantastic, too, and if you have guests from outta town, save room for desert in Ghirardelli Square.

Couple quick hits on M&K: menu changes daily, make reservations for dinner, try the chowder, countless options for oysters and such, but I will defer to my slime eating friends for guidance on that!  YUCK!
author: Sean O.

description:
Had dinner with my dad a few weeks ago here most recently, though I'll describe my most recent experience, I've been there on a few occasions for lunch. 
My dad is an avid seafood fan who loves seafoody-chain places in almost any city he visits. 

(+) We easily made a reservation on the day of for 7:30 thru opentable.com. 
(+) Dad enjoyed the Ahi Tuna appetizer. I guess all restaurants need to have their signature Seared Ahi Tuna appetizer, but this one met and exceeded my expectations. 
(+) All the tables are pretty good ones, as the restaurant has 'layered' tables that are like 'stadium seating'. 
(+) We were seated promptly and didn't have to wait for our 7:30pm reservation. 

(-) Waiter was really weird. Totally not conversational/friendly, somewhat of a Waiter-bot. You'd expect better from this place, right? 
(-) PARKING! What the....??? For $40-50/pp not including beverages, you'd think they'd validate for more than one hour in the garage. I wasn't in the mood to drive around and look for street parking and the parking that evening came out to $14! On the drive there, I called them and asked, they said they *did* have parking in the garage, but the hostess failed to tell me VALIDATION WAS FOR ONLY ONE HOUR. 
(-) The Ono was "OK"... not as "Ono" as I had expected... also, when we asked for a substitution on the rice (b/c we had to, my dad had chipped a tooth and was told 'no rice'  for the next 60 days) the waiter was all, "Well, we only have asparagus and carrots!". OK, that's FINE.. sigh... 

Overall, an experience you kind of 'have to do' with the parentals/in laws/ grandparentals / OR outta towners.... but for a romantic or impressive date for locals? Nah, there are plenty of other restaurants in the city that would fit that bill!
author: M'ia K.

description:
Came here for my husband christmas party.

The service (the waiters that work at our party) was excellent
The food - was crap!  really really bad.  Filet mignon was awful...it tasted and smelled bad.
author: L C.

description: There are better seafood restaurants in the city, but few with as much variety or as spectacular a view as you'll find here. The three-level dining room, with its wide windows, dark wood, and touches of gleaming brass, provides a comfortable setting for a meal featuring the fresh catch of the day, and there generally are thirty or so options from which to choose. The kitchen tends to be more competent than creative, and service can be sluggish. While I wouldn't come here on my own, I find it's one of the better dining spots in the Fisherman's Wharf/Ghirardelli Square area if in the company of out-of-towners looking for a decent dinner and a killer view.
author: Gourmet G.

description:
Sometimes it's fun to be a tourist in your own town.  There's nothing wrong with walking around Ghirardelli Square or pointing at trinkets displays on Pier 39.  Sure, it's nice when your in-laws from Idaho act as a buffer between your hip, urbane self and your touristy, I LOVE SF - sweatshirt wearing alter-ego . . . but what if they are not in town?

When my friend suggested dinner at McCormick & Kuleto's, I was a bit surprised.  I haven't been there in years, and I rarely think "Ghirardelli Square" when I think about dinner.  I am really glad he suggested the place, though.

We showed up at 7:30 pm last Friday, and Ghirardelli Square was almost deserted.  I bet the tourists decided not to freeze their butts off and stay in.  We found parking right on Jefferson Street and walked right in.  The hardest part was trying to get to the hostess without "accidentally" trampling over confused tourists.

As we were walking to our table, I realized how HUGE this place was.  Big floor to ceiling windows, tiered seating, gold banisters and massive pillars made it look even bigger.  Our booth was not by the window, but the view was still amazing.  I could see why the tourists love it so much!

We started with a Kona Kampachi sashimi appetizer.  It was my favorite part of the entire meal: thinly sliced Kona Kampachi fish, served with slices of avocado with wasabi and soy sauce.  The fish was delicious and flavorful.  For $11.95 for 4 slices, it'd better have been!

Then I ordered the lettuce wedge salad with blue cheese dressing.  The salad wasn't very exciting, but it was definitely up to par.  For my entree, I ordered one of their daily specials, Alaskan halibut cheeks (hee hee - butt cheeks!).  The halibut cheeks were delicious.  They are sweeter, chewier and stringier than your average halibut steak, which made this fish dish quite exciting.  They were served on a bed of risotto, which complemented the Alaskan delicacy perfectly.  At $32.95, I think the word "delicacy" is not a misnomer. 

I'd like to point out that my friend's experience wasn't as smooth as mine, although, truth be told, both of his problems were citrus related.  First, his $11 lemon drop aperitif was not as strong as he had hoped.  Then, during the meal, it took him awhile to flag down the waitress to ask for a couple of slices of lemon to complement his grilled salmon.  "When life gives you lemons, make lemonade" seems appropriate here, I suppose.  

We had a wonderful time, and I definitely see myself coming back here when I am in the mood for some fish.  Your out-of-town guests will love this place even more!
author: Yan G.

description:
Absolutely, FIVE STARS!!!

I celebrated my 30th birthday party here recently and it was GREAT!!

Thank you so much, Susan and the entire team @ McCormicks & Kuletos. Food was great and Service was excellent. Price was very affordable and free street parking after 6PM.

We rented the dolphin room in the back of the restaurant, set up for 75 guests. We brought our own cupcakes, linens, chairs and DJ.

I highly recommend this venue for a beautiful backdrop of San Francisco Bay.

They cater to Weddings and special events. Thank you so much for wonderful, memorable milestone birthday.

5 STARS all the way!!
author: Emily L.

description: This place has a fantastic, unobstructed view of the SF waterfront. It looks out directly at Alcatraz and the view truly adds to the dining experience. The restaurant is also pretty massive. All of the staff was very kind and attentive. The Dungeness Crab Cake appetizer is pretty good. I really liked the crispy parsnip chips they topped it off with. I wasn't thrilled by the entrees, but they were decent. I had the Pacific Snapper with the Lime Ginger Sauce. Unfortunately, it was served to me barely warm and the fish was pretty dry. The Petrale Sole is slightly better and definitely has more flavor. The Macaroni, Gruyere, Truffle side is creamy and delicious so I recommend that. As far as desserts we tried the Banana Toffee Cream Pie and the Ghirardelli Chocolate Ganache Tart. Both were very good. The Cream Pie is much lighter than the tart. The tart is DELICIOUS if you love chocolate, but is very, very dense so for some people they may only be able to handle eating part of it.
author: Kathy A.

description:
One star for not having $1.95 Happy Hour Bar Food like their other restaurants in Berkeley and San Jose.  

BOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!!!!!!  WEAK!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

stinky tofu
author: StinkyTofu S.

description:
We had a two-for-one entree coupon for the end of sustainable fish month (okay, it might not actually be called that, but that's the gist of it).   I liked the McCormick & Schmick's in Seattle (excellent fish and chips) and Schmick's (quite a good steak au poivre, really), and I thought the Pat Kuleto pedigree might add something here.  I'd always filed it away as a potential sleeper, particularly given the views.  

Bottom line:  a snoozer, not a sleeper.   The fish was fresh:  we had scallops and swordfish, and they were cooked well.  The beets on the beet salad also were done well.  But there was absolutely no love, or no soul, in the cooking.   The sauces were pedestrian, not to mention gloppy.   The perfect tuna cut with a perfect knife can be perfect sashimi, but if you slap on some goo, well, it becomes an expensive waste of time.
author: Laurel B.

description:
We had our Christmas party here this year. The CEO was in town and i wore a dress ( that is something that doesn't happen very often! )

I don't eat fish or seafood so this probably isn't the best location for me .... so ill start with the positives. 

We were in the function room downstairs .... the views are stunning and we had our own bar. The waiters were accommodating and friendly and the overall service was fine. We had a choice of 4 wines, the Syrah was delicious and the waiters kept the bottles coming.

I thought the food was really disappointing. The walnut salad to start was nice but i had the sirloin steak for entree and was really disappointed. I had it cooked medium ..... and it was medium .. but very tough ... other people on my table who had the steak said the same. The roast potatoes were really greasy so overall the main was not that appetizing. Apparently the fish dishes were great - the salmon in particular. 

The servings are huge ... would i go back ? ... maybe .... would i recommend .. for fish lovers i imagine so !
author: Amy W.

description: came here with a party of 7 on monday night. I tried to make an appt on open table for 730 but they only had either 530 or 830, so I chose the 530, kinda early but whatevers, its a weekday.  Food was not all that great, over priced for the quality of the food. the oysters were delicious tho. the server and employees seem like they were rushing us out. cleaned our table and took away our plates quick style, it was only about 630! Anyway, over priced food.
author: Alyce l.

description: I did not remember the food being as good as the view at McCormick & Kuleto's, but this time the food was excellent.  All four diners at our table enjoyed their dishes very much.  Service was excellent, although as the night when on and the restaurant got more crowded, the waiter took a little longer to appear.  There were 3 private parties at the restaurant that night, so the staff was understandably busy.  We saw the staff trotting quickly from table to table to get the coverage they needed.  I highly recommend McCormick & Kuleto's as a great mix of beautiful view and delicious food.  Great place to take out-of-town guests.
author: Sarah F.

description:
I've had both lunch and dinner here, even just for a cocktail. My stars are based on the over all. If it where for a good hearty lunch I'd give it 5 stars. Good lunch good views, no complaints. But over all aspects is just so so...

By the reviews I'm wondering if the expectations are too high because the place looks so grand with beautiful views. I'd have to say though, your not so much paying for the food as you are for the views. 

It is a fine place for lunch, but I'd never expect a fancy dinner here. The bar is cozy, but too many tourists. I'd prefer the local scene.

Cheers!
author: Dee C.

description: I've tried the LA versions of this chain, not bad, considering the price. View was nice overlooking the waterfront. Be specific when asking for a window view, ask for a both on the second level when making reservations. Wasn't impressed with the seasonal King salmon, a little dry and not flavorful. The dungeness crab pasta was excellent, with plenty of crab, but you have to look for it, sometimes hidden under the pasta. Raw oysters, Kumamoto oysters from Humboldt were EXCELLENT (but small.) They were very good about letting you sample taste a few wines before deciding on a glass. Service was a little slow during the peak, but friendly. Watch out, a cappucino or coffee comes from the bar and undergoes liquor tax, as well as the SF city health tax of 3.5%... it does add up. Because of the tourists and Ghiradelli Square, it's a pretty casual place, noisy, with kids. Hint for parking: go to the end of Van Ness for the public free parking, plus meters are open after 6pm. Some of the nearby garages are ridiculously priced.
author: Naomi K.

description:
Not that I venture out to Ghiradelli Square all that often or anything, but I am still surprised that I have never been or seem to remember seeing McCormick & Kuleto's here.  To start, it has a fantastic view.  yes, there are some construction going on outside, but it is still a wonderful place to see the sunset, facilitated by the large windows facing the Bay.

The food is fairly standard for an upscale seafood restaurant.  We shared a bunch of appetizers.  Calamari was a hit, while the crab tower was a bit indescribably strange.   Crab cakes were pretty delicious and the starter salad comes in very large quantities.  

I had the ciopinno for entree, thinking it might resemble the awesome ciopinno I had at Bobby Flay's Mesa in Vegas.  I must say that it has all the right components: a tons of fresh seafood such as prawns, scallop, mussels, clams, even a crab leg.  But the flavor was really lacking.  It wasn't as rich and complex as I had hoped.  And the toasted bread was way too oily. 

It's hard to say if this is a restaurant to take visitors to.  On one hand, it has a gorgeous view which is very San Franciscan.  On the other hand, there isn't much local personality to the restaurant at all.  If I only looked inside, I could have been anywhere at a $$ seafood restaurant, which makes it kinda boring.
author: Candice B.

description:
You pay for the view.  The restaurant is gorgeous and even has a curved staircase.  

Clam chowder is just as good as any other in Fisherman's Wharf.   It probably IS the same...do all those places open the same can?

Henyway...blah blah blah blah blah blah.  

Come one come all ye tourist of the Mid West!!  You shall dine on bland delicacies of our sea coast village of San Francisco!  

They have a bar....two stars.
author: Jay H.

description:
Yummy, yummy, yum.

I ordered pasta here and I loved it. I was seated within five minutes, even though it was a busy Saturday night. The servers were very friendly and very polite. The restaurant is constructed very nicely. I don't think there could possibly be any table that was considered a "bad table". Everything was very nice. Not too fancy to the point where you have to dress up, but nice enough for you to feel relaxed and comfortable. Seafood is their specialty, so make sure all your picks revolve around fish and such. Their appetizers were great to start off a good dinner with as well. Pricing was fair, especially since it's view of the bay is pretty nice. I would definitely want to come back again.
author: Sylvia N.

description:
This could be a four-star place, but I just can't do it. The food was really good, better than I expected. They really do know how to cook fish there and it's fresh (which is why it's a bit pricey in my opinion). The view is great. The service is nice, but not exactly overwhelmingly present as it is large and so is kind of a factory. If we hadn't had to ask for bread and water more than once, it might have qualified as classy and earned itself another star. Lots of tourists (another reason they are a bit pricey and aren't overly attentive), but they seemed to behave themselves. This is the kind of place that, if someone has a gift certificate or family visiting, I'd happily go along. But I can't imagine suggesting it on purpose when there are so many more interesting places to go in town.

Make a reservation! This place is always pretty busy and becomes a cluster___ in the evenings.
author: Brian B.

description: We walked in without a reservation and got seated right away. It did take awhile to get a cocktail but the ambience was great and the view was nice.  Food was good, but we have a McCormick & Schmidt back home with similar food. All in all it was good experience.
author: Joe P.

description:
I've always had a nice time here. It's a good place to take out of towners.

However they have the worst Irish Coffee in the city, which is ironic when you consider the Buena Vista, a mere block away, has the best. So you can do the whole spectrum in just a little bit. Although experientally I would say Tosca really has the best. But anyway, we walked there on a cold foggy night from Pine street over several hills and were ready from warming up. However the coffee was:

- Tiny
- Weak
- Luke warm
- Incredibly expensive

Minus one star for disappointment. Total ripoff: don't do it, stick to the chow. There are way better places for drinks. 

The view is spectacular, and it's a great place for brunch or dinner with out of towners. I also ate here with a big group for Thanksgiving once and had a nice time. They do prepare seafood very well, and the place is fancy but really comfortable at the same time. I don't specifically remember what I had which is kind of strange though but it was not memorably bad in any way.
author: Roxmarie M.

description:
Ok, I'd figure i'd jot a few things down.

I went here on Veterans Day with a group of Vets, now McKormick and Kuleto's has a special deal for those that have served with a complimentary entree menu, pretty kickass deal. But, they dont do it on Veterans day, its the sunday prior, that in itself kinda sucks as those of us that serve usually have to work that day, but after a quick conversation with the GM they decided to give us the special menu anyways. kickass!

They have an extensive wine menu which i perused but i decided on cocktails, so no vino for me. I'd heard about the bloodies but didnt get a chance to try one, maybe if i came with a smaller group i might have.

So while the special menu is not full it seemed to have a decent selection, being as i'm a bit adverse to seafood, (not being able to breathe after taking a bite of shellfish will do that to someone) I opted for the Top Sirloin that was on the Vets menu. I can't really complain as this place is mainly a seafood joint but i've definatly had better cuts of beef, but it was good nonetheless. While my fellow companions all had the seafood, they really liked it. 

The wait staff was great and the GM came by a few times to see how we were doing, all in all it was a good experience.

I gave them 3 stars, since the steak wasnt superb, and we were kind of shoved off into the back of the place away from the other patrons.  Also we werent informed that the sides had to be ordered seperate so that caused a bit of confusion.
author: Cooper M.

description:
Came here yesterday for bf's mom's birthday. We thought we were eating Indian cuisine but we ended up here. When I first saw the place I thought to myself, "Omg! I'm so under dressed for this place!" But when we walked in most people were just in a regular polo and jeans. Phew that was a relief. 

BF's brother made reservations for 5 so there wasn't a wait. We quickly got seated by the nice host and then got our drinks on! I had the Peach lemonade cocktail. Not bad...not bad at all! BF and his family had wine (I'm not really fond of wine) but it's okay because I got my cocktail! 

We had the deep fried calamari with three different sauces. O-M-G so good!!! 2 exclamation marks because i was hungry but still very very good. Took a bite of the calamari and it felt perfect in my mouth. Crunchy an hot on the outside and fresh in the inside. Yum-o

 I ordered the mix grill ($24.95), it came with halibut, crab cake, salmon, veggies, and mashed potatoes. Really worth it even though I didn't pay. Thanks Wesley! The mashed potatoes were reallllllly good. Probably the best mashed potatoes I've had. The salmon came with some kind of berry sauce which I didn't really like much but everything else was really. I was inhaling my food because it was so good! 

Now why are you thinking I'm giving them 4 stars since I'm going on and on about how good their food was? Well let me tell you, it was the RESTROOM! Sorry people I do judge a restaurant by their restrooms, it's still a part of the whole experience. How may I put this. The restroom seemed like the type that you can find in a hole-in-a-wall restaurant. Water all over the floor, dim, mirror looked like it could've been in a horror movie, and it had a funny smell. Grossssss

Well back to the FOOD, we decided to order dessert since it was BF's Mom's birthday so we ordered two kinds of dessert, a fruit cobbler with vanilla ice cream on top, and a chocolate cake with ice cream on the side. The cobbler was a little sweet for me but the chocolate cake was good. It wasn't dry at all and they even made a little cute decoration on the plate with a shadow of a fork made with cocoa powder. Overall a very good experience. Oh and did I mention that we were seated by the window? We were facing the beach and the sunset, even though the boyfriend and i wasn't on a date it was still really romantic.
author: Tracy A.

description:
I come here often because of their happy hour deals. They don't have an enormous amount of drink specials but if you're gorging yourself with their cheap and good food, it's fine. 

From 3p - 6pm, their happy hour has... for $2.95 each, you can get... a half pound burger, hummus w/ pita bread, chicken sliders. 

I have noticed that they staff 3 bartenders but only 1 server during these hours. Poor server... but that's not a problem for me unless they don't even realize that we haven't been approached in awhile or if my beer is done and I'm drinking nothing --- which has not happened but this could be a service issue for others.
author: Ella C.

description:
There were ten of us for lunch just after Christmas.  Some of the ten were out-of-towners looking for a real San Francisco experience.  We wound up selecting McCormick and Kuleto's over several other view restaurant options which appeared just too pricey, particularly because we had four kids with us.  We were very pleased with our choice.  The restaurant is a large, impressive, nice place, with gigantic windows looking out to the bay.

I had baby greens with crumbled blue cheese an glazed walnuts, followed by Grilled Prawns and olive tapenade on crostinis.  Both were very delicious.  Others in the group had clam chowder, chowder in a bread bowl, lobster bisque and various salads.  None were disappointed.  

For just over $20 per person, we left feeling like we had indulged in a real San Francisco gem.  Adding to this was the fact that Ghirardelli Square was just outside the door.  We will definitely go back!
author: Holly N.

description: I recently went here during a visit to San Francisco with my bf. I don't really remember the name of the dishes we got, but my bf ordered risotto and shrimp with a sauce that was creamy and milky. Nice place with white table clothed tables and sophisticated servers. I had penne pasta with salmon pieces, artichokes, mushrooms, and asparagus. It was a bit pricey, but I really enjoyed it. The portions are huge, so we ended up having the left overs at a gas station on the drive home.. and it was still delicious. I'll definately visit this place again, since there's one closer to home. Very large array of seafood dishes and this one had a great view of the water.
author: Lorraine S.

description: We arrived on time, and were pleased to find that we had a table with a beautiful view of the water. The bartender was nice, but the drinks were inconsistent (sent 3 back!) It was lunchtime, a very light crowd... and our food never came. And never came. "I'm so sorry" and "it will be just a few minutes" was the mantra. When we did get the food, the orders were wrong, and the food was nothing special. Would never recommend.
author: Michelle M.

description:
OLD FISH USED - had grilled sea bass and it tasted fishy. fresh fish does not taste fishy. i know, i eat sea bass often. 

COLD SCALLOPS - must've sat in window too long. plates not heated, and they use really thick plates. no excuse. 

service - pretty good. 

view - excellent

food - has very good potential but see above. as a diner there said "it could be better"

WINE - dont order by the glass - it tastes left open in a frig for days

had no rsvns last night at 630pm and host sat gf and i at end of dining room right away despite a busy house. 

despite touristy area i didnt get lousy treatment to counter as i expected.
author: Neal N Bob N.

description:
This is an old favorite.  We were seated suprisingly quickly for dinner with a nice water view despite the crowds.

I had the  halibut cheeks with risotto. It was fabulous.  

Martinis were perfect too.

Service was fair.  The waitress was nice and knowledgeable but did't check back as much as she should have.
author: Jens J.

description:
This turned out to be a great recommendation (thanks Will T!) for dinner for my Midwestern relatives after a long, fun day in Napa. A big, airy space with a sunset view and dependably good food was just the ticket. We did happen to go during that crazy hot spell and the place was sweltering, but none of us had any complaints about the food. In fact, Will T and I thought the curry mussels and the sashimi apps were excellent. We also had delicious fish cheeks (just to give Grandma and Aunt Betty something to talk about back home!). 

The bar scene looked pretty vibrant, so I can see taking work colleagues here as well if they were staying on the Wharf. As others have noted, it is fairly pricey for the portions, but isn't that how it always works with the knock-out view restaurants?
author: Gretchen T.

description: The food is decent and I love the view of the bay. They offer quite a variety of dishes on the menu, so, it should be a good place for any group. It's a little touristy but then again, so is everything in Fisherman's Wharf.  I'd give it four stars if they weren't so slow serving us. Yes, we had a party of like 15 but it was a Wednesday and there was no one else in the restaurant.
author: Lauren B.

description:
I went to this place today for the first time. I would say that their Monday through Friday Happy Hour specials between 3 PM to 6 PM are awesome. Where else can you get a cheeseburger and Fries Combo anywhere for $1.95!! they also have Chicken Sandwich for that much and other appetizers without having to spend more than $4. I will definitely come back as much as possible for that.
 I will NEVER and I mean NEVER eat here at another time because it's freakin' expensive as $hit for seafood dishes. Plus I thought some of the bartenders gave a little attitude.
author: Nir B.

description: Great view, great service. My cobia fish was fresh. I recommend the lobster tail bites and fresh oysters as apps.
author: Jason D.

description:
If I could rate this place any lower, I'm afraid the gravity of my rating would trigger the formation of a black hole that would consume all of Fisherman's Wharf.

Upon first entering the front area, you think, "WOW!  Happening place with an amazing view."  From there it was pretty much a fast slide in to oblivion.

Party of four, we were waiting at the Host Stand for at least five minutes before being acknowledged.  (We were the only ones there, dude was behind the counter on the phone)  After he told us just a minute (five), another employee came up to him and started complaining about another employee.  They had it out, and then we got our table.

I have condensed that story to a great degree......

We sit, are presented menus, and it takes approximately ten minutes for our waiter to even REALIZE that we are there.  He was bouncing around the restaurant as if he was trying to re-create a Jackson Pollack painting with an air guitar but miraculously manages to avoid us (maybe I AM anti-matter...)  Never get his name, only a flippant attitude, and actually for the first time in my life manage to consume my entire appetizer with my menu in my lap BEFORE they take our dinner order.

Redacting much more of the future story, my two favorite parts now in hindsight are 1. My Sashimi:  As fresh as the day it was caught in 1954.  2.  The power went out and the staff ran around taking cues from our waiter on how to imitate Jackson Pollack paintings.

Two other truly shocking aspects of the entire affair and I take this from a safety and service standpoint:  during the power failure the manager was seen once on his cell phone stomping through the restaurant---after that he stood in the bar.  Second, when I asked the waiter about receiving a bill with the power out he laughed at me.  (Menu, paper, pen, calculator?) Oh no, must...have...computer...HAHA!  Here's your tip.

The over all rudeness, poor quality, and lack of customer service makes me wonder how this place stays in business.  Seeing how the staff conducted themselves in a unique situation with the power out blew me away.  It was no big deal, but they literally vanished and managed to provide even LESS service when they had lighting.

Dine at your own risk......take your business some place else.
author: Chris V.

description:
Gorgeous view - go during late afternoon in time  to still catch the view and the sunset.  They have a fair wine selection (my date said so, I don't really know much about wine, but I can tell you my bellini was excellent). 
Seafood wise - oyster sampler was great - nice chance to taste a variety before settling on what you really want.    We followed that up with steamed clams and crab - everything was fresh and you couldn't beat the service.  I would recommend this place for any special occasion or for out of town visitors.
author: M J.

description:
The 5 stars is for the happy hour menu.  This is a great place to drop in between 3-6 for some cheap, but good quality bar food.  All of the happy hour items are full portion size.  Cheeseburger and fries $2, fish tacos rice and beans $4, Kobe beef sliders $5.  

The menus is pretty big with hummus, sweet potato fries, manila clams, mussels, etc.  They make up for the cheap food by charging you full price for beers $5.50!  I suggest that if you're in the neighborhood, grab some cheap drinks at one of the many bars that begin to serve happy hour (3-7pm) at the wharf ($3 beers and wells) and then walk up to McCormick's for an early dinner before going out for more drinks!
author: Mike T.

description: Ok..it was a business trip and the sales rep arranged the dinner reservations.  I was hoping for a local establishment. While the atmosphere was nice and the waiters attentive - to a point, the menu was not that great. I had the seared Ahi-tuna with cajun spice serves with a small portion of seaweed salad and rice/niori roll. I would have not put them together but it worked. All in all it part of a chain in a tourist district. If that is what you are looking for, you found it here.
author: Mb S.

description:
I have been here a bunch of times with my family, and for the past two years i've been here with my girlfriend for Valentines day. On a normal non holiday night, it's not too bad. The prices for non-holidays are decent, not too low and not too high, the food quality is good (great seafood selection), and the service is fast. 

For Valentines day, the service is superb. They really step their game up for this day. Sure the prices skyrocket for the holiday, but boy does the food make up for the price. Typically i get the Lobster and Steak, while my girlfriend chooses the fish of her liking. Perfect every time, they also personalized the menu for us so that it read our names and the holiday. Best service i've seen thus far. 

Tips and Pointers:
-You have to try (at least once) the Valentines day menu
-Try the calamari and crab cakes
-Views are absolutely amazing at sundown and night
-Prices can be high depending on what you chose and the season
-I suggest getting a reservation
-If you are casual you can always sit at the bar area

[APPROVED]
author: Eric T.

description: The food here is sooo flavorful. Definitely give it a try. I came here with 5 people so although it's not a family style restaurant we did family style. The beet salad is so yummy. The escargot was also very delicious and delicate. Baked in a butter sauce served with a puff pastry. Takes you all the way to London! Even the sweet potatoe fries were sooo good. The truffle oil they use gives it a crunch and melts in your mouth. My 14 month old loved it. The gnocci pesto is a great comfort side dish. The tuna seared with sweet and tangy flavor took my all the way to Thailand. Must get that one. The scampi wasn't good. It was bland and watery so pass in that. And the mussels in garlic wine sauce was very good. Make sure to ask for more bread to soak all that yummmmy sauce up. My brother being the asian boy he is, said he wished there was rice for that sauce! Lol. Smh
author: Linh T.

description:
This was my daughter's 17th birthday party. Friends and Family.
We were able to get reservations at the very last minute, a week before. They promised a menu with her name and date on it. Not done.
They held the reservation for us. We were late due to heavy traffic in SF. That was great. Our tables were in a nice room off the beaten traffic. IT took forever to get our drinks and take our orders and for the bread to hit the table. We had some hungry folks.  I should have managed the timing with the wait staff better, but the meal was good for the # of the group- No complaints.
They could have done better by acknowledging the special occasion, timing a little slow.
But otherwise, for a 17th birthday party planned at the very last minute, I thought they did a decent job!
author: Vivian L.

description:
Upon arrival, we thought that we'd have to wait at least an hour because there was a line out the door, but surprisingly we were seated almost immediately. 

Our table had a spectacular view of the bay & Alcatraz. The staff seemed very friendly & the atmosphere was nice. Our waiter was super nice. We had dinner around 6. 

The food was OK. We ordered Hogs Island oysters that were AMAZING! to begin as well as the calm chowder that somehow came after our meal & was a let down :( being that it's a seafood place & in Fisherman's Wharf - we expected it to knock our socks off, but we didn't even finish it.

We ordered the fish & chips and the petrale sole. Both were very good & a decent price. 

Being a tourist - Would we go back? Hmm ... We wouldn't avoid it but would try something else first. ;)
author: Lola F.

description:
Food: FRESH SEAFOOD. Their menu is printed up each day with all the fish that came in that day and where it came from. I don't know if it was FedEx'd or whatever, but that's still awesome. We started off with the lobster & shrimp rolls with their really good sweet & sour sauce. Then I had the stuffed salmon, which was excellent, but the sauce and mashed potatoes were too buttery for my taste. Any other person would have loved it, but since I don't even like putting butter on my bread, it was wayyy too rich and creamy for my taste. Otherwise it was really good, but I think it would have tasted better if it was wild salmon instead of farmed salmon. I also stole a bite of the lime sea bass from my friend and it was lighter, and quite tasty as well. For dessert we got the banana toffee cream pie. It was a good balance of sweet, creamy, and caramel drizzled bananas.

Service: EXCELLENT. The host, busser, and server. Our server was very professional, gave good recommendations, friendly, answered all our questions, checked on us after each dish arrived, and made the fresh squeezed lemonade sweeter since it was a bit too tart for us.

Atmosphere: It has a nice view of Aquatic Park, especially with the tiered seating, so everyone gets a view and not just the people sitting by the window. It has a nice sophisticated feel to the place, but nothing extravagant. Spacious seating with a lot of tourists, but I guess it's a given since it's located at Ghiradelli Square.

Good seafood, nice view, excellent service. Maybe we just got lucky on choosing our entrees or got a really good server, but I would come back to try some of the other items on their menu.
author: Linda C.

description:
I went here because my girlfriend's relatives were visiting and staying in the Sheraton by the wharf.  The appetizers were great (calamari, popcorn shrimp, crab cakes, etc..), while the swordfish I had was just okay.  
Pros:  
- kid's menu and crayons to keep them happy
- view (can see the sunset)
- location (walked from the hotel) and next to Ghirardelli  for dessert
- best restroom in the square


Cons:
- food took to long and not even that busy (served the table that came after us first) 
- bill came in really late
author: calman r.

description:
Service is part of the overall experience in any retail and service oriented establishments, so you wonder and seriously scratch your head when it's non existent.

We came here for a drink and maybe some apps.  There were 4 people at the bar who were already served.  There are 2 tables of 2 - one already had drinks.  There is the bartender, we saw one waitress who went over to talk to the bartender for a while then disappeared and there was one woman screwing some shelves up.  All the while, not one person acknowledged us - no eye contact, no hello...nothing.  The bartender went on to clear a table while still ignoring us.  After 15 minutes of being ignored, we got up and left.  

If this was the boom days and they were packed, you can still understand (although still not tolerable) this kind of behavior...but given today's economy, you would think they will welcome anyone who walks through the door...or not.
author: Gloria H.

description:
I love this place. I've been here 3 times, each with a wonderful experience.

This is a seafood restaurant and I don't really like seafood. Why do I go? The ambiance, the service, the location, and... the food.

You walk in here and you feel like you've time traveled to the days of the Titanic. You're overlooking the water at Ghirardelli Square. The inside is super classy.

I've never really waited long for a table because the place can accommodate so many people. The strange thing is that it still feels really intimate. I also felt that even though this place is classy, the crowd isn't pretentious.

Once you're seated, the staff will gladly take your order, recommend dishes, and customize anything to your tastes. They are very attentive, sometimes overly so.

The food is fantastic. I've had tried everything from the crab cakes to the halibut, to steak and chicken dishes. And have I mentioned the reasonable drink and dessert prices? The desserts can knock your socks off.

Anyone who is out of town and wants to eat in SF, I usually take them here. All of them have enjoyed it. I'll be back for sure.
author: Will K.

description:
Hooray for Happy Hour! They have a cool selection of dishes for their happy hour menu. I came here with a friend and between the 2 of us we ordered 6 plates and 3 drinks. I was full and couldn't eat anymore. We had 2 plates of sweet potato frites in garlic dipping sauce, mussels in BBQ sauce, clams in cream sauce, a pulled pork sandwich with fries, turkey sliders. The menu consists of $2, $4, and $5 items with a good variety. Can you complain about a half pound burger with fries on the side for $2? They do not skimp on the portions - I ate to my heart's content. The mussels and clams are on the small but is drenched in delicious sauce. The summer cocktail menu consists of variations of cosmos, martinis, and other fruity cocktails for $6. 

Since my friend and I arrived early, the restaurant was not crowded. Right around 6 PM, a crowd of people were waiting for a table in the dining area. We were seated in the bar area. The restaurant is fairly clean and there is a nice view of the bay from the booth we were sitting at. When we got up to leave there were lurkers who were waiting to pounce on our table. But our other friends were still sitting and enjoying their food and drinks. 

The only drawback is the time of their happy hour 3PM-6Pm from Monday through Friday. Too bad I get off work so late. I would come here again for the happy hour menu. The regular dinner menu is expensive $20+ per plate.
author: Candace F.

description: I don't want to give even a star. Don't waste your time to go to this restaurant very very bad customer service.
author: Anjali P.

description:
Not a place I would typically go to, but we had family in town and they decided to check this place out. 

Overall it was good... not great. The food was good, I had the Mahi Mahi in a Thai Curry sauce, all the apps we had were good; calamari, fried feta & crab cakes. Everything was a little over priced (you pay for the view/location i guess), and the restaurant kinda had a "cheesecake factory" vibe to it, touristy for sure. 

The views are great, service is legit, but there are definitely better places in The City to spend $20-30+ a plate.
author: Blake W.

description:
I usually go for the happy hour.  The food is good and the price has slowly gone up and they are cutting good choices off the menu.  I'm guessing it has gotten popular. The service is hit or miss, they only have one server for the whole bar area.  what is all those waiters doing in the dining area? Sometimes, its easier to just order at the bar.  The cheeseburger gets 2.5stars! 
So one day i decided to splurge and get half dungeness crab.  It was very fresh and delicious and a good size.  However to my horror, they cleaned out the shell.  I mean, it was scraped clean, that was the only part worth looking forward toward, and it was gone.  I'm not big on the gooey brain, but i would of at least liked to had a taste.  horrible, ruined the whole experience.
author: Quailty P.

description:
I have been to a number of McCormick restaurants in the Los Angeles and San Jose areas, but this one remains the best that I've had. The restaurant sits in the corner of Ghiradelli Square overlooking the bay with beautiful decor. Its a really nice place to share a romantic evening despite the hustle and bustle that may occur. I've been coming here for two years now, and I have never been disappointed with my visits. 

Even on days that it is crowded, I have never felt as though I was being pushed aside for other customers' sakes. They usually put me up at a bar table for drinks while I wait, and even there the service is attentive and prompt. The only time that our dishes took a few minutes longer to come out than usual, they gave me and my girlfriend complimentary clam chowder. And the servers here are just top-notch, they make rounds regularly and make sure my glass is never empty.

My dishes of choice here are to start with the oysters and the crab-cakes as appetizers. If you are particularly hungry, the clam chowder here is fantastic, and not as restrictively filling as the Boudin's chowder down the wharf. Dip it with the soughdough bread they provide and its just delicious. My entrees selection always include either the Jumbo Shrimp or Scallop dishes of the day.

Come to this restaurant! You will not regret it.
author: Jeffrey L.

description:
so we all know about the prices...just dont become a frequent customer!  

our server was quick and very courteous.  Bread came out quickly and i ordered clam chowder, which was really good, and the jambalaya which was nearly perfect.  The soup had fresh clams and the jambalaya had generous portions of mussels, clams, and shrimp.  I was enjoying my meal until I saw the bill...but hey, it was a special occasion so I won't complain!  

Oh and don't forget the gorgeous view of the bay...so choose a window seat!!
author: Kimberly C.

description: Had a fun Russian Waitress who always kept our wine/water glasses full and bread. Was a busy night but all the food came out exactly how we (complicated) ordered it. Recommend the Linguine, wedge salad, red blend wine and crab/mango/avocado appetizer!
author: Sarah B.

description:
Native San Franciscans are taught from a young age to forgo touristy spots such as McCormick & Kuleto's, which is why I've seen it my whole life & never thought to have dinner here until last night. Touristy restaurants along Fisherman's Wharf are usually pricey, a little stuffy & filled with tourists & that is definitely the case for this seafood restaurant.

The bf & I came here for their lobster special: $19.95 for a 1 lb. Maine lobster & vegetables. I had the crabcakes (not lump crab meat, which was very disappointing, but it was still pretty good, had a mild flavor & was sitting in a smooth white sauce) & the hearts of palm salad (vinaigrette dressing was strong & over powering but the ingredients of almonds & ham & greens went well together very nicely.) 

We also shared a bowl of baked potato soup which was thick, rich & very flavorful. All in all, we paid $65 (not including tip.) 

We were seated side by side in a table across from their huge windows overlooking the water on one end & the busy streets on the other. We had a pretty spectacular view. The restaurant is very airy with the tall ceilings & lots of seating.

Service was a little slow, but our waitress was friendly. Good place for a romantic date, but I don't think I will be returning for dinner anytime soon.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
October is national seafood month and going to McCormick & Kuleto's is a great way to celebrate.

I came here with a big group for a Birthday celebration.  We ordered up the appetizer sampler and the spring rolls to start.  The sampler was deep fried heaven. Calamari, popcorn shrimp, onion rings, and crab cakes.  Not too greasy and very tasty. The spring rolls were light and crispy and was paired with a yummy dipping sauce.  

For entrees I had the traditional Crab Louie salad w the vinaigrette.  Very good!  The crab was super fresh.  The BF had the Black Cod which was perfectly prepared and very tasty.  

The service was awesome and we all loved our waiter.  He was super attentive, honest and funny.  The price could be a little a high but the ambiance and entire experience makes up for the inflated prices.
author: Frankie F.

description:
I loved this place. Did some wine tasting in G. Square, had a bit of a hunger twitch and swung in for Martinis and AMAZING oysters. I love oysters. We had the sampler platter, and it was really fantastic. (Shoot I wish I remembered my favorite ones- they are second on the list)

We also shared the crab cakes which were good too. 

Bartenders were very friendly, and have been working there for years. Atmosphere is nice too, good mix of locals and tourists in a neat SF location. 

I would go back here in a heartbeat.
author: Danielle V.

description:
The best part about this place was that you could make reservations through Open Table, but other than that, the food SUCKED.  There's no other way I could put it.

I took my mom here for Mother's Day lunch and we were lucky to have a table next to a window, which was really nice.

Here's what we ordered:

Tumbo Tuna, cooked tempura style ($22): it was very bland, served with steamed rice and seaweed salad.  It was cold when it got to our table and I finished it in less than 10 minutes, even though I took my time.  Yup, that's how small it was.  Oh yeah, and the side of my plate looked like they hadn't cleaned it.  It had dried up smears of clam chowder or something.

Seafood Alfredo Pasta ($22): First off, the scallops were NASTY.  They were weird, small, bitter things.  They tasted like brussel sprouts!  And  the shrimp looked like they came out from someone's Shrimp Louie.  They were tiny, and smelled like they were old.  

Overall, the food was way below average and we expected more from them.  The Kuleto's in Burlingame is classier and food tastes way better!!  I'm not sure if they are in any way affiliated, but they're still better and is what I expected from this location.  Oh yeah, and service was so-so.  One kept making me try to order something else... I guess I know why.

Some Mother's Day, right?  Oh well...
author: Michelle H.

description:
For what it is, it's not too bad.  If you need a place to bring out of town guests, who love Fisherman's Warf (for some God forsaken reason), then it's probably one of your best options.  

My husband and I went there recently with his visiting in-laws.  The view is stunning, the food is decent enough (though expensive) and the service was really great.  A couple of hints, if Ovid is working at the bar, be sure to order a few cocktails before dinner.  And try some of their signature cocktails, they have a couple of golden oldies that make it worth the visit (think egg whites instead of sour mix). And if Elizabeth is working, ask to be in her section when you make your reservations.  

What to order:  the Scallops were good, the Blackened Halibut is amazing, and the chocolate souffle with blood orange sauce is delicious.  What to stay away from: anything fried.  

Overall, not bad for the location/chain restaurant status.
author: Jessica B.

description:
No surprises based on the other reviews here: I had a great time, as long as I overlooked imperfections in the food (mostly the result of poor timing in the kitchen), an excessively chatty but not fully attentive waiter, a backed-up kitchen that delayed our food, and errors in transferring our bar tab to our table check.  Why did I have a great time, then?  Because the view (especially at sunset), the happy energy of the touristy crowd, and the theater-like terraced layout of the restaurant make for a festive atmosphere.  I never go here without an out-of-town visitor and they never fail to be impressed, so it's worth it for me.  The food isn't a detractor, it just isn't a draw.  It's not a great value, but once you factor in everything else, I keep going back.  Plus, you can always go get a wonderful chocolate milkshake at Ghirardelli's afterwards if dinner wasn't satisfying.  

There are some nice touches: the french bread is very fresh.  The butter is sweet and creamy.  There are flowers on or near the tables.  The menu is totally cool: today's huge fresh fish selection from all over the world can be prepared any way that you can see dishes listed on the menu. 

There is one weird thing: the bathrooms are down two flights of stairs.  For some reason, the men's room is always full of loitering preteen boys.  Maybe they're bored with their families and don't have anywhere else to play?

Definitely a cut above the other fisherman's wharf eateries.
author: Eric N.

description:
