Now I understand why the ratings are low. They should call Chef Ramsey (Hell's Kitchen) as they have gone totally down hill. They used to have fantastic scallops, now they are served marinated and over cooked.  

I've had a problem with them over cooking fish last time I visited; well it happened again last night to my friend. The waiter later told us it is Company policy to cook all fish medium. I felt it is more like over done... I  wonder why?

Thinking I had this figured this out I ordered sashimi, even asked if it was raw, yes I was told. It was not close to the quality of any reputable sushi bar I've visited.   

The oysters are still great, but pricey. The clam chowder is really good, but I'd go to another place for fish or scallops. As they now prepare 400 meals on a busy night and it seems the policy is quantity way over quality.
author: Andy Z.

description:
I have eaten here several times and have always enjoyed the food.  It has a nice view of the bay, and a good selection of wine.  

stick to the seafood here as its what they do well.  The oysters are truly good and I always seem to also order the crab cakes.  For the main course I recomend the seafood jambalaya and the halibut.

If you live in SF and never go to the tourist areas this can be a fun evening out. Or if you are visting  SF you can see one of SF main tourist spots and have a good meal.
author: Mike B.

description:
My dad takes me here every time for special occasions -- he is nothing if not consistent -- so I might as well toss off a review after going there Easter Sunday. 

I've tasted a large portion of their menu over the years, and I'm a big fan of the meals -- provided they bring out the dish I ordered. That has failed to happen the last two times I've been there. Hey, the leg of lamb tasted great, don't get me wrong, but it was supposed to taste more like grilled halibut. At least they get my dessert right -- I get the dark chocolate cake every time.

Again, the seafood is solid, but expect to pay for that waterside view you're getting. And I know I may sound snooty, but I wouldn't take a date here when I know I'm eating in a room full of tourists. It's still good enough for dad, though.
author: Greg K.

description: Ahhhhhh fine dining on the water! I am a San Francisco native and came here with family. I love seafood and I still like playing tourist and visiting the Warf once in a while. I got a very nice portioned main course Mahi mahi dish, started off with oysters (amazing), steamed clams in white wine sauce (good sauce) and calamari(didn't care to much for the calamari). All the dishes looked great that we ordered. The service was great and our wine glass was always fiilled! Our waiter took care of us and so did some other staff. This place is pricey, but I didn't have to pick up the tab anyways!
author: X X.

description:
This is a great place for out of town guests.  It is in tourist town Ghiradelli Square, and has a very large window that has a spectacular view of sailboats on the Marina.   It is nice to have a beer here on a Saturday.

They have fresh seafood of every variety.  This is a good place for the traditional dinner.  I liked the almond crusted Mahi Mahi I had there.  Almond crusted food is such a good idea.  One thing to steer clear of, the thirty dollar sashimi plate.  Terrible terrible.  Stick to American food please oh chef.  Sashimi is not merely shreds of raw fish served on a plate. 

If you stick to the American fare, you will get something good.
author: apple r.

description:
Fabby Views, GR8 happy hour, Good service.  

Talk about specials?!?!?  You HAVE to have their AWESOME (and I am so not a burger person) hamburger and hand-cut wide French fries $2.50 !!!! (I think it is like $14 on regular menu price).  That ALONE is worth the visit!  Had a funky cucumber tini, was very different.  Was such a great place to end up at after a full day of walking around for 6 hours!!
author: LINDA R.

description:
Oh my gosh, what a view!  I could sit by the window and stare outside for hours and hours, sooo breathtaking.  We were at McCormick's today for a work related seminar and I have never been so happy to listen to a presentation.  Our table was very close to the window and it was gorgeous, sunny and a serene clear blue sky type of day, felt amazing to be so close to such beauty.  

The restaurant itself, is really nice, slightly high end - the tables are covered with tablecloth, nice dishwear, and silverwear.  The servers are attentive and professional.  The food's pretty good, not stellar, but tasty.  I thought the pasta with pesto flavored sauce was decent.  The tomatoes and artichokes addes were a nice touch.  

What really would pull me back is that view.  Dang!  Too ridiculously fabulous to miss out on.
author: Swetha G.

description:
Oh jizz.  This affair calls for a full-blown story.

The food is good... that's what made me go back a 2nd time.  BUT this time the serve was horrible.

First, we made a reservation on open table.. We get there five minutes before our reservation and they tell us it'll be 5-10 minutes.. ok fair enough.. right?  Well, 20 minutes later we are finally seated.  Not cool.  Don't abuse the reservation system and don't lie to me.

We sit down and don't see our server for 5 minutes... when we do see her she tells us she'll be right back... 5 minutes later she brings us bread and says she'll be right back... so now 5 minutes later she finally asks us what we want to drink... (the clock now ticks at 35 minutes after we step foot into a restaurant we had reservations in).  

Okay so, We order a $40 bottle of wine.. she comes back about 5 minutes later and starts opening a bottle of wine that we didn't order... we correct her and she says "OOh sorry!"  we look at the menu and she, of course, thought we ordered an $85 bottle of wine.  Of course.  So (you guessed it) 5 minutes later.. she brings the correct bottle of wine and takes our order.

The food comes relatively fast and she warns us the plates are VERY hot.  Indeed, the plates are hot.. the food on the other hand.. is luke warm.  Meh!  Seriously?  So anyway, overall the food is good.. salmon, mahi mahi, crab cakes.. no serious complaints.. 

When she came back to check on us, she asks "Does everything taste okay?"  I thought that was an interesting standard.. okay?  Just okay?  I mean.. yeah it's okay, is that the extent you care?

Who knows if I'll ever go back.. the fish is good and the selection is great.. the service, on the other hand.... is scary.

Oh, I forgot to mention that they basically gave us a loaf of uncut bread for bread service..  which we had to completely man-handle to slice and eat.

seeya.
author: Derek B.

description:
Gorgeous view of the bay through large windows, nice open feeling, good ambiance.   Nice selection of seafood.  Good portions and standard service.

A bit overpriced and very RICH/fatty foods - a bit greasy.  However, it was pretty tasty.
author: Laura G.

description:
Bad, horrible, will not go back, sorely disappointed.
So, the fam and I have been coming here every year for drinks before we go down to Aquatic Park for Fleet Week.  We've always loved our experience at the bar (it is pricey but that's to be expected).

We thought we'd try dinner here for a special occasion.  Went for mom's b-day with a party of 20.  Made reservations about a month ahead of time.  When we got there there were going to seat us at two totally separate tables dang well knowing it was a special occasion - are you serious ?!

After waiting for about 30 mins. we were seated and it went downhill fast from there.  Service was horrible, waiter never came by, when he did he was scattered, and forgetful - ie. drinks, water refills, appetizers, etc. etc.

After a VERY long wait for dinner our food came and EVERYONE, all 20 of us were disappointed with our food.  No flavor, not cooked properly, overpriced, and seafood wasn't even fresh tasting.  I should mentioned that most of my family are not even picky eaters too.  I was even more angry that they had completely ruined what was supposed to be a special occasion meal.

To top it off, I wrote a letter in to their manager regarding the experience and NEVER HEARD BACK.  But, judging from all these yelp review which seem to echo the same sentiment, maybe they didn't bother since they already know how much they suck.
author: Kristine T.

description:
I came here the day after V day, 2/15, and I was seated right away.  I was actually a little late to my reservation, but they gave me the booth, while a few other people had to wait.  I couldn't complain, but I felt a little guilty.

My main gripe is with the portions and the prices.  It doesn't really seem like you're getting what you pay for.  Yes, I realize one goes here for more than the food.  The taste was just okay, and the atmosphere, quite frankly, wasn't that great.  It was noisy, and the view was.... dark.  I can't see why someone would come here at lunch time, but it's probably better at that time of day, especially if they have a different menu.  I had the Sashimi, which was a big mistake.  I have no idea was I was thinking, and I take some responsibility for that.  Who gets Sashimi at a Western seafood restaurant?  Only idiots, apparently.  But excuse me for my curiosity, which usually gets the better of me.

I wouldn't go here again on my own dime because it there are other restaurants in the area that I haven't tried yet and appear to have more character and value.  I would, however, gladly go if someone else was going to treat :D
author: Jin D.

description:
The location on the waterfront is always a nice treat for a meal out, and the Ghirardelli Square atmosphere is a fun touch for before and after dining experience. I'm a local and know there are other offerings with perhaps slightly more moderate prices for dishes. That said, the service was prompt and mindful, the food was delicious (all of it), and portions are suitable to take 1/2 home for a great lunch the next day!

The "no filler" crab cake appetizer is hearty & lives up to its name and chef's reputation... EXCELLENT!! The Wine selection is normal fair for the average palette, but there are some selections if you're looking. Price/glass is norm for any SF restaurant if not on the low/med side.

Entrees were excellent, served hot right from the sous pan. The Wild Salomon Penne was just right, one of my favorite healthy seafood Italian dishes.

Dessert was AWESOME! Our server wasn't kidding, the pastry chef there, she is just that good! We had the "Chocolate Box w/ Berries" and that is one killer Chocoholics dream for two! This is definitely a good place to take a date and have nice, no stress dining, easy conversation, and good food! Note: street parking around Ghirardelli is free after 7pm. Bring lots of quarters if you park earlier!
author: Matthew M.

description:
Went here yesterday and I must say it was definitely a pleasant experience. Our server was awesome ( Crystal) I highly suggest the next time you go there ask to sit in her section. She was on top of everything from beginning to end. Awesome personality as well. As soon as we sat down she brought out drinks and when I told her it was my boyfriends birthday she asked him if he had a "birthday menu" when he said no she immediately rushed to the front to get him this menu and it was so cute! It had Happy Birthday typed on the top with the date, a small keepsake. 

Drinks were creative but very tasty. I had the Mai Tai and my honey had the Mojito and something that consisted of Jack Daniels w/ some sort of fruit juice. Very tasty I might add and I'm not even a Jack Daniel's fan. 

I started my dining experience with a Caesar salad, he started with a bowl of clam chowder. My salad was good, you can't really screw up a salad. His chowder however came out cold, but our server being the awesome person she is took it away and had it back and HOT in 5 minutes. =) He said one it was hot, it was a very tasty chowder.

Our entrees consisted of the linguine with Cajun chicken, this dish was okay, nothing special but pretty spicy. Nothing special. Birthday boy's dish however was veryyyyyyyyyyyyy good in my opinion. He had the Halibut with some sort of sauce. ( looks like soy sauce) and you dip your fish in the sauce. super yummy! and i don't even like fish.

Our waitress even surprised him with a dessert and a candle to blow out. =) Very sweet.

Parking is validated... 9$ off .... works for me... 

I would definitely go back... but only if Crystal is my server. HA! =)
author: Lisette E.

description:
The food is OK, but it IS overpriced. 32 bucks for a halibut fillet. yeesh. The wine selection was surprisingly decent. The view was nice.  The service was acceptable.

I can't believe nobody else has mentioned this in their review. I find this to be pretty damn unacceptable. After several glasses of wine and an irish coffee, I needed to use the facilities. When I got up there, I had to wait like 10 mins before I could relieve myself. Their restrooms only support one person at a time. Terrible.
author: Wes C.

description:
I remember coming here for prom back in high school. I don't really remember what we had but I visited this restaurant again three times in the last two months. My boyfriend had the seafood stew which tasted very delectable. I was surprised at the amount of clams and oysters they had in there. I had the yellowfin tuna but it wasn't that good. The outside had crusted pepper around it and the fish itself tasted pretty cold. We also had the garlic clams as an appetizer and the sauce with the clams were sooooo good! It tasted even better when it was dipped with bread. 

My friends and I also came here for the happy hour menu which has REALLY great prices ranging from $1.99 appetizers and $3.95 dishes. I ordered the Ahi Tuna melt and it was disgusting. It wasn't even ahi tuna, it was regular tuna. Our waiter didn't even bother writing down our orders and had to return to clarify what we ordered. Yet, he still managed to forget my order. When we told him he didn't put it in immediately but stalled for a good ten minutes. Other than the horrible service our Spicy Ahi Tuna roll was good. My friend had the Wasabi barbeque chicken wings which also tasted very good.
author: Vikki K.

description:
Reminds me of Legal Seafoods on the easy coast but more expensive, less friendly, and not as good with smaller portions... better views though.

This place was okay  but definitely not worth the price over over 50 a person.   First, the bread came out and it was cold and only half cut.  Second, I had the arugula/melon salad that was completely uninspired.  For dinner, I had the Pacific Grill which was okay, but just tiny pieces of fish and I couldn't really tell if they were grilled or not.

I agree with what other people were saying about the wait-staff... I couldn't tell if they were ordered not to be friendly or not but it was weird interacting with them during the dinner.  Then only validating for 1 hour was a but of a surprise when we had to WAIT ONE HOUR to sit down because they didn't remember our reservation.
author: Alex D.

description:
My dear friend has been raving about this Ghirardelli Square landmark 
for years. She finally talked me into going yesterday evening when she emailed me their "March Happy Hour Menu" with its incredible appetizer choices, many for only $1.95. With happy hour running from 3 - 6PM Monday through Friday, this is a great way to fore go cooking for the family and eat out, provided you don't indulge in too many of their yummy cocktails. 

We ordered several of the $1.95 choices which included full size treats! First off, we both had a McCormick's Cheeseburger, cooked to order, complete with a sesame seed bun, lettuce, tomato, red onion AND french fries. Next came my favorite, tasty Asian "Sesame Chicken Wings," six delectable yummies in sesame BBQ with a wasabi ranch sauce, "Beer Battered Mushrooms" with a sherry mayonnaise, and "Tandoori Chicken Skewers" with a cucumber dipping sauce. I did 
splurge and order one item from the $3.95 selections - the spicy tuna roll. Everything was FABULOUS....and, of course, we did imbibe from the $9.95 drink list. I had a passion fruit cocktail of some sort that I could 
have consumed in one gulp and my friend had some equally delectable berry treat. 

What a deal....we must definitely go back while the economy has this restaurant offering these great specials. If you're still hungry after happy hour, you can stay for dinner - the menu looks incredible and the views are what our wonderful Bay area is all about! 

Our server was excellent...my only complaint was that I was freezing on this very cold day, with the expanse of glass and the door constantly opening and closing. I guess I needed MORE alcohol!!!
author: Carmen H.

description:
I needed a place to take the wife for our anniversary.   I was looking for a seafood restaurant in Fisherman's Wharf and turned to my fellow yelpers.  After spending a hour reading reviews on various "tourist trap" seafood restaurants on the Wharf, I decided on McCormick & Kuleto's.

We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.  Scenery=FANTASTIC!  Service=GREAT!  Food=DELICIOUS!   Everything was perfect from beginning to end.  I had the grilled halibut and she had the salmon...cooked just right!  I wish the clams in the chowder were bigger, but it was still good chowder...just my preference.   It is a little pricey (my halibut, potatoes was $33), but it was for a special occasion, so who cares!   We will go back again!
author: John B.

description:
Good friggin' food.  I love a good seafood dish and by Jove, I got one here.  Cedar plank salmon with raspberry dipping sauce.  Holy friggin' Jesus.  I thought I was gonna have a Meg Ryan moment at the table.  Pair it with a crisp chardonnay and some roasted potatoes, and I'm writhing on the floor in front of my almost-mother-in-law and boyfriend (at that time anyway).

However, the wait time was a bit ridiculous.  The waiter took his sweet ass time taking our order and returning with drinks and food in a timely fashion.  Granted, we didn't have anywhere to be, but I was starving, man.  Couldn't he see that glazed look in my eye?

M.I.L & Boyfriend shared a whole bass and some fried calamari (which was some of the tastiest I've had).  

Dessert was tiramisu, one of my favorites.  If a restaurant has it, I tend to go for it because it's consistent and ends my experience on a positive note.

Another note:  they accept people in their casual attire despite the restaurant's dressy atmosphere.  Makes taking your guy out even easier, unless yours likes to get all fancy.  None of the guys I date every seem to.

Either way, this place was a nice way to experience San Francisco.
author: Lahnna E.

description:
When I was in high school, this was the place my family would go on special occasions.  I ate there more than a few times, and we always left feeling satisfied. 

Which is why I have to ask, WTF, M&K? 

We arrived there in the afternoon. We were a large party, I had family in town from Hawaii and Guam, and this seemed like the place to take them. After being seated and given lunch menus, we waited a full 35 minutes, without water, I might add, for our waiter to return. When he did, he informed us that the kitchen had closed for lunch and we'd have to order from the dinner menu.

I pointed out that he'd given us the lunch menu and we'd been ready to order for about 20 minutes. He was not apologetic. 

Our waiter's attitude did not improve for the rest if our meal, our food was not as good as expected (as I remembered from my youth) and I was disappointed that my plan to take my family out somewhere nice left me feeling like I'd just overpaid for a bad meal at Olive Garden. 

From other reviews on here I can see I'm not the first to experience this sort of thing.  I won't be back, and that's a shame because I could have been a lifelong customer.
author: Svoboda S.

description:
V.I.P. Happy Hour...5 entre items for only $1.95 Mon-Fri  3:00-6:00pm!
Do people know about this????  
If you can show proof that your a Bay Area resident with a driver's license or other id you get a little V.I.P. card that you can show them and they have 5 decent entres for only $1.95.  I highly recomend their cheesebuger with INCREDIBLE french fries.  They're like high end McDonald fries (don't laugh)...thin, krispy, and delicious.  The fried calamari is another winner...actually some of the best calamari I've had.  It's not what I expected from what I consider to be a pretty touristy restaurant.  It's not the best place, but it's hard to beat that happy hour deal and some of their items are right on.
author: Sean M.

description: Ugh this place sucks and is so overpriced. Yes, the views are amazing. But the staff is weird and rude and the food is not really good. Tourist trap!
author: Lina L.

description:
My husban made RSVP's for Valentines Day. We got there a few minutes early, the waiting area is way too small, they suggested going to the bar, what was the difference, that was small too and there was no available seats. So , we went back down to the waiting area and lucky enough 2 of the 3 seats were available. Good thing becasue I was wearing heels and ended up waiting 15 minutes after our RSVP was for. I get the fact that they were busy, its Valentines Day, fine, BUT, for such a high upscale restaurant, they should have had a bigger waiting area and been more on time with the seating.
Anyway, once we were called that our table was ready, all my frustration and annoyance dissappeared when I saw a dozen gorgeous red roses on our table. Aww, my husband is good!!! 
Our waiter was very helpful and very attentive! We had 3 bottles of wine $100 a pop! But, it was good!!!
We had a dozen oysters for starters. Then we had the lobster bisque...OMG, it was DELISH!!!! I had the Cioppini, I give that a 10, my hubby had the grilled swordfish, mashed potatoes. I know we probably had something else, but I cant remember, I was feeling good from the $100 wine we were drinking.
The food overall was delicious!!
Bill please.........................$500 for a dinner for 2! Will we go next weekend, I think not. WFor us at least, this only a special occasion type of place. However, we will be going back for the lobster bisque....but thats it! Too expensive! But, it is a 10 for food!
I gave it 4 STARS only because of the waiting and waiting area.
author: Carmen C.

description: Great location. Fantastic view.  Very popular restaurant.  The food is good, but the reservation staff are a bit rude and uncaring.  I called to make a reservation and the person on the phone said that they were fully booked that day.  The only opening was at 3:30pm (for dinner).  Seeing that is dinner was going to be our annual Christmas Dinner I agreed to a 3:30pm dinner.  On a whim I went to opentable.com to see if I could get a better table time.  What do you know?  ALL times were open 3:30pm - 9:00pm.  So I reserved at 5:00pm dinner and call the restaurant again.  I explain my two reservations and the woman says: "well we are overbooked so there is no guarantee you will be seated."  It is 5:10pm and we are seated in a nice cozy booth with a great view.  I would give more stars but the reservation process is horrible and leaves a bad taste in my food.
author: Alvin W.

description: Went there on Wed Feb 15th, 2012.  I ordered a Rib Eye Steak for dinner and received a New York.  I informed the waitress of the mix up, she came back and told me it was a Rib Eye per the chef.  I informed her is was NOT as I always order Rib Eye steaks - not New Yorks because I do not find them as flavorful.  Needless to say the restaurant was not willing to do anything to rectify this and I was STUCK with this New York steak.  I will not return to this place nor would I recommend it.  Customer satisfaction should be somewhere on their scale of good service.
author: Katheryn H.

description:
Why is it that all these allegedly high-end, generic American seafood restaurants have started serving seared ahi slices with a clump of wasabi, pickled ginger, and soy sauce? This restaurant even made this pretentious show of giving me disposable wooden chopsticks... JUST FOR THE AHI!  Ooh, be still my beating Asian heart!

And on top of that, the ahi wasn't especially fresh, certainly nowhere near as fresh as it would have been in any good Japanese restaurant in SF, and it was twice the price.

You could say: "It's your fault ordering raw fish in an American restaurant," but I disagree.  If this place is going to tout itself as a high-end seafood restaurant, the least they could do is use the freshest fish.  That and offer other seafood dishes besides seared ahi that aren't completely drowning in butter/cream/cheese.

What an overpriced tourist trap.
author: James L.

description:
I dined here on a nice corporate dime so I can say that I quite enjoyed my meal and the 10 different dishes I was able to try. Something I certainly would not have with my own pocket money.

My favorite was actually my main dish. Halibut Cheeks. I'm a sucker when it comes to cheeks. I see it on a menu. Whether it's braised veal cheeks. Or beef cheeks. I have to have it. 

The view's great and the service was great as well. The meal was great (Yes, I can keep saying great over and over disregarding proper writing etiquette). 

That said, this place is pretty pricey (outside of the awesome HH prices). You are certainly paying a premium for the location.
author: Kien L.

description:
As former Marina dwellers, my husband and I would walk here often for the great view, fabulous ambience, and amazingly delicious food & good service. Despite being local food snobs, we happily enjoyed eating at McCormick & Kuleto's beautiful Ghirardelli Square restaurant on Fisherman's Wharf.

I thought our family would enjoy the location for Mother's Day dinner this past month, and man were we wrong. We will never return to our former favorite haunt. Horrible service (for starters, 1 hour after ordering our appetizer, our calamari & $15-for-4-prawn-cocktail finally showed up -- and they hadn't even asked us if they could take our order yet! Asking where our soup was... begging for a 2nd glass of sparkling wine 3x to take me out of my misery... it goes on.) This with a table of 10, including 2 teens & 2 kids, not a romantic/leave-us-alone-to-linger dinner. And, once the food finally arrived, I'll plagarize another Yelper: "It Sucked."  It was very painful paying the $600 bill. The food and service has gone downhill, and we will not return.
author: Michelle L.

description:
First I'd like to preface this review by saying I was here for a wedding so I can only critique it on its wedding service. 

Overall, I enjoyed my experience at this restaurant. The servers were friendly and attentive considering the chaos of servicing a large wedding. They started with appetizers and drinks before dinner, and I particularly appreciated the servers who came out to the patio to serve us yummy tender sesame covered chicken strips, tasty filo dough baked brie, and flavorful bruschetta. 

When we got into the dining room it was nicely setup, albeit the tables were packed with all the flatware, silverware, and glasses. The service was prompt as they ensured we had drinks and correct dishes. The food came out pretty promptly and service was smooth. I had the filet mignon which was good although I would have preferred it to be medium rare, however I understand that they had to make them all the same to serve a large party. After dinner we were served vanilla ice cream in wine glasses and the wedding cake. Then we were ushered back downstairs for more drinks and festivities. 

Like I said at the beginning of the review, I can only judge this restaurant based on the service for the wedding, and based on this experience I had a nice time. I'd be happy to come again another time to try out their regular restaurant service!
author: Mabel L.

description:
My family is definitely a fan of McCormick and Schmicks and decided to spend our Thanksgiving dinner here. While the service was nowhere near as good as we expect from the McCormick's franchise, our overall experience was decent.

The cost here is what you would expect and very spendy. We only eat at McCormicks for special occasions and being a temporary resident of the area this fit the bill. To be honest $20/person was reasonable for a Thanksgiving day dinner.

The service was pretty slow and disorganized, this could have been because the staff was not too interested in working on Thanksgiving. They were very attentive when we spilled a drink on the table which was impressive.

The food was above average, but the brussell sprouts tasted like they came out of a perfume bottle. I'm guessing that they used too much truffle oil on the sauce.

Unfortunately I have to say that we will not be giving the Wharf area our business again since the City of SF insists on not getting rid of the Bushman. Our visit to the area was perfect until my wife was scared and humiliated by this "character" who then proceeded to imply she was scared when he slept with her last night too. Nah, we don't need that and we'll keep our dollars away thank you.
author: David D.

description:
Dad took me here for Christmas dinner, and raved about it the whole way there.  We got there about 15 minutes early an found a spot at the end of the bar.  Had a great pinot while we waited...

Although I realize that SOME people didn't make reservations (even though it was Christmas), we had time for 3 drinks each before we were seated - and I NURSE my drinks, folks.  Seriously.

The food wasn't bad - we had a really yummy appetizer, but the fish I had wasn't particularly memorable, and the veggies were boring.  I only ate half intentionally - but when I asked to take the rest with me, the busboy gave me the strangest look!!

I'm really looking forward to summer, when Gary Danko's set to open a restaurant around the hood.  I'll be going there instead, I think.
author: Madeleine K.

description:
It pains me to lower my rating, but I just have to in hopes that management will pay attention and make an attempt to regain their status as a 4 star restaurant.  The atmosphere is too great to be anything but a 4 star rating on Yelp.  

We came back for our anniversary weekend (6 years!!!) with a group of 12.  It was a pretty mediocre experience.  The food was just so-so.  Lots of strange occurances during the evening.  We paid over $1k so we should really expect true excellence... not the case last Sat. night.  

First of all, we were seated in the corner (it was somewhat fun for us cause we were right next to the staircase that we came up to make our grand entrance) BUT it was freezing.  We sat there for a good five minutes, noone wanted to take their coats off.  Our server was gracious and turned down the AC for us and it got better.  

The service was a bit hit-or miss.  There were many times where he took drink orders at one end of the table, but didn't bother coming down to our end of the table.  Also, I received my entree a good 5 minutes before anyone else (granted I ordered the seared ahi tuna, so it wasn't like I was concerned about my meal getting cold, but weird still).  Then, one of the gals in our group asked for her steak done medium and it showed up rare... so then she had to wait for them to fix the mistake while we all ate.

You can't go wrong with the ambiance.. They really knew what they were doing when they designed the restaurant with it's big windows facing the bay, gorgeous lighting and beautiful decor.  The food was not your top quality seafood, but decent.  My ahi dish came with a couple of rice/nori cakes....  but the rice was very dry.  Very disappointing.  The sourdough bread?  AWESOME!  I can never resist sourdough bread with butter... a definite weakness!
author: Sheila D.

description: Celebrated a birthday here!  At first thought it was a waste of time to come to the North Point section of SF for a simple dinner, but it was worth every mile.  McCormick and Kuleto's far exceeded my expectations!  One of the best salads I've had at any restaurant, that's saying a lot.  It was peppered just right and the ranch wasn't over-powering the natural crisp lettuce and the ingredients balanced really nicely.  As an entree I enjoyed beer battered catfish and house fries.  While the fish wasn't seasoned, the beer batter gave it a unique taste; but the side of cold slaw had a touch of seafood (which was unique).  Overall, the experience was wonderful, all guest seemed to enjoyed their appetizers and entrees.  They even customized the menus for keepsakes.  Waitress was patient and delightful.  Only drawback was it was a bit dark.
author: Krissy A.

description:
I love going to this place for some reason. I've been here 4 times and always had a great time. The last time I was here was with one my ex and it was completely packed. I had reservation and everything but we wanted a table with the view of the pier and water so we had to wait. I ordered the Clam Chowder and it's the best Clam Chowder I've had. This is coming from a person who love Clam Chowder. Anyways I order their steak and a glass of wine. The steak was delicious, tender, juicy and the flavor mMmm. That was until 2/3 into the steak there's a part was completely raw. I mean there was blood dripping when I put my fork in it. I told the waiter and he was happy to bring it in to recook. 

It was nice sitting and dining while there's a view of the pier and water. The whole wall is just glass so almost anywhere that you sit, you'll be able to see the water and sunset. The place just look beautiful, very classy, elegant and you know make you want to throw a button up and suit on for a night out when you go there. 

I think they have a great staff because every time that I was there, their service was always good. The wait staff have knowledge about the whole menu and they give out good recommendation. The only time they were a little slow was that day because it was packed since it's Valentine Day. I love going here and this is probably one of my favorite restaurant. It's quite pricey if you're on a budget but I've been to many nice restaurant but the food and service usually disappoint me. So if you want good food, lovely atmosphere, and great service, come to McCormick and remember to dress up a little. :)
author: Thanh T.

description:
My group and I started here for cocktails during Happy Hour. The drink specials and pre set happy hour meals sounded tasty. 

I had the Cucumber Martini and crab cakes... My Martini had cucumber infused vodka but needed an additional shot of regular vodka to even give the cocktail a kick.  

My crab cake was fair, 2 small pieces. ;( 

Overall the best part was the view.....AMAZING!!! Bay at sunset. The reason for me to return again.

I would try this place again and then edit my review.
author: Lady O.

description: I used to come here often for dinner and lunch.  We now come here often for the happy hour.  The seafood fare is very reliable here, always fresh.  The view is nice from the dining area and is a nice spot to take visitors from out of town.
author: V B.

description:
I had the Dungeness Crab Strozzapreti Pasta. I got a LOT more crab meat than I expected. The size of the noodles made it a bit difficult to eat, but it in no way would discourage me to order it again. (like penne sized x 3). We hit the dungeness crab season about 3 weeks into it and it was absolutely fantastic. 

Having spent a few weeks in August in Savannah, GA and Charleston, SC, I had some fantastic seafood there and this definitely comparable. and maybe even better.

My boyfriend highly enjoyed his lobster stuffed with dungeness crab and shrimp and brie. Something called Lobster Thimidor (that last word might be wrong, but it's close).  It was a special for the night and he loved it.

I thought the wine list was wonderful, mostly California wines with a very few French and kiwi wines in the mix. My waiter was very knowledgeable about the wine and gave us a great recommendation once I'd narrowed it down to a SavBlanc. 

Also, I very much enjoyed the view from the restaurant, but chalk that up to me being a newcomer to the bay area...I'm still enchanted by the west coast. 


P.S. My boyfriend just warmed up the leftovers of my dish and I'm about to attack him for them....
author: Liz T.

description:
came here for xmas dinner with the girls. the view is nice and service wasn't bad. i like how we got a round table for a party of 8 so it was easier to mingle.

food was pretty good...
-started off with hog island oysters-they were huge, but super sweet
-calamari w/ clintro mayo sauce-good, but too oily
-tuna tartar-yummy

i got the seabass-it looks werid cuz the sauce was all pink, but it was really good. there was a thin layer of hashbrown on top on my fish and spinach. it was tasty.

i tried my friends scallop and porkbelly-that was super flavorful

the smoked salmon was cooked to perfection

for the sides: mash potatos-fluffy and good
mushrooms-yummy
gnocci-not my thing...didn't like the pesto 

too full for dessert.
author: Karen H.

description: One star is too many. If you enjoy getting food poisoning and puking your guts out, then this is the place for you! Stay away from the lobster bisque.
author: Ali K.

description:
3.5 stars -- 3 for food, bonus 0.5 for the atmosphere and gorgeous views of the bay.

I loved the atmosphere here -- great grown-up type place to have a nice meal, lovely with a lovely clinking of glasses and flurry of conversations going on. I also enjoyed the seating -- tiny old-style, lamp-on-table booths that angle diners' eyes toward the floor-to-ceiling windows showcasing the bay.

The food was cruising for an almost-4-star rating early on; the sweet potato fries were good, as was my house salad (the greens were quite fresh). But my entree was disappointing -- the broth on the grilled scallops too salty, the texture of the scallops a tiny bit rubbery. Not inedible, but I did leave one full scallop behind, which is most unlike me.

Stopped at the Ghirardelli soda shop afterward for an ice cream cone -- perfect ending to a rich meal.
author: Nob H.

description:
The best clam chowder and crab cakes in the City. Hands down.

Here's why: 
Chowder is thick, which it must be. Chowder is flavored correctly - I can taste the sauteed celery in there. Chowder tastes great with ground pepper and tastes fresh. I am left craving more, as it should be.

Crab cakes are tender, not pasty and you can taste the fresh crab - its very moist. They are panfried, freshly. There are two sauces, one a fabulous cream sauce puddled around the cake, the other is "chive oil" which just takes the flavor over the top and makes it the BEST.

Love the service and the newly renovated powder rooms as well. 
Plan to bring the family here next month for sure.
author: Nan L.

description:
Made reservations several days in advance of their November 11, 2007 special Veteran's Day dinner - I called on Nov. 11, 2007 to verify the reservation but found out it was deleted.  They still had space but an hour earlier.  I asked for a window table but was told that they wouldn't promise us one, but they would put down the preference.  We didn't get a window table even though there were more than six or seven window tables available for over an hour.  The host was a little rude too.

Food:  We had Cobb Salad, Grilled Trout, Pacific Seafood Stew, Scallops over Crab cake, and Sashimi Combo, for our appetizer we had the Oyster Sampler.  

The oysters had shell fragments in them.
The scallop dish was Ok - scallops were salty but the crab cakes were good.  
The grilled trout was tasteless and the vegetables were undercooked.  The seafood stew and sashimi combo were forgettable.  

Even with complimentary entree for the two veterans in the family, this dinner cost us over $100.00 for four people.  In our opinion, the food was overpriced and not very good.  

PASS on this restaurant.
author: G. T.

description:
I really want to love this place. The location is fantastic, they validate parking and the menu looks fantastic. The menu says it really focuses on fresh and local ingredients but my latest visit there left much to be desired.
The drink menu is very comprehensive and the bloody mary mix is some of the best I have had. Unfortunately, the celery they used for garnish was soggy and browned on the edges. Really? You go to all that trouble to perfect the mix and you put that in it?
As for the apps, we ordered some oysters and some were wonderfully fresh but one was frozen. The duck spring rolls sounded awesome but the duck was dry and lacked flavor. The dish also came with a heaping pile of herbs and lettuce. It was a nice thought but there was so much wasted.
My crab sandwich was good and the fries were perfect. My fiance had a strange version of the Hangtown Fry. It made us miss Tadichs's. 
I will give the place another try as I love the location and if well executed, would be stunning,
author: Jann J.

description: A member of the McCormick  & Schmidt family of restaurants.  a bit pricey, but a very nice restaurant and good service.  get a table by the window or in the corner facing the bay for a spectacular view of the street life and water (and the bay swimmers!).  the food and environment are pleasant and fresh and make for a good dining experience. only drawback is the price.
author: Justin H.

description:
You can't beat the view and well the view.  The food was pretty sub par.  Pretty much everything I had was not impressive.  The waiter was very friendly, but now they are doing some preferred member program with discounts and some birthday free entree.  I really don't want to be sold a membership when I am grabbing dinner.  I guess it is a recession gimmick they are offering.  Who knows.  

I would likely come back if the folks are in town and we need a quick bite to eat, but will remind myself to keep it to a few starters and a beer and wait to eat a full meal somewhere else.
author: Aaron B.

description: Food was okay, view was great and service was amazing! Niles was the best and on top of it! Wish we could bring him to Vegas!
author: Brisa S.

description:
Out of all the places on the wharf. This is probably one of the most elegant of them all. Plus they offer a huge selection of every seafood thing you could possibly want. 

From shark to mahi mahi to salmon to seabass to clams oysters and mussels. They have it all. All flown in from different parts of the world and is superbly fresh. I love it. 

All of the entrees are created with their perfect counterparts. 

The view is beautful. The lighting is not too romantic but not too bright either. 

You also dont have to be too dressy, after driving around the city all day i dont feel bad coming in a pair of flats.

It is pretty expensive, but then again I am a foody and i have never cared about price for good food.
author: Kristiin P.

description:
We had our Valentines Day celebration here, we pre booked a week ago for 8:00pm.
And believe it or not we are seated @ 9:15 pm. We have no choice at that moment, no where to go because that day all restaurants are already fully booked unless we decided to eat @ McDonalds!
And also that day is very very cold we cannot even stay outside so we just stayed inside
Standing for 1.5 hrs. (We went there @ 7:35 pm to check). We are like sardines in that front desk area. Even though I told the 2 concierge
That I'm Diabetic and really needed to eat something no effect at all. That Day I guess they became so greedy and booked too much people. we ordered their Valentines Day special the Persian spiced Lamb Top Sirloin (very Pricey) and Grilled Mahi Mahi Chimicurri, we also ordered their Small Oysters Sampler for Appetizer, they're so delicious but not enough too tiny. The Trio Mushroom soup & Clam Chowder soup are just okay, the Clam chowder is a bit salty though.The Food is good my Lamb was cooked to perfection
The Cous Cous rice is good too. The Server is friendly but he looks so tired. 
I could have given them 4 stars or even 5 because the food I ordered is good. But
Our overall experience is not so good. Maybe next time we will try to Dine there
But definitely not on Valentines Day.
author: Jhunn T.

description: Great evening. Perfect round table for our group of 7 with a fabulous view of Aquatic Park out the huge windows. Excellent raw oysters app. Delectable scallops main. Delicious chocolate dessert. Good service, great atmosphere. Highly recommend.
author: Scott v.

description:
There are restaurants in the city that are expensive and touristy, but you go there because it's a solid bet your food will be good and there's a reason San Francisco is the tourist destination it is.  McComick and Kuleto is a perfect example of this.

The touristy is the location and the view.  Ghirardelli isn't quite the cultural center of San Francisco but it can be fun and the views from the dining room are outstanding.  The Bay/Marin/Golden Gate bridge really are worth it.

The food is solid, high quality seafood and chops.  There will be no meals that blow you away with their innovation here but you'll rarely feel like you didn't have a good dish.

It's a little pricey because location = $$$

Enjoy it for what it is and you'll have a good time.
author: Jared W.

description:
this place is pretty nice for a touristy restaurant.  it overlooks the bay - making the ambiance great.  

my boyfriend and i started out the evening pretty well.  we got our wine, crab cakes, and entrees pretty fast - he had rib-eye, which was meh, and i had coho which was good.  we intended to have dessert but it felt like we sat there for 20 minutes waiting for our server.  that was the only downer about our experience.  since we got there via zipcar, we had to pass and stop at ben & jerry's to satiate our sweet cravings.  otherwise, i would have given it a 3 star.
author: Bettina D.

description:
It ain't hip or happening and yes (gasp!) there are tourists there.  

Howevah...  You should check it out sometime.

Transit Man and I have been here twice for late-afternoon appetizer-only lunches and both the food and service have been exemplary.  On neither occasion had we planned on coming beforehand but each time was excellent.  Both visits fell between lunch and dinner service and the restaurant was uncrowded and we had an excellent table (in fact, we had the same table on both visits...).

One of the standouts from the most recent visit was the seared ahi with a traditional wasabi and pickled ginger garnish.  Very common, right?  Yes, but it was *perfect*.  The spicy spring roll was quite wonderful, as well.

We also ordered figs stuffed with goat cheese and garnished with pistachios and a balsamic reduction.  The server asked how we liked it and I said it was really good, but in my opinion it needed a little more textural balance (more pistachios?) and the contrast of something boost the 'savory' side.  She indicated that it was new on the menu and if we were willing to wait, the executive chef wanted to hear our feedback first hand.   He came by and we spent a couple of minutes chatting. 

Like all of Pat Kuleto's restaurants with a view orientation that I've been to, the seating is tiered and the tables are generously sized and not so close to each other that you're sitting on a stranger's lap.

The view of Aquatic Park, Pier 39 (the view of the Balclutha alone is worth it) and the Bay beyond the Muni pier is, well, peerless.
author: Nancy W.

description:
Views: 5 stars
Food: -1 star
Prices: -1 star
This was my out of state coworker's choice.  She wanted something with a view and touristy.  The bread was good as was the service.  We didn't have a reservation yet we were seated quickly.  I had the fettuccine alfredo which was ok but on the watery side.  My coworker had the a steak which she said was ok.  The rest of the menu is rather basic, lots of fish, some red meat and other traditional items like calamari and fish and chips.  Good strong cosmos too.  This place is worth it for trying once because the view is spectacular.
author: La C.

description:
Had Christmas dinner here with family. Must admit that we went there because it was the only place that looked decent that we could find that had reservations available.

Cocktails were a little slight, but nicely executed. Good wine list ('02 Iron Horse Chardonnay). Food was wonderful, fish cooked exactly as we wish (from rare to medium) and very friendly service, especially considering our waiter had most likely had the Christmas crowd from hell.

Solid (if not adventurous) dining experience, especially considering the holiday.
author: Jason D.

description:
There is not one of Pat Kuleto's restaurants that I haven't loved this being no exception. I took my mom here for Christmas Eve Dinner and she loved it. The views are amazing, it has a large open dining room,  warm color scheme with wood and brass in the bar. Our service was attentive and friendly on such a busy evening. This is a great place to take the parents or groups with kids. The menus emphasis is mainly on seafood but you'll also find some great pasta dishes as well as a well prepared steak.
Located in Ghirardelli Square.
author: JJ C.

description:
McCormick & Schmick's in Boston is pretty good so we thought we'd try it on the west coast.  Thought the food was somewhat lacking, but being from New England, I realize I'm spoiled when it comes to seafood. 

The service is a whole different story, though.  It was hands-down the WORST service I've ever had.  Our waitress completely ignored our requests and didn't deserve the tip we left. 

Bottom line - head to Scoma's instead.
author: Erin V.

description:
We were walking in Ghiradelli Square, looking for a place to eat. I know, tourist hell, but we were on foot and not wanting to take a cab somewhere. I saw McCormick & Kuleto's and was excited - I've never had a bad meal in a McCormick & Schmick's restaurant, not in Washington, DC, not in Crystal City, VA, not in Berkeley, not in San Jose. Always fresh, excellent seafood.

We walked in, expecting a wait - after all, it was a Saturday night about 7PM and we did not have a reservation. The maitre d' was very courteous, friendly and efficient, and !gasp! found us a table with a view. Immediately. I thought we had it made. The view was spectacular! 

Our waiter was excellent - we could see that he was very busy but his service and attention did not wane at any time. I'd have to give them at least 4 stars for service alone. 

I ordered citrus crusted sea scallops - I can't pass up scallops. My SO ordered the grilled sea bass, which he can't pass up. We should both have passed.

The scallops came out on the cold side, and soggy. No good sear on them - just plain old white. Like they'd just sat under the heat lamps and someone sprinkled citrus-seasoned panko crumbs on them. A disappointment. And my SO's sea bass? Well, it tasted like it was a few days old, and getting to the point where it should not have been served. Fresh sea bass is not fishy, at all. And it was tough, overcooked. But at least the mango salsa or whatever it was masked the fishy flavor. It just seemed sad, somehow - that we're sitting here looking out at the Pacific Ocean (well, the Bay) and the seafood we're eating is uninspired, not fresh, and poorly prepared. 

Another thing worth a mention - and I know this to be absolutely true at cheaper places - don't order wine by the glass. We did, since at higher end places, there are more quality controls in place. Wrong. My pinot gris  tasted like it had been sitting uncorked in the bar fridge for a few days. While we're on the subject, this is a seafood restaurant, right? The white wine list was pretty uninspired and ran to lower end whites, with no decent Sauv Blanc options. That's just a crime, in California.

One absolute rave about dinner - the cappuccino creme brulee. Now, that was delectable.
author: K S.

description: We dined at this restaurant for our last night in San Francisco.  We wanted something special and since we are familiar with McCormick and Schmick's here in Seattle, we thought this would be a great choice.  When we arrived, we were told we couldn't be seated yet since our entire party hadn't arrived yet.  While we were waiting, other parties came in that didn't have reservations and were seated at tables by the window.  The two hostesses started looking at us and talking behind a menu and then said we could be seated even though our party hadn't all arrived.  We were given a table far away from the windows.  Our waiter was so busy, he literally RAN between tables.  Fifteen minutes passed between appetizers and salads.  During our meal, the bar manager dragged TWO LARGE, OVERFLOWING GARBAGE cans right past our table. Totally unacceptable! Tables were taken down loudly (doors could have been shut) and carried out past us from the private dining room. My sister and I both ordered the Crab Louie.  It was ice berg lettuce, four pieces of tomato, one egg, and six pieces of cucumber.  There was crab but not a huge amount.  Way overpriced for the salad we were given.   Our dinner took so long that we were the last table to leave.  While we were eating our dessert, the bar manager came over to announce to us that the bar was closed and the door locked.  I would not recommend this restaurant and would be hesitant now to recommend any McCormick and Schmick's restaurants.
author: Lynda F.

description:
THIS HAPPY HOUR ROCKS MY SOCKS!

I've only been here once and had the $2.95 half-pound cheeseburger (w/fries) and a beer. This was one of the best cheeseburgers I've ever had and the fries were perfectly seasoned and a little crunchy, just how I like it. The $4.95 fish tacos were pretty good as well.

My only gripe was that the food took a while to come out, but nothing can beat this price + a beautiful view of the bay!

Now if only happy hour was til 7p, I'd be here more often.
author: Kelly K.

description:
The best thing about the restaurant was the awesome view and romantic ambiance. Our booth had us seated directly facing the gorgeous sunset...Definitely a great place for dinner around 6 or 7 in the evening. They had a wonderful wine and fresh fish selection on the menu. But I  ended up getting the grilled tuna with watermelon sauce (served with bok choy and rice cake). I can almost say that I enjoyed the ricecake as much as I did the tuna. I know it sounds strange that the rice cake can be soooo good, but it's really no ordinary/bland/stale rice cake. It soaked up the juices from the fish and the watermelon sauce which made each bite oh-so savory. Thicker portions of the fish was cooked really well, but thinner regions of the tuna may have lost too much of the moisture. 

The waittress came by following the entree to drop off the dessert menu. I caught eye of the creme brulee, but I had to resist and save room for other treats. (McCormick & Kuleto;'s is located right in Ghiridelli Square...yummy sundaes)

Service was great. The waittress was very attentive. I have a water-overdrinking tendency, and she made sure my cup was at least half way full at all times. We also used a 20 dollar off coupon that we found off of their website. Great deal! We ordered two entrees and it came out to $40 even (including the tip).
author: Carrie W.

description: I came here with my family for mother's day since it was pretty much the only place that was still taking reservations last minute.  I want to give them 4 stars, but their customer service is horrible. When I called to confirm my reservation the lady said she couldn't find my name, and started giving me all this attitude.  Luckily, I was able to make an additional reservation.  I gave this place three stars because we enjoyed the food and they were able to give us a table next to the window.  However, i just hated the way our waitress treated us.  In fact, I looked around at all the other waiters and they all looked just as unenthusiastic and rude.  You would think on a special occasion, they would smile and greet their customers but as soon as we sat down it just seemed as if they wanted to get our order in and get us out.  It doesn't look like i'm the first to complain about the poor service, which shows they obviously don't care because the service doesn't seem to get any better.  My halibut was good though, and i'm just glad we got window seats.  If it wasn't for that... I would have rated this place 2 stars.
author: Mae P.

description: We had a unexpected visit from the parents so we planed a trip to San Francisco to have diner with the family. We came across the Golden Gate Bridge and easily traveled rt into the wharf. Parking was easy we then went in we were greeted and seated rt away the staff was very polite & professional we were seated at a beautiful table located in front of a window with awesome views of the bay.there were 5in our party and we all order separate dinners. We order appetizers to start we had fresh bread and fresh salad then our meals all five of us were very happy with everything we were served we had desert and all five of us left happy we recommend everyone eat here :)
author: Mark C.

description: Excellent food and view!  There menu is on the pricey side but the view is awesome.  We had a great dinner and what'd the sun set over the water! I would go here again.  The wheelchair access is off of Larkin St. Through their bar area.  Larkin St is a steep hill, however once inside both dining levels are accessible!
author: Douglas B.

description: DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY! If you crave that beautiful view of the city bay just stay outside and dine somewhere else for a delicious seafood meal. Wednesday night our family went to this place for dinner with two out of town guest that were staying at the Fairmont ( we should of ordered room service). It took 20 minutes to get our Arnold Palmers and Wine, 30 minutes for our salads and thankfully only 15 minutes for our entrees. The salads were good. The entrees were terrible. The Crab pasta with Blue Cheese and Sugar Snap peas was disgusting. The pasta was warm then they put cold crab meat on top. Yuck. The Clam with linguini was so spicy all you tasted was red pepper flakes and destroyed the beautiful clams. The scallop dish was over cooked, the shrimp scampi was garlicy (but I think ok) and the filet was cooked right (med-rare) but tiny size. We can't believe that place serves meals like this and charges over $25 for every entree.  There are times when service can make up for the terrible food but the server didn't even try and was overwhelmed.  The dining room was full but there was no site of a manager. This is a terrible representation of SF food and service. My suggestion: take a walk along the bay and go to the Mission District for amazing food and half the price.
author: Ryan E.

description:
Our family descended on McCormick & Kuletto's for a long overdue get together.  All of us are adults ranging from 20 to I'm guessing 75.  The atmosphere at the restaurant is nice - fancy but not stuffy.  The view was great even with a foggy night.  We were able to see across to Sausalito/Tiburon, Angel Island and Alcatraz and watch the sky change color as the sun went down.  One of the Aunts spent a long time staring at the people swimming in the bay and being amazed by it.  I have to admit, I don't know how anyone actually does do that.  Too cold for me.  
The service was attentive but not overly.  I have a food allergy and the waiter not only checked the two dishes I asked about but checked on all of the salmon dishes and a couple of other specials just in case I had decided I'd like a different one.  
As for the food, I'd give them 3 1/2 stars.  I was not able to eat the crab and shrimp cake appetizers we had so I can't rate them but my son loved it and they disappeared off the table.  
I had the Clam Chowder as a starter and it was average - nice and creamy but not a knock out.  There was a good balance of clams and potato but I still needed to add my oyster crackers to it.  
I chose the Grilled Wild Salmon with corn pudding cake and cherry tomato salad. The fish was a little over cooked for my tastes, but then I like my fish very rare so I can't complain about that and I didn't tell them how I wanted my fish done.  The corn pudding was yummy but the tomato salad was a little too vinegary but otherwise tasty.
My son had the Mahi Mahi and since I had asked about that dish I knew I could taste it.  It was done very well and I would get it if I go again and it is offered.  It was breaded in Macadamia nuts and served in a milky sauce with plantains as an accompaniment.  I enjoyed the small piece he gave me and he licked his plate clean.
Other dishes ordered were Fisherman's Stew (a little of everything from the sea including a crawdad that neither of the people who ordered it knew how to get into - I told them to rip it in half and pretend it is a little lobster); grilled scallops and vegetables; penne pasta with salmon; tilapia in a nut crust with fruit salsa and rum sauce; and Petra sole in bread crumbs with mashed potatoes on the side.  Everyone enjoyed their dishes and overall it was a satisfying meal.   The menu changes daily and the fish tasted fresh.  No one ordered wine but they had a nice selection of wines by the glass as well as bottles.  
Overall I would recommend it for a group gathering.   I wouldn't come here on a "date" but for a group like this, it was appropriate and everyone found something that satisfied their particular tastes.
author: Karen C.

description:
I have been here many times. I usually go with people visiting because you can't beat the view and it's the best restaurant in the wharf area.

My last experience there was not a good one although the manager came through at the end otherwise I would have given 1 star. 

I went with a friend from out of town who wanted to see the GG bridge and the sea lions on pier 39. We had a reservation and got a great table right away. Everything went downhill from there. Appetizers never came,    And one entree was raw. Was sent back to have cooked properly and it took a very long time to come back, I was already done eating by the time my friend's  meal came back. The manager, Mia came over and apologized profusely and did not charge us for our meal. 

So it was a series of unfortunate events but rather than just apologized Mia compensated us for it. 

This was the only bad experience I have ever had there.        

When in the area I would definitely recommend it! The food and view can't be matched!
author: D S.

description:
Just a quick review  to possibly save someone else from making the same mistake.  Don't order the so-called lobster tail for $34.95 at McCormick & Kuleto's unless you bring a magnifying glass with you.  It may be fresh, but it's the smallest lobster tail I've ever seen.  Not only that, but they serve it in the shell so it appears larger.  By the time you're finished trying to dig the minuscule amounts of flesh out of the shell, you'll be lucky to get three small bites.  I think they told me it was 5 ounces after I commented on the size (or lack thereof), but that must be including the weight of the shell.

I was looking forward to my first lobster tail in decades and was beyond disappointed when I was served this.  Listing this dish on the menu as "lobster tail" should be illegal.  To be perfectly fair, it was served with a delicious corn succotash.  I think a less deceptive listing on the menu would have been "Succotash with petite lobster tail."  I also would not recommend the Caesar salad, which was limp.

That being said, the view is excellent, the decor is nice, and the staff was very friendly and attentive.  However, I don't see myself ever returning to this restaurant.
author: Elaine T.

description:
I'm surprised at all the bad reviews here.  We ate dinner here last Friday and we loved it.  I booked the reservation on opentable, arrived a little early so we went to the bar to have a drink.  I love the dark wood throughout the restaurant.  The bartender was super nice and offered to let me try two different wines before choosing one.  

The view really is amazing too, especially around sunset.  After it gets completely dark, not much can be seen.  We got one mixed greens salad and one caesar's salad, and they were not too impressive.  Then, we got one scallops dish which was really yummy and one Petrale sole dish with parmesean cheese, which was good but on the greasy/heavier side.   We cabbed there so we didn't have the parking sticker shock, but yeah, it's pretty darn expensive to park at Ghiradelli Square.  The service was good too.  The clientele had a lot of tourists and a lot of foreigners too, but it's Ghiradelli Square afterall. 

Overall, the food was good and the view is amazing.  If I had out of town guests, this will definitely be a place I'd bring them.
author: Pelina C.

description:
Meh, I would give 2.5 stars total, but the views can bump it up to Yelp's requisite whole number ratings. The food was only so so for what you're paying: the prawn scampi in my linguine was good -- and they actually give you quite a few -- but the pasta and sauce was kind of bland. I specifically asked for the pasta to be al dente (yes yes, I'm a snob), but it was still slightly overcooked. Whether that means they usually REALLY overcook it, and it was a good thing I asked for it to be al dente, or they didn't heed my request at all is yet to be determined.

A friend's parmesan-crusted sole (our waiter's recommendation) was only so-so, but the bf's tombo tuna tempura appetizer was pretty good -- delicately fried, and not smothered in fried batter. The clam chowder was good too, with richness coming from the seafood and sherry, rather than lots of cream. But almost $40 (including tax and tip) for an iced tea, good clam chowder, and so-so prawn scampi linguine, for LUNCH mind you... well, at least I enjoyed the views and company.
author: J C.

description:
My fiancee and I have always enjoyed this restaurant. The food was always good. Our servers have always been prompt, friendly and helpful with giving suggestions on what to try from their menu. We find this place quite nice to just sit in and relax and enjoy the food together.

The only downside is the waiting time to be seated with reservation made. There has been a few times that we waited 20-30 minutes to be seated. That's quite a bit too long for a reservation. It can also be a bit loud and crowded during dinner times.
author: Rodel M.

description:
My company had our Christmas holiday party here in 2008. The party started with servings of hors d'oeuvres - new zealand rack of lamb (turned out to be the best), grilled vegetable lavash, baked scallops, deep fried chicken fingers, and veggie fresh baked pizzas. All were mediocre except the lamb as it was the highlight of the party. 

For our main course, my wife had the filet mignon and lobster thermador stuffed with crab meat and I had the rib-eye steak with garlic prawns (or it could be the other way around, but we shared). 

The steaks were awful, both the filet and rib-eye had a fowl smell to it, like it was going bad or something. Taste-wise, both weren't that much better either, but I think the rib-eye was at least bearable. I couldn't even eat the filet - it was that bad...and I love steak! 

Lobster thermador was decent, but the grilled prawns was a joke. They're really just shrimp, the medium to large kind, and it definitely tasted more like it was steamed than grilled, kind bland too. 

Dessert was a joke as well as they brought out a sampler of biscotti, chocolate truffle with raspberry sauce and fruit tart, all in one dish so everyone had to share. But because there were only 2 of each, some didn't really get to taste all different samplers. Not sure why they did it like that. What they expect us to do, split those tiny truffles into 4 pieces? 

Well, at least we had a decent guy working behind the bar and basically all the alcohol you can withstand. I'm not much of a drinker, but it's cool to try some of the drinks that I normally would not order in a bar. 

At the end of the night, the only positive thing was the rack of lamb. I had 3 pieces and it was really good. The rest were either mediocre or extremely bad. I doubt my company will come back again as most of us agree that the steaks reek.
author: Tom S.

description: Was a little disappointed in the prep of the food.  I ordered the Sole Petrale dish, it was over cooked, dried and tasteless.  Little sauce, maybe a teaspoon worth.  The bread came late, their  Exotic Mushroom Sauté was over cooked, like the light before, it was dry, and tasteless.   Would i got back, not at this location.  Try Irvine location.
author: William O.

description: Ate lunch here during the Americas Cup off day. Seated right away, wait staff was attentive and professional. We had the shrimp cocktail appetizer which was very good, 5 or 6 jumbo shrimp. We each had a cup of the clam chowder, one of the best I have ever had. I had the seared sea scallops, four huge specimens, on a cauliflower puree that was not smooth as it should have been. The wife had the small filet which was done as ordered and tasted perfect. We had a very good espresso flavored creme brulee to complete the meal. By far not the best meal we ever had but the excellent maitre-d and the rest of the staff made the experience memorable.
author: J G.

description:
I really love this restaraunt. 

The view is awesome, the food is pretty good, and everyone there is very warm and friendly. 

I am a big fan of fish, and you can get it fresh and delicious here. The menu is 'different' every day, but I always order the crab cakes. They're excellent. 

This is a great place to take a date, to celebrate during a night out, or to watch a beautiful sunset. Pick a day with good weather!
author: Kenan A.

description:
Just got back from McCormick & Kuleto's and my taste buds are pretty satisfied right now. I am still very full by the delicious food I had with my coworkers. 

Overall, it is a nice place to go if you appreciate fresh seafood. I always believe freshness is the key to good seafood. If it is fresh, it will most likely taste good. We ordered oysters and clams for appetizer, they were perfect. My sea bass was excellent too, tender and juicy, and well seasoned. Just my coconut flavored rice was a little bit on the hard side. And of course we couldn't pass the deserts even though all of us were pretty full after our main courses. As we expected, deserts were great, I had coconut flan, creamy, not too sweet, lightly toasted crispy coconut added a very nice touch.

Almost forget to mention, the view is great too. Through those large windows, you can overlook the beautiful SF bay, what more you can ask for?
author: Samantha Z.

description:
+ had fish from San Pedro, California, hometown of the gods
+ the chocolate box o rasperry mousse is still my favorite chocolate dessert and that's saying a lot
+ the layout, you always feel like you have a good table
+the view when you can see it
+ the salads
+ the drinks

- there orginality of the menu

I go there with my parent when they're in town and it's always a nice dinner, but nothing blows my mind (except the box made out of chocolate, that's just genius).
author: Katie T.

description:
Went here for a family dinner. 

Everyone really enjoyed their meal. The shrimp cocktail was HUGE, the fried calamari tasty and the creme brulee delicious.

Prices are up there, but the selection of fish and preparation methods is very expansive.

Nice views of the bay as well.
author: Shannon B.

description:
Great View, Bland bland bland food. 
*did i mention bland?*

Came here for a friend's birthday. We sat near the windows with a great view. It was a beautiful sunny day in SF (a rare event).

The seafood appetizer platter was pretty tasty- coconut prawns, popcorn shrimp, crab cakes, and fried calamari.

I shared a couple of dishes with my friend.  The swordfish skewers and tilapia with Jamaican Rum Sauce. I was disappointed with both. They were quite bland.  Adding some salt and pepper didn't help. In fact i couldn't differentiate the fish because they both tasted the same- BLAND. For about twenty something a platter it sure wasn't worth it.

We also had the creme brulee. Another disappointment. It had so much orange zest in the dessert it tasted like cough syrup. 

Come here for the view, appetizers, and possibly a drink. Surprisingly I can't recommend the fish platters.
author: Bert T.

description:
I came here on vday, had to wait 15 mins even though we arrived on time for our reservations. The food was VERY mediocre and overpriced. The only thing worth ordering is the stuffed salmon. I had the black cod, which the waiter recommended, and it tasted like the steam fish I usually make at home (asian style).  I have to admit, the fish was fresh, it just wasn't good. What a waste.

Besides that, the service was terrible. Our waiter kept walking right pass us to serve the tables NEXT to us. I believe the ratio for amount of service given to table next to us and our table is about 5:1. 

And of course, we did not get a seat with the view. 

Our tab with crab cakes, steamed clams, stuffed salmon and black cod was about ~$80. But the opportunity cost of going to a better restaurant to share a perfect date...priceless.
author: Tiffany T.

description:
Been here twice, and both times were fabulous.

I'm a sucker for classy seafood restaurants next to the water.  Peak time, sunset! Take a date or grab some friends after work and hit up the bar.  The have delicious salads and very generous entrees. I was impressed by their drink selection, they have a ton of old fashion cocktails which were fun to learn about.
author: Tammy L.

description: Wow, Im surprised this place has such low reviews.  Went here for the happy hour, which was awesome.  Me and my friends had such a great time we stayed there for a long time.  The view is great and the service was great! Would definitely go back next time I'm around ghiradelli square!
author: Molly F.

description:
You pay a premium for the view and the fact that it is in tourist central.  Our meals were not bad but for the money expected something a little more special.  

Interior feels like a Cheesecake Factory and the food was similar in quality.
author: David I.

description: I can speak only the martinis, chowder and sour dough bread & butter and views.    Martini's were top notch - fresh lemons squeezed into the drink.  I'm picky about my drink and clearly they don't use pre-mixed beverages.   nice cold martini glass with a fine sugared rim.   The sour dough bread was fantastic and had great flavor (along with the butter - no weird tastes from the fridge).  The chowder was very good.    The view is outstanding!  Service was friendly, helpful and efficient.  Stop next door at Giradelli for a square of chocolate to finish off - or a chocolate sundae.  I'll go back!
author: Jules T.

description: View of Alcatraz and sun setting is great! Service is good. Food is not so good. I first tried this restaurant in June 2012 and it was very good, crab cakes were fresh and the sturgeon was very delicious. It was so good I went back the following day for lunch! I went back this June 2013 and boy was I disappointed. The crab cakes were not as good and actually looked awful and the sturgeon was overcooked and just not appetizing. I guess they must have changed chefs and that was not a good move. I cannot recommend this restaurant like I used to anymore.
author: Betty Y.

description:
Their food is good, good salads, oysters, and seafood.

Typically, we go on a Sunday nite late because it's 1/2 a block away so I am biased,  eat in the bar/lounge (low key and no reservations needed) and, order oysters (fresh and tasty) and steamers their sauce is the best. Extra bread for dipping in the clam broth. Then, split a fish entree. It's touristy but, great views out the window and, nice place to bring in visitors who don't want to eat at a "scene"
author: L P.

description:
It's an expensive and pretentious restaurant -- and sometimes that's exactly what you want, and sometimes you're just going here to lunch on a rainy day because you work across the street.

It's not my kind of establishment, but I was pleasantly surprised by the $5.45 bowl of potato leak soup.  It's absolutely delicious, and it comes with incredibly tasty sourdough bread!  However, it's a wild guess when this soup option is on the menu which changes daily (you might luck out on Tuesdays and Fridays).

Things worth mentioning:
- Wait staff is very attentive and want to take your dishes before you're even done licking them.
- Very few vegetarian options are available.
- They go all fancy with the presentation of the food so don't expect your lettuce to be cut when you order the house salad.
- Happy Hour menu starts at 3:00PM and you can get a burger for under $2.00 if you buy two drinks (great deal!).
author: Vicky B.

description:
Came here a few years ago and finally decided to write a review.

We came here for one of our Bday parties and i agree with many of the yelpers here that view is awesome! Atmospher very posh and the staff at the time were ok.

Food however was not that great.  We ordered mussels and salmon and pasta....not really that great..  The mussels had a really strong fishy taste and it was enough to gag....

Pasta was very disappointing.....

I ordered a steak sandwhich.  It was probably the only thing thats good there...how friggin sad.  i will never come back again.....
author: Shirley H.

description: Great views, but that is about it. Bread is cold, fish drenched in butter, risotto and gnocchi unedible. Very disappointing dinner for my husband and I on our one year anniversary. Left with a $90 check and we even split an entree. Completely regret choosing this place.
author: Ashley S.

description:
I love this place.  I wish I could get here more often; it's a bit out of the way for me, and I hate hanging out in parts of the city that are overrun with countrified tourists.  Still, every now and again I have to come here to get my seafood fix on.  Nice view, if you can get it.  I prefer the small booths up on the "mezzanine" platform.  It's quieter and more private than being right on the floor with a window table, yet you still get awesome views.  Service has been good --sometimes even stellar--every time I've been here.  

The dessert menu could use a bit of work, but you don't come here for dessert.  That's what Ghiradelli's is for, right across the way.
author: Lizette W.

description: Ate here with the boss and coworkers for Christmas lunch. I tried the carpaccio, the gnocchi and sturgeon, and everything was very yummy. Beautiful view of the bay, and the service was very nice. I'm thinking of bringing the bf here for his birthday!
author: Marianne S.

description: Well the view as you already must know is hands-down the best but there is more to a 5-star rating than just location. The food is very average and the service was below average when I was there at least. M&S is an ok chain, nothing that special overall so if you go to the one in San Francisco it is for the view and the decor mainly.
author: Joe H.

description:
We've dined at this restaurant two or three times before --- usually lunch, and we've always been very satisfied.  The view is fantastic!
