Disappointed this time with the waiter's lack of attention to us:  no mention of specials or that on Valentine's Day you can order from the regular menu.  I found the chowder tasty but too heavy; warm dungeness crab so-so.  No desire to stay for dessert.  A great waiter can make up for a lot!
author: Debbie P.

description:
Host was very pleasant upon arrival, not overbearing yet accommodating. Our server was nice but overwhelmed. It took a long time for him to show up at the table to take our order, and a long time to receive our dinner. We had to get his attention for water refills, to add a salad, to order dessert. If you didn't grab his attention, you would see him frantically rushing from table to table but not yours. This may not have been his fault, he seemed to be covering a large area of the restaurant.

The meal itself was enjoyable but not spectacular. We had oysters, very fresh and yummy. I ordered swordfish which was done perfectly, the starchy goo aka polenta underneath tasted OK but made me long for a plain pile of mashed potatoes next to rather than smushed under the entree. Creme brulee dessert was good, not good enough to dream about later though. Kudos to them for automatically serving salad dressing on the side. 

I would eat here again. It's not good enough to fantasize about, though the oysters and swordfish have crossed my mind more than once. Views from almost any table are fantastic.
author: S S.

description: Overhyped, overpriced, lackluster service, in a tourist area makes this place pretty dam pretentious.  Had the sturgeon which cost a whopping $31 for a portion that isn't that generous and to greasy.  Forget eating here might as well throw your money, go eat at the wharf instead at least the food taste better in the tourist area.
author: Stevezee C.

description:
Nice views of the bay, etc.

The sampler appetizer was good; crab cake, popcorn shrimp, coconut shrimp, calamari.

The waiters kept pushing the halibut and Alaskan king crab.

I ordered the Atlantic Salmon Specialty plate entree. It was stuffed with halibut, crab, etc. Came with mashed potato.

I enjoyed my entree. The sauce for the entree was good. HAD to mix it with the mash, and when the mash was gone, had to dip the bread.
author: qirk z.

description:
The service was good, but the waiter didn't really know the food that well.
They seated me and my GF at a crappy table when there were plenty of tables there that were in nicer locations, ok so we weren't dressed up but nobody there was very dressy.
My fish was DRY and boring.
My GF's steak was "enh."

Yeah, not worth it but it wasn't awful either.
author: Tom S.

description:
This is tourist heaven. The views in any weather are just ethereal. The raw bar is where this is a plus. Oysters, bloody marys and relatives and or friends visiting from the glacial states  more than justifies this as a tourism must stop.. It also makes the rest of the sites  a lot more mellow.

Service is good, prices geared to the SF tourists, but it is so aesthetically pleasing a view it's worth a once in awhile visit.
author: tery c.

description:
This place is excellent.  the food here tastes GREAT.

the view of the bay is refreshing and romantic, great place to take your girl/guy,  excellent romantic, light hearted dining.  The bar is stocked with excellent scotch, and the bartenders are all veterans.

The staff will love you no matter what style you are wearing, which is great for a lazy dresser like me.  Some of the waiters have been there over 20 years.  they know what they are doing!

There is also a happy hour with a small menu including 1/2 lb Angus beef burger, coconut prawns, seared ahi, shrimp cocktail, etc for like 2-4 dollars a plate.

The best way to dine here is to just walk in and sit yourself at the bar or booths/tables near the bar, which is also self-seating.  Come during happy hour and save huge.  

As for romantic dining, if you want to spend away, you will love the perfectly cooked seafood, lightly seasoned with California ingredients. think fillets, oysters Rockefeller, half shell platters and whatnot. Yes, the steaks and the bistro food are good here as well.

Price goes from cheap to expensive, depends what you feel like eating. don't forget scoma's around the corner.
author: Mark K.

description:
I would only go here for the drinks & the view.  The food was very disappointing...
Honestly, how do you mess up steamed crab legs???
author: Christine W.

description:
It was anniversary time and I always wanted to eat here so on a Sunday night we got a table right against the window.  MK is all decorated for Christmas.   I had the pear perfection for my cocktail and I'm happy I made this my drink choice.  We had the calamari another great choice.  
For dinner I had the linguini with the mini clams.  It was nice and flavorful and a nice lighter food choice.  We splurged on the Ghiradelli tart yum!

Service was excellent.  Not too intrusive but kept the water glasses full and the plates cleared off quickly.    Glad we finally made it here!
author: Lisa V.

description:
McCormick & Kuleto's is another component of the great selection of seafood restaurants in SF and the Bay Area.  This place has always come recommended from family friends and can say that we have dined here several times over the years when living in the area.
 
First of all, the location is prime.  The restaurant is situated in Ghiradelli Square just up the road from Fisherman's Wharf.  There are definitely crowds around but it is easy to navigate, compared to those down on the Embarcadero.

Sitting on the side of a hill, diners are greeted with outstanding views of the Bay which include the Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz and even a glimpse of Sausalito on a clear day/night.  Parking is fairly easy to get due to the abundance of meters and parking garages in the area, plus they will validate your parking for you.
 
The decor is what you would expect with the white table clothes and wood accents, however, this is definitely not upscale.  Reservations are recommended but I have seen people walk in off the street and get a table.  The typical crowd here are locals but you get plenty of tourists as well.  Dress is causal but don't be surprised to see a sports jacket or business suit at an adjacent table.
 
The food is extremely fresh and the menu reflects what has been caught that day.  You can get your typical appetizers and entrees that you would find on most seafood restaurants, but there are a few surprised items featured on the menu.  I've never had a complaint about the quality of the food and the wait staff is always willing to help you with your selections.  As a further enticement to visiting McCormick & Kuleto's, you can skip the dessert menu and head next door to Ghiradelli to grab some ice cream while taking a pleasant after dinner stroll.
 
McCormick & Kuleto's is a welcome break from the usual Fisherman's Wharf seafood restaurants and features a great selection of fresh seafood (as well as some meat options) which is complemented by a good wine selection.  The views are absolutely fantastic and the decor is what you expect.  I would recommend this place to anyone looking to break away from the usual tourist locations, you won't be disappointed.  Definitely a great place for a dinner date.
author: Trent C.

description: Good food.  Good atmosphere.  Bad service.  Attitude problems clearly across management and wait staff.  Awkward unfunny jokes piled on top of laggy service, not a great combination.  Wait staff probably has some kind of serve-the-big-tippers-only mindset.
author: Anon A.

description: The only good thing about this place is they have beautiful view over sees the ocean and Bridge. Other than this, food are over price and not tasty at all.
author: Jenny C.

description: this place is very nice for fishermans wharf. We made reservations (as always) so we didnt have to wait. I ordered a sailors meal (a cup of clam chowder and fish and chips). To drink i ordered the raspberry italian soda. the italian soda was pretty good. the chowder was excellent!! the fish was good, but the fries were AWESOME!!! For desert i ordered the pear sorbet. BEST SORBET EVER!!!! they even served it in a crepe bowl!  so if you are a tourist and you are stuck in fishermans wharf because you can't find any place thats "nice", go here!
author: neil r.

description: A great view & environment.  Service is usually pretty good, but not so good last night in the bar. The food is spotty, sometimes okay, but generally not great. Expensive, but perhaps worth it if you can enjoy the view.
author: Mark W.

description:
No, terrible food and parking is costly.
Great atmosphere and very beautiful interior design. We were given a window table that was nice and the rest is down hill.

Their Seafood Cioppino is Not the famous San Francisco style. I have ordered Cioppino about 30 times in my life and this was the worst.
Don't waste your $30.00. I am visiting from out of town and I am so disappointed.

My wife's Sea Bass crusted with horse radish was so so. The waiter's recommendation was not good.

Giraidellii Square parking cost is outrageous. $7.00 an hour. Sure I could have parked on the street but before 7 pm it's 1 hr max.

 Forget the 1-1/2 hour credit from the restaurant because I parked from  4pm to 9pm and did could not get the credit because I reached the $32.00.
90% of the shops are gone, so so sad.
However, we enjoyed visiting with our friends.
author: BYRON D.

description:
mccormick & kuleto's... dark wood, classy low lit vibe. seafood, fat steaks, traditional cocktails -  citrus is squeezed per drink order wut!? the menu looks killer & its some healthy coin to grind here but when 4pm rolls around...

the happy hour at the bar is on! a half pound cheese burger with all the fixins & fries for 2.95! but wait, theres more... clams, mussels, bbq pulled pork, nachos... the selection changes & not everything is $2.95 - the menu is broke up into different price points but no complaints from me. i can keep it under $10 & that includes a frosty pint!

yah its all high rollin but the bar is chill. folk kikin it there are anybody. jeans, bow tie, ball cap, slippers, stilettos, rolex, timex, friendship bracelet.

ok, so sometimes i have to wait. the cocktail waitress seems to fly solo and stay real busy so be ready when she comes around. i know, its hard to keep patient with a fat burger and tall frosty on the brain. but no lie people, this place is for real.
author: BadBanana B.

description:
Best views in the city for a restaurant. Good food at Fisherman's wharf. i love to go there and eat a relaxed meal while watching the swimmers in the bay. Too chilly for me. They have great fish and surprisingly a wide variety of other meals which are at a variety of price points.
One of my San Fran favorites.
author: Anna M.

description: This is the best happy hour in town. The happy hour food ranges from 1.95 Fried Chicken Sliders on Mini Biscuits to 4.95 Steamed Clams in a White Wine Garlic Broth. The best deal in the house is the $2.95 Half Pound Cheeseburger, served medium-well with cheddar cheese and fries. The drink specials change daily however they have $4.50 house margaritas all summer long. I opted for the margs (rocks/salt) which were tasty and refreshing.
author: Angelica C.

description:
okay so the view was pretty awesome. but im just going to give bullet points of what makes this place sub par at best. 

-dirty fork on the table with NO replacement
-no knife at my setting, when i asked for a new one, i was left hanging until i had to ask another server for one. 
-the actual scallops on the scallops/pork belly dish were the best thing. even though they were mildly bland. the lentils on that dish were over cooked as well as the pork belly, you dont over cook pork belly. 
-server didnt even asks us how our meal was until we were finished. 
-ordinary is a great word for this place. or bland :)
author: Heather D.

description: humm.. is okay. appetizers really good, entrees... not so much
author: Michael W.

description:
The view was AMAZING! Who doesn't want to look out at the bay, Sausalito, Angel Island, and giant ships cruising by while eating some very tasty food?
I have severe food allergies and the waiter went above and beyond to make sure i didn't have to pull an Uma Therman at the table. This place is great if you want to take your parents out to lunch, or go out on a dreamy date night. The price was also very reasonable. YUM! I will definitely be coming back here!
author: Lindsay P.

description:
I love that I can walk into this place, sit down in the lounge with no preamble, and order good solid seafood dishes that are admittedly pricey but not outrageous.

I've never had a bad meal here.  The clam chowder is absolutely delicious.   The salmon stuffed with brie, shrimp and crab meat is darn good, and the sauce that's served with it is miraculous.

You may not get out of here for under $60, but hey, if you wanna park with little to no hassle and be eating seriously yummy food within 20 minutes, this is a great place to do so.  Also, you can get ice cream from the Ghirardelli fountain shop afterwards (if you have room, that is).  What's not to like?
author: Mel B.

description:
I have never been so sick in all my life.  I live in VA and I ate here one unfortunate Saturday evening when I was visiting my best friend in CA. I had really been looking forward to the trip because I was 13 weeks pregnant and it was one of my last chances to travel to see my friend.  I ate some cereal in the am and spent the day walking around Golden Gate Park before heading here for an early dinner.  I had the crab cakes and some clam chowder and became dangerously ill within hours of the meal.

I should preface this by saying - I am not crazy.  Besides this incident, I was never sick during my pregnancy.  I worked 12 hours shifts up until the end no problem.  I have never had another case of food poisoning besides this one.  I have never been a sick patient in a hospital besides this one time.  I am a nurse so I feel like I have a pretty fair perspective on what happened to me.  There is no reason why a pregnant person shouldn't be able to eat the meal that I ordered at this restaurant.

I spent the entire night violently ill before having to go the hospital where I was diagnosed with food poisoning.  My trip was ruined. I had to spend an additional $600 in hospital bills that wasn't covered by my insurance.  And most frightening of all, I came dangerously close to losing my son (he just turned 2 now and is the joy of my life.)  

After the incident, I contacted M & K to let them know what happened in a very polite manner, hoping that maybe I could save future diners from a similar experience.  I never had any thoughts of lawsuits or anything of the sort, but they were too cowardly and inhuman to even respond to me which I still find completely vile to this day.  Even without admitting any guilt, they could have at least said something about how it was too bad that I had such a bad experience after eating there - something.

I look at my son today and I can't even describe how unreal it feels to think that one silly overpriced meal could have changed my life forever.  Shame on McCormick & Kuleto's for being so careless with their diners lives.  And you still owe me, my son and my family, an apology.
author: Nancy T.

description: I love McCormick and Kuleto's but last night was so bad.  My calamari was soaking in oil and complain about it. The server told me that they've changed the recipe and put extra oil on it.."much healthier" huh???  Oh boy......never again.
author: Amy N.

description:
Very sloooooow service. Party of 9....all said food was just fair. My
scallop dish was disappointing and pathetic.Four small scallops over a huge bed of lentil beans...such a poor combination. A tourist trap...and
a waste of $$$ for what you get and the taste of the food. An attractive
restaurant with great view but there is a huge glare and brightness
that come in from the huge windows and it is not relaxing. They need
to tint the windows. There are much better choices to eat
in this city.....I do not recommend this place,and we will never return
here again. This is a chain and with that food quality and taste lacks.
author: Girly Foodie F.

description: We sat, and eat at, the bar.  Great service, excellent food, terrific view.
author: E J.

description: Our server was friendly and the food was good. View is spectacular! my only wish is that my pork chop had more seasoning. Definitely worth the trip though!
author: Shannon G.

description:
I might be a little harsh with this review... especially because of the price of the meal... so first the bad. then there are at minimum 2 redeeming factors.  

First the food: Bad bad bad.  For a $$$ restaurant ($80 for 2) this was BAD BAD food.  I would have ok'd it at a $ price, but under no circumstances was it good food. 

The crab was old.  It was not fresh and by no means alive when it was cooked.  I don't mean that it was freezer burned, but you could tell this was not fresh.

The next day I had to go to a market, buy a live crab, and cook it - that was good... somethings you just have to do yourself... However, I will say that BOBO's on Lombard at Van Ness is ooo ooo so good for crab.

The halibut was ok.  It appeared to have been previously frozen though... perhaps not --- by no means something to be bragging about.

The balance of the meal was just alright - the clam chowder was fine.  The veggies and potatos were as expected... no problems.

Now for the good... and this is the part that makes me feel a bit bad about rating this place so harshly - but FOOD IS FIRST in a restauraunt!  How would you like it if you had a cell phone that couldn't dial out, but had every other feature.... thats this kind of restauraunt.

Service: I'll give service a great rating i dunno - better than most.  The people there were willing to help with everything.  Love the people hate the food.

Location: great view.  Gotta love the view.

Condition of the restauraunt: Nice - pretty clean.  Good people there.

Moral of this story: restaurant has just become complacent... get some better food people.  I understand this place used to be a lot better for seafood - so here's a message stop free-riding on your good history and focus a little more on the food!
author: Walter C.

description: This has been the worst restaurant I have ever been to. The food is ok but, the customer service is horrible beyond description. The waiter was consistently very rude. One instance was when asking him to replace a dirty plate. He took the plate and started examining the plate as if implying "Are you kidding me." A second instance was when we mentioned how dry the halibut was. The waiter said "That's the way the French do it". This bitter experience has left me no choice other than to recommend people to go else where.
author: Kevin W.

description: It does have a very nice view of the Bay.  Lots of tourists.  The food is good, if a bit overpriced.  Parking can be dicey-- I wouldn't want to be here on a busy weekend in the summer when this part of town is out of control with out of towners.  But I've been here later in the evening in the middle of the week, and the view is romantic.
author: Sarah S.

description: Great food, fairly attentive service though they bought our main course before they had cleared away our starter dishes.  Were slow to provide us drinks, but they were busy when we went.  Great view of the bay and a nice atmostphere.
author: Kevin S.

description: We work in the area and have been to both the main restaurant (when taking clients) and the bar area (when it's just us). Usually the food is better than average - but pricey. You are paying for the location/view, which is pretty awesome. Service is ok. Today, however, it was unusually poor. We ate in the bar area - and keep in mind that the entire restaurant was not busy at all. However, it took over 30 minutes to get our food - which obviously sat under a heat lamp - I think the waiter forgot our food, since others who came in after us were served before we were. He also forgot who had what (there were only two of us) - and that one of us ordered a regular salad with our food - not the pasta salad that we were given. The pasta had the color of the slices of red onion that it sits in - it looked like bruised pasta salad. The long sitting food did not sit well with us (we ate because we were hungry and on our lunch hour). When asked for more ketchup/mayo etc - yes we had to ask for it, the waiter would only bring it in the small, mini containers (what - no bottles?) I went to the bar counter to pay and get change and the waiter then brought my change around the bar and all the way out to our table - when all the while I was still standing right at the bar where he took my money - very odd. By the way, we ate here two weeks ago and my coworker had mussels which were not cleaned properly. We don't think we'll return after today's experience.
author: R F.

description: I use to go here when I lived and worked in the area. They have OK food, nothing 'great'. Very touristy, and no loyalty towards the locals that you may find at the other restaurants in the neighborhood. Great views though. But I'd rather not have to pay for the view and enjoy it outside.
author: Foodie D.

description:
they have a $2.95 half-pound cheeseburger and fries with purchase of a drink, for happy hour. it was plain, meh.

the $4.95 clams and mussels also meh, just simple buttery tomato sauce to them.

cheap cheap food, but still...  

happy hour, fail.
author: Ethan L.

description: I try to get something different everytime I come here, but it's hard to pass up the scallops. The food is always cooked to perfection, and the waiters always have really great recommendations.
author: Desirea C.

description: Lunch here with out-of-town guests worked perfectly. Menu is seafood-focused, providing several SF traditions, eg. crab dishes.  But it's extensive enough to offer many solid non-fish options. Fabulous view- ask for window table. Service impeccable, friendly.
author: Beth V.

description: We ended up eating here after our plans to land at the bar of Gary Denko's crashed, although we arrived early enough to get seats.  In any case, my dining buddy and I had a very nice meal at this restaurant with a gorgeous view of the Bay.  I had the pastry stuffed with halibut with a unique huckleberry sauce, and my buddy had the ribeye steak.  Everything was delicious.  We're not into alcohol, but I noticed that they had an extensive wine and alcohol selection that would suit just about anyone.  This place has plenty of seating, and almost every seat overlooks the Bay, gorgeous.  We would have sampled the dessert menu, had it not been that we planned on going to Ghirardelli for dessert.  That too was awesome, as always.  Great experience, I recommend this place.
author: s m.

description: Although I haven't eaten here in forever, I am a vouchee for them.
author: Ray B.

description:
This is the restaurant I'd buy, just so I could hang out there.  It has a great view of the bay, experienced bartenders who take care of you, and excellent shellfish and seafood.  Sometimes crammed with tourists, we generally just sit at the corner of the bar and watch the swimmers from the Dolphin club while we suck down some oysters.  (Although we do bring out-of-town guests there for the view.)

Not really haute cuisine, but your basic, good stuff.  Being a regular, I wouldn't be surprised if the tourists had a lesser experience.
author: Joseph A.

description: I've been here a couple times for lunch and each time was awesome!  Delicious food (have had the gruyère/truffle oil mac 'n cheese, lobster bisque, crab roll and sweet potato rosemary oil fries), great service and fantastic view in a comfy booth facing out over the water.  Love that you can order either a 5 oz. or 8 oz. glass of (very decent) wine and it comes in a little carafe!  Much better and less expensive for what you get than other seafood restaurants in touristy areas.  And I love the interior with the cool old light fixtures.
author: Beth D.

description: Crazy good happy hour and the view is to die for!  It doesn't hurt that it's next to a cupcake shop, wine tasting room and Ghirardelli Ice Cream!  Come hungry.
author: Liss J.

description: Great view of the bay! The fresh fish menu is fantastic and always different. The staff is friendly and helpful. The bar is small, but the dining room is efficent. A bit pricey, but I've never been disappointed in the quality of the food, wine or liquors.
author: Morgan W.

description: We *really* enjoyed Easter brunch at Kuleto's.  The service was excellent, the food was very good and the view was spectacular!
author: diane r.

description: Reservations don't help at all. I made a reservation a few days before and when we arrived we still had to wait 20 minutes to get seated. The food was not all that great. You pay for the view of the SF Bay.  It's in a tourist area to expect to pay higher prices. I ordered Salmon and it was definitely not the most tasty I ever had. The service was subpar also. It was hard to get a waiter for refills. I was not impressed by this restaurant.
author: Chester M.

description:
went here for my dad's birthday alst weekend adn it started off nice. the view was great the server was nice.  as we sat there and talked we got our appetizers pretty fast, but as the night goes along we started wondering where our main courses were. i personally felt that we were forgotten. my sister didnt get a refill on her water until asked and i mean she went through three cups and i mean come one two empty cups and no refill. i didnt get a refill on my tea until i flagged down a server. i mean really for a fine dining place and me having to flag down the service to get refills is kinda pathetic. so after an hour had gone by i once again flagged down the server and asked if it was gonna be much longer  for our main course to come out, and she replies while i can check for you but the runners are suppose to take care of that. REALLY???? is that the best answer??? i mean it might be true but in the end regardless if you gonna bring the food or not dont you wanna provide a good service or at least get a nice tip whatever. so then the manager comes out and apologizes for the delay and says that we are actually gonna be serve soon...we were the fourth ticket in line.

and when the food came out it wasnt impress i mean it wasnt bad but it wasnt all that great. so if i was asked would i come back i would say FUCK NO!!! the service was horrible and the food wasnt that great especially for the price. never again
author: Tofer M.

description: This is a very fancy seafood restaurant.  I do like coming here and must give you a heads-up.  It's very expensive, at least for me.  Can only come here on special occasion. Food is generally good and service is what you expect to be at this price of food.  Four stars because I'm a fan but can't go whenever I want to, have to look out for my wallet.  Expect for $50/person easily and you can tell they are looking forward for a big tip.  Great for dating, I meant the 1st one or an anniversary.  Since you are there, as well go for Ghirardelli Ice Cream and Chocolate Shop.
author: P. C.

description:
My boyfriend chose this place for our anniversary. Wow! He really went all out to find a nice romantic place with a pretty view. It's too bad that we came at the time when the fog starting to roll in. Anyway, the decor inside is beautifully decorated with shell-like lighting fixtures and colors of brown for trimming and a dark shade of coral/pinkish wallpapers. The tables are situated on three tiers so anywhere you sit, you can get a view of the bay. 
The place is really packed on a Friday night, so the boyfriend was lucky to make reservations or else we'd have to wait. The host seated us right away, so there wasn't a long wait to have our table ready. Not even a few minutes, our waiter came with our menus, basket of bread and our glasses of water. 
I didn't know the menu changes each day, so it's never the same...Well, that's what my boyfriend told me and so did the waiter. Awesome! Plus, he gave recommendations after I asked him what he would suggest if I wanted to try something for the first time and get a good experience out of my meal. A lot of the stuff he mentioned were all seafood (duh! we're around fisherman's wharf and the pier), but I order their 8 oz. Ribeye Steak and my boyfriend ordered a 9 oz. sirloin steak. I would've gone with a seafood dish, but I decided upon steak instead. We waited for a few minutes before our food came out.
Nice presentation for their meals. I wasn't too fond of their mashed potatoes, because it wasn't as fluffy and moist. Although, the potatoes came well with the mushroom sauce that was drizzled on top of the steak. Yummy! I wish the chef had cooked it right, because I asked for medium but it came out medium well. The steak itself wasn't anything special. I kind of regret not ordering a seafood dish. 
Since my boyfriend wasn't feeling too well, I ordered us some hot tea. The waiter came out with a selection of tea...Jasmine, Chinese black tea, mint, lemon, etc. All from Numi. We got the Jasmine and Chinese Black Tea. We enjoyed it much! I kept asking for more hot water. Our waiter was really nice about it and really friendly too. Didn't know he had jokes, but he sure got a good laugh out of us. Too bad I forgot his name. Bummer!
I suggest that the people who take care of the bathrooms, need to refill/stock up on the paper towels and mop up the floors. Really disgusting.
Surprisingly, we didn't get to finish our food but we did enjoy the tea a lot more. I guess we were to awed by their service, the beautiful interior of the restaurant, and a somewhat spectacular view of the bay. I'd come by again, but I'll have to try a seafood dish instead.
author: Fraulein C.

description:
terrible...simply terrible...

even though we had a $75 gift certificate, it STILL wasn't worth it. the crab cakes tasted frozen, chowder was salty, and then we got to the entrees...oh the horror.  the "cajun" ahi tuna tasted like it fell on the floor. who pairs CAJUN seasonings with soy sauce and wasabi?! and the sea bass with pilaf and veggies tasted like a marie calendars frozen tv dinner.  and mind you i LIKE marie calendars...

the dessert was the only halfway decent thing but the coffee smelled like wet towel. 

service was unprofessional. view was nice, but overall one of the worst dining experiences possible in SF, especially for the money.
author: Ernie C.

description: NOT for Groups....   years ago we had a horrible experience here (they had a problem giving the group knives saying we did not need them LOL) and decided that we would give it ago again!  BAD MISTAKE!   They are not group friendly at all and, not compassionate with meal changes, we work with the elderly and some time after a doctor visit they have to change meals due to dietary restrictions..  We Prepaid for 51 only 49 showed up and they wanted to charge us $13 or so dollars per person that changed their meal.... then argued with me when trying to resolve this issue saying that i never told her or specified on my contract that the people need to pay for it ....  I highly recommend FOG HARBOR FISH HOUSE they have way better pricing and the contact there is a sweetheart never a problem!
author: Alie C.

description: So I don't know about the rest of their food, but I came for the Happy Hour Food. Why, cuz it's cheap as shit!!!! It's really quite good too! The wings were really good! Nachos, well nachos can only get so good...but were good. Sweet P Fries, never go wrong there! A tad on the greasy side, but worth it, since they were like $1.95 or something......Oh AND a 1/2 pound cheeseburger with fries for $2.95!!! Oh and you can't substitute the fries for sweet p fries, oh well. still a great deal!!!!! Our server was really nice as well! You do have to buy $3.00 drink. So a soda works, or one of their happy hour drink specials (those kinda suck) work as well. Either way, it's cheap and good, I'll be back!
author: Megan L.

description: Wow, a restaurant with a REAL children's menu!  Not mac 'n' cheese or pb&j, but fish and adult food in kid portions.  The grilled chicken sandwich was great as were the fish and chips.  A martini made to perfection as well.  The portions were just perfect and the service was wonderful.  Our waiter was so friendly he cheered up the day.  For this neighborhood, the prices were exactly what we expected.  Overall good experience and we'll return.
author: Erin M.

description: fancy little joint with a waterfront view. this place is located in the ghirardelli square which is very touristy. The prices aren't bad but the food should be much better!
author: Kee G.

description: Good food, small portions, over-priced, with better than average views of the SF Bay. Definitely not one of the finer places, but I was with some out-of-town people who wanted to be near the wharf and square. Would not likely go again. The noise level was too high, and we were there at 7 pm on Thursday night.
author: Chris C.

description:
Went here for a girl's night out, and I really like this little corner of the city.  Picturesque and very SF.  While waiting for the last of our party, two of us sat at the bar for a pre dinner half bottle of wine.  We opted for the Grgich Hills Fume Blanc 2005 which was excellent!  Just what I was looking for -- light and crispy.  The bartender (who looked a tad like Steve Martin, I say) was classic... he sounded like he ran the place... and maybe he did, who knows.  He was very knowledgeable about the various fresh seafood of the world-- which is their specialty, and also very well versed on the wine selections.  

So, eventually we were seated at a table by the large windows overlooking the bay.  Our waitress had a weird awkwardness to her... always popping in for a quick update or question and as it came time for any of us to respond she was already practically leaving the table.  One of my friends even noted, to my agreement, that she had a way of standing very very close to us.  This is all good for a giggle, and didn't really ruin our time... but funny to remember.  Also when she would bring us a plate, she would not excuse herself or prepare the landing space before she began to place it on the table, but would kind of just plop it down on top of things.  Odd!  She even picked up one of our dine about town menus and put it right on top of our bread.  Curiouser and curiouser!  When she brought my steak knife as she was passing our table, we were in the midst of a conversation and she tucked it under my elbow.  HAHA... very comical.  Anyhow, I ended up not doing the dine about town and ordered the porkchop which was delicious, tender and juicy (I don't much eat seafood) and my friends' crab cakes and halibut (? or salmon) made them happy.. and the apple crisp with vanilla ice cream was suuuper good.  Getting to be my favorite dessert.  Good times.
author: Marjorie B.

description:
overall good impression of this place.  nice setup in there with attractive lighting and the tiered seating, so every table gets a good view of the bay.  and i got the feeling it was more of an established restaurant like a steakhouse or house of prime rib than a hip place like cosmopolitan cafe, but it was still cool.  restrooms could use a little sprucing up though.

anyway, just got the clam chowder and crab cakes because i didn't have a huge appetite and both were good.  nothing spectacular though.  crab cakes came out smaller than i had anticipated, so i order a side of green beans and those were really good.  sides always make a meal.

since kuleto's is right across from ghirardelli, i'd wanted to save room for dessert and go over there after the meal.  but then i went over in my head of what i could get over there and wasn't really in the mood for anything that night, so passed on that idea.  would have been nice if the server had brought a dessert menu, but by the time she mentioned bringing a dessert menu (after my friend had already finished hers from her DAT menu) i was always over it.  see marjorie b's review for more antics by our curious server.
author: spiff e.

description: i had the sturgeon and the chappino both were excellent, i want to try the sunday brunch
author: pochini m.

description: This seems like kind of a tourist trap (its in ghirardelli square, so that goes unsaid..), but they did have a pretty good drink menu.  Being a picky drinker (girly drinks, vodka only, strong but dont taste strong), if you dont have a drink menu i'm usually at a loss...and this place had a TON of good drinks to choose from! They weren't too strong, but that can be expected...didnt try the food, and i dont think i would as it seems somewhat expensive for what it is, and as with most tourist traps, probably not the best quality for your money..that said, i dont know, so cant judge yet.
author: Danielle J.

description: McCormick was a terrible experience. The waiter, Jeffery S., treated us horribly. When we asked him for more water, he would reply to us with sarcasm.  Jeffery was well in his late 30's, but acted like he was 5yrs old. I was really shocked when I heard him being polite to the other table. He had manners and acted on his best behavior. I thought the only reason he treated us terribly was because we were under 21 years old and we didn't order any wine. So he probably thought we were some cheap couple, who couldn't afford anything. If Jeffery was a good waiter he would have treated us the same no matter what we ordered of what our age was. But he didn't. I don't know what McCormick was thinking hiring a jerk like Jeffery S.
author: Victoria C.

description: Great location with bay views and good - not great - food. Staff is super helpful and accommodated a large group very well. We had a great time with family and the bill was hefty.
author: Rebekah O.

description: We had a really good time at McCormick. Food was really good and the environment is very nice.
author: Dipesh M.

description: Loved it.  The service was good, he was friendly and polite.  We really enjoyed the food, the crab meat was so fresh, and the flavors of our meals so good.  Our drinks were tasty so we ordered more! Were so full we skipped desert, not that our waiter didn't try to entice us to have some, next time maybe.
author: Mauricio F.

description: I believe people don't give this place enough credit. Just because it is on the warf does not make it automatically bad. I am not one for sea food, but if you are looking for a good steak or pasta dish this place has it down. The mash potatoes are to die for and the service is usually pretty good. And honestly, even if the food isn't your favorite, the view of the bay makes it worth the price.
author: Michelle K.

description:
Let me begin by saying the only reason this place got 4 out of 5 stars rather than 3 out of 5 is for the service and location!!! The service was great...Totally as it should be for a 40+ a plate restaurant. 
The food was okay. Not GREAT but not bad either. My bf got the grilled Mahi with green Thai sauce which was very, very good. He doesn't really like seafood other than crab legs but he took a chance with the Mahi and was very impressed. My oldest kid got the Salmon which was also pretty darn good. He loves seafood and of course ate every last drop. I ordered the roasted vegetable purse which was not very good...Okay, not at all good (just thinking about it now is turning my stomach). My younger son got the fettuccini marinara and it was not any good either; overcooked pasta and weird, oddly spicy, yet tasteless, marinara sauce....Bleh. My little one didn't eat but 3-4 bites. Their drinks are good. I had some terrific lemony vodka things (at 10-12 bucks each...OUCH) and my bf got some absinthe thing that was super yum. 
So: To recap here.....Great service, two yummy seafood dishes served with two horrible non-seafood dishes, great mixed drinks and a fun location equals 4 out of 5 stars....I guess. 
My suggestion, ORDER SEAFOOD and combine with great company.
author: Kelly O.

description: Very disappointing.  I have eaten at their affiliated restaurants (McCormick and Schmidt) and have liked them for what they are: an upscale seafood and steak chain (and I'm not anti-chain).  Still, this place just did not cut it.  I started with the clam chowder.  It was bland, gloopy and tasteles; consistency of glue with not discernable taste (or texture) difference between the clams and diced potatoes.  I had the scampi with shrimp, to which I added crab.  The linguini pasta was way overcooked (and, for some strange reason, in very small pieces).  The five or six shrimp were fine, if a bit overcooked (which in my experience, is often the case when you order shrimp pasta).  The fiew pieces of crab were fine.  Overall, not worth the price.  Nice atmosphere and service.
author: Carlos S.

description: Hey this is a place to take out of towners to enjoy the view and pay the steep price and wander through Ghirardelli Square. Weekday lunch is the time to go for low key and more attentive service. Three levels, watch the stairs, easy to slip on the highly waxed and looking very lacquered oak veneer. You'll find a fair amount of tourists that are looking like the Seniors on an Alaskan Cruise dinner night out here, perchance? Or was it just that it was summer in the foggy city.
author: miriam b.

description: I work in the area and for the last four years have watched this restaurant go D-O-W-N-H-I-L-L!   It used to be a place we looked forward to going... fast service (we were on our lunchbreak),  good food with reasonable prices.  Whenever a co-worker had a birthday, this is the place we'd take them.   The restaurant, with its amazing view, had a touch of specialness to it.  But lately (like for the past two years) the service has slowed down considerably, the food has gone from good to lousy and yet the prices haven't plummeted like the quality of the food has.   The view is the only thing that has stayed the same; it's as nice as ever but definitely not worth the disappointing food.
author: Kassy A.

description: The lady and I went here for V-day dinner. The only con that I had was that we did end up waiting a little bit even though we did have reservations. But I guess this was understandable since it was pretty chaotic there. Well worth the wait! We were seated right next to a window with an awesome view! Make sure you get the popcorn shrimp. I know, I know its just popcorn shrimp but damn it's good!  Service was great, food was great and I could actually hear the person in front of me talking. Good times for sure! CHEERS!
author: MAX J.

description:
Been to MC&K before and have enjoyed the experience.  It's been a few years, however.  This past month, I was entertaining people from the East Coast.  We did the tourist thing and went to Fisherman's Wharf.  Although it is not crab season and it has not been in season for several months, there was an abundance of crab all over the place.
Instead of a waterfront restaurant, I wanted to bring my guests to MC&K because I knew the view was spectacular and the food had alwaysbeen very good.
We got there, the restaurant was relatively empty, got the table for 7 people.  The menu had listed crab and so we were happy.  When the waiter came to the table he said that there was no crab and the menu was incorrect.  I know that menu is printed daily (so what's up with that?)
He went on to say they had not received any crab and were at the mercy of deliveries.
When I said how disappoint we were as we wanted at least 4 crab dinners and a few bottles of wine, he said he would check with the kitchen.  When returning with another person, I was then told that the crabe they received was too small and the chef is very particular about what he prepares.
Needless to say, our party of 7 left the beautiful view for a crab dinner elsewhere.  
Not too happy with this experience.  Not sure I would return either.
author: Cindy T.

description: Good service, presentation, location and food.  Wife and I enjoyed the seabass and hallibut cheeks.
author: Levi S.

description: Great location, but we went Christmas Day and they were running at least 20 minutes behind. The food was so-so. I had the macadamia nut crusted mahi-mahi, and I couldn't finish it. Soggy and bland. Service was so-so.
author: Italophilia M.

description:
My hotel concierge recommended this place.  Three of us wanted a place with a view down by the water.  It did have an awesome view, but that was where anything good stopped.  When I heard the name I at first wondered if it was related to McCormick and Schmick's, but I thought it couldn't be.  Wrong.  It's just a M&S relabeled.  And it's just as bad.

Like another review of mine, I don't understand how seafood here in San Francisco can be so expensive; but, here it was again. One companion simply had a crab cake appetizer as her meal because everything was just incredibly expensive -- and this was at lunch!

 I had the sea bass with a sweet glaze.  It was ok, but nothing special at all.

I can't say I'd return here to eat -- even with the view.
author: Philip G.

description: I was here for a private banquet so I can only speak for that experience.  The entrees were not bad.  Hors d'oeuvres were VERY good!  The restaurant was very cozy with such a nice view of Alcatraz.  It was a lovely dinner party.
author: Jessica N.

description: Good Menu - Service was mediocre. Has a great view of the bay but when we asked to be seated in that area they were rather snobbish about it. Normally I would understand because we didn't have a reservation but it was a Tuesday at 7 and there were plenty of open tables.
author: Jessica S.

description: After reading yelp, my expectations were low, and they were met exactly.  Most overcooked steak I've ever had in a restaurant.  Good apps, ok salad.  Waitress kept serving everyone at the table except for me and we had to keep calling her back.  After lunch (where the view was awesome), I asked to get my parking validated and they coldly asked me if I had actually eaten there.  Fun.  I'd pass.
author: Jared G.

description: I have been a fan of this restaurants years ago so I have been to all of their branches...food is average but it still has a good reputation for old timers!
author: cecille p.

description: Decent place. Not to die for. It's one of those restaurants that you eat at just to try because it looks like it would be good.  Probably won't come back again by choice.
author: Lily Z.

description: Just had my XMas dinner here last week. The location is nice and the views are great, but the menu sort of sucked a little bit. The Portland location had a lot more choices and the food was also yummier. The SF location seemed to be very focused on certain types of customers who frequently visit the restaurant and order the same plate every time. Try the seabass, swordfish or mahi mahi - those are probably their best ones.
author: Sav B.

description: The very first time I went here was years ago while on a first date. I thought it was fabulous. Now I'm thinking just the date was fabulous. Anyway, went here last night and it was okay. The view is wonderful. Yah, yah. But the food was just alright. My halibut was drowning in Lemon Butter sauce and there really weren't that many healthy althernatives on the menu. All the seafood was either fried or cooked in butter. Yuck. The service I have to say was pretty good. Our waiter was funny and kept us pretty entertained most of the evening. It was freezing cold in the restaurant though. Make sure to wear a sweater.
author: Heather L.

description: This place has a nice view right on the water in FIsherman's Wharf.  They print their menus daily which is great because they have fresh seafood all the time.  We went for my boyfriend's birthday and when we got sat they had printed out a special menu with "Happy Birthday" and the date on the menu which I thought was cute.  The service was acceptable (we are both servers though so we know what is great).  We started off with some oysters which were awesome, then got fried calamari which comes with three different dipping sauces.  I got the sea bass over soba noodles in a miso broth which I wasn't a big fan of but I ate it anyway.  The server was too busy to really pay attention to us which was fine because we wanted to be left alone that night.  I probably wouldn't go back because there are way better places to eat in San Francicsco
author: Elaine K.

description: I always end up bring out-of-towners here for 3 simple reasons.  The view (duh).  The seafood (duh).  And fresh squeezed margaritas at the bar... yum!
author: Tessa R.

description: The funny thing is, I don't think this place is that bad.  Sure it's over priced and the service is just ok, but the food was actually pretty good.  The waiters dress up which makes you feel semi-uncomfortable in your jeans and t-shirt, but the funny part is that it's Ghirardelli square, so most people are very casually dressed while others dress for what they think is a 5-star dinning experience.  Best view and tons of local seafood options - I'd do it for lunch if it was convenient, it's very typical fare, but a lot of options.
author: Jared F.

description: Plain and simple, I've had better seafood for a lot less expensive.  For lunch, the GF had the Halibut for $33 which came out somewhat dry.  The brother and I both had the Pacific Seafood Stew, good, but I'd prefer Scoma's Cioppino over this.  On a positive tip, the Raw Oyster sampler platter was sublime and the Dungeness Crab Mango Tower was very delightful.  Overall though, too pricey for the product.
author: Brent N.

description: If you have the money and wants to impress someone special, this is an elegant restaurant to take your date to.  Fantastic views of the wharf, bay and Alcatraz.  I had to take off two stars because #1, they charged me health tax and #2, their food is really just average at a pocket deep price.  But the view and the ambience combined are 5 stars and I think it's good to try it once for the experience.  But really, this place is more of a tourist attraction than for the locals.
author: Chris R.

description: Nice place, soothing ambience and good food.  We love it.  I had seafood stew and my husband as usual fish and chips.
author: Pikachu P.

description:
My husband and I decided to play tourist for the evening and stopped in for a drink.   It was around 9pm and we were very tired from walking around and stopping at all the local pubs etc.  We were not intoxicated or loud or dressed inappropriately.  The bar was empty. We asked for two jack and cokes and the bartender gave us a weird smirk.   My husband put a $20.00 dollar bill on the counter as we waited for our drinks.  Bartender brought our drinks and said $22.50.  My husband was pulling out more money from his pocket and said " Damn!  $22.50! crazy!" (in a jokingly manner)  the bartender took the drink and said "you don't want it"?  totally rude.   Remember my husband did not take the money back but was willing to pay for the drinks.   Most bartenders would have said something to the effect of "well they are good drinks" or " I know but it San Francisco for ya."  Instead he was totally rude and insulting.  We left.  No wonder why the bar was empty.    

We ended up going across the street and had the same drinks for $17.00 and the bartender got a nice tip!!
author: Chi C.

description: Wow, this place has changed since the last time I was here. I had been ranting and raving to my boyfriend about how good the clam chowder was here ($8.95 for an amazing clam chowder bread bowl) and was excited to take him since this was the first time he'd ever been. Both of us were starving, and someone brought us water and bread after about 10 minutes, even though we had already decided what we were getting before then. After waiting about 20 minutes, a server finally came over to us and took our order, which was two of the bread bowls and a steamed crab legs appetizer along with two bloody marys. We didn't wait long for the drinks, and then the server brought us the two bread bowls after a reasonable time. He didn't mention anything about the appetizer, so we figured it was coming soon. After we were almost done with the bread bowls, my boyfriend flagged him down and asked about the crab legs. The server looked surprised and said, "Oh, they were going to come out after your clam chowder." Umm....I guess I didn't realize that appetizers are supposed to come out AFTER your  meal?? After finishing the bread bowls, we waited about another 10 minutes until the crab came, and when the server dropped it off he asked if we'd like another round of bloodys. We said yes, but by the time he brought them we had already finished the crab legs. I'm not exactly sure how long that was, but think about the length of time it takes to crack and eat about 6 crab legs....yeah. It was awhile. And I usually prefer to enjoy my drinks WITH my food. Overall, service sucked big time, my boyfriend still left a 20% tip but let's just say the server was lucky that he picked up the tab this time and not me. Two stars because the food itself was AWESOME as well as the drinks....but if it wasn't for that this place would definitely get a one star.
author: Nicole B.

description: If there were 10 stars, it would defenitly be a 10 ... Nice, elegant, and a dimmly romantic setting (but dimmly good enough for a bar with a buddy) - pricy but def worth it, an automatic order for me would be a dozen (sometimes 2) orders of the fresh oysters from all around the word and usually the filet medium with a Jack & Coke or the finest red wine !!!!!!!!!!!! Don't forget the chocolate bag for desert, even if it takes a hacksaw to cut it!
author: Mack M.

description: Came here for the 1st time last night for holiday dinner with friends. While the group I was with made the experience fun, dinner was "ok". In the future, I would stick to happy hour for this place. The sweet potatoe fries were great, and so was the macaroni with gruyere and truffle. I tried the hangtown frye which was fried oysters over scrambled eggs. It was considered a "San Francisco Classic", at least according to the menu, but it was nothing to write home about. Service was good, but overall, a one time experience only.
author: Doris C.

description:
"Ideal for entertaining out of town guest who are looking for a relaxing,   above average seafood dinner with a fantastic view. Absolutely charming decor that mirrors the inside of a ship right in Ghirardelli Square that is not only good for happy hour."  
Food: 3.5 stars (Halibut cheeks gets 4 stars)
Presentation: 2 stars (no effort)
Ambiance/View: 4 Stars
Service: 3.5/4 stars (*depends on the server, attentive and friendly, passes the water glass test =never less than half full)
Price: 3.5 stars (Approx. $30 per person, fair portions)
*out of 5 stars
The Halibut cheeks  without a doubt are a must try because you don't know what you are missing if you are still a halibut cheek virgin! However, this item was recently removed from the menu for some unknown criminal reason so if it does return, order it immediately! The Mahi Mahi is a safe and won't disappoint with a less than classic chimchurri sauce. Mussels in curry broth are delectable and a nice choice for those wanting a taste of shellfish. Sushi appetizer is surprisingly very  fresh and would happily order again. Now please...stay away from the filet mignon unless tough and flavorless dead cow is what you're looking for because you're a T-Rex with razor sharp murder teeth.
Also they are more than happy to let you sample the wines before you purchase a glass so I would recommend  taking them up on the offer if you're a picky pretentious wanna be wine snob or just cheap.
My rant: I wish there was a dress code because the classy atmosphere of the restaurant suffers at the expense of poorly dressed fanny pack wearing tourist who completely adulterate the mood.
author: Vicky V.

description: My parent's love going here when they are in town.  The food is good overall, but I am not sure if it's worth the prices.  The view can't be beat.
author: T-Bone L.

description: Came here a couple of weeks ago with a friend on a Sunday, and it was packed. This is a tourist spot, even so the food was good, we sat in the bar section and the service was slow. That's why I didn't give it 4 stars. But over all not too bad.
author: timothy h.

description: This seafood restaurant was not up to my expectations.  The food was cold and flavor seemed kind of bland.  If you are looking for seafood, there are many other great restaurants in the fisherman's wharf area.  The views of the bay are great but the best little secret is their happy hour in which some of the entrees are $2 such as a burger or fried calamari.
author: Brandon L.

description: I've been here a couple of times and I just hate that it's so touristy. I guess it's less touristy than Fisherman's Wharf, but it's a sliding scale. The fish is fresh and the menu seems to change frequently. Just save room for Ghiradelli!
author: Carson H.

description:
the service and food does not match the quality of the dining area.  good meal, great  views, and affordable, close to a lot of things, but certainly nothing to write home about.  

we were treated like 2nd class citizens when we arrived, although we did not have reservations.  it was  late, but it took 10 minutes for them to  seat  us, and at  probably the worst table in the house.
author: Steve H.

description:
why is this only rated 3 stars? granted, the fisherman's wharf is a huge tourist trap, but mccormick definitely served up! i was very satisfied with my meal! 

oh, and not to forget the awesome view, and the fact that ghiradelli is next door!! dessert, anyone?
author: J Z.

description: A tired restaurant now, Tony Kuleto must cringe knowing his name is still on the billing. Our waiter was excellent but he didn't have much to work with in terms of product. Also I am guessing that over the years management has added at least a dozen tables that were not originally planned in the design and as a consequence the place is way too loud.  While I am sure that tourists eat this place up with its view, I suggest you spend your dollars on better value elsewhere.
author: bob r.

description: The view was great, but the food was horrible. Our waiter was cool, but it took about 30 minutes to get our food. It did not taste good at all. The clam chowder was extremely salty and the lobster was very rubbery. When all was done, our bill was about $120. You would think a place with such a nice view would take advantage of it and match it with good food/service.
author: Ryan M.

description: My husband and I went here on a Saturday evening and it was pretty crowded.  We walked into the front entrance and asked for a table for two.  The rude host responded with "well do you have a reservation?" (of course we didn't-what out of towner does?)  He told us it would be more than 45mins to get a table and didn't even ask if we wanted to put our name down.  Luckily his sidekick hostess informed us we could sit at the bar without a wait.  I'm giving this place 3 stars because the service was very nice.  Our waitresses let us take our time, informed us if something was taking too long and asked a good amount of times if everything was okay....(the food wasn't all that great though...I've certainly had better)  A-OK but I wouldn't eat here again...
author: Christina M.

description:
At best - mediocre.

If you want a quasi-quiet place with a fantastic view in Ghirardelli Square for a drink, this is the place to go.  If you're looking for decent food & service - skip this one.  The clam chowder was inedibly salty, the waiter brought the wrong wine and was snippy when we had to request the check numerous times, and to the San Francisco Examiner reviewer who said "Crab cakes are the best I have ever tasted" - stop reviewing Red Lobster...they were quite average.

The main courses were okay - small portions for the price, and nothing special.  My husband's steak was quite nice, but I'm rather suspicious as to my Sea Bass being fresh not frozen.

Dessert - blech.  Guittard chocolate cake - sounds pretty yummy, no?  NO!  Dry, overly sweet cake that would have been more at home at Denny's.  All I have to say is thank goodness for Kara's Cupcakes next door...they certainly rescued me from my chocolate cravings!

Oh - and prepare to be overcharged...the prices are clearly adjusted for the view.
author: Kristin S.

description:
The view is spectacular! That said, anywhere but here for good food. If I had known just how awful the food was, I would have sold the gift certificate on craigs list or ebay. Now that's bad. I had the Easter special, which was  wild halibut with scalloped potatoes. He had some kind of steak with mashed potatoes. Let me just say that he is not a foodie, and generally as long as it isn't too healthy and interesting, he will enjoy it. My fish was way under cooked, flavorless, and made me feel ill. The potatoes lacked flavor and were just cream, cream, and more cream. There were about 6 spinach leaves tossed beneath the fish and they were also bland. The fish was drizzled with a balsamic glaze and it tasted only of vinegar and without balance. The steak was nothing special and had what looked like the same glaze that I had on my fish. Our waiter was nice, but each time he walked by his mouth was a full as a chipmunk! When asked what the vegetable was, he said that he had idea. Odd, don't you think. 
We spent and additional $35 on top of the $50 gift certificate and I would have been happier munching some fresh crab and french bread. A bowl of clam chowder down the street would have far surpassed this place. If not for the view, it would have been a total wash!
Anywhere but here!
author: francez M.

description:
Went there last week with family visiting from out of town.
The short answer is amazingly slow service, mediocre food,
rude bartender.  Full story: my husband and I got there early,
and got a great mojito from the first bartender.  Then that bartender
went off duty, and the next guy refused to make it the same way.
It took the restaurant over 25 minutes to seat us, despite the fact that
we had a reservation.  Then it took them more than half an hour to 
bring appetizers.  The oysters tasted 5-6 days old, pretty nasty.  The
main course, the king salmon special, wasn't fresh enough to be delicious, just not actually spoiled.   If you want a great view, this is
the place for it, though.
author: Anne U.

description:
eh... it's another one of those places tourists like to go to when they're in the area.
i've actually never had a meal at this restaurant.  was at the bar with some friends one afternoon and had some drinks.
it seems like a pretty old and run down place... wear and tear here and there...
author: charlotte s.

description: It seems like everytime I come here I am already so buzzed from hitting up Wattle creek. I came here a few weeks ago after hitting up the Wattle creek tasting room. my date and I ordered a dozen oysters they were pretty good. My friend had the grilled salmon and i had a steamed crab all in all we both left satisfied,and I damn well should have been $95.00 later.
author: Kim R.

description:
For the money - you can do MUCH better in SF. The only good thing we ordered was the steamed lobster - which I give more credit to the lobster than chef. 

Our waiter disappeared for about 25 minutes after taking our order than came wandering back around and dumped a horrible chicken potato soup and ceasar salad off. The soup was warm as was the salad. Gross.

We had some terrible pasta dish w/ crab too. 

I'll never go back.
author: Bubba M.

description: The food was good.  The view was good.  The service was good.  The BLOODY MARY's were GREAT!  SPICY!  Yum.
author: Susan L.

description: This place has very good food, but a bit pricey -- so here's a tip: go to the bar at Happy Hour and get the $1.95 burger.  Yeah, that's right, $1.95.
author: Patty W.

description: I would rate this as the worst service I have ever gotten in a restaurant. There was a whole row of tables that seemed to be in "no man's land" when it came to service. Have worked in restaurants before and couldn't make sense of their waiter assignments. Had several tables wait 10 minutes before having to flag down a waiter just to get drinks. Service was slow, waiters kept claiming that they didn't know someone was at the table.  Had to wait 10 minutes to get check after chasing down waiter.  They were out of bread. Chowder was good, but rest of food was just good. Beautiful view and restaurant interior was nice, but service spoiled the experience.
author: Peter H.

description:
ive been here a couple times..first time was a happy hour food were cheap and good...the second time for dinner,  my bf took me here after a fight.. i think i had some carbcakes and tuna or some fish for entee, potions are really small..(mind u im not big eater) i cant barely remember the rest of what we had, sooo it wasn't that great!
 service was ok tho...and the view is beautiful..i think that's mainly what we paid for!
author: Jo Z.

description: Went here for dinner with my cousins and to watch the fireworks.  The view is definitely a draw and did not disappoint.  There was no surprises with the food, and unfortunately, most of it was bland.  The signature ahi tuna was probably the best dish, although the portion was small.  The calamari was decent but not exceptional.  The mussels had a lovely broth but were undercooked and had a texture that was just wrong.  I had a mixed grill with mixed results.  The halibut was fresh but unmemorable.  The crab cake had too much breading.  The wild Alaska King  salmon was the best of the lot and was simply grilled.  Unfortunately, this location does not have a Happy hour special like the other M&S places I have been (great happy hour specials in DC, Seattle, Pittsburgh, and Philly).  If they did, I would definitely come back, but as it stands, it would be a good place for a company dinner and that's it.
author: Peter L.

description: Ok, so this place is really nice on the inside. You get a nice view of the bay while enjoying your meal. I got some kind of seafood pasta but remember that it was really fresh.  A little over price, but considering the location I could see why. Probably wouldn't come again, but I had a nice time.
author: Kristine R.

description:
I've had better food, service and overall experiences at other well established restaurants.  Most of us in our group were local but we were entertaining out of town friends so I understand that the majority of the patrons were tourists.  Our server was so sick that she could hardly speak or be heard so we never heard if there were any specials or recommendations on the menu.  I would think that the management would either assist this obviously laboring server by asking other staff member to assist or send her home to rest her voice.  Many of us at the table wondered about the poor image and feeling customers get when being served by someone who could be contagious.  The real kicker was the surprise 'Health Tax' that was itemized on our bill (roughly 3.5%), when we asked our server about it, we of course could not hear what she had to say since she needed the health benefits that this tax apparently supports.  Why would a restaurant itemize such an item unless it's some form of a protest against this city mandated tax on restaurant owners?  To me, the restaurant loses a referral and a customer due to this form of passing the cost to it's customers.  The City also loses in that we will now think less than twice about dining in the city to need to pay 8.5% + 3.5% + deserving gratuity of 15% = 27% in addition to what is charged for just the food on the menu!  

Don't mind at all IF the service, food, atmosphere were all right.  It just wasn't right at all at M & K tonight!  Sorry.
author: Randall F.

description:
super romantic views of GG bridge and water. great waitstaff. 

nice ambiance in restaurant

loved the crab cake. but it was on the small side.

avoid the "sea scallops" dish - too many different sauce flavors going together at the same time. the "sea scallops" come with beans and broth. note this is NOT the same dish as the porkbelly sea scallops dish but per yelp that isn't great either.

clam chowder was OH SO DELISH. maybe the best I've tasted in a long time. 

side of asparagus was generous proportioned.

we decided to opt for ghiradelli for dessert. 

saw some kids at the restaurant which was nice. always grateful for family friendly white tablecloth places even though we went without our kid.
author: Win H.

description: So I came here on a very hot friday afternoon to enjoy the sunset and waited over an hour at the bar to get a seat by the large windows overlooking the bay.  When we were finally seated, the sun had already set and the air conditioning located directly above my seat seem to run full blast, and made it obnoxiously cold.  I'm pretty sure that contributed to the almost spontaneous coagulation of the fatty pools that surrounded my $34 filet mignon as it left the waiter's hands and placed onto my table.  Oh well, at least the calamari at the bar was not bad.
author: K N.

description: It's just a shame this place isn't better.  The views are fantastic, and as noted by Mia K., it's fairly easy to get a reservation (perhaps that should be telling me something).  But the bottom line is, the food is average.  My fish was dry, and accompanied by plain basmati rice.  Boring...  The crabcakes are good, and if I went back, I might get the entree portion of those and skip the rest.  I was disappointed in dessert - I'm not a huge dessert lover, but when I saw warm 3-berry cobbler on the menu, I said "that's me!":  Alas, it was extremely tart (tart like the berries weren't ripe tart) and the crust, while beautifully draped over the china bowl it came in, did not add any texture or flavor.  All in all, it's not worth the money, even for the view... IMHO, of course.
author: Julie L.

description:
This was my third visit and all my experiences have been different but I wanted to finally write a review because I feel like I have an excellent feel for the restaurant. 

We were sat immediately at a decent table.  We decided to be a bit adventurous and started out with the red curry mussels. The dish was served quickly but when it was served the server seemed distracted because she had forgotten was she giving us and then ran off embarrassed.  I was served without a napkin and there was no bread or butter. The mussels were OK.

About halfway through the appetizer I recognized the manager and decided to say hi. He recognized me as a regular and decided to move us to a nicer window seat. Two minutes later my napkin arrived. Then a minute later our bread arrived. The service clearly changed for the better. This third time around I also clearly noticed how pricey this restaurant is. Not that it is expensive but dishes such as sole, salmon and halibut were more expensive than other similar restaurants. Perhaps the pricing is due to the view. When our entrees arrived they were both very good. Not spectacular but very good. I was surprised at the size of my sole. The portion was the biggest I had ever received at a restaurant serving sole. We then moved on to the dessert which was enormous. Sweet but very good. 
All in all I like McCormick and Kuleto's. The view is nice and the food is pretty good. But the trick is to order the most simple dishes. The more complicated dishes tend to suffer from trying too hard. Often the simple things in life are the best!
author: Roger H.

description: FIRST DATE restaurant!  that's all i have to say...awesome service,   amazing views, and delicious food.  SEAFOOD i love it!
author: Jaclyn L.

description: Happy hour is why you should come here. If you're an out of towner, in this area, it is going to be a hard deal to beat. At regular prices? Not so much...
author: Anita B.

description: Mini hamburgers with different cheeses and toppings, Asian rolls with fancy dipping sauces and some many choices from the sea you won't know where to start.  Good for a start to an evening but I would not stay for dinner.  The place is usually filled with tourist and can get very loud.
author: Angela D.

description: I really liked their appetizer sampler platter.  It was $49.95, but it was filled with good food:  calamari, coconut shrimp, popcorn shrimp and crab cakes.  That was the highlight of the entire meal.  Clam chowder was good, but I've had better.  Their blackened chicken linguine was so-so, chicken was a bit dry and the sauce was very heavy.  My friend ordered the crab cobb salad which she didn't eat much of since it was drowned in too much dressing.
author: Kit E.

description: Location is great...beautiful views however the food is just OK and it's pricey. This is not good in my book. I'd much rather enjoy a meal somewhere else for the price.
author: Mimi C.

description: Tasty food...great presentation...awesome service..nice view but a bit to noisy.
author: Allison T.

description: While my parents were in town they wanted to go to Fisherman's Wharf, and so we ended up at this place for dinner.  I was a bit skeptical, being the snob that I am, but I actually have to say that my halibut was quite flavorful, and had an excellent potato side dish.  All in all, not a bad option in the Wharf.
author: Jenn K.

description: If you love seafood, then this your heaven. If you appreciate good service, this place is it. Reservations are highly recommended. Good for your Valentines, or a celebration. Very crowded during dinner. Full bar.  A beautiful view after-dark. Like I said, seafood is pretty much on the menu. I enjoyed eating clams. Salad is tasty as well. They give you a decent amount.
author: Smooth R.

description: My wife and I just spent two days in SF and while the weather was chilly the people were warm and friendly.  We met some great people in ghiradelli sq at some of the shops and then rolled into the restaurant at lunch to check it out for dinner that night.  The view is spectacular of the bay and alcatraz out the huge windows.  You probably can't get a bad seat in there but they put us in a prime spot since we were celebrating our anniversary.  They also printed up special menus for us that said "Happy Fourth Anniversary" which was a nice little touch.  The service and view alone are worth a trip and we are from Boston so the prices don't really seem all that high for the food but I am sure you can find cheaper.  All in all the food was above average.  The crab cake was quite good and different than the east coast variety.  Calamari was not very crispy but the fried capers were a nice touch.  My wife had the shrimp scampi which was traditionally done and the shrimp were large and fresh.  I was in a red meat mood and had the fillet which was cooked perfectly rare.  Side of truffled mac and cheese was bland and dissappointing but they ended by bringing us a free dessert for our anniversary.  Overall a great experience for our last night in SF.
author: Erik H.

description: I brought some out of town guests here for dinner last night mostly because they were in the mood for seafood and also because it was close to their hotel.  I thought the food was good, but not great.  However, I'm giving them 4 stars for the view/atmosphere and also for the service, which were both excellent.  We ate dinner early because we had a child with us, so the restaurant was fairly quiet and very pleasant for most of our meal.  However, as it got later and the restaurant started to fill up, it did get really noisy (just something to keep in mind).  I love that they take reservations on opentable.com too.  All in all, it was a nice dining experience and I'll probably come back again.
author: Shannon E.

description: This place has a special place in my heart because my grandparents would take me here when I student at CAL. I have been here about 20 times over the last 10 years.  I love the clam chowder, seafood and bay water view. Be sure to request to sit by the window overlooking the bay at all times. I had lunch here most recently in April. The food was still good, but the service was a bit slow. Ensure to have a lot of time or put in your entire order at once.  There is a private room for group events and I attended a group event here about 3 years ago. The food and service were great for the group event. After you eat, enjoy Ghiradelli square withe the chocolate factory, Cost plus and the myriad of shops and jewlery shops.  If you are adventurous, you can have lunch here and enjoy the Maritime Museum across the street, water views and old ships docked close by.
author: Vanessa B.

description: Very good quality food, large portions, consistently good, nice ambiance. However, items offered on menu are pretty standard, nothing super exciting.
author: Upekkha M.

description: The view is lovely, and a nice place to take out of town guests.  It is definitely touristy.  My martini was stiff and delicious (I always talk about my damn martinis).  For appetizers we ordered the chilled crab, and it was delicious.  We also ordered crab cakes and clam chowder that were also good and filling.  For my entree, I had the scallops.  They were also good.  I would say, nothing that blew my mind, but a good solid meal.  My parents were happy.  The service was a bit spotty, but that's because it was Christmas, and hey, I was just thankful the servers were working on a holiday.  I always kind of feel like an a#$hole coming to restaurants on holidays.
author: Sarah F.

description: The place is ideal for a tourist like me. The view of the harbor is breathtaking. Waiters are very attentive. A bit pricey but the food was great. Love this place.
author: Michelle S.

description: My husband and I had come here several years ago and it was very good.  This time I wasn't crazy about it.  The bartender was pleasant.  I ordered the clam chowder and a poached pear/spinach salad/hazelnut.  The chowder was just okay and the salad a bit boring, the presentation could use some help as well, it was far from appealing and the dressing not that great either   I also had two glasses of wine.  Total price with tip was $60.00!!!!  I was appalled that I could spend that much on soup salad and wine not to mention that it was marginal! The bar also smelled a bit like some type of cleaning supplies (maybe bleach?).
author: Linda L.

description: I had a very good experience when I went to M&K.  Everything that our group ordered was very good, tasted fresh, and priced just right.  I remember coming out here with another group (there was 6 of us - 3 couples on Valentine's Day) and in the end, with all the appetizers and desserts, we all ended up paying only about $60-$70 per couple. Of course this did not include any cocktails or wines (actually, i was already quite loopy when dinner started so I decided to skip alcohol during dinner.) Seriously, for a nice, decent restaurant with fresh dishes - the seafood was pretty good - located at one of the busiest areas of San Francisco (the Wharf), this is good bang for your buck. I'd definitely go out here again.
