author: Chris A.

description: four big stars here for the view, the atmosphere and the solid meat and potatoes fresh seafood plates.  the fried oysters are great and so is their alder smoked salmon.  honestly, this is the perfect tourist experience in SF.  after dinner, walk down to the beach below the park and enjoy the lights on the bay.
author: cindy b.

description: We came here for the "amazing" happy hour specials... we left with a full belly, some dough left in our wallets but a bitter taste of the not so great service.  First, you must sit in the bar for the happy hour specials. I guess I should have assumed this but we made reservations and when they said we had to sit in the overly crowded bar area to partake in happy hour we were less than thrilled.  After too many minutes goes by without being greeting by anyone we finally flag someone down and they say someone else needs to help us, not them. Ok, but who?? Our server finally came around and she was obviously very frazzled, we actually just felt bad for her.  Our food took forever and it all came out at the same time.  Pretty sure when people order appetizers they expect them to come out before the main course. Anyway, food was ok, service was poor but I am attributing this to lack of staff, not 100% a bad server.
author: Kate V.

description: This place had wonderful views...I went for only apps, but they were wonderful. Tried the tuna (very fresh), crab and lobster rolls, and nibbled on a seafood cobb salad. All were very tasty, but a bit pricy. Bar room was cozy. Even though I didn't eat dinner, the menu was pretty big and looked tasty!
author: Rita M.

description: beautiful spot, out of control prices!~!!! well vodka madras and a draft beer. $17.00 really?? are $%@*^#@ kidding me.. and the bartender reached across the bar where i had his two dollar tip waiting.. really, at least wait until i leave!! absolutley ridiculous!!! never seen such rude stuck up people in my life.. Never again!!!! I have been bartending a long time and you never, ever, do that!! my drink was practically on the dollar bills and he reached across the bar and grabbed it!! I was so shocked i couldn't even talk at that point, we left and will never , ever return!!!!! PLEASE don't bother!!! ANd fyi, it is NOT KID FRIENDLY!!!
author: Jill F.

description: Went here on 06/21/10 for a late lunch/early dinner. The hostess ignored us for a couple minutes even though we were right by the entrance door. What a bad first impression for an expensive restaurant. We then asked nicely if we could get a table by the window.  Lucky for us! We got a really bad server. He's a gray-haired man with a really weird vibe. He was mumbling to himself and sneered at us a couple times. Not sure why. His tips was hand-written on the bill by him even though there were only 4 of us. Later on, we found out that the restaurant charged us 3 times for it. We had to call the restaurant 4 times to clarify the charges. They hung up on us "accidentally" 3 times in a row. Overall: very bad service, ok food, & nice view if you get window seating. Don't think I'll ever come back to this restaurant again!! I would recommend going to the Beach Chalet Restaurant instead for great service, food, ambiance, & view of the ocean beach.
author: Devy Z.

description: Easily one of my favorite seafood restaurant. Yes this place commands high price, but for what you get, it's well worth it for mouth watering seafood that melts in your mouth. Fresh fish, cooked to perfection. Highly recommend the halibut, shrimp cocktail, ahi tuna and many others. And to top it off, the view is absoulutely phenomenal. Perfect place to enjoy your meal while watching the sun set.
author: benjamin c.

description: I went here after I graduated from college and it was great.  They added a special message for me on the menu which was classy.  They were quick with service, place has a nice view and the food is quality.  At a table of ten we were a little crammed but everyone ordered something different and I tried pretty much everything.  THey have a solid calamari.  THey have a great sea bass and baked salmon.  The baked salmon is what I ordered.  The only down side here is it is a little over priced but it is san francisco so what do you expect.  Also the seafood pasta dishes werent great.  Other than that great night.
author: christian l.

description: went there a while back. went there for veterans day for a free meal.  extremely nice interior with a great view of the bay. the service was excellent. my meal was ok. a bit on the salty side. can't really say i recommend it.  i had a drink that was made well though.
author: RAy J.

description: The Bartenders here are great. The food is ok. That's the good part. The management and service is way below par. We sat at the bar and had dinner, very nice atmosphere. Because of the location management has let this place run down I imagine because they feel tourist will keep coming. Its a shame actually. Our bartender was very professional and was good on the up sale. But his hands where tied about getting the food out. Another couple were in the dinning area and had to come back to the bar because the service was so bad. We booked this reservation on OpenTable and when we got to the restaurant we decided to eat at the bar. They cancelled our reservation as if we were a no show. I called back the next day and was told by the first person you had to eat in the restaurant. The 2nd manager called me back and said that it must have been a mistake and would book another reservation for me and then put that I showed up so I would get my points. It didn't happen. San Fran is a great foodie city. Don't waste your time here.
author: Roger H.

description: Not a Fan....the food quality was incredibly poor.  I ordered some Snow Crab legs.  I've had better quality than my grocery store in Dallas, Texas.  Too, they gave me nothing but knuckles!!!  My wife ordered the dungeness crab pasta - - ugh!  The crab meet was shredded and you could bairly see any....incredibly poor.  Look elswhere for food.  Also, a very touristy environment with familys that have been down at the pier all day.
author: Fred B.

description: The bartender makes a mean drink and the staff was generally attentive.  The steak (uh, right...why am I eating steak at a seafood restaurant...group dinner...no choice) was tough and virtually raw.  Thanks for coming all this way from the mid-West to enjoy a fantastic Bay view, but locals can do better.
author: Drexel B.

description: they no longer have starches on their plates :( i know i dont need those extra mashed potatoes, but when im paying 28 $ for  my stuffed salmon that used to come with actual whole veggies, not shredded veggies and mashed potatoes with a LARGE piece of salmon...i was pretty dissapointed!!! the service is always great but they have really gotten cheap... tear
author: Shauna P.

description:
This place deserves a flat out zero! I've been working in the restaurant business for over 10 years and have been a server for over seven years and I know the difference in crappy, mediocre, and exceptional service.  As for this place, it is by far the worst place that I have ever been to.  

Here's how it all started... 
I made a reservation about 2 months in advance as a surprise for my boyfriend's birthday.  Right when we got there, we checked in and were asked to wait even though the place was empty.  Then, when we were seated, we looked through the menu for a good 5 minutes and noticed that our server never came to greet us.  Since I'm a server, I assumed that our server was busy and couldn't get to us.  However, since the place was practically empty, that surely couldn't have been the reason.  Since it was my boyfriend's birthday I didn't want to make a scene, so we waited around some more.  About 20 minutes later, the server finally came up and asked us for our drinks. Right when she arrived at our table, we could already tell that she wasn't too happy to see us.  As she was neither friendly or polite,  we quickly ordered our appetizers, soup, and drinks.  After she left, it took her another 15 minutes to bring me my iced tea and my boyfriends wine.  Then, instead of taking our meal orders, she left and didn't return for another 20 minutes.  Our server was basically non-existent.  Must I remind you, it was a Monday night and it was not busy what-so-ever.  We were one of her TWO WHOLE TABLES! Anyway, throughout the course of our meal, our server never once came back to check up on how our food tasted, how everything was going, and if we needed anything.  She totally walked passed our table and ignored us.  She was however extremely friendly and attentive to the table right next to us.  (older Caucasian table) This has by far been the worst restaurant experience of my life.  I think Chuck'E'Cheese has better service than this.  

Again, our server was not friendly nor polite.  Obviously she was stereotyping my boyfriend and I.  Just because we're an Asian couple in our 20's doesn't mean that we'll skimp you on your tip. First of all, this obviously isn't the cheapest of restaurants out there. Second, we don't look the slightest bit ghetto.  Third, if we're dressed for the occasion then that obviously means something!   It's ridiculous, must I tattoo SERVER on my forehead to indicate that I tip upon how my service was.  I usually tip 20%+ and have never skimped anyone on a tip.  Being a server myself, I never stereotype my guests and treat them all the same.  In fact, my biggest tippers are younger guests of an ethnic background.  All I have to say is that this place doesn't even deserve to have a one star rating.

I WILL NEVER MAKE A RETURN VISIT AND WON'T RECOMMEND IT TO ANYONE.
author: Diana T.

description:
I scheduled a group lunch with them for a tour group. The booking process went well we received our Event Order and sent in our deposit. We emailed in our entree counts and requested a final invoice. In our Event Order it specified that we would be paying for only the menu that we contracted with them. Any additions, alcoholic beverages, etc... will need to billed individually to the person who incurred those charges. We even went as far as to say that if our driver were able to join them he will pay for his meal on his company card. They noted that we would pre-cut a check for the group.
Approximately an hour after our event we receive a phone call informing us that there is a balance due. Mind you we pre-paid for 51 people, only 49 people showed up. So they are ahead by two people. The extra charge was due to the fact that 2 people decided they wanted a different entree (one of the 3 entrees that we offered on our pre-set menu) so they charged us $13 each for the change. They didn't inform us or the people that changed their mind that there would be a charge.
We have had problems with their corporate offices in the past and had just started using their restaurants again. After this we will not be returning and will spread the word around that they do not honor their contracts or follow the specific instructions of their clients.
author: Stacey A.

description: Delicious food and amazing views. We came at lunchtime so it was more afforable than dinner. Convenient location if you are in the Fisherman's Wharf area.
author: Andrea K.

description: i honestly enjoyed this restaurant, and will continue to return here, the food here is great, i always order seafood here and it stay amazing me everytime. very clean place, very nice view, very good service, joking people always a thumbs up from me. i give it 4 stars.
author: David T.

description: Despite the fact this is located in Fisherman Wharf with tons of tourist. It is a great place for dinner and happy hour. Since I'm not big into seafood, I ordered a steak. the steak was aged, seasoned and grilled to perfection, its so tender that you can cut it with a butter knife. The happy hour menu is great, its so cheap. The atmosphere of the restaurant is classy, white table clothe, with a great view of the San Francisco bay. Sometimes you might find some tourist wearing ugly sweater with jeans and sneakers. Please, this is McCormick and Kuletos..wearing something nice.
author: Ryan S.

description: Average food at tourist prices. I brought my out of town friend here because she wanted to grab some clam chowder and ice cream (I wasn't willing to walk all the way to Fisherman's Wharf). The bar is not bad though if you want to grab a drink or quick bite and avoid waiting for a table.
author: Retired B.

description: Almost didn't go after reading older posts BUT it was great!  The food was delicious, service prompt and friendly and the view sublime.  It is pricy but for a special occasion or just a gorgeous day, I'd definitely go back.  They list what farms the fresh ingredients come from- a nice touch.  The bartender makes a good drink too!
author: holly w.

description: I'm only rating the happy hour special between 3-6pm M-F.  I got a $1.95 cheese burgers w/ fries.  The burgers were good size 1/3 to 1/2 pound...couldn't really tell because of the dim lighting in our spot.  It's kind of hard to believe a place where they have entrees from $20-$50 would offer so many items for $1.95-$4.95, but it's true.  This is one of the best bargains for HH food I've been to in SF.  I'll definitely be back!
author: LT B.

description: we had a business luncheon here, so i'm not sure if my experience is indicative of the normal service and food one would get, but i have to say i thought the food was good...not great, but solid....and the service was also good.  i had the caesar salad, which was passable....maybe i bit plain...i had the mahi mahi encrusted with macadamia nuts...in this guava sauce (which maybe was a bit too plentiful) and manga salsa.  it was pretty tasty.  then had this apple/pecan pie ala mode.  the food was decent, but not earth-shattering...as was the presentation i gave that day....
author: Miss P.

description: My parents like coming here when visiting because the food is consistent and they like the view. Parking is easy and we can walk around in a pretty part of the city after we get sundaes.
author: Michele A.

description: touristy, yes. but can locals enjoy a nice view and good food....of course! the in-laws were in town and wanted something other than italian. we walked from their hotel to mccormicks on a saturday night, without a reservation, and were seated immediately (b/c of the holidays, most locals were not in town). i feel like the service was slow, but the food was delicious. i'm a vegetarian, and was allowed to order off the kids menu (more choices) the family orderd a 6oz mignon, tilapia,  and mahi mahi. everyone LOVED their meals. the quality is so good, the views are gorgeous and location is convenient to tourist areas but far enough away to disconnect from the crowds.
author: Sari W.

description:
Boy, has this place gotten lousy!  My visiting relatives took us there last Saturday night.  First of all the opening amenities (glasses of water, bread, butter, etc.) were so sloooow in coming we were 
left sitting there wondering if anyone even had taken notice of our presence.  Alright, maybe that was just a glitch, we thought.  Surely the entrees will be delicious.  Well, four of our party of five were served our entrees, but not my elderly mother, who had ordered salmon.  Not a dish that requires a long cook time.  We called the waitress over to ask for her food (!) and were assured it would be right out.  Eight minutes later, with the four of us staring at our plates watching the food get cold, her salmon was rushed out.  She took one bite and discovered it was raw on the inside.  Back to the kitchen!  She finally got her food but the whole thing had begun to feel sour by then.  No less that 2 waiters came by to claim the fault for the tardiness, but that didn't make the experience any more pleasant, to say the least.
After my partner called over the manager and gave her a large piece of his mind, the general manager of the restaurant came over and took a third off the bill.  100% would have been more like it.  We're never going back.
author: Noel R.

description: For the price we paid I would have had better service someplace else.  I wish I hadnt of gone here for my BF's birthday dinner.  Lousy service, Food is ok, not great for the price and an overall bad experience.  They get one star for the location.  My salmon was a little overcooked so it was dry and woody,  they forgot to bring out bread, and our appetizer and my bf's side.   Spent 83 dollars and left no tip.  Didnt get an apology from the waiter allthough when we had to flag down the manager for the sides we  did get a little mumbled sorry.  What sucks is now I have to plunk down more money for an actual birthday dinner that is a good experience.  What a waste!
author: Natalie T.

description: held luncheon there for four hours with sixteen grls!! yipe that rite! with games and prizes!! first come the clam chower and icea tea or coffee!! i had the grilled chicken with mash potatos and veggies on side!! thEn come the dessert: Creamy vanilla ice cream on top of warm apple pie!! that the bESt!! i tried my fren's pasta and salmon.. they were aLL delicious.. You can look out into the sea and boat.. when i went there it was cloudy.. hope you catch it on a sunny day!!! must try it!! very upscale and Expensive!! costed us over $1000 for  two tables and two more empty tables for rOOm for prizes and stuff...
author: Lily T.

description:
After finding a great $25 coupon on www.slickdeals.net , I figure it'll be nice to give this place a try.  (I called to make sure the coupon is valid here eventhough it's not on the address of the coupon!...DUH...dumb!)  When we arrived, they had a line.  But we had a reservations so we got seated immediately!....YEAH!..SEE YA!  Unfortunately, when I showed the host the coupon, she explained to me it's not valid here, only in addresses that's on the coupon.  oh well.  IT's ok..it's not going to ruin the good Friday night.  The coupon is just only a bonus only.    The ambience of the place is great.  The spectacular view of Aquatic Park and the Bay.  We were greeted by a very friendly waiter who offered some recommendations since it's our 1st time there.  We ended up ordering the Pacific Seafood Stew ($19.95) and the Indonesian Seabass ($23.95).  The Seabass was a little on the salty side, so I just flipped it over and ate the bottom part rather than the salted crusty grilled side.  The vinegrette sauce with the seabass didn't really go well with the fish, but great with the bland, white rice.  It also came with the sauteed string beans and 1 baby carrot.  (no flavor).  But the Pacific Seafood Stew was pretty good though, but also on the oversalty side.  It wasn't a big portion though.  For that price, I would prefer the Seafood Cioppino from the Tadish Grill ($22.95), which is bigger portion and much flavorful broth.

I guess this place is what many of the Yelpers were saying.  You only pay for the view, NOT the food.  

At the end, we skipped out on their desserts since we're just NEXT door to the Ghiradelli Ice Cream store...MUCH better choice!
author: Gary Y.

description: ate here with my girlfriends. nice view. good clam chowder. my friend ate the etoufee-she cleaned the plate, must have been good. not bad.
author: emily p.

description:
we just had our wedding at mccormicks and it was awesome! not only was the setting was so beautiful, but they were very easy to work with. linda  was always helpful and supportive. she really put me at ease. and everything worked out perfectly! i was so happy. and all our guests were so impressed with the view and the food. i was worried that with 100 guests the food would be so so. but it it was great! 

and it was so much fun! when we walked in through the regular restaurant to enter the reception area, all the guests in the restaurant stood up and cheered for my new husband and me! such a blast! thank you so much for an amazing wedding!
author: Alison L.

description: I am judgeing this restaurant, not for the food, but rather for it's poor public relations. My partner, as many others in this economy, has been searching for work for a long time. He applied for a job as bartender, a position, by the way for which he is more than qualified. I find no fault in their not hiring him. That is their poragative. However, he was called back for two interviews and was led to believe that he was very qualified. They expressed great interest, enough to tell him that he would be called for a third interview. After not hearing from anyone, he called back and was told that the responsible  person would be in the following day. Of course they never called back or returned another call. All they had to do to show some professionalism and common curtesy was to call him and inform him that he hadn't gotten the job. After all, looking for work is a lot of work and employers have an obligation to treat applicants with respect. If not the whole process is very destructive.
author: Joseph M.

description: Went here for dinner a couple nights ago. I will start out by saying it is somewhat a pet peeve of mine when you actually have a reservation at a restaurant, show up at said time, and then proceed to wait about 15 minutes for your table. I know a busy place can have problems turning tables over, but it was certainly not that busy and I have a philosophy that reservation holders should take precedent over walk-ins. Decor inside is nice, the tables are on three tiers, so most of the tables have no problem getting the view of the Bay, which is cool. Now onto my next pet peeve, the bread and water rule. Bread (or something to nosh on) and water should hit your table fairly promptly. I am all for restaurants that withhold water unless requested as a conservation measure, but most restaurants that do this actually have something on the table that informs you of their policy. Anyhow, bread got there eventually and water, too, once I asked for it. The timing of the dishes was weird. Salads came suspiciously fast, leaving a long wait between them and the entree. Then came the lag between finishing dinner and the dessert pimping followed by a ridiculously long wait for the desserts themselves. The waiter was nice enough, but forgot our request for a second bottle of wine until it was too late. My water was not refilled once (I didn't ask, but I shouldn't have to). Portions were OK, a little on the skimpy side since flavor-wise, they weren't worth the price. I would call the food passable, neither very good nor very bad. If you are looking for a place to take some wide-eyed out-of-towners looking for that postcard San Francisco experience, you could do worse than McCormick & Kuleto's, but you could do better.
author: Don B.

description: Being tourists, a trip sailing around Alcatraz was requested and actually quite fun, except for the hoards of other tourists which blanketed the streets of Fisherman's Wharf. Sadly, my guest actually requested to eat seafood in the area and McCormick & Schmicks/Kuletos was chosen only because of the proximity of where we happened to be when we stopped walking. It does have a decent-enough view, but the food is far from stellar. My friend, E, a new mother who had not eaten out in over a year, was thrilled with her lobster, but ordering an over-priced, East Coast lobster in a West Coast seafood restaurant just seems wrong to me. I had a miso-crusted monk fish which was thick with a sickly sweet Oriental sauce. K ordered an etoufe he was reasonably pleased with, but I found it pasty and gooey. Ellen's daughter was given fish-and-chips which were actually on par with some of the better pubs around the city, but over-priced for a children's meal.
author: Carolyn T.

description: Fine dining. Great menu, fresh seafood, nice wine list, solid service. A good place to splurge.
author: Matt G.

description:
my husband and i came here for our anniversary. we had a great time. great ambiance. our waiter was polite, respectful. 

we ordered manila clams for an appetizer, my husband ordered a surf/turf entree, and i cannot remember what i ordered. the clams were amazing. so fresh and simply cooked... phenomenal! my husband's filet was perfect, the grilled prawns that came with it were also good (however, kind of a rip... it was like 13 or 14 dollars to add 3 prawns to his steak dish)

overall, great experience... would love to come dine here if ever in the area again.
author: Rominda R.

description: Where to begin! It was three of us - we all work together up the street . We walk up to the Maitre 'D stand, where an older gentlemen behind the stand was on the telephone who, still after 5 minutes, didn't even acknowledge us to say he'd be with us in a moment - nothing. Then a waitress cuts us off - literally stands in front of us while we are waiting to be helped/to be seated - doesn't excuse herself or anything. And then finally after about 10 minutes - they seat us!  We ordered Croque Monsieur - HIDEOUS! The Croques were DROWNING - I mean *D-R-O-W-N-I-N-G* in bechamel sauce - not prepared in the traditional French way - and were just hideous. They used cheap packaged ham inside to boot. The sandwich was completely soggy and basic like sucking on a cream sandwich. The bechamel sauce was closer to hollandaise sauce with too much cream. Really awful. To boot - we had a $20 gift cert - didn't realize that you couldn't use it on Valentine's Day - though mind you, this was lunch, NO special V-day menu, and it was three colleagues; but anyway...we left cash as well as the $20 cert - and the watiress came RUNNING after us outside, in the rain, screaming - to let us know we couldn't use the gift certificate on valentine's day. Really? They should have paid us to come! The upside of restaurant: Great View. And that would be the ONLY upside...
author: M L.

description: We had not been here for years, but went because it was raining and we could park in the parking lot underground Ghiradelli Sq (come on - you've all been to a restaurant for this reason??).  Pluses: good food, good service, good kid's menu, comprehensive adult menu, nice atmosphere. Minuses: really only the price, entrees average $25-35, but definitely still a good option near Fisherman's Wharf. So, we stayed dry and got our parking validated.
author: Craig C.

description: Our party of four had 7pm reservations on a Sunday but were not seated until 7:15pm, a bad omen of things to come. After another long wait we had our drink orders taken but it was yet another long wait before we ever saw our actual waiter who only came by to tell us our drinks were on the way.  We did not get our entrees until 1hr 15min after our reservation time. Two of the four entree portions were  very small. Supposedly McCormick's validates your parking but only for 1hr 20min, totally inadequate for this type of restaurant. I ended up having to pay another $4.50 to get my car out. Had I known this I would have deducted the amount from the waiters tip, who we seldom saw. Unless you are a tourist there are much better choices.
author: V S.

description: Meh.  The view is beautiful, but we got put at a table near the kitchen, which kind of sucked.  Huge gripe: it smelled like mildew throughout the restaurant?  You know that smell that your table has been wiped down with a towel that was damp for too long?  The whole restaurant smelled that way, from the moment we walked in.  Why?  I have no idea how this happens.  I thought the food was good, but not for the price.  This place is a tourist trap - great view, convenient location, San Francisco seafood classics like clam chowder and cioppino, and a price that shows you are paying for location.  I had the cioppino, which had lots of goodies but was incredibly salty and some of the seafood was a bit overdone.  Ordinarily, this wouldn't be a problem because I'm not picky, but the dish cost $30 for brunch, so the overcooking was a bummer.  My partner's dover sole was way too rich.  Our guests enjoyed their lobster salad and crab omelette, so no complaints on those dishes.  We were entertaining tourists, so it was actually not a bad place to go for brunch, but anyone who actually lives here has many, many better options.
author: audrey y.

description: Our Norwegian friends chose the McCormick & Kuleto's private dining room, on the lower level of the restaurant with an unobstructed view to Alcatraz, for their wedding reception. Susan Richardson is their catering manager, and she made the planning experience simple and the event itself flawless and memorable. The Russian woman who served as our world-class captain (I'm sorry I've forgotten her name) kept things moving and handled everything gracefully and with charm and competence. The evening started with drinks--stocking the special whiskey we'd requested--and passed hors d'oeuvres, and guests stood out on the private terrace looking at the views and the people passing by, a first-rate location. Our hosts decided to let everyone order from the menu, and it was a feast that pleased everyone. The evening came in at about $212 per person, including fine wines, drinks, dinner, tips, tax, room charge. Our host got his money's worth and some.
author: Peter P.

description: I remember when this was Senior Peppy's way back when I was a kid; man, how times have changed.!  They have jazzed it up a notch with those sweeping views of the bay.  Tip: sit on the top level as you can get an allaround better view that way.  The service is very friendly and they will answer any questions that you may have.  The bread is fresh from the oven with wonderfully smooth, cremy butter.  The Hangtown fry is to die for with good size fresh, neaty oysters (not sure which kind,) crispy, greasless bacon, and fresh tomatos served fritata style in which the fritata is crispy and smooth.  The green beans accompaniing the dish are excellent sauted in garlic and olive oikl.  I also some tried of my uhncle's fish and chips; the piece of fish was greasless and crispy (I think that it could have been white fish or cod) with tarter sauce that tasted homemade and not too mayonessey; the fries were crispy and greasless.  What a fitting meal on a hot bay area day, let alone a rarely hot San Francisco day.  So, for excellent seafood for a little mmore than your typical moderately priced restaurant with friendly service in a casual, yet upscale atmosphere, McCormick and Kuleto's cannot be beat.  Keep up the good work guys.!
author: Brian S.
